original: de'i tshe ni mngon du byed par 'gyur ba med la des bsdus pa yang med do //
analyzed: de'i tshe ni mngon du byed par 'gyur ba med la des bsdus pa yang med do //
translated: At that time, it does not manifest and it is not included in that.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mthong ba'i lam gyis bsdus pa'i sems ni rnam par chad pa'i sems la dmigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyis bsdus pa'i sems ni rnam par chad pa'i sems la dmigs pa ma yin te /
translated: The mind subsumed by the path of seeing does not focus on the mind that is interrupted,

original: mtha' dag la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtha' dag la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it focuses on the entirety of the three times.

original: bsgom pa'i lam la dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe mngon du byed pa dang / des bsdus pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam la dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe mngon du byed pa dang / des bsdus pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúfocuses on the path of cultivation‚Äù means that at that time it manifests and it is included in that.

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang mi ldan pa zhes grub pa bzhin du nges par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang mi ldan pa zhes grub pa bzhin du nges par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is to be ascertained in the same way that it is established as not being associated with emptiness and signlessness.

original: rnam pa dang dmigs pa tha dad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rnam pa dang dmigs pa tha dad pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because their aspects and focal objects are different.

original: de gnyis ni spyi'i rnam pa can dang 'dus ma byas kyi yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis ni spyi'i rnam pa can dang 'dus ma byas kyi yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those two have a general aspect and an unconditioned object field.

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni shes bya'i rang gi mtshan nyid sems dang sems las byung ba'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni shes bya'i rang gi mtshan nyid sems dang sems las byung ba'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The knowledge of others‚Äô minds has the nature of the object, mind and mental factors, as its object.

original: ci'i phyir smon pa med pa dang mi ldan pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir smon pa med pa dang mi ldan pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it not associated with the absence of expectancy?

original: 'di ltar gzhan gyi sems shes pa sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid la dmigs pa ni smon pa med pa dang mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan gyi sems shes pa sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid la dmigs pa ni smon pa med pa dang mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the knowledge of others' minds that focuses on the reality of the feeling of pain is compatible with the absence of expectancy.

original: zad pa dang mi skye @231b ba shes pas ma bsdus pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zad pa dang mi skye @231b ba shes pas ma bsdus pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is not subsumed by the knowledge of elimination and nonarising.

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni shes pa bzhis bsdus pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni shes pa bzhis bsdus pa yin te /
translated: The knowledge of others' minds is subsumed by four knowledges.

original: de'i phyir gzhan gyi sems shes pa kun du rtog pa dang yongs su tshol ba'i bsam pa can yin pa'i phyir lta ba'i bdag nyid la de gnyis la lta ba'i bdag nyid ma yin pas de gnyis kyis ma bsdus so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan gyi sems shes pa kun du rtog pa dang yongs su tshol ba'i bsam pa can yin pa'i phyir lta ba'i bdag nyid la de gnyis la lta ba'i bdag nyid ma yin pas de gnyis kyis ma bsdus so //
translated: Therefore, since the knowledge of others' minds is conceptual and has the nature of investigation, it is not subsumed by those two, because those two are not conceptual and do not have the nature of investigation.

original: bar chad med pa'i lam bkag pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam bkag pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is not subsumed by the uninterrupted path.

original: bar chad med pa'i lam ni nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir spong ba'i lam yin la /
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam ni nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir spong ba'i lam yin la /
translated: The uninterrupted path is the path of elimination because it is the antidote to affliction.

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni rnam par grol ba'i lam yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni rnam par grol ba'i lam yin te /
translated: The knowledge of others' minds is the liberated path.

original: rnam pa drug rnam par grol blo //
analyzed: rnam pa drug rnam par grol blo //
translated: The mind is liberated in six ways.üîΩ

original: zhes bya ba 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The knowledge of nonarising is the sixth type of liberation.

original: gzhan dag na re khyad par gyi lam yang yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re khyad par gyi lam yang yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: It is also the path of distinction.

original: don dam pa dag yin yang kun rdzob la brten pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /üîΩdon dam pa'i rgyu mtshan can nam don dam pa nyid don dam pa ste /
analyzed: don dam pa dag yin yang kun rdzob la brten pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni / don dam pa'i rgyu mtshan can nam don dam pa nyid don dam pa ste /
translated: Even though they are ultimate, they are based on the conventional.üîΩThe knowledge of elimination and nonarising are ultimate because they are characterized by the ultimate or because they are the ultimate itself.

original: zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dag don dam pa pa yin yang kun rdzob la brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dag don dam pa pa yin yang kun rdzob la brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though they are ultimate, they are based on the conventional.üîΩWhat is based on the conventional?

original: ci zhe na de dag la stong pa dang bdag med pa'i rnam pa dag ma gtogs so zhes bya ba sbyar ro //
analyzed: ci zhe na de dag la stong pa dang bdag med pa'i rnam pa dag ma gtogs so zhes bya ba sbyar ro //
translated: The aspects of emptiness and selflessness are excluded.

original: ji ltar 'di dag kun rdzob la brten zhe na /üîΩde'i phyir bdag gi skye ba zad do //
analyzed: ji ltar 'di dag kun rdzob la brten zhe na / de'i phyir bdag gi skye ba zad do //
translated: How are they based on the conventional?üîΩTherefore, it is said: ‚ÄúMy births have been eliminated.

original: 'di las srid pa gzhan mi shes so zhes bya ba smos te go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di las srid pa gzhan mi shes so zhes bya ba smos te go rims bzhin no //
translated: I will not know another existence.‚Äù

original: de dag gi stobs kyi rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob la brten pa dang / zag pa med pa nyid la gtan tshigs smras pa ste /
analyzed: de dag gi stobs kyi rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob la brten pa dang / zag pa med pa nyid la gtan tshigs smras pa ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause they are conventional knowledges that subsequently engage those powers‚Äù means that they are based on the conventional and are uncontaminated.

original: gang gi phyir zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dag gi rjes kyi kun rdzob kyi shes pa dag de lta bu'i rnam pa can du 'jug pa de'i phyir de dag gi rjes su skyes pa kun rdzob kyi shes pa dag la de dag kun rdzob laüîΩbrten pa zhes brjod de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dag gi rjes kyi kun rdzob kyi shes pa dag de lta bu'i rnam pa can du 'jug pa de'i phyir de dag gi rjes su skyes pa kun rdzob kyi shes pa dag la de dag kun rdzob la brten pa zhes brjod de /
translated: Because conventional knowledges that subsequently engage the knowledge of elimination and the knowledge of nonarising engage their objects in that way, conventional knowledges that arise subsequently to them are said to be based on the conventional.

original: zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dag ni don dam pa la 'jug kyang kun rdzob la brten to //
analyzed: zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dag ni don dam pa la 'jug kyang kun rdzob la brten to //
translated: Although the knowledge of elimination and the knowledge of nonarising engage ultimate reality, they are based on the conventional.

original: stong pa dang bdag med pa'i rnam pa don dam pa la 'jug pa dag ni don dam pa nyid la brten pas 'di dag zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pas bsdus pa med do //
analyzed: stong pa dang bdag med pa'i rnam pa don dam pa la 'jug pa dag ni don dam pa nyid la brten pas 'di dag zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pas bsdus pa med do //
translated: The aspects of emptiness and selflessness that engage ultimate reality are based on ultimate reality itself, but they are not included in the knowledge of elimination and the knowledge of nonarising.

original: ci zag pa med pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ci zag pa med pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: What is uncontaminated?

original: bsam pa ci zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: bsam pa ci zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is the thought?

original: ci ji ltar zag pa med pa spyi yid la byed pa rnam pa bcu drug bshad pa de bzhin du zag pa med pa rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa yang 'ga' zhig yod dam 'on te zag pa med pa spyi'i rnam pa kho na yin zhes bya
analyzed: ci ji ltar zag pa med pa spyi yid la byed pa rnam pa bcu drug bshad pa de bzhin du zag pa med pa rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa yang 'ga' zhig yod dam 'on te zag pa med pa spyi'i rnam pa kho na yin zhes bya
translated: Just as the general aspects of the uncontaminated were explained as sixteen, are the specific aspects of the uncontaminated also explained as sixteen, or are they not explained as sixteen?

original: ba'o // dogs pa de yang gang las she na /
analyzed: ba'o // dogs pa de yang gang las she na /
translated: From what is that doubt?

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa zag pa med pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can du bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa zag pa med pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can du bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is explained that the uncontaminated knowledge of others' minds has specific aspects.

original: dri med bcu drug las gzhan rnams med de /
analyzed: dri med bcu drug las gzhan rnams med de /
translated: The uncontaminated has sixteen aspects, but others do not.

original: 'di skad bstan @232a * //üîΩpar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan @232a * // par 'gyur te /
translated: This is taught:

original: gzhan zag pa med pa spyi'i rnam pa yang med na /
analyzed: gzhan zag pa med pa spyi'i rnam pa yang med na /
translated: If the general aspects of the uncontaminated do not exist,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa lta ga la yod ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa lta ga la yod ces bya ba'o //
translated: how could the specific aspects exist?

original: mi ldan pa'i sems kyi zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pas so //
analyzed: mi ldan pa'i sems kyi zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pas so //
translated: The phrase a mind not conjoined refers to the uncontaminated.üîΩThe aspects of impermanence, suffering,

original: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ste /
translated: and so on occur.

original: mi rtag pa ni mi rtag pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mi rtag pa ni mi rtag pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Impermanence is called impermanence.

original: ta sil gyi rkyen 'di ni zhes bya ba'i don la sbyar ro //
analyzed: ta sil gyi rkyen 'di ni zhes bya ba'i don la sbyar ro //
translated: The suffix -ta is added to the root ‚àöas in the sense of ‚Äúthis condition.‚Äù

original: rkyen 'di ni thams cad la de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rkyen 'di ni thams cad la de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: This condition should be understood in the same way in all cases.

original: yang na mi rtag pa zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa'i ngo bor ro //
analyzed: yang na mi rtag pa zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa'i ngo bor ro //
translated: Or, ‚Äúimpermanence‚Äù is the nature of impermanence.

original: gzhan la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to the others.

original: 'di ni gnas yod do //
analyzed: 'di ni gnas yod do //
translated: This is a basis.

original: 'di ni gzhi yod do zhes bya ba ni 'di gnyis kyang zag pa med pa'i rnam pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni gzhi yod do zhes bya ba ni 'di gnyis kyang zag pa med pa'i rnam pa yin te /
translated: This is a ground. These two are also types of the uncontaminated.

original: 'di ni gnas yod do zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid yod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di ni gnas yod do zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid yod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúThis is a basis‚Äù means ‚Äúthis is an intrinsic identity.‚Äù

original: 'di ni gzhi yod do zhes bya ba ni 'di ni rgyu yod do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: 'di ni gzhi yod do zhes bya ba ni 'di ni rgyu yod do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThis is a ground‚Äù means ‚Äúthis is a cause.‚Äù

original: gnas dang gzhi'i sgra ni rang gi mtshan nyid dang rgyu'i rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas dang gzhi'i sgra ni rang gi mtshan nyid dang rgyu'i rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The terms ‚Äúbasis‚Äù and ‚Äúground‚Äù are synonyms for ‚Äúintrinsic identity‚Äù and ‚Äúcause.‚Äù

original: rigs pas skyed pa'i sgo nas shes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log par shes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rigs pas skyed pa'i sgo nas shes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log par shes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúOne will understand through reasoning‚Äù means ‚Äúone will understand without error.‚Äù

original: 'di'i don ni nyi 'og pas smras pa gang yin pa 'di ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni nyi 'og pas smras pa gang yin pa 'di ma yin te /
translated: The meaning of this passage is not as the AparƒÅntakas explain it.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /üîΩ'di'i don mi rtag pa la sogs par 'gyur ba gang yin pa 'di ni gnas yod do //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na / 'di'i don mi rtag pa la sogs par 'gyur ba gang yin pa 'di ni gnas yod do //
translated: What is the meaning, then?üîΩThe meaning is this: ‚ÄúThere is a basis for the impermanence, etc.,

original: 'di ni gzhi yod do zhes bya ba ste /üîΩ'di ni srid pa yod do //üîΩ'di ni go skabs yod do //
analyzed: 'di ni gzhi yod do zhes bya ba ste / 'di ni srid pa yod do // 'di ni go skabs yod do //
translated: of this,‚Äù i.e., of the aggregates.üîΩ‚ÄúThere is a possibility for this,‚ÄùüîΩ‚Äúthere is an opportunity for this,‚Äù

original: 'di ni 'byor pa yod do zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni 'byor pa yod do zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: ‚Äúthere is a means for this.‚Äù

original: gzhi'i sgra ni de ltar shes par 'gyur ba gang yin pa 'di ni rgyu yod do zhes rgyu'i tshig kho na yin no //
analyzed: gzhi'i sgra ni de ltar shes par 'gyur ba gang yin pa 'di ni rgyu yod do zhes rgyu'i tshig kho na yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúbasis‚Äù is a word for cause, meaning ‚Äúthere is a cause for this.‚Äù

original: gnas ni go skabs yin no zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten la grags pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: gnas ni go skabs yin no zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten la grags pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: ‚ÄúA basis is an opportunity‚Äù is from the perspective of worldly convention.

original: gal te 'di bstan bcos kyi don yin par 'gyur na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gal te 'di bstan bcos kyi don yin par 'gyur na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: If this were the meaning of the treatise, then the treatise would not say, ‚ÄúIf this were the meaning of the treatise,‚Äù and so on.

original: bdag dang bdag gi zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta bas so //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta bas so //
translated: The expressions I and mine are due to the false view of individuality.

original: chad pa dang rtag pa zhes bya ba ni mthar 'dzin pa'i lta bas so //
analyzed: chad pa dang rtag pa zhes bya ba ni mthar 'dzin pa'i lta bas so //
translated: The expressions annihilation and eternality are due to the extreme views.

original: rgyu med pa dang / byed pa med pa dang / skur pa 'debs pa zhes bya ba ni log par lta bas so //
analyzed: rgyu med pa dang / byed pa med pa dang / skur pa 'debs pa zhes bya ba ni log par lta bas so //
translated: The expressions causelessness and aimlessness are due to false views.

original: mchog dang / gtso bo dang / khyad par du 'phags pa dang ; dam pa zhes bya ba ni lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pas so //
analyzed: mchog dang / gtso bo dang / khyad par du 'phags pa dang ; dam pa zhes bya ba ni lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pas so //
translated: The expressions highest, best, supreme, and most excellent are due to the esteeming of views.

original: 'das pa dang / grol ba dang / nges par 'byin pa zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pas so //
analyzed: 'das pa dang / grol ba dang / nges par 'byin pa zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pas so //
translated: The expressions past, liberated, and leads out are due to the esteeming of morality and asceticism.

original: nem nur dang yid gnyis dang / the tshom zhes bya ba ni the tshom gyis so //
analyzed: nem nur dang yid gnyis dang / the tshom zhes bya ba ni the tshom gyis so //
translated: The expressions doubt, uncertainty, and hesitation are due to doubt.

original: chags pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags kyis so //üîΩ@232b sdang ba zhes bya ba ni zhe sdang gis so //
analyzed: chags pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags kyis so // @232b sdang ba zhes bya ba ni zhe sdang gis so //
translated: The expression attachment is due to craving.üîΩThe expression aversion is due to hostility.

original: rlom pa zhes bya ba ni nga rgyal gyis so //
analyzed: rlom pa zhes bya ba ni nga rgyal gyis so //
translated: The expression conceit is due to pride.

original: rmongs pa zhes bya ba ni gti mug gis so //
analyzed: rmongs pa zhes bya ba ni gti mug gis so //
translated: The expression delusion is due to ignorance.

original: de skad kyang mi 'byung ste zhes bya bas ni 'di ni gnas yod do //üîΩ'di ni gzhi yod do //
analyzed: de skad kyang mi 'byung ste zhes bya bas ni 'di ni gnas yod do // 'di ni gzhi yod do //
translated: The phrase this is not so indicates that this is not the mode of the uncontaminated aspects.

original: zhes bya ba 'di rnam pa bcu drug ma gtogs pa zag pa med pa'i rnam pa ma yin par shes par byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di rnam pa bcu drug ma gtogs pa zag pa med pa'i rnam pa ma yin par shes par byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is the basis is not an uncontaminated aspect, except for the sixteen aspects.

original: de lta bas na 'di ni de'i don ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa la sogs par shes par 'gyur ba gang yin pa 'di ni gnas yod do //üîΩ'di ni gzhi yod do zhes ji skad du smras pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di ni de'i don ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa la sogs par shes par 'gyur ba gang yin pa 'di ni gnas yod do // 'di ni gzhi yod do zhes ji skad du smras pa'o //
translated: Therefore, this is not its meaning means that the knowledge of impermanence, etc. is not this is the basis as it was stated.

original: de ltar yid dang gzhan gyi sems shes pa thams cad rdzas kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can du grub bo //
analyzed: de ltar yid dang gzhan gyi sems shes pa thams cad rdzas kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can du grub bo //
translated: Thus, all mental and others' minds are established as having the intrinsic identity of substance as their object.

original: rdzas su ni bdun yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rdzas su ni bdun yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: They are seven in substance.

original: phyin ci log bzhi'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa bzhi'i rdzas su yin zhing /
analyzed: phyin ci log bzhi'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa bzhi'i rdzas su yin zhing /
translated: They are the substance of the four aspects of suffering because they are the antidotes to the four misconceptions.

original: kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang / lam gyi rnam pa rnams las re re zhig rdzas su yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang / lam gyi rnam pa rnams las re re zhig rdzas su yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because each of the aspects of origin, cessation, and path is a substance.

original: kun 'byung gi rnam pa thams cad rgyu'i rnam grangs yin te /
analyzed: kun 'byung gi rnam pa thams cad rgyu'i rnam grangs yin te /
translated: All the aspects of origin are synonyms of cause.

original: dper na dbang po dang brgya byin dang grong khyer 'jig ces bya ba dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dper na dbang po dang brgya byin dang grong khyer 'jig ces bya ba dang 'dra'o //
translated: For example, indriya, indra, and purandara are synonyms.

original: de bzhin du 'gog pa dang / lam gyi rnam pa thams cad kyang 'gog pa dang lam zhes bya ba'i rnam grangs yin pas rdzas su bdun yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'gog pa dang / lam gyi rnam pa thams cad kyang 'gog pa dang lam zhes bya ba'i rnam grangs yin pas rdzas su bdun yin no //
translated: Similarly, all the aspects of cessation and path are synonyms of cessation and path.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams ni rdzas su rnam pa bcu drug go zhes brjod de /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams ni rdzas su rnam pa bcu drug go zhes brjod de /
translated: Vaibhasikas say: There are sixteen aspects that are substances.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa bzhin du kun 'byung la sogs pa'i rnam pa thams cad kyang so sor mngon du bya dgos pa'i phyir rnam pa rnams ni shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid pas so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa bzhin du kun 'byung la sogs pa'i rnam pa thams cad kyang so sor mngon du bya dgos pa'i phyir rnam pa rnams ni shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid pas so zhes zer ro //
translated: Because the aspects are the nature of wisdom, all the aspects of origin and so on must be individually manifested, like the aspects of suffering.

original: de la rkyen la rag lus pa'i phyir mi rtag pa'o zhes bya ba ni rgyu la sogs pa rkyen la rag las pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de la rkyen la rag lus pa'i phyir mi rtag pa'o zhes bya ba ni rgyu la sogs pa rkyen la rag las pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is impermanent because it depends on conditions, because it depends on causes and so on.

original: rkyen la rag las te /
analyzed: rkyen la rag las te /
translated: It is born in dependence on conditions.

original: skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of the statement, ‚Äúbecause it is born in dependence on conditions.‚Äù

original: gnod pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bya ba ni gnod pa byed pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnod pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bya ba ni gnod pa byed pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is suffering because it has the nature of being harmed, because it has the nature of being harmed.

original: bdag gir lta ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis stong pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bdag gir lta ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis stong pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is empty because it is the opposite of the view of mine.

original: bdag yod na bdag gi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag yod na bdag gi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the self exists, then mine would exist.

original: bdag tu lta ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi bdag med pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi bdag med pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is selfless because it is the opposite of the view of the self.

original: gang gi rtag pa de ni sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi rtag pa de ni sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: That which is permanent is suffering.üîΩThat which is suffering is selfless.

original: sdug bsngal ba ni bdag med pa'o zhes bya bas sdug bsngal gyi bden pa de ni bdag gi mtshan nyid can ma yin la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba ni bdag med pa'o zhes bya bas sdug bsngal gyi bden pa de ni bdag gi mtshan nyid can ma yin la /
translated: Thus, the truth of suffering does not have the characteristic of a self.

original: bdag med pa de la bdag go snyam du mngon par zhen pa ni bdag tu lta ba ste /
analyzed: bdag med pa de la bdag go snyam du mngon par zhen pa ni bdag tu lta ba ste /
translated: The view of self is the manifest adherence to the non-self as a self.

original: de'i gnyen por bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: de'i gnyen por bdag med pa'o //
translated: The antidote to that is the non-self.

original: sa bon gyi chos kyi tshul gyis rgyu'o zhes bya @233a * //
analyzed: sa bon gyi chos kyi tshul gyis rgyu'o zhes bya @233a * //
translated: The cause is taught by the phrase ‚Äúin the manner of a seed-dharma.‚Äù

original: bas ni / rgyu thag ring po'i gnas skabs ston te /
analyzed: bas ni / rgyu thag ring po'i gnas skabs ston te /
translated: This shows the state of a distant cause.

original: dang po'i sa bon lta bu'o //üîΩsa bon gyi chos kyi tshul gyis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dang po'i sa bon lta bu'o // sa bon gyi chos kyi tshul gyis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is like the initial seed.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúin the manner of a seed-dharma‚Äù

original: sa bon gyi chos kyi lugs kyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sa bon gyi chos kyi lugs kyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: means ‚Äúin the manner of a seed-dharma.‚Äù

original: 'byung ba'i tshul gyis kun 'byung ba'o zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i tshul gyis kun 'byung ba'o zhes bya bas ni /
translated: The origination is taught by the phrase ‚Äúin the manner of an origination.‚Äù

original: de ma thag tu skye ba ltar rgyu thag nye ba'i gnas skabs ston te /
analyzed: de ma thag tu skye ba ltar rgyu thag nye ba'i gnas skabs ston te /
translated: This shows the state of a proximate cause, as if it were arising immediately.

original: 'di phrad nas 'byung bas kun 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di phrad nas 'byung bas kun 'byung ba'o //
translated: It is an origination because it originates after coming into contact with that.üîΩThe full production is taught by the phrase ‚Äúin the manner of a connection.‚Äù

original: 'brel pa'i tshul gyis rab tu skye ba'o zhes bya bas ni rgyun ma 'chad pa'i rgyur ston te /
analyzed: 'brel pa'i tshul gyis rab tu skye ba'o zhes bya bas ni rgyun ma 'chad pa'i rgyur ston te /
translated: This shows the cause of the uninterrupted continuum.

original: sa bon dang / myu gu dang / lo ma dang / sdong bu la sogs pa ltar 'di las rgyun chags pa 'am rab tu skye bas na rab tu skye ba'o //
analyzed: sa bon dang / myu gu dang / lo ma dang / sdong bu la sogs pa ltar 'di las rgyun chags pa 'am rab tu skye bas na rab tu skye ba'o //
translated: It is a continuum because it is a continuous process, like a seed, sprout, leaf, stem, etc.

original: mngon par bsgrub pa'i don gyis na rkyen zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: mngon par bsgrub pa'i don gyis na rkyen zhes bya bas ni /
translated: It is a condition in the sense of accomplishment because

original: rgyu la sogs pa rkyen mang po zhig la skye ba ste /
analyzed: rgyu la sogs pa rkyen mang po zhig la skye ba ste /
translated: many causes, etc., are conditions for the arising of a single thing.

original: rkyen rnams phan tshun mngon du phyogs pa las de skye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rkyen rnams phan tshun mngon du phyogs pa las de skye ba'i phyir /
translated: It arises from the mutual orientation of the conditions.

original: rkyen gcig gis skyed pa ni cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: rkyen gcig gis skyed pa ni cung zad kyang med do //
translated: There is nothing that arises from a single condition.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'ji ba'i gong bu dang / thal zhar dang / 'khor lo dang / tha gu dang / chu rnams 'dus pa dper brjod do ;
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'ji ba'i gong bu dang / thal zhar dang / 'khor lo dang / tha gu dang / chu rnams 'dus pa dper brjod do ;
translated: Therefore, the examples of the lump of clay, the spindle, the wheel, the thread, and the water are mentioned.

original: / phung po zhig pa'i phyir 'gog pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: / phung po zhig pa'i phyir 'gog pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is cessation because of the destruction of the aggregates.

original: phung po skye ba 'gog pa'i don gyis so //üîΩme gsum zhi ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phung po skye ba 'gog pa'i don gyis so // me gsum zhi ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is the object of cessation because of the destruction of the arising of the aggregates.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi me zhi ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi me zhi ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the pacification of the three fires because of the pacification of the fires of passion, hatred, and folly.

original: 'tshe ba med pa'i phyir gya nom pa'o zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'tshe ba med pa'i phyir gya nom pa'o zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is sublime because it is free from violence, which is to say, because it is free from suffering.

original: skyon thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir nges par 'byung ba'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: skyon thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir nges par 'byung ba'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is a refuge because it is the relinquishment of all misfortune.

original: skyon ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu rnams te /
analyzed: skyon ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu rnams te /
translated: Misfortune refers to the causes of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu thams cad dang bral zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu thams cad dang bral zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is a refuge because it is the relinquishment of all the causes of suffering.üîΩIt is a path because it is a means of going.

original: bgrod pa'i don gyis ni lam mo zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das par bgrod pa'i don gyis so //üîΩrigs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir /üîΩrigs pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bgrod pa'i don gyis ni lam mo zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das par bgrod pa'i don gyis so // rigs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir / rigs pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is a means of going to nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: 'thad pa dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'thad pa dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is correct because it is in conformity with reason.üîΩIt is in conformity with reason because it is in conformity with fact.üîΩIt is a practice because it is the means of accomplishing.

original: yang dag par bsgrub pa'i don gyis bsgrub pa'o zhes bya ba ni yang dag par 'gro ba'i don gyis na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yang dag par bsgrub pa'i don gyis bsgrub pa'o zhes bya ba ni yang dag par 'gro ba'i don gyis na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the means of accomplishing the right going.

original: shin tu yang dag par 'da' bar byed pa'i phyir nges par 'byin par byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni /üîΩ'bras las nyams pa 'chi ba med //
analyzed: shin tu yang dag par 'da' bar byed pa'i phyir nges par 'byin par byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni / 'bras las nyams pa 'chi ba med //
translated: It is the cause of definite emergence because it causes one to transcend completely.

original: ces 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no death for one who has fallen away from the fruit.

original: nges par 'byung ba'i dgos pa ni nges par 'byin pa ste /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i dgos pa ni nges par 'byin pa ste /
translated: The purpose of definite emergence is definite emergence,

original: dbang po'i dga' ston bzhin no //
analyzed: dbang po'i dga' ston bzhin no //
translated: like the feast of the senses.

original: gtan du ba ma yin pa'i phyir mi rtag pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gtan du ba ma yin pa'i phyir mi rtag pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is impermanent because it is not eternal.

original: sngar ni snga na med pas mi rtag par bshad la /
analyzed: sngar ni snga na med pas mi rtag par bshad la /
translated: Previously, it was explained that impermanence is due to nonexistence prior to existence.

original: da ni zhig nas med pas mi rtag pa'o zhes ston to //
analyzed: da ni zhig nas med pas mi rtag pa'o zhes ston to //
translated: Now, it is taught that impermanence is due to nonexistence after destruction.

original: khur lta bur gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya @233b ba ni /
analyzed: khur lta bur gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya @233b ba ni /
translated: It is like a burden because it is a burden.

original: khur lta bur gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khur lta bur gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is like a burden.

original: sdug bsngal gyi gang zag de 'tshir zhing gnon par byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi gang zag de 'tshir zhing gnon par byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is said that the person of suffering is crushed and oppressed.

original: 'dod dgur byed pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di la 'dod dgur byed pa'i ngang tshul yod pas na 'dod dgur byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod dgur byed pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di la 'dod dgur byed pa'i ngang tshul yod pas na 'dod dgur byed pa'o //
translated: One who has the nature of being under one‚Äôs own control is under one‚Äôs own control.

original: 'dod dgur byed pa med pa ni 'dod dgur byed pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod dgur byed pa med pa ni 'dod dgur byed pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: That which is not under one‚Äôs own control is not under one‚Äôs own control.

original: don 'di ni mdo las kyang gsungs te /
analyzed: don 'di ni mdo las kyang gsungs te /
translated: This meaning is also stated in the sutra:

original: dge slong dag gal te gzugs bdag yin par 'gyur na /
analyzed: dge slong dag gal te gzugs bdag yin par 'gyur na /
translated: ‚ÄúMonks, if form were the self,

original: gzugs bdag nyid la gnod pa byed par 'gyur gyi zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gzugs bdag nyid la gnod pa byed par 'gyur gyi zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: form would be such that it could not be faulted by itself.‚Äù

original: 'ong ba'i tshul gyis rgyu'o zhes bya ba ni /üîΩ'di las 'ong bas na rgyu ste /
analyzed: 'ong ba'i tshul gyis rgyu'o zhes bya ba ni / 'di las 'ong bas na rgyu ste /
translated: The cause is in the manner of coming.üîΩBecause it comes from this, it is a cause.

original: 'di las skye bas na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di las skye bas na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is: because it arises from this.

original: 'byung ba'i tshul gyis kun 'byung ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i tshul gyis kun 'byung ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Origination is in the manner of arising.

original: gang gi phyir ma 'ongs pa'i dus nas bdag nyid du red cing 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ma 'ongs pa'i dus nas bdag nyid du red cing 'byung ba'o //
translated: Because it arises and comes into existence from the future time,

original: 'phel ba'i tshul gyis rab tu skye ba'o zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'phel ba'i tshul gyis rab tu skye ba'o zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is fully produced in the manner of increasing.

original: dper na sa bon dang / myu gu dang / lo ma la sogs pa'i rgyun gyis 'phel ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sa bon dang / myu gu dang / lo ma la sogs pa'i rgyun gyis 'phel ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the development of a continuum of seeds, sprouts, leaves, and so on.

original: so sor 'brang ba'i don gyis rkyen to zhes bya ba ni skyed pa'i bya ba la gtso bor gyur pa'o //
analyzed: so sor 'brang ba'i don gyis rkyen to zhes bya ba ni skyed pa'i bya ba la gtso bor gyur pa'o //
translated: Condition means the cause, because it is the primary factor in the activity of producing.

original: rjes su 'gro ba'i don gyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig tu bstan par 'gyur ro //üîΩ'brel pa med pas 'brel ba zhig pa'i phyir 'gog pa'o zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal phyi ma dang 'brel pa med cing /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba'i don gyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig tu bstan par 'gyur ro // 'brel pa med pas 'brel ba zhig pa'i phyir 'gog pa'o zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal phyi ma dang 'brel pa med cing /
translated: The meaning of following is indicated by the word ‚Äúafter.‚ÄùüîΩCessation is because of the absence of connection, due to the destruction of the connection.

original: sdug bsngal snga ma 'gog pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sdug bsngal snga ma 'gog pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there is no connection with future suffering and there is the cessation of previous suffering.

original: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gsum dang bral ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang 'jig pa dang gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid dang bral ba'i phyir ro //üîΩdge ba'i phyir gya nom pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gsum dang bral ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang 'jig pa dang gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid dang bral ba'i phyir ro // dge ba'i phyir gya nom pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because of the absence of the three characteristics of conditioned phenomena, because of the absence of arising, passing away, and change while abiding.üîΩIt is sublime because of being virtuous.

original: thar pa dam pa'i don du dge zhes bya ba yin pas so //
analyzed: thar pa dam pa'i don du dge zhes bya ba yin pas so //
translated: Liberation is virtuous in the highest sense.

original: yid brtan pa'i mchog yin pa'i phyir nges par 'byung ba'o zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal thams cad rgyun chad pas mchog tu bde ba'i phyir dang / de las gzhan yid brtan par bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid brtan pa'i mchog yin pa'i phyir nges par 'byung ba'o zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal thams cad rgyun chad pas mchog tu bde ba'i phyir dang / de las gzhan yid brtan par bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the ‚Äúsupreme refuge‚Äù because it is the supreme bliss that results from the cessation of all suffering, and because there is no other refuge beyond it.

original: lam ngan pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi lam mo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lam ngan pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi lam mo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is the ‚Äúpath‚Äù because it is the path that is the opposite of the bad paths.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa tshol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa tshol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the ‚Äúpath that seeks nirvana‚Äù because it seeks nirvana.

original: rigs pa ma yin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis rigs pa'o zhes bya ba ni de las gzhan pa rigs pa ltar snang ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs pa ma yin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis rigs pa'o zhes bya ba ni de las gzhan pa rigs pa ltar snang ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the ‚Äúreason‚Äù because it is the opposite of the unreasonable, since it is the opposite of the false reasonings that are other than it.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong dang mi 'gal ba'i don gyis bsgrub pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong dang mi 'gal ba'i don gyis bsgrub pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is the ‚Äúaccomplishment‚Äù because it is the meaning that is not in conflict with the city of nirvana.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong du 'jug pa dang mi 'gal zhing slu bar mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong du 'jug pa dang mi 'gal zhing slu bar mi byed pa'o //
translated: It is the ‚Äúaccomplishment‚Äù because it is not in conflict with, and does not deceive, those who enter the city of nirvana.

original: 'dis sgrub par byed pas na sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis sgrub par byed pas na sgrub pa'o //
translated: It is the ‚Äúaccomplishment‚Äù because it accomplishes that.

original: srid pa thams cad kyi gnyen po yin pa'i @234a * //
analyzed: srid pa thams cad kyi gnyen po yin pa'i @234a * //
translated: It is the ‚Äúantidote to all existence‚Äù because it is the antidote to the three realms.

original: phyir ; nges par 'byin par byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i srid pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: phyir ; nges par 'byin par byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i srid pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is the definite-deliverance because it is the antidote to the existence of the desire, form, and formless realms.

original: 'jig rten pa ni phyogs gcig gi gnyen po yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa ni phyogs gcig gi gnyen po yin no //
translated: The mundane path is the antidote to only a part.

original: ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba ni slob dpon gyis smos pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba ni slob dpon gyis smos pa'o //
translated: It should be stated as desired means that this is the opinion of the master.

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid 'thob pa'i sngar ram 'og tu med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩmi mthun par gyur pa'i phyir sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid 'thob pa'i sngar ram 'og tu med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // mi mthun par gyur pa'i phyir sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because it has the nature of arising and passing away means that it does not exist prior to or subsequent to the attainment of its own nature.

original: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis so //üîΩbdag dang bral ba'i phyir stong pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis so // bdag dang bral ba'i phyir stong pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is suffering because it is in opposition means that it is suffering because of the suffering of conditioned states.

original: nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is empty because it is devoid of a self means that it is empty because it is devoid of an inner being who is the agent.

original: bdag nyid kyis bdag ma yin pa'i phyir bdag med pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis bdag ma yin pa'i phyir bdag med pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is insubstantial because it is devoid of a self means that it is insubstantial because it is devoid of a self that is a master.

original: gang mi rtag pa de ni sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: gang mi rtag pa de ni sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: What is impermanent is suffering.

original: gang sdug bsngal ba de ni bdag med pa'o zhes bdag gi mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang sdug bsngal ba de ni bdag med pa'o zhes bdag gi mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: What is suffering is without self, because it does not have the characteristics of a self.

original: 'dun pa'i rtsa ba can zhes bya ba ni dang po'i rgyu'i dbang du mdzad nas 'dun pa'i rgyu can no ;
analyzed: 'dun pa'i rtsa ba can zhes bya ba ni dang po'i rgyu'i dbang du mdzad nas 'dun pa'i rgyu can no ;
translated: ‚ÄúHaving desire as its root‚Äù means that it has desire as its cause, from the point of view of its primary cause.

original: /'dir 'dun pa ni sred pa'i rnam grangs so //
analyzed: /'dir 'dun pa ni sred pa'i rnam grangs so //
translated: Here, desire is a synonym for craving.

original: 'dun pa las kun 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni nye ba'i rgyu dbang du mdzad nas 'dun pa'i rgyu can no //
analyzed: 'dun pa las kun 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni nye ba'i rgyu dbang du mdzad nas 'dun pa'i rgyu can no //
translated: ‚ÄúArising from desire‚Äù means that it has desire as its cause, from the point of view of its proximate cause.

original: 'dun pa'i rigs can zhes bya ba ni 'dun pa'i rkyen can no //
analyzed: 'dun pa'i rigs can zhes bya ba ni 'dun pa'i rkyen can no //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving the nature of desire‚Äù means that it has desire as its condition.

original: 'dun pa las rab tu skye ba zhes bya ba ni /üîΩde ma thag pa'i rgyu'i dbang du mdzad nas so //
analyzed: 'dun pa las rab tu skye ba zhes bya ba ni /üîΩde ma thag pa'i rgyu'i dbang du mdzad nas so //
translated: ‚ÄúOriginating from desire‚Äù means that it has desire as its antecedent cause.

original: rab tu skye ba zhes bya ba'i sgra tha mar 'don pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do zhes bya ba ni kun 'byung gi rnam pa bzhi las rab tu skye ba'i rnam pa gsum par 'don cing rkyen gyi rnam pa bzhi par 'don mod kyi /
analyzed: rab tu skye ba zhes bya ba'i sgra tha mar 'don pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do zhes bya ba ni kun 'byung gi rnam pa bzhi las rab tu skye ba'i rnam pa gsum par 'don cing rkyen gyi rnam pa bzhi par 'don mod kyi /
translated: Although the four aspects of origination are mentioned in the order of origination, and the four conditions are mentioned in the order of condition,

original: mdo las bstan par ni rab tu skye ba'i sgra rgyu kun 'byung ba rkyen rab tu skye ba zhes phyi nas 'don par bya'o //
analyzed: mdo las bstan par ni rab tu skye ba'i sgra rgyu kun 'byung ba rkyen rab tu skye ba zhes phyi nas 'don par bya'o //
translated: in the sutra, the term ‚Äúarising‚Äù is mentioned after the cause, origination, and condition.

original: yang 'dun par mtshungs bzhin du 'dun pa 'di dag la khyad par ci yod ce na /
analyzed: yang 'dun par mtshungs bzhin du 'dun pa 'di dag la khyad par ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between these intentions, since they are the same in being intentions?

original: nga'o snyam pa ni bye brag med par lus la 'dun pa yin no zhes bya ba ni phung po mtha' dag la bdag gi dngos po don du gnyer bas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nga'o snyam pa ni bye brag med par lus la 'dun pa yin no zhes bya ba ni phung po mtha' dag la bdag gi dngos po don du gnyer bas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The intention ‚ÄúI am‚Äù is an intention toward the body without differentiation.

original: gyur cig snyam pa ni bye brag med par yang srid pa la 'dun pa yin no zhes bya ba ni lha dang mi la sogs pa'i rnam pa la mi ltos par yang srid pa tsam zhig don du gnyer ba'o //üîΩ'di lta bur gyur cig ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba rnam pa 'dir gyur cig ces lha 'am /
analyzed: gyur cig snyam pa ni bye brag med par yang srid pa la 'dun pa yin no zhes bya ba ni lha dang mi la sogs pa'i rnam pa la mi ltos par yang srid pa tsam zhig don du gnyer ba'o // 'di lta bur gyur cig ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba rnam pa 'dir gyur cig ces lha 'am /
translated: The thought ‚ÄúMay I be‚Äù is the desire for mere existence, without any distinction.üîΩThe thought ‚ÄúMay I be like this‚Äù is the desire for a specific rebirth, as a god or human, etc.üîΩThe thought ‚ÄúMay I be like this‚Äù is the desire for a specific rebirth, as a god or human, etc.

original: mi yang rung ste /
analyzed: mi yang rung ste /
translated: The thought ‚ÄúMay I be like this‚Äù is the desire for a specific rebirth, as a god or human, etc.

original: bye brag tu sred pa la 'dun pa'o //
analyzed: bye brag tu sred pa la 'dun pa'o //
translated: The desire for a specific rebirth is the desire for a specific rebirth.

original: nying mtshams sbyor ba nyid 'ching ba yin pas na nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i 'ching ba ste /üîΩde la 'dun pa @234b ni don du gnyer ba'o //
analyzed: nying mtshams sbyor ba nyid 'ching ba yin pas na nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i 'ching ba ste / de la 'dun pa @234b ni don du gnyer ba'o //
translated: The desire for the bond of rebirth is the desire for the bond of rebirth.üîΩThe desire for the bond of rebirth is the desire for the bond of rebirth.üîΩThe desire for the bond of rebirth is the desire for the bond of rebirth.üîΩThe desire for the bond of rebirth is the desire for the bond of rebirth.üîΩThe desire for the bond of rebirth is the desire for the bond of rebirth.üîΩThe desire for the bond of rebirth is the desire for the bond of rebirth.üîΩThe desire for the bond of rebirth is the desire for the bond of rebirth.üîΩThe desire for the bond of rebirth is the desire for the bond of rebirth.üîΩThe desire for the bond of rebirth is the desire for the bond of rebirth.üîΩThe desire for the bond of rebirth is the desire for the bond of rebirth.üîΩThe desire for the bond of rebirth is the desire for the bond of rebirth.üîΩThe desire for the bond of rebirth is the desire for the bond of rebirth.üîΩThe desire for the bond of rebirth is the desire for the bond of rebirth.üîΩThe desire for the bond of rebirth is the desire for the bond of rebirth.üîΩThe desire for the bond of rebirth is the desire for the bond of rebirth.üîΩThe desire for the bond of rebirth is the desire for the bond of rebirth.

original: dmyal bar nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i 'ching ba don du gnyer ba mi srid pas de'i phyir yang na las mngon par 'du byed pa la 'dun pa yin zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: dmyal bar nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i 'ching ba don du gnyer ba mi srid pas de'i phyir yang na las mngon par 'du byed pa la 'dun pa yin zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The desire for the bond of rebirth is the desire for the bond of rebirth.üîΩThe desire for the bond of rebirth is the desire for the bond of rebirth.üîΩThe desire for the bond of rebirth is the desire for the bond of rebirth.üîΩThe desire for the bond of rebirth is the desire for the bond of rebirth.üîΩThe desire for the bond of rebirth is the desire for the bond of rebirth.üîΩThe desire for the bond of rebirth is the desire for the bond of rebirth.

original: las la mngon par 'du byed ba ni las mngon par 'du byed pa ste /
analyzed: las la mngon par 'du byed ba ni las mngon par 'du byed pa ste /
translated: The desire for the bond of rebirth is the desire for the bond of rebirth.üîΩThe desire for the bond of rebirth is the

original: de la 'dun pa ni sbyin pa 'di lta bu dang 'di lta bu sbyin no snyam du don du gnyer ba'i sgo nas don du gnyer ba'o //
analyzed: de la 'dun pa ni sbyin pa 'di lta bu dang 'di lta bu sbyin no snyam du don du gnyer ba'i sgo nas don du gnyer ba'o //
translated: Aspiration is the desire to give such and such gifts, by way of the desire for the object.

original: de la dang po ni sdug bsngal gyi dang po'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir rtsa ba'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la dang po ni sdug bsngal gyi dang po'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir rtsa ba'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The first is the root cause, because it is the cause of the first suffering.

original: dang po 'dun pa des 'phangs pa'i 'dun pa las brgyud nas phung po lnga 'am bzhi'i skye ba mngon par 'grub pa ste /
analyzed: dang po 'dun pa des 'phangs pa'i 'dun pa las brgyud nas phung po lnga 'am bzhi'i skye ba mngon par 'grub pa ste /
translated: The first, aspiration, is the cause of the five aggregates or four aggregates that are projected by that aspiration and that are produced in sequence from aspiration.

original: 'di ni phung khrol thams cad kyi rtsa ba'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni phung khrol thams cad kyi rtsa ba'i rgyu yin no //
translated: This is the root cause of all misfortune.

original: 'bras bu'i sa bon bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i sa bon bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is like the seed of a fruit.

original: rtsa ba'i rgyu yin pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rgyu yin pa lta bu ste /
translated: It is like the root cause.

original: sa bon gyis 'phangs pa'i myu gu la sogs pa'i rgyu las 'bras bu 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa bon gyis 'phangs pa'i myu gu la sogs pa'i rgyu las 'bras bu 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the fruit arises from the cause of the sprout, etc., which is projected by the seed.

original: gnyis pa ni kun 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni kun 'byung ba yin te /
translated: The second is the origination,

original: des de yang dag par 'grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: des de yang dag par 'grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: because it is the origination of that.

original: bye brag med par yang srid pa la 'dun pa gang yin pa 'dun pa gnyis pa des lus de yang dag par 'grub pa'i phyir /üîΩskad cig ma brgyud pas 'bras bu myu gu la sogs pa skye ba bzhin te /
analyzed: bye brag med par yang srid pa la 'dun pa gang yin pa 'dun pa gnyis pa des lus de yang dag par 'grub pa'i phyir / skad cig ma brgyud pas 'bras bu myu gu la sogs pa skye ba bzhin te /
translated: The second craving is the craving for existence in general, and it is the craving that brings about the formation of the body.üîΩThe process is similar to the arising of the effect, such as a sprout, through a succession of instants.

original: dper na brgyud nas myu gu la sogs pa skye ba 'bras bu'i yang dag par 'grub pa yin pa de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dper na brgyud nas myu gu la sogs pa skye ba 'bras bu'i yang dag par 'grub pa yin pa de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The arising of the sprout, etc., is the formation of the effect, which occurs indirectly.

original: gsum pa ni 'di lta bur gyur cig snyam pa'i 'dun pa ji skad du bshad pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni 'di lta bur gyur cig snyam pa'i 'dun pa ji skad du bshad pa'o //
translated: The third craving is the craving for a particular kind of existence, as in the wish, ‚ÄúMay I become like this.‚Äù

original: de dang 'dra ba'i sdug bsngal gyi rkyen yin te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba'i sdug bsngal gyi rkyen yin te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The condition for suffering is similar to that.

original: bye brag tu yang srid pa la 'dun pa rnam pa gang yin pa de dang 'dra ba'i sdug bsngal gyi rkyen du gyur pa dang / mi lus don du gnyer ba ni 'gro ba gzhan gyi lus kyi rkyen du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bye brag tu yang srid pa la 'dun pa rnam pa gang yin pa de dang 'dra ba'i sdug bsngal gyi rkyen du gyur pa dang / mi lus don du gnyer ba ni 'gro ba gzhan gyi lus kyi rkyen du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The condition for suffering is similar to the craving for a particular kind of existence, but the desire for a human body is not a condition for the body of another kind of being.

original: lus la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rlung dang / nyi ma la sogs pa bsdu ste /
analyzed: lus la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rlung dang / nyi ma la sogs pa bsdu ste /
translated: ‚ÄúLike the body, etc.‚Äù The term ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes wind, sun, etc.

original: de dag kyang 'bras bu phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang 'bras bu phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: They are also endowed with a perfect result.

original: nus pa ni bsil ba dang / dro ba nyid do //
analyzed: nus pa ni bsil ba dang / dro ba nyid do //
translated: The potency is the capacity for heat and cold.

original: rnam par smin pa ni mngar ba dang / skyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ni mngar ba dang / skyur ba nyid do //
translated: The ripening is the capacity for sweetness and sourness.

original: mthu ni gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi nus mthu'i khyad par te /
analyzed: mthu ni gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi nus mthu'i khyad par te /
translated: The power is the special capacity of form, etc.

original: gang las 'byung ba dang / sdud pa la sogs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gang las 'byung ba dang / sdud pa la sogs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: , from which the arising, the gathering, etc.

original: bzhi pa ni rab tu skye ba ste /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni rab tu skye ba ste /
translated: The fourth is the arising.

original: de kho na las de skye pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de kho na las de skye pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúFrom that alone, it arises‚Äù means:

original: de kho na las zhes bya ba ni nying mtshams sbyor ba'i 'ching ba la 'dun pa las so //
analyzed: de kho na las zhes bya ba ni nying mtshams sbyor ba'i 'ching ba la 'dun pa las so //
translated: ‚Äúfrom that alone‚Äù means from the craving for the bond of rebirth-linking;

original: de skye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nyid mtshams sbyor ba yang srid pa zhes bya ba skye zhing 'byung ba'i phyir 'bras bu'i tha ma me tog bzhin te /
analyzed: de skye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nyid mtshams sbyor ba yang srid pa zhes bya ba skye zhing 'byung ba'i phyir 'bras bu'i tha ma me tog bzhin te /
translated: ‚Äúit arises‚Äù means that the rebirth-linking is called ‚Äúrebirth‚Äù because it is the arising and occurrence of the result, like a flower.

original: dper na tha ma me tog las 'bras bu rab tu skye ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na tha ma me tog las 'bras bu rab tu skye ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, the fruit is produced from the flower as the last cause.
Here,

original: 'dun pa bzhi pa ni yang srid pa'i mngon sum pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: 'dun pa bzhi pa ni yang srid pa'i mngon sum pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: the fourth desire is the direct cause of rebirth.

original: snga ma gsum ni brgyud pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: snga ma gsum ni brgyud pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The first three are the indirect causes.

original: yang na 'dun pa bzhi ni sred pa'i bye brag rnams las lnga tshan gnyis dang bzhi tshan gnyis yin te zhes bya ba ni ji skad du bshad pa dag ste /
analyzed: yang na 'dun pa bzhi ni sred pa'i bye brag rnams las lnga tshan gnyis dang bzhi tshan gnyis yin te zhes bya ba ni ji skad du bshad pa dag ste /
translated: Or else, the four desires are two groups of five and two groups of four, which are the different types of craving, as explained above.

original: go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: go rims bzhin no //
translated: They are in the order in which they arise.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: nga'o snyam du bye brag med par lus la 'dun pa de ni srid pa'i bye brag lngar 'gyur te /
analyzed: nga'o snyam du bye brag med par lus la 'dun pa de ni srid pa'i bye brag lngar 'gyur te /
translated: The desire for the body, which is the thought ‚ÄúI am,‚Äù is fivefold, as a particular type of craving.

original: dge slong dag nga'o snyam pa yod na /üîΩnga 'di lta bu'o snyam pa 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: dge slong dag nga'o snyam pa yod na / nga 'di lta bu'o snyam pa 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: ‚ÄúMonks, if the thought ‚ÄòI am‚Äô exists,üîΩthe thought ‚ÄòI am thus‚Äô arises,

original: nga 'di 'dra'o snyam pa dang / da de lta ma yin no snyam pa dang / nga bzang ngo snyam pa dang / nga ngan no snyam pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nga 'di 'dra'o snyam pa dang / da de lta ma yin no snyam pa dang / nga bzang ngo snyam pa dang / nga ngan no snyam pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the thought ‚ÄòI am like this,‚Äô the thought ‚ÄòI am not,‚Äô the thought ‚ÄòI will be good,‚Äô and the thought ‚ÄòI will be bad‚Äô arise.‚Äù

original: bye brag med par lus la 'dun pas sdug bsngal ba lnga tshan 'di ni de lta'o //
analyzed: bye brag med par lus la 'dun pas sdug bsngal ba lnga tshan 'di ni de lta'o //
translated: The five types of desire for the body are the same as the above, except that they are not specific.

original: lnga tshan gnyis pa ni de la 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam pa 'byung bar 'gyur zhing de la 'byung bar mi 'gyur snyam pa dang / 'di lta bur 'gyur ro snyam pa dang / 'di 'dra bar 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam pa dang / de lta ma yin par 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: lnga tshan gnyis pa ni de la 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam pa 'byung bar 'gyur zhing de la 'byung bar mi 'gyur snyam pa dang / 'di lta bur 'gyur ro snyam pa dang / 'di 'dra bar 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam pa dang / de lta ma yin par 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The second group of five is the desire that ‚Äúmay I be born in such a place,‚Äù the desire that ‚Äúmay I be born in such a way,‚Äù the desire that ‚Äúmay I be born like this,‚Äù the desire that ‚Äúmay I be born in such a form,‚Äù and the desire that ‚Äúmay I be born in such a manner.‚Äù

original: 'dun pa lnga tshan 'di ni bye brag med par yang srid pa la 'dun pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dun pa lnga tshan 'di ni bye brag med par yang srid pa la 'dun pa yin no //
translated: These five types of desire are the desire for existence in general.

original: de la gyur cig snyam pa 'byung bar 'gyur zhing de la 'di lta bur gyur cig snyam pa dang de 'dra bar gyur cig snyam pa dang de lta ma yin par gyur cig snyam pa 'byung ba bzhi tshan 'di ni bye brag med par yang srid pa laüîΩ'dun pa yin no //
analyzed: de la gyur cig snyam pa 'byung bar 'gyur zhing de la 'di lta bur gyur cig snyam pa dang de 'dra bar gyur cig snyam pa dang de lta ma yin par gyur cig snyam pa 'byung ba bzhi tshan 'di ni bye brag med par yang srid pa laüîΩ'dun pa yin no //
translated: The four types of desire that ‚Äúmay I be,‚Äù the desire that ‚Äúmay I be like this,‚Äù the desire that ‚Äúmay I be in such a way,‚Äù and the desire that ‚Äúmay I be in such a form‚Äù are the desire for existence in general.

original: gyur kyang ci ma rung snyam pa dang / 'di lta bur gyur kyang ci ma rung snyam pa dang / de lta bu ma yin par gyur kyang ci ma rung snyam pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba bzhi tshan 'di ni bzhi pa nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i 'ching ba la 'dun pa yin no //
analyzed: gyur kyang ci ma rung snyam pa dang / 'di lta bur gyur kyang ci ma rung snyam pa dang / de lta bu ma yin par gyur kyang ci ma rung snyam pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba bzhi tshan 'di ni bzhi pa nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i 'ching ba la 'dun pa yin no //
translated: The four sets of four thoughts such as How good it would be if I were to become like this! How good it would be if this were to become like that! and How good it would be if this were not to become like that! are the four types of aspiration for the fetter of connecting with the next life.

original: de la dang po ni sdug bsngal gyi dang po'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir rtsa ba'i rgyu yin te zhes bya ba rgyas par snga ma bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la dang po ni sdug bsngal gyi dang po'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir rtsa ba'i rgyu yin te zhes bya ba rgyas par snga ma bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The first is the root cause because it is the cause of the first suffering, and so on, as before.

original: 'jug pa med pa'i phyir 'gog pa'o zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang skye ba'i 'jug bzhi pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'jug pa med pa'i phyir 'gog pa'o zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang skye ba'i 'jug bzhi pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is cessation because there is no further engagement, meaning there is no further engagement of affliction and birth.

original: sdug bsngal zhi ba'i phyir zhi ba ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal zhi ba'i phyir zhi ba ste /
translated: It is peace because it is the pacification of suffering, and so on.

original: sdug bsngal ni ma zhi ba yin la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni ma zhi ba yin la /
translated: Suffering is not peace.

original: de yang skye ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: de yang skye ba kho na yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is just birth.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: de'i phyir dge slong dag de ltar na zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir dge slong dag de ltar na zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, Monks, it is like this.

original: gong na med pa'i phyir gya nom pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gong na med pa'i phyir gya nom pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is sublime because there is nothing higher.

original: gong ni yod pa ni gya nom pa yin no zhes bya bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gong ni yod pa ni gya nom pa yin no zhes bya bar mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not suitable to say that what is higher is sublime.

original: yang phyir mi ldog pa'i phyir nges par 'byung ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang phyir mi ldog pa'i phyir nges par 'byung ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is emancipation because there is no return.

original: gtan du nga ma yin pa ni nges par 'byung @235b ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gtan du nga ma yin pa ni nges par 'byung @235b ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not emancipation if there is not complete non-return.

original: lam lta bur gyur pa'i phyir lam mo zhes bya ba ni lam dang chos mthun pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩyang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin zhugs pa'i phyir rigs pa'o zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin zhugs pa ma yin pa ni rigs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam lta bur gyur pa'i phyir lam mo zhes bya ba ni lam dang chos mthun pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin zhugs pa'i phyir rigs pa'o zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin zhugs pa ma yin pa ni rigs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the path because it is like a path. The meaning is: because it is similar to a path.üîΩIt is correct because it is correctly engaged. The meaning is: it is not correct if it is not correctly engaged.üîΩIt is practice because it is definite. The meaning is: it is not practice if it is indefinite.

original: so sor nges pa'i phyir sgrub pa ste zhes bya ba la so sor nges pa nyid ni mya ngan las 'das par nges pa nyid de /
analyzed: so sor nges pa'i phyir sgrub pa ste zhes bya ba la so sor nges pa nyid ni mya ngan las 'das par nges pa nyid de /
translated: It is definite because it is definite in nirvana.

original: de nyid kyis der 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyis der 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it goes there.

original: de nyid la khungs ni /
analyzed: de nyid la khungs ni /
translated: The source for that is this:

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
translated: As it is said in detail.

original: gtan du nges par 'byung bar byed pa'i phyir nges par 'byin no zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: gtan du nges par 'byung bar byed pa'i phyir nges par 'byin no zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: It is the truth of the path because it is the means of deliverance, as before.

original: yang na rtag pa dang bde ba dang bdag gi dang bdag tu lta ba spyad pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: yang na rtag pa dang bde ba dang bdag gi dang bdag tu lta ba spyad pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Or, for those who practice the views of permanence, happiness, mine, and self, respectively.

original: de la 'du byed rnams rtag go snyam du lta bas spyad pa rnams la ni mi rtag pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'du byed rnams rtag go snyam du lta bas spyad pa rnams la ni mi rtag pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: For those who practice the view that formations are permanent, the aspect of impermanence.

original: 'du byed rnams bde'o snyam du lta bas sbyang pa rnams la ni sdug bsngal ba'i rnam pa'o //üîΩ'du byed rnams bdag gi ba'o snyam du lta bas sbyang pa rnams la ni stong pa'i rnam pa'o //üîΩ'du byed rnams bdag yin no //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams bde'o snyam du lta bas sbyang pa rnams la ni sdug bsngal ba'i rnam pa'o // 'du byed rnams bdag gi ba'o snyam du lta bas sbyang pa rnams la ni stong pa'i rnam pa'o // 'du byed rnams bdag yin no //
translated: For those who practice the view that formations are happy, the aspect of suffering.üîΩFor those who practice the view that formations are mine, the aspect of emptiness.

original: snyam du lta bas spyad pa rnams la ni bdag med pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: snyam du lta bas spyad pa rnams la ni bdag med pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: For those who practice the view that formations are a self, the aspect of selflessness.

original: 'du byed rnams rgyu med pa'o snyam du lta bas spyad pa rnams la ni rgyu'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams rgyu med pa'o snyam du lta bas spyad pa rnams la ni rgyu'i rnam pa'o //
translated: For those who practice by the view that compounded things are causeless, it is the aspect of cause.

original: thams cad kyi rgyu dbang phyug la sogs pa gcig pu'o snyam du lta bas sbyang pa rnams la ni kun 'byung ba'i rnam pa'o ;
analyzed: thams cad kyi rgyu dbang phyug la sogs pa gcig pu'o snyam du lta bas sbyang pa rnams la ni kun 'byung ba'i rnam pa'o ;
translated: For those who practice by the view that the cause of everything is a single entity such as God, it is the aspect of origination.

original: /'gyur bar lta bas spyad pa rnams la ni rab tu skye ba'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: /'gyur bar lta bas spyad pa rnams la ni rab tu skye ba'i rnam pa ste /
translated: For those who practice by the view of transformation, it is the aspect of production.

original: dang por 'byung zhing rab tu skye ba yin gyi /
analyzed: dang por 'byung zhing rab tu skye ba yin gyi /
translated: It is the first arising and production,

original: 'gyur ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: not transformation.

original: yang na 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni dga' ba'i gang du skye ba zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i rnam grangs so //
analyzed: yang na 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni dga' ba'i gang du skye ba zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i rnam grangs so //
translated: Alternatively, ‚Äútransformation‚Äù means ‚Äúbirth in a place of pleasure,‚Äù and ‚Äúproduction‚Äù is a synonym for ‚Äúbirth.‚Äù

original: blo sngon du btang ba byed pa po yin no snyam du lta bas spyod pa rnams la rkyen gyi rnam pa ste /
analyzed: blo sngon du btang ba byed pa po yin no snyam du lta bas spyod pa rnams la rkyen gyi rnam pa ste /
translated: For those who practice by the view that the intellect is the agent that precedes, it is the aspect of condition.

original: rkyen gyi tshig ni blo sngon du ma btang ba'i rgyu'i tshig go //
analyzed: rkyen gyi tshig ni blo sngon du ma btang ba'i rgyu'i tshig go //
translated: The word ‚Äúcondition‚Äù is a synonym for ‚Äúcause.‚Äù

original: thar pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: thar pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: With regard to ‚Äúthere is no liberation,‚Äù and so on,

original: skye ba'i rgyun la thog ma bzhin du tha ma yang med do snyam du gang dag log par lta ba gang yin pa de'i gnyen por 'gog pa'i rnam pa yin no //üîΩyul nye bar longs spyad pa med phyir dang / dbang po rnam 'jig pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: skye ba'i rgyun la thog ma bzhin du tha ma yang med do snyam du gang dag log par lta ba gang yin pa de'i gnyen por 'gog pa'i rnam pa yin no // yul nye bar longs spyad pa med phyir dang / dbang po rnam 'jig pa'i phyir na /
translated: The aspect of cessation is the antidote to the view that the continuum of birth is without a beginning and without an end.üîΩThe aspect of peace is the antidote to the view that liberation is suffering, because there is no enjoyment of objects and because the faculties are destroyed.üîΩThe aspect of excellence is the antidote to the view that the bliss of the absorptions is excellent.üîΩThe aspect of definitive emergence is the antidote to the view that nirvƒÅ·πáa is not definitive emergence.

original: sdug bsngal ni thar pa yin no snyam du lta bas spyad pa rnams kyi gnyen por ni zhi ba'i rnam pa yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni thar pa yin no snyam du lta bas spyad pa rnams kyi gnyen por ni zhi ba'i rnam pa yin no //
translated: The aspect of separation is the antidote to the view that the path is not the separation from suffering.üîΩThe aspect of cessation is the antidote to the view that the continuum of birth is without a beginning and without an end.üîΩThe aspect of peace is the antidote to the view that liberation is suffering, because there is no enjoyment of objects and because the faculties are destroyed.üîΩThe aspect of excellence is the antidote to the view that the bliss of the absorptions is excellent.üîΩThe aspect of definitive emergence is the antidote to the view that nirvƒÅ·πáa is not definitive emergence.üîΩThe aspect of separation is the antidote to the view that the path is not the separation from suffering.

original: bsam gtan gyi bde ba gya nom pa yin par lta bas spyad pa rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa thams cad ni brda phrad par sla bas rnam par ma phye'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi bde ba gya nom pa yin par lta bas spyad pa rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa thams cad ni brda phrad par sla bas rnam par ma phye'o //
translated: The aspect of excellence is the antidote to the view that the bliss of the absorptions is excellent.üîΩThe aspect of definitive emergence is the antidote to the view that nirvƒÅ·πáa is not definitive emergence.üîΩThe aspect of separation is the antidote to the view that the path is not the separation from suffering.üîΩThe aspect of excellence is the antidote to the view that the bliss of the absorptions is excellent.üîΩThe aspect of definitive emergence is the antidote to the view that nirvƒÅ·πáa is not definitive emergence.üîΩThe aspect of separation is the antidote to the view that the path is not the separation from suffering.üîΩThe aspect of excellence is the antidote to the view that the bliss of the absorptions is excellent.

original: shes rab @236a * //üîΩgzhan dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa'i phyir shes rab rnams dang bcas par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: shes rab @236a * //üîΩgzhan dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa'i phyir shes rab rnams dang bcas par mi 'gyur te /
translated: The aspect of definitive emergence is the antidote to the

original: rten dang dmigs pa dang rnam pa dang dus dang rdzas mtshungs pa dag gis mtshungs par ldan pas na mtshungs par ldan pa'o zhes bya ba ni nges pa yin no //
analyzed: rten dang dmigs pa dang rnam pa dang dus dang rdzas mtshungs pa dag gis mtshungs par ldan pas na mtshungs par ldan pa'o zhes bya ba ni nges pa yin no //
translated: The definition is: they are similar in five ways, i.e., in terms of basis, object, aspect, time, and substance.

original: 'di ltar rnam pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba thams cad kyi dmigs pa 'dzin pa'i rnam pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rigs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba thams cad kyi dmigs pa 'dzin pa'i rnam pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rigs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni //
translated: Thus, the aspect is the aspect of apprehending the object-field of all minds and mental factors.

original: mdo sde pa'i lugs yin no //
analyzed: mdo sde pa'i lugs yin no //
translated: This is the Sautrantika system.

original: 'dzin pa ni 'dzin pa'i bye brag go //
analyzed: 'dzin pa ni 'dzin pa'i bye brag go //
translated: Apprehending is a particular kind of grasping.

original: de lta ma yin na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na /
translated: Otherwise,

original: shes rab kyang rnam pa dang bcas par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar grub bo //
analyzed: shes rab kyang rnam pa dang bcas par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar grub bo //
translated: it would be established that wisdom also has an aspect.

original: yang ci shes rab kho nas 'dzin par byed dam zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang ci shes rab kho nas 'dzin par byed dam zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Does only wisdom apprehend?

original: gtod par byed dam zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gtod par byed dam zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means: does it project?

original: de dang bcas pa'i dmigs pa dang bcas pas 'dzin par byed ces bya ba 'dis ga las she na /
analyzed: de dang bcas pa'i dmigs pa dang bcas pas 'dzin par byed ces bya ba 'dis ga las she na /
translated: From what is this known?

original: bstan bcos las te /
analyzed: bstan bcos las te /
translated: From the treatise.

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are the dharmas that have an object?

original: sems dang sems las byung ba thams cad do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba thams cad do zhes gsungs so //
translated: All the minds and mental factors.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i chos gzhan thams cad kyis kyang 'dzin par byed do zhes bya ba smos so //üîΩyod pa thams cad gzung bya yin //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i chos gzhan thams cad kyis kyang 'dzin par byed do zhes bya ba smos so // yod pa thams cad gzung bya yin //
translated: That is why it is said: ‚ÄúAll the other dharmas that have an object also grasp.‚ÄùüîΩAll that exists is the object of apprehension.

original: zhes bya ba ni gang cung zad rdzas su yod pa 'am brtags par yod pa de thams cad gzung bar bya ba yin no //üîΩ'dir yod pa smos pa ni med pa bzlog par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang cung zad rdzas su yod pa 'am brtags par yod pa de thams cad gzung bar bya ba yin no // 'dir yod pa smos pa ni med pa bzlog par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Whatever exists substantially or conventionally is all apprehended.üîΩHere, the word ‚Äúall‚Äù is used to exclude the non-existent.

original: thams cad smos pa ni rdzas dang kun rdzob nye bar gzung bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad smos pa ni rdzas dang kun rdzob nye bar gzung bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúthat exists‚Äù is used to include the substantial and the conventional.

original: de ltar byas nas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ltar byas nas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Having done that,

original: shes rab ni rnam pa yang yin te /
analyzed: shes rab ni rnam pa yang yin te /
translated: wisdom is a kind of apprehension,

original: de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has that as its nature.

original: 'dzin par byed pa yang yin te /
analyzed: 'dzin par byed pa yang yin te /
translated: It is also an apprehender,

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has an object.

original: gzung bar bya ba yang yin te yod pa'i phyir dang / shes rab kyi dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzung bar bya ba yang yin te yod pa'i phyir dang / shes rab kyi dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are also objects of observation because they exist and are objects of observation of wisdom.

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa gzhan ni 'dzin par byed pa dang gzung bar bya ba ste /üîΩtshogs pa phyi ma gtad par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa gzhan ni 'dzin par byed pa dang gzung bar bya ba ste / tshogs pa phyi ma gtad par bya ba yin te /
translated: Other objects of observation that possess objects of observation are that which apprehends and that which is apprehended.

original: chos thams cad ni skad cig ma gnyis kyi dmigs pa yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro /üîΩrnam pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni skad cig ma gnyis kyi dmigs pa yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro / rnam pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The latter collection is that which is to be passed on because it is said, ‚ÄúAll phenomena are objects of observation of two moments.‚Äù

original: shes rab kyi rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir dang / shes rab kho na rnam pa yin no zhes bya ba grub pa'i mtha' yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir dang / shes rab kho na rnam pa yin no zhes bya ba grub pa'i mtha' yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not aspects because they are not the nature of wisdom and because it is a tenet that only wisdom is an aspect.

original: dmigs pa med pa'i chos rnams ni gzung bar bya ba kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni gtang bar bya ba kho na yin te /
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa'i chos rnams ni gzung bar bya ba kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni gtang bar bya ba kho na yin te /
translated: Dharmas that are without objects of observation are only objects of observation because they are only that which is to be passed on.
