original: gtong par byed pa ma yin @236b no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gtong par byed pa ma yin @236b no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They are not that which passes on because it is a synonym for ‚Äúnot that which apprehends.‚Äù

original: dge ba la sogs pa'i bye brag bstan par bya ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge ba la sogs pa'i bye brag bstan par bya ste zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The Distinctive Features of Virtue and so forth should be explained.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa dang / sa dang rten la sogs pa'i bye brag bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa dang / sa dang rten la sogs pa'i bye brag bstan par bya ste /
translated: Virtue, nonvirtue, indeterminate, the specific realms, levels, etc.

original: dang po rnam gsum zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dang po rnam gsum zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The first is threefold, because it is contaminated.

original: gzhan rnams dge zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan rnams dge zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The others are virtuous.

original: zag pa med pas nye bar 'tshe ba med pa nyid kyis te nye bar 'tshe ba med par 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: zag pa med pas nye bar 'tshe ba med pa nyid kyis te nye bar 'tshe ba med par 'gro ba yin no //
translated: They are virtuous because they are not harmful, since they are uncontaminated.

original: tshigs su bcad pa'i dang po na yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa'i dang po na yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because it is mentioned first in the verse.

original: shes pa zag bcas zag pa med //
analyzed: shes pa zag bcas zag pa med //
translated: Knowledge is contaminated or uncontaminated.

original: ces bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa der kun rdzob shes pa dang por 'don pa yin no //üîΩdang po sa rnams thams cad na //
analyzed: ces bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa der kun rdzob shes pa dang por 'don pa yin no // dang po sa rnams thams cad na //
translated: In that verse, conventional knowledge is mentioned first.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Conventional knowledge is on all levels.

original: kun rdzob shes pa ni rang gi ngo bo dmigs pa'i sgo nas 'dod pa'i khams nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du dmigs so //
analyzed: kun rdzob shes pa ni rang gi ngo bo dmigs pa'i sgo nas 'dod pa'i khams nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du dmigs so //
translated: Conventional knowledge is focused on its own nature, from the desire realm up to the summit of existence.üîΩConventional knowledge is on all levels.

original: drug na chos shes bya zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam sa drug pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: drug na chos shes bya zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam sa drug pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The sixth is called Dharma knowledge because it is the sixth level of the path of seeing.

original: de dag gcig tu zad pa dang bcas pa'i phyir mi lcogs pa med pa las gzhan pa'i nye bar bsdogs pa dag na med la 'dod pa'i khams la dmigs pa'i phyir gzugs med pa'i sa dag na yang med do //
analyzed: de dag gcig tu zad pa dang bcas pa'i phyir mi lcogs pa med pa las gzhan pa'i nye bar bsdogs pa dag na med la 'dod pa'i khams la dmigs pa'i phyir gzugs med pa'i sa dag na yang med do //
translated: It does not exist on the access concentrations other than unrestricted access concentration because they are exclusively associated with the contaminated faculty of possessing complete knowledge. It does not exist on the formless realm levels because it focuses on the desire realm.

original: dgu na rjes shes bya ba zhes bya ba ni mi lcogs pa med pa la sogs pa rnams gong ma'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa dmigs pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: dgu na rjes shes bya ba zhes bya ba ni mi lcogs pa med pa la sogs pa rnams gong ma'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa dmigs pa'i phyir la /
translated: The ninth is called subsequent knowledge because it focuses on the higher realms of suffering and so on.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa'i nyer bsdogs rnams dang / srid pa'i rtse mo ni gcig tu zag pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa'i nyer bsdogs rnams dang / srid pa'i rtse mo ni gcig tu zag pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It does not exist on the access concentrations of the second absorption and so on and on the summit of existence because they are exclusively associated with contaminated states.

original: de bzhin drug ces bya ba la /
analyzed: de bzhin drug ces bya ba la /
translated: So too, six.

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba'i sgras ni ma phye bar sa dgu pa'i rnam pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba'i sgras ni ma phye bar sa dgu pa'i rnam pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: The term so too indicates that it is associated with the nine levels without differentiation.

original: phye na ni ci rigs par drug dang dgu dag na yod do //
analyzed: phye na ni ci rigs par drug dang dgu dag na yod do //
translated: If differentiated, it exists on six and nine levels, respectively.

original: gzhan yid shes pa bsam gtan na //
analyzed: gzhan yid shes pa bsam gtan na //
translated: Knowledge of others' minds exists in the absorptions.

original: zhes bya ba ni mngon par shes pa'i dbang du byas nas bshad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mngon par shes pa'i dbang du byas nas bshad pa'o //
translated: This is explained from the perspective of the higher perceptions.

original: gzhan na med do zhes bya ba ni nyer bsdogs dang bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa dag na med pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan na med do zhes bya ba ni nyer bsdogs dang bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa dag na med pa'o //
translated: It does not exist in other levels means it does not exist in access concentrations, the absorptions, or the formless realm.

original: de ni 'dod dang gzugs rten can //
analyzed: de ni 'dod dang gzugs rten can //
translated: It is supported by desire and form.

original: zhes bya ba la gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi rten can kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi rten can kho na yin gyi /
translated: Knowledge of others' minds is supported by desire and form alone.

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa kho na 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi rten can ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa kho na 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi rten can ni ma yin no //
translated: But knowledge of others' minds is not necessarily supported by desire and form.

original: gong na mthong lam med ces 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gong na mthong lam med ces 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: Because it is said, The path of seeing does not exist above.

original: chos shes pa ni 'dod pa'i rten can kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: chos shes pa ni 'dod pa'i rten can kho na yin gyi /
translated: Knowledge of the truth of Dharma is supported by desire alone.

original: chos shes pa kho na 'dod pa'i rten can ni ma yin no //
analyzed: chos shes pa kho na 'dod pa'i rten can ni ma yin no //
translated: But knowledge of the truth of Dharma is not necessarily supported by desire.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Therefore it is said,

original: khams gsum pa'i rten can gzhan zhes bya ba smos so //üîΩpha rol gyi sems shes pa dang chos shes @237a * //
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i rten can gzhan zhes bya ba smos so // pha rol gyi sems shes pa dang chos shes @237a * //
translated: It is supported by other levels of the three realms.

original: pa ma gtogs so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: pa ma gtogs so zhes bya ba la /
translated: Except for knowledge of others' minds and knowledge of the truth of Dharma.

original: rjes su shes pa dang sdug bsngal shes pa la sogs pa bsgom pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa bzhi dang / zad pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa dang kun rdzob shes pa ni khams gsum pa'i rten can yin no //
analyzed: rjes su shes pa dang sdug bsngal shes pa la sogs pa bsgom pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa bzhi dang / zad pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa dang kun rdzob shes pa ni khams gsum pa'i rten can yin no //
translated: The knowledge of elimination and nonarising and conventional knowledge are possessed by beings of the three realms.

original: 'gog pa shes pa ni gcig ste /
analyzed: 'gog pa shes pa ni gcig ste /
translated: The knowledge of cessation is one.

original: chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa lus dang tshor ba dang sems dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i phyir chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa de la dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa lus dang tshor ba dang sems dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i phyir chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa de la dmigs pa yin no //
translated: It is the close placement of mindfulness of phenomena because it focuses on the close placement of mindfulness of phenomena since cessation is dissimilar in characteristics to body, feeling, and mind.

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni tshor ba dang / sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pas bsdus pa'i phyir yin no zhes bya bar rtogs na chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa go ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni tshor ba dang / sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pas bsdus pa'i phyir yin no zhes bya bar rtogs na chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa go ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: If it is understood that the knowledge of others' minds is subsumed by the close placement of mindfulness of feeling and mind, how is it the close placement of mindfulness of phenomena?

original: sems las byung ba 'du shes kyi khyad par la dmigs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sems las byung ba 'du shes kyi khyad par la dmigs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it focuses on the specific discernment that is a mental factor.

original: 'du shes la sogs pa dag ni chos kyi skye mched kyis bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du shes la sogs pa dag ni chos kyi skye mched kyis bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because ideation, etc. are included in the sense-field of mental objects.

original: tshor ba yang chos kyi skye mched kyis bsdus mod kyi de ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dag tu so sor gzhag ste /
analyzed: tshor ba yang chos kyi skye mched kyis bsdus mod kyi de ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dag tu so sor gzhag ste /
translated: Although feeling is also included in the sense-field of mental objects, it is separately established as a foundation of mindfulness.

original: gsum las gzhan ni chos so zhes sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: gsum las gzhan ni chos so zhes sngar bshad zin to //
translated: It was previously explained that the other three are mental objects.üîΩThe remaining four are the four foundations of mindfulness.üîΩThe remaining four are the four foundations of mindfulness.

original: lhag ma bzhi yin no zhes bya ba ni /üîΩlhag ma ni shes pa brgyad de /
analyzed: lhag ma bzhi yin no zhes bya ba ni / lhag ma ni shes pa brgyad de /
translated: The remaining four are the four foundations of mindfulness.

original: de la kun rdzob shes pa ni thams cad kyi yul can yin pas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi yin no //
analyzed: de la kun rdzob shes pa ni thams cad kyi yul can yin pas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi yin no //
translated: Conventional knowledge has the four foundations of mindfulness for its object, because it has all for its object.

original: chos shes pa ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa la dmigs pas bzhi yin no //
analyzed: chos shes pa ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa la dmigs pas bzhi yin no //
translated: Knowledge of the principle has the four foundations of mindfulness for its object, because it has suffering, etc. for its object.

original: rjes su shes pa yang de dang 'dra'o //üîΩsdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang lam dang zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa rnams ni re re zhing dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bzhi yin te /
analyzed: rjes su shes pa yang de dang 'dra'o // sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang lam dang zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa rnams ni re re zhing dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bzhi yin te /
translated: Subsequent knowledge is also like that.

original: phung po lnga la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po lnga la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Knowledge of suffering, origin, path, destruction, and non-production have the four foundations of mindfulness for their object, because they have the five aggregates for their object.

original: rjes su shes pa ma gtogs so //üîΩzhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rjes su shes pa ma gtogs so // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: except for subsequent knowledge.üîΩThe knowledge of the path is the object of nine knowledges.

original: chos rjes blo phyogs phan tshun min /
analyzed: chos rjes blo phyogs phan tshun min /
translated: The knowledge of the path is the object of nine knowledges,

original: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is said, ‚ÄúThe knowledge of the path is the object of nine knowledges, except for the knowledge of cessation and the knowledge of elimination.‚Äù

original: chos shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa lam shes pa'i dmigs pa ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam dang / zad pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa rnams so //
analyzed: chos shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa lam shes pa'i dmigs pa ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam dang / zad pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa rnams so //
translated: The knowledge of the path is the object of the knowledge of suffering, origin, cessation, path, elimination, nonarising, and others‚Äô minds, and the conventional knowledge that is compatible with the knowledge of the path.

original: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung shes pa dag gi dmigs pa ni kun rdzob shes pa 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal dang de kun 'byung bas bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung shes pa dag gi dmigs pa ni kun rdzob shes pa 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal dang de kun 'byung bas bsdus pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of suffering and origin are the objects of conventional knowledge that is subsumed by the desire realm suffering and its origin.

original: rjes su shes pa ni thams cad du chos shes pa'i dmigs pa ma yin te yul tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su shes pa ni thams cad du chos shes pa'i dmigs pa ma yin te yul tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Subsequent knowledge is not the object of the knowledge of the path, because they are different objects.

original: lam rjes blo yi dgu yin no //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lam rjes blo yi dgu yin no //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
translated: The knowledge of the path is the object of nine knowledges.üîΩThe knowledge of the path is the object of nine knowledges,üîΩbecause it is said, ‚ÄúThe knowledge of the path is the object of nine knowledges, except for the knowledge of cessation and the knowledge of elimination.‚ÄùüîΩThe knowledge of the path is the object of the knowledge of suffering, origin, cessation, path, elimination, nonarising, and others‚Äô minds, and the conventional knowledge that is compatible with the knowledge of the path.üîΩThe knowledge of suffering and origin are the objects of conventional knowledge that is subsumed by the desire realm suffering and its origin.üîΩSubsequent knowledge is not the object of the knowledge of the path, because they are different objects.

original: rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa sdug bsngal la sogs pa @237b shes pa la ni de'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i lam kho nas dmigs la kun rdzob shes pa khams gong ma'i sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gis bsdus pa la ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung shesüîΩpa dag kho nas dmigs so //
analyzed: rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa sdug bsngal la sogs pa @237b shes pa la ni de'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i lam kho nas dmigs la kun rdzob shes pa khams gong ma'i sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gis bsdus pa la ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung shes pa dag kho nas dmigs so //
translated: Subsequent knowledge focusing on the truths of suffering and origin in the two higher realms is the focal object of both the knowledge of suffering and origin.

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa la ni rjes su shes pa'i phyogs kyis bsdus pa lam shes pas dmigs so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa la ni rjes su shes pa'i phyogs kyis bsdus pa lam shes pas dmigs so //
translated: Knowledge of others' minds subsumed by the aspect of subsequent knowledge is the focal object of the knowledge of path.

original: lam shes pa'i dmigs pa yang dgu yin te /
analyzed: lam shes pa'i dmigs pa yang dgu yin te /
translated: The focal object of the knowledge of path is nine.

original: kun rdzob shes pas ma gtogs so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: kun rdzob shes pas ma gtogs so zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is not conventional knowledge.

original: lam shes pa ni lam la dmigs pas de'i dmigs pa ni shes pa zag pa med pa dgu yin te /
analyzed: lam shes pa ni lam la dmigs pas de'i dmigs pa ni shes pa zag pa med pa dgu yin te /
translated: The knowledge of path focuses on the path. Therefore its focal object is the nine uncontaminated knowledges.

original: de dag lam gyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩkun rdzob shes pa'ang ma yin la /
analyzed: de dag lam gyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // kun rdzob shes pa'ang ma yin la /
translated: They are the nature of the path.üîΩIt is not conventional knowledge.

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa zag pa dang bcas pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa zag pa dang bcas pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not contaminated knowledge of others' minds.

original: lam shes pa zag pa med pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩsdug bsngal rgyu blo'i gnyis yin no //
analyzed: lam shes pa zag pa med pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro // sdug bsngal rgyu blo'i gnyis yin no //
translated: Because it focuses on uncontaminated knowledge of the truth of the path.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: The two of the truths of suffering and origin are its focal objects.üîΩThe conventional knowledge of the truths of suffering and origin is the focal object of knowledge of suffering and knowledge of origin because it is included in the truths of suffering and origin.

original: kun rdzob shes pa ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gi nang du gtogs pa'i phyir sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung shes pa dag gi dmigs pa yin no zhes bya bar rtogs na gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: kun rdzob shes pa ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gi nang du gtogs pa'i phyir sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung shes pa dag gi dmigs pa yin no zhes bya bar rtogs na gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni ji ltar zhe na /
translated: If one understands that, how is knowledge of others' minds the focal object of ten?

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa'i phyogs gcig kyang sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gis bsdus pa yod de zag pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa'i phyogs gcig kyang sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gis bsdus pa yod de zag pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: One part of knowledge of others' minds is also subsumed by the truths of suffering and origin, because it is contaminated.

original: bzhi'i bcu yin zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: bzhi'i bcu yin zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: The Abhidharmakosa states, Four are the focal object of ten.

original: de la kun rdzob shes pa ni thams cad kyi yul can yin pa'i phyir shes pa bcu la dmigs so zhes bya bar rtogs na /
analyzed: de la kun rdzob shes pa ni thams cad kyi yul can yin pa'i phyir shes pa bcu la dmigs so zhes bya bar rtogs na /
translated: If one understands that conventional knowledge is the focal object of ten knowledges because it has all as its object,

original: ji ltar gzhan gyi sems shes pa'i dmigs pa bcu yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan gyi sems shes pa'i dmigs pa bcu yin zhe na /
translated: how is knowledge of others' minds the focal object of ten?

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni chos dang rjes dang lam dang kun rdzob shes pas bsdus pa yin la /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni chos dang rjes dang lam dang kun rdzob shes pas bsdus pa yin la /
translated: Knowledge of others' minds is included in Dharma, subsequent, path and conventional knowledge.

original: de'i dmigs pa ni rnam par ma phye bar shes pa bcu yin la /
analyzed: de'i dmigs pa ni rnam par ma phye bar shes pa bcu yin la /
translated: If its focal object is not differentiated, it is the ten knowledges.

original: dbye na ni chos dang rjes kyis bsdus pa dag gis ni shes pa brgyad do //
analyzed: dbye na ni chos dang rjes kyis bsdus pa dag gis ni shes pa brgyad do //
translated: If differentiated, it is the eight knowledges subsumed by Dharma and subsequent knowledge.

original: lam shes pas bsdus pa yi ni dgu'o //
analyzed: lam shes pas bsdus pa yi ni dgu'o //
translated: It is the nine knowledges subsumed by path knowledge.

original: kun rdzob shes pas bsdus pa yi ni kun rdzob shes pa dang gzhan gyi sems shes pa gnyis so //
analyzed: kun rdzob shes pas bsdus pa yi ni kun rdzob shes pa dang gzhan gyi sems shes pa gnyis so //
translated: It is the two knowledges subsumed by conventional knowledge and knowledge of others' minds.

original: ji ltar zad pa dang mi skye ba dag gi dmigs pa shes pa bcu yin zhe na /üîΩzad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dag ni bdag gis lam bsgoms te /
analyzed: ji ltar zad pa dang mi skye ba dag gi dmigs pa shes pa bcu yin zhe na / zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dag ni bdag gis lam bsgoms te /
translated: How is the focal object of the knowledge of elimination and nonarising the ten knowledges?

original: yang bsgom du med do zhes bya ba chos dang rjes su shes pa'i lam la dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: yang bsgom du med do zhes bya ba chos dang rjes su shes pa'i lam la dmigs pa yin te /
translated: The knowledge of elimination and nonarising focuses on the path of Dharma and subsequent knowledge, thinking, I have meditated on the path and there is no more to meditate on.

original: de'i phyir shes pa zag pa med pa dgu la dmigs pa sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gi bden pa la dmigs pa'i zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dag ni bdag gis sdug bsngal yongs su shes @238a * //üîΩpar byas te /
analyzed: de'i phyir shes pa zag pa med pa dgu la dmigs pa sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gi bden pa la dmigs pa'i zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dag ni bdag gis sdug bsngal yongs su shes @238a * // par byas te /
translated: I have fully known suffering

original: yang yongs su shes par byar med /üîΩkun 'byung spangs te yang yongs su spang du med do zhes sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gis bsdus pa'i kun rdzob shes pa la dmigs so //üîΩdbye na na chos shes pas bsdus pa dag gi dmigs pa ni rjes su shes pa ma yin la /
analyzed: yang yongs su shes par byar med / kun 'byung spangs te yang yongs su spang du med do zhes sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gis bsdus pa'i kun rdzob shes pa la dmigs so // dbye na na chos shes pas bsdus pa dag gi dmigs pa ni rjes su shes pa ma yin la /
translated: and there is no more to fully know.üîΩI have abandoned origin and there is no more to abandon.üîΩIf classified, the focal object of those subsumed by Dharma knowledge is not subsequent knowledge and the focal object of those subsumed by subsequent knowledge is not Dharma knowledge.üîΩThe focal object of the knowledge of elimination and nonarising is the conventional knowledge subsumed by the truths of suffering and origin.

original: rjes su shes pas bsdus pa dag gi ni chos shes pa ma yin no //üîΩchos 'dus byas rnams la rnam pa brgyad du bya'o zhes bya ba la /üîΩ'dod pa dang ldan pa'i chos rnams ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rjes su shes pas bsdus pa dag gi ni chos shes pa ma yin no // chos 'dus byas rnams la rnam pa brgyad du bya'o zhes bya ba la / 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i chos rnams ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The focal object of the knowledge of elimination and nonarising is the conventional knowledge subsumed by the truths of suffering and origin.üîΩThe focal object of the knowledge of elimination and nonarising is the conventional knowledge subsumed by the truths of suffering and origin.üîΩThe focal object of the knowledge of elimination and nonarising is the conventional knowledge subsumed by the truths of suffering and origin.üîΩThe focal object of the knowledge of elimination and nonarising is the conventional knowledge subsumed by the truths of suffering and origin.üîΩThe focal object of the knowledge of elimination and nonarising is the conventional knowledge subsumed by the truths of suffering and origin.üîΩThe focal object of the knowledge of elimination and nonarising is the conventional knowledge subsumed by the truths of suffering and origin.üîΩThe focal object of the knowledge of elimination and nonarising is the conventional knowledge subsumed by the truths of suffering and origin.üîΩThe focal object of the knowledge of elimination and nonarising is the conventional knowledge subsumed by the truths of suffering and origin.üîΩThe focal object of the knowledge of elimination and nonarising is the conventional knowledge subsumed by the truths of suffering and origin.üîΩThe focal object of the knowledge of elimination and nonarising is the conventional knowledge subsumed by the truths of suffering and origin.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa'o /
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa'o /
translated: The focal object of the knowledge of elimination and nonarising is the conventional knowledge subsumed by the truths of suffering and origin.

original: de bzhin du gzugs dang ldan pa yang rnam pa gnyis yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs dang ldan pa yang rnam pa gnyis yin la /
translated: So too, those associated with form are of two types.

original: gzugs med pa dang ldan pa yang rnam pa gnyis yin no //
analyzed: gzugs med pa dang ldan pa yang rnam pa gnyis yin no //
translated: Those associated with the formless realm are of two types.

original: zag pa med pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: zag pa med pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Those that are uncontaminated are of two types.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa dang mi ldan pa ma yin pa'o //üîΩdge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i bye brag gis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa dang mi ldan pa ma yin pa'o // dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i bye brag gis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: They are not associated or nonassociated.üîΩThose that are virtuous and those that are neutralüîΩare distinguished by their specific characteristics.

original: dge ba ni so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa ste /
analyzed: dge ba ni so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa ste /
translated: The specific characteristic of the first is that it is virtuous, because it is said,

original: thar pa dam pa'i don du dge //üîΩzhes bya ba 'byung ba'i phyir ro //üîΩlung du ma bstan pa ni nam mkha' so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa ste /
analyzed: thar pa dam pa'i don du dge // zhes bya ba 'byung ba'i phyir ro // lung du ma bstan pa ni nam mkha' so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa ste /
translated: Liberation is virtuous in the ultimate sense.üîΩThe specific characteristic of the second is that it is neutral, because it is said,

original: lung ma bstan pa brtan pa dag / ces 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lung ma bstan pa brtan pa dag / ces 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Stable neutral states are space and so on.

original: de la kun rdzob shes pa'i dmigs pa ni chos bcu po thams cad yin no zhes bya ba ni /üîΩkun rdzob yul ni thams cad do ;üîΩ/ zhes bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la kun rdzob shes pa'i dmigs pa ni chos bcu po thams cad yin no zhes bya ba ni / kun rdzob yul ni thams cad do ; / zhes bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The focal object of conventional knowledge is all ten phenomena.

original: chos shes pa yi ni lnga ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos shes pa yi ni lnga ste zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The focal object of Dharma knowledge is five.

original: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung la dmigs pa'i 'dod pa na spyod pa'i mtshungs par ldan pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa dag go //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung la dmigs pa'i 'dod pa na spyod pa'i mtshungs par ldan pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa dag go //
translated: Those associated and not associated with the desire realm that focus on the truths of suffering and origin.

original: chos shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa lam gyi bden pa la dmigs pa ni zag pa med pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa dag go //
analyzed: chos shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa lam gyi bden pa la dmigs pa ni zag pa med pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa dag go //
translated: Those associated and not associated with the truth of path that are compatible with Dharma knowledge and focus on the truth of path are uncontaminated.

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa la dmigs pa'i ni 'dus ma byas dge ba yin te /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa la dmigs pa'i ni 'dus ma byas dge ba yin te /
translated: Those that focus on the truth of cessation are virtuous unconditioned states.

original: 'dus ma byas lung du ma bstan pa ni bden pas ma bsdus pas de ni zag pa med pa'i shes pas dmigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas lung du ma bstan pa ni bden pas ma bsdus pas de ni zag pa med pa'i shes pas dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Unconditioned neutral states are not subsumed by the four truths, therefore they are not focal objects of uncontaminated knowledge.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa dang zag pa med pa dang / drug dang zhes bya ba ni mtshungs par ldan pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i bye brag gis so //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa dang zag pa med pa dang / drug dang zhes bya ba ni mtshungs par ldan pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i bye brag gis so //
translated: Those that focus on the truths of cessation and path that are associated and not associated with the form and formless realms and the uncontaminated are six, because they are classified as associated and not associated.

original: 'das ma byas dge ba yang yin no //
analyzed: 'das ma byas dge ba yang yin no //
translated: They are also virtuous and unarisen.

original: drug ste 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams yin no zhes bya ba ni re re zhing mtshungs par ldan pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i bye brag gis so //
analyzed: drug ste 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams yin no zhes bya ba ni re re zhing mtshungs par ldan pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i bye brag gis so //
translated: The knowledge of others' minds is six: the three realms, plus the uncontaminated.

original: 'gog pa shes @238b pa'i ni gcig ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'gog pa shes @238b pa'i ni gcig ste zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The knowledge of cessation is one:

original: de ni rtag tu so sor brtags pas 'gog pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rtag tu so sor brtags pas 'gog pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it always focuses on analytical cessation.

original: lam shes pa'i ni gnyis te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lam shes pa'i ni gnyis te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The knowledge of the path is two:

original: zag pa med par mtshungs par ldan pa yin pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa dag go //
analyzed: zag pa med par mtshungs par ldan pa yin pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa dag go //
translated: it is either uncontaminated, associated with the mind, or unassociated with the mind.üîΩThe knowledge of others' minds is four:

original: 'dod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa dang zag pa med pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams so zhes bya ba ni /üîΩgzhan gyi sems shes pa ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed dam /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa dang zag pa med pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams so zhes bya ba ni / gzhan gyi sems shes pa ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed dam /
translated: the desire realm, form realm, uncontaminated, and associated with the mind.

original: gzugs med kyi khams la dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs med kyi khams la dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The knowledge of others' minds is not associated with form or the formless realm.

original: zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dag gi dmigs pa ni chos dgu yin te zhes bya ba ni zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dag gi dmigs pa ni chos dgu yin te /
analyzed: zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dag gi dmigs pa ni chos dgu yin te zhes bya ba ni zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dag gi dmigs pa ni chos dgu yin te /
translated: The focal object of the knowledge of elimination and nonarising is the nine phenomena.

original: re re yang khams gsum gyi sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: re re yang khams gsum gyi sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Each focuses on the four truths of the three realms, such as the truth of suffering.üîΩThe focal object of the knowledge of elimination and nonarising is the nine phenomena.üîΩThe focal object of the knowledge of elimination and nonarising is the nine phenomena.üîΩEach focuses on the four truths of the three realms, such as the truth of suffering.üîΩThe focal object of the knowledge of elimination and nonarising is the nine phenomena.

original: 'dus ma byas lung du ma bstan pa ma gtogs so zhes bya ba ni de bden pas ma bsdus pa'i phyir dang zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dag bden pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir de ma gtogs so //üîΩde'ang lhan cig 'byung ba'i chos rnams zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas lung du ma bstan pa ma gtogs so zhes bya ba ni de bden pas ma bsdus pa'i phyir dang zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dag bden pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir de ma gtogs so // de'ang lhan cig 'byung ba'i chos rnams zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The focal object of the knowledge of elimination and nonarising is the nine phenomena.üîΩEach focuses on the four truths of the three realms, such as the truth of suffering.üîΩThe focal object of the knowledge of elimination and nonarising is the nine phenomena.üîΩThe focal object of the knowledge of elimination and nonarising is the nine phenomena.üîΩEach focuses on the four truths of the three realms, such as the truth of suffering.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa sems las 'byung ba rnams dang de dag gi thob pa dang skye ba la sogs pa rnams te /
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa sems las 'byung ba rnams dang de dag gi thob pa dang skye ba la sogs pa rnams te /
translated: The focal object of the knowledge of elimination and nonarising is the nine phenomena.üîΩThe focal object of the knowledge of elimination and nonarising is the nine phenomena.

original: de dag dang rang gi ngo bo mi 'dzin no /üîΩci'i phyir rang gi ngo bo mi 'dzin zhe na /
analyzed: de dag dang rang gi ngo bo mi 'dzin no / ci'i phyir rang gi ngo bo mi 'dzin zhe na /
translated: Each focuses on the four truths of the three realms, such as the truth of suffering.üîΩThe focal object of the knowledge of elimination and nonarising is the nine phenomena.üîΩThe focal object of the knowledge of elimination and nonarising is the nine phenomena.üîΩEach focuses on the four truths of the three realms, such as the truth of suffering.üîΩThe focal object of the knowledge of elimination and nonarising is the nine phenomena.üîΩThe focal object of the knowledge of elimination and nonarising is the nine phenomena.üîΩEach focuses on the four truths of the three realms, such as the truth of suffering.üîΩThe focal object of the knowledge of elimination and nonarising is the nine phenomena.üîΩThe focal object of the knowledge of elimination and nonarising is the nine phenomena.üîΩEach focuses on the four truths of the three realms, such as the truth of suffering.

original: yul dang yul can tha dad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yul dang yul can tha dad pa'i phyir te /
translated: The focal object of the knowledge of elimination and nonarising is the nine phenomena.

original: yul ni yul can las tha dad de /
analyzed: yul ni yul can las tha dad de /
translated: The object is different from the subject,

original: rang gi bdag nyid la bya ba 'gal ba'i phyir sor mo'i rtse mo dang ral gri'i so ni de nyid kyis mi reg cing mi gcod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid la bya ba 'gal ba'i phyir sor mo'i rtse mo dang ral gri'i so ni de nyid kyis mi reg cing mi gcod pa bzhin no //
translated: because it is contradictory for something to act upon itself. For example, the tip of a finger does not touch itself, and the edge of a sword does not cut itself.

original: chos mngon pa pa rnams ni gang zhig ma tshang bas gang mi skye ba de ni de'i rkyen yin na rang gi ngo bo ma tshang bas dngos po rnams mi skye ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: chos mngon pa pa rnams ni gang zhig ma tshang bas gang mi skye ba de ni de'i rkyen yin na rang gi ngo bo ma tshang bas dngos po rnams mi skye ba yang ma yin te /
translated: The Abhidharma masters say: If something does not arise due to the incompleteness of something else, then the latter is a condition of the former. But things do not arise due to the incompleteness of their own nature,

original: rang gi ngo bo rtag tu yod pa'i phyir te rkyen nyid ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo rtag tu yod pa'i phyir te rkyen nyid ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: because their own nature always exists and is not a condition.

original: gal te sems dang sems las byung ba rnams rang gi ngo bo'i yul can ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te sems dang sems las byung ba rnams rang gi ngo bo'i yul can ma yin na /
translated: If minds and mental factors do not have their own nature as their object,

original: 'o na phan tshun gyi yul can du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na phan tshun gyi yul can du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then they would have each other as their object.

original: bshad pa phan tshun gyi yul can ma yin te /üîΩdmigs pa gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad pa phan tshun gyi yul can ma yin te / dmigs pa gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: We respond: They do not have each other as their object,üîΩbecause they have the same focal object.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ni dmigs pa gcig pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ni dmigs pa gcig pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because minds and mental factors have the same focal object.

original: phan tshun gyi yul can nyid yin na ni dmigs pa gcig pa nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phan tshun gyi yul can nyid yin na ni dmigs pa gcig pa nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: If they have different objects, then the condition of having the same object is lost.

original: de lta na ni 'o na rang gi tshogs pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa 'dzin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na rang gi tshogs pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa 'dzin par 'gyur te /
translated: If that is so, then it would apprehend what is not its own collection.

original: dmigs pa med pa'i phyir dang yul dang yul can tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhe na //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa'i phyir dang yul dang yul can tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhe na //
translated: Because it would not have an object and because the object and subject would be different.

original: de'i phyir ha cang nye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩldan pa ma yin pa 'dzin @239a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir ha cang nye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te / ldan pa ma yin pa 'dzin @239a * //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúBecause it is too close.‚Äù

original: pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It does not apprehend what is not its own collection.

original: ha cang nye ba'i phyir mig la gnas pa'i mig sman dang mig sman gyi thur ma la sogs pa mi mthong ba bzhin no //
analyzed: ha cang nye ba'i phyir mig la gnas pa'i mig sman dang mig sman gyi thur ma la sogs pa mi mthong ba bzhin no //
translated: Because it is too close, like the ointment and the ointment stick that are placed on the eye are not seen because they are too close to the eye.

original: mdo las kyang skad cig ma gcig la chos thams cad yul yin pa med do zhes bya ba mthong ste /
analyzed: mdo las kyang skad cig ma gcig la chos thams cad yul yin pa med do zhes bya ba mthong ste /
translated: Also, a sutra states, ‚ÄúIn one moment, all phenomena do not have an object.‚Äù

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: It says,

original: dge sbyong ngam bram ze yang rung /
analyzed: dge sbyong ngam bram ze yang rung /
translated: ‚ÄúThere is no mendicant or brahmin

original: gang cig car thams cad shes pa 'am mthong ba de ni 'ga' yang med do zhes bya ba yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gang cig car thams cad shes pa 'am mthong ba de ni 'ga' yang med do zhes bya ba yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: who simultaneously knows or sees all.‚Äù

original: de ni rnam par chad pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bar chad med pa dang rnam par grol ba'i lam rnams go rims bzhin du sa 'og ma dang gong ma la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩsbyor ba dang khyad par gyi lam dag gi dmigs pa yang ci rigs par sa gcig pu 'ga' zhig kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: de ni rnam par chad pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bar chad med pa dang rnam par grol ba'i lam rnams go rims bzhin du sa 'og ma dang gong ma la dmigs pa'i phyir ro // sbyor ba dang khyad par gyi lam dag gi dmigs pa yang ci rigs par sa gcig pu 'ga' zhig kho na yin gyi /
translated: Because it focuses on the separated, that is, because the uninterrupted and liberated paths focus on lower and higher levels, respectively.

original: thams cad ni ma yin no //üîΩnges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i sbyor ba'i lam gyis bsdus pa gang gi dmigs pa 'dod pa'i khams yin pa de'i gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams ma yin no //
analyzed: thams cad ni ma yin no // nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i sbyor ba'i lam gyis bsdus pa gang gi dmigs pa 'dod pa'i khams yin pa de'i gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams ma yin no //
translated: The focal object of the path of preparation and the special path is any single level, as is appropriate, but not all levels.üîΩThe focal object of any path of preparation subsumed by the factors conducive to penetrative insight is the desire realm and not the form and formless realms.

original: de bzhin du gang gi gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams yin pa de'i 'dod pa'i khams ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du gang gi gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams yin pa de'i 'dod pa'i khams ma yin no //
translated: Similarly, the focal object of any path of preparation subsumed by the factors conducive to penetrative insight is the form and formless realms and not the desire realm.

original: de bzhin du mi sdug pa dang tshad med pa dang zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched la sogs pa dang / rnam par sun 'byin pa dang / khyad par can gyis bsdus pa'i dmigs pa ni 'dod pa'i khams kho na yin gyi khams gzhan dag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du mi sdug pa dang tshad med pa dang zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched la sogs pa dang / rnam par sun 'byin pa dang / khyad par can gyis bsdus pa'i dmigs pa ni 'dod pa'i khams kho na yin gyi khams gzhan dag ni ma yin no //
translated: So too, the focal object of the immeasurables, the bases of subjugation and so on, and the focal object subsumed by the discernment of repulsiveness and the special abodes are the desire realm alone and not other realms.

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te sa thams cad la dmigs pa yin na ni de lta na sa thams cad las cig car 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur te /üîΩsa 'og ma la yin pa 'ga' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te sa thams cad la dmigs pa yin na ni de lta na sa thams cad las cig car 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur te / sa 'og ma la yin pa 'ga' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: If that were not so, then if they focused on all levels, they would simultaneously be free from attachment to all levels.

original: sa gong ma dang 'og ma las kyang 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa gong ma dang 'og ma las kyang 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They would be free from attachment to not only lower levels but also higher levels.

original: so so'i skye bo 'dod chags dang bral ba kho na shes pa gcig dang ldan par ma zad kyi /üîΩ'phags pa dang / zag med skad cig dang po la //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo 'dod chags dang bral ba kho na shes pa gcig dang ldan par ma zad kyi / 'phags pa dang / zag med skad cig dang po la //
translated: Not only would ordinary beings who are free from attachment possess one knowledge,üîΩbut also ƒÅryas and those possessing uncontaminated states possess one knowledge.

original: chags can shes pa gcig dang ldan //
analyzed: chags can shes pa gcig dang ldan //
translated: Those with attachment possess one knowledge.

original: chags can zhes khyad par du byas pa ni 'dod chags dang bral ba ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa la gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chags can zhes khyad par du byas pa ni 'dod chags dang bral ba ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa la gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term ‚Äúone who is desirous‚Äù is specified because one who is free from attachment possesses knowledge of others‚Äô minds on the perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering.

original: zag med skad cig dang po la //
analyzed: zag med skad cig dang po la //
translated: In the first moment of uncontaminatedüîΩknowledge, one possesses only conventional knowledge.

original: zhes bya ba ni bzod pa rnams shes pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir kun rdzob shes pa gcig pu kho na dang ldan no zhes ston pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bzod pa rnams shes pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir kun rdzob shes pa gcig pu kho na dang ldan no zhes ston pa'o //
translated: This indicates that one possesses only conventional knowledge in the first moment of perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering because perseverance for Dharma knowledge is not by nature knowledge.üîΩIn the second, one possesses three.

original: gnyis pa la gsum ste zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa de nyid chos shes pa dang sdug bsngal shes pa gnyis su bgrang ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa la gsum ste zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa de nyid chos shes pa dang sdug bsngal shes pa gnyis su bgrang ste /
translated: This indicates that one possesses three in the second moment of perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering because Dharma knowledge and knowledge of the truth of suffering are counted as two.

original: go rims bzhin du chos @239b tsam rtogs pa'i phyir dang / sdug bsngal gyi yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du chos @239b tsam rtogs pa'i phyir dang / sdug bsngal gyi yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One possesses Dharma knowledge because one realizes mere phenomena and one possesses knowledge of the truth of suffering because one possesses the object of the truth of suffering.

original: bzhi la re re 'phel dang ldan //üîΩzhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: bzhi la re re 'phel dang ldan // zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: In the fourth, one possesses four.

original: chos shes pa dang sdug bsngal shes pa ni yongs su bgrang ba zin te /
analyzed: chos shes pa dang sdug bsngal shes pa ni yongs su bgrang ba zin te /
translated: This indicates that one possesses four in the fourth moment of perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering because Dharma knowledge and knowledge of the truth of suffering are counted as two.

original: de ni rjes su shes pa dang kun 'byung dang 'gog pa dang lam shes pa rnams yongs su bgrang bar bya ba yin pas de'i phyir bzhi la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de ni rjes su shes pa dang kun 'byung dang 'gog pa dang lam shes pa rnams yongs su bgrang bar bya ba yin pas de'i phyir bzhi la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: They are counted as subsequent knowledge, knowledge of the truths of origin and cessation, and knowledge of the path.

original: lam la chos shes pa rnams la ni bdun dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob dang chos dang / rjes su shes pa dag dang / sdug bsngal la sogs pa bzhi dang ldan no //
analyzed: lam la chos shes pa rnams la ni bdun dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob dang chos dang / rjes su shes pa dag dang / sdug bsngal la sogs pa bzhi dang ldan no //
translated: One who possesses Dharma knowledge of the truth of the path possesses seven: conventional knowledge, Dharma knowledge, subsequent knowledge, and the four such as knowledge of suffering.

original: lam la rjes su shes pa la yang de dag kho na dang ldan te /
analyzed: lam la rjes su shes pa la yang de dag kho na dang ldan te /
translated: One who possesses subsequent knowledge of the truth of the path also possesses those seven.

original: rjes dang lam shes bdag ni sngar bgrangs zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes dang lam shes bdag ni sngar bgrangs zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Subsequent knowledge and knowledge of the path were previously counted as Dharma knowledge and subsequent knowledge.üîΩIf one is free from attachment, one possesses all of them in all instances.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba zhig yin na ni thams cad du zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam gyi skad cig ma bco lnga la ni pha rol gyi sems shes pa 'jig rten pa lhag par ldan no //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba zhig yin na ni thams cad du zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam gyi skad cig ma bco lnga la ni pha rol gyi sems shes pa 'jig rten pa lhag par ldan no //
translated: One who is free from attachment possesses all of these in all instances of the fifteen moments of the path of seeing.

original: de ltar byas na zag pa med pa'i skad cig dang po la ni kun rdzob dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa gnyis dang ldan la /
analyzed: de ltar byas na zag pa med pa'i skad cig dang po la ni kun rdzob dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa gnyis dang ldan la /
translated: If that is so, then one possesses two: conventional knowledge and knowledge of others' minds, in the first moment of uncontaminated knowledge.üîΩOne possesses four in the second moment.

original: gnyis pa ni bzhi dang ldan no zhes thams cad du rgyas par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni bzhi dang ldan no zhes thams cad du rgyas par brjod par bya'o //
translated: This should be extensively applied to all.

original: lam la rjes su shes pa ni gzhan gyi sems shes pa zag pa med pa dang yang ldan te /
analyzed: lam la rjes su shes pa ni gzhan gyi sems shes pa zag pa med pa dang yang ldan te /
translated: Subsequent knowledge of the truth of the path possesses uncontaminated knowledge of others' minds.

original: des ni gnas skabs dang gzhan gyi sems shes pa phyir mi 'ong bas bsdus pa rnyed de /
analyzed: des ni gnas skabs dang gzhan gyi sems shes pa phyir mi 'ong bas bsdus pa rnyed de /
translated: Because it obtains knowledge of others' minds that is subsumed by nonreturn and knowledge of the occasion.

original: lam la rjes su shes pa bsgom pa'i lam yin pa'i phyir dang 'dod chags dang bral ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam la rjes su shes pa bsgom pa'i lam yin pa'i phyir dang 'dod chags dang bral ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Subsequent knowledge of the truth of the path is the path of meditation and it is free from attachment.

original: yang gnas skabs gang du shes pa du dag cig thob ce na zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //
analyzed: yang gnas skabs gang du shes pa du dag cig thob ce na zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //
translated: In what states do one obtain how many knowledges?

original: yang 'thob pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: yang 'thob pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig ce na /
translated: What is this called obtainment?

original: gang zhig bsten pa thob pa dang rnyed pa thob pa zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i chos la goms pa dang dbang phun sum tshogs pa ste de dag gi mtshan nyid kyang 'chad par 'gyur ro //üîΩji ltar skyes pa rnams /
analyzed: gang zhig bsten pa thob pa dang rnyed pa thob pa zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i chos la goms pa dang dbang phun sum tshogs pa ste de dag gi mtshan nyid kyang 'chad par 'gyur ro // ji ltar skyes pa rnams /
translated: The characteristics of these will be explained later.

original: ma 'ongs pa 'thob ces bya ba ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa 'thob ces bya ba ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How do those who have already arisen obtain future states?

original: re zhig sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa skyes na bzod pa de yang ma 'ongs pa de'i rnam pa bzhi 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: re zhig sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa skyes na bzod pa de yang ma 'ongs pa de'i rnam pa bzhi 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: When perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering arises, one obtains four future aspects of that perseverance.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa skyes na yang de nyid ma 'ongs pa de'i rnam pa bzhi 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa skyes na yang de nyid ma 'ongs pa de'i rnam pa bzhi 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: When Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering arises, one obtains four future aspects of that knowledge.

original: sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa skyes na yang de dang 'dra ba ma 'ongs pa thob par 'gyur gyi mi 'dra ba dang bden pa gzhan gyi yul can ni ma yin te de bzhin du thams cad la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa skyes na yang de dang 'dra ba ma 'ongs pa thob par 'gyur gyi mi 'dra ba dang bden pa gzhan gyi yul can ni ma yin te de bzhin du thams cad la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: When perseverance for subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering arises, one obtains future states that are similar to it, but one does not obtain dissimilar states or those that possess other truths as their object.üîΩThe same applies to all remaining states.

original: bsgom pa'i lam la ni shes pa skal ba mi mnyam pa'i rnam pa thob pa yang yin pas de'i phyir ro //üîΩci'i phyir mthong ba'i lam la shes pa 'dra @240a * //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam la ni shes pa skal ba mi mnyam pa'i rnam pa thob pa yang yin pas de'i phyir ro // ci'i phyir mthong ba'i lam la shes pa 'dra @240a * //
translated: But on the path of cultivation, one also obtains knowledge of the aspects of superior realms.

original: pa'i rnam pa kho na thob ces smras so /
analyzed: pa'i rnam pa kho na thob ces smras so /
translated: Why is it said that one obtains only knowledge of the same aspect on the path of insight?

original: bsgom pa'i lam la thob pa ltar shes pa skal ba mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa'i rnam pa mi thob ces bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam la thob pa ltar shes pa skal ba mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa'i rnam pa mi thob ces bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúone does not obtain knowledge of the aspects of superior and inferior realms as one does on the path of cultivation‚Äù is supplied.

original: bzod pa rnams ni bsgom pa'i lam la med pas bzod pa rnams ma smos te shes pa kho na rnams dpyod do //
analyzed: bzod pa rnams ni bsgom pa'i lam la med pas bzod pa rnams ma smos te shes pa kho na rnams dpyod do //
translated: Since the acceptances do not exist on the path of cultivation, only the knowledges are examined.

original: rigs rnams ma thob pa'i phyir ro zhes smos pa ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu rnams ma thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rigs rnams ma thob pa'i phyir ro zhes smos pa ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu rnams ma thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause one has not obtained the families‚Äù means because one has not obtained the homogeneous causes.

original: ji ltar na mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang stong pa dang bdag med pa dang rnam pa bzhi phan tshun skal ba mnyam pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang stong pa dang bdag med pa dang rnam pa bzhi phan tshun skal ba mnyam pa yin zhe na /
translated: How are the four aspects of impermanence, suffering, empty, and nonself mutually homogeneous?

original: bzod pa la sogs pas bsdus pa'i phyir dang / dmigs pa tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzod pa la sogs pas bsdus pa'i phyir dang / dmigs pa tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are included in the category of patience and so on, and because their focal object is not different.

original: de la sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa skyes na de'i rigs 'thob cing de'i rnam pa bzhi'i rigs 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa skyes na de'i rigs 'thob cing de'i rnam pa bzhi'i rigs 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: When the perseverance for the knowledge of the truth of suffering arises, the lineage of that is obtained and the lineage of its four aspects is obtained.

original: sdug bsngal chos shes pa la yang de dang 'dra bar brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal chos shes pa la yang de dang 'dra bar brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said for the knowledge of the truth of suffering.

original: 'di ltar sdug bsngal mthong na sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rnam pa kho na 'thob par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar sdug bsngal mthong na sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rnam pa kho na 'thob par 'gyur gyi /
translated: In this way, when one sees suffering, one obtains only the aspects of suffering and so on.

original: kun 'byung la chos shes pa la sogs pa rnams ni ma yin te /
analyzed: kun 'byung la chos shes pa la sogs pa rnams ni ma yin te /
translated: One does not obtain the aspects of the knowledge of the truth of origin and so on,

original: rigs tha dad pa'i phyir dang / dmigs pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs tha dad pa'i phyir dang / dmigs pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because their lineages are different and because their focal objects are different.

original: yang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams las rnam pa gcig mngon du gyur na rnam pa lhag ma rnams kyi rigs 'thob pa gang yin pa 'di la rgyu ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: yang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams las rnam pa gcig mngon du gyur na rnam pa lhag ma rnams kyi rigs 'thob pa gang yin pa 'di la rgyu ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: What is the cause for obtaining the lineage of the remaining aspects when one aspect of impermanence and so on manifests?

original: dmigs pa mtshungs pa'i skal pa 'dra ba nyid kyis so //
analyzed: dmigs pa mtshungs pa'i skal pa 'dra ba nyid kyis so //
translated: It is due to the similarity of fortune that has the same focal object.

original: 'dir sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa skyes pa gang yin pa de nyid thams cad kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu nyid du gnas pas de skyes pas thams cad kyi rigs rnams thob bo zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa skyes pa gang yin pa de nyid thams cad kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu nyid du gnas pas de skyes pas thams cad kyi rigs rnams thob bo zhes bya ste /
translated: Here, the perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering is the homogeneous cause of all subsequent perseverance and knowledge. Therefore, when it arises, the types of all subsequent perseverance and knowledge are obtained.

original: de bzhin du gzhan la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said for the other truths.üîΩOn the path of meditation, all knowledge and its aspects that are homogeneous and heterogeneous are manifested. Therefore, the homogeneous cause of all is obtained.

original: bsgom pa'i lam la ni skal ba 'dra ba dang skal ba 'dra ba ma yin pa'i shes pa thams cad dang de'i rnam pa rnams mngon du gyur pas thams cad kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu 'thob par 'gyur bas der shes pa'i rnam pa khyad par du 'phagsüîΩpa ma 'ongs pa 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam la ni skal ba 'dra ba dang skal ba 'dra ba ma yin pa'i shes pa thams cad dang de'i rnam pa rnams mngon du gyur pas thams cad kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu 'thob par 'gyur bas der shes pa'i rnam pa khyad par du 'phags pa ma 'ongs pa 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, at that time, the aspects of knowledge that are superior are obtained in the future.

original: rjes gsum la ni kun rdzob kyang //
analyzed: rjes gsum la ni kun rdzob kyang //
translated: Conventional knowledge is obtained in three.

original: zhes bya ba 'dir ni kun rdzob shes pa khyad par can gzung gi thams cad ni ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dir ni kun rdzob shes pa khyad par can gzung gi thams cad ni ma yin no //
translated: Here, conventional knowledge is obtained as a special case, but not all conventional knowledge.

original: chos shes pa dag la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: chos shes pa dag la ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not obtained in Dharma knowledge and subsequent knowledge.

original: bden pa zad par mngon par ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: bden pa zad par mngon par ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: Because they do not fully comprehend the truths.

original: de ni bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'i mthar 'thob na /
analyzed: de ni bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'i mthar 'thob na /
translated: If one obtains the result at the end of realizing the truths,

original: chos shes pa ngag la ni bden pa zad par mngon par rtogs pa med de /
analyzed: chos shes pa ngag la ni bden pa zad par mngon par rtogs pa med de /
translated: then one does not fully comprehend the truths through Dharma knowledge of the truths.

original: 'di ltar sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang 'gog pa la chos @240b shes pa dag gi ni gzugs dang gzugs med par rtogs pa'i sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang 'gog pa mngon par mi rtogs pas don byas zin pa ma yin pa'i phyir chos shes pa dag la
analyzed: 'di ltar sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang 'gog pa la chos @240b shes pa dag gi ni gzugs dang gzugs med par rtogs pa'i sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang 'gog pa mngon par mi rtogs pas don byas zin pa ma yin pa'i phyir chos shes pa dag la
translated: Because the Dharma knowledges of the truths of suffering, origin and cessation do not fully comprehend the truths of suffering, origin and cessation that are realized in the form and formless realms, since they do not accomplish their purpose.

original: mi 'thob bo //
analyzed: mi 'thob bo //
translated: One does not obtain the result through Dharma knowledge.

original: lam gyi bden pa ni sngon 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis mngon par ma rtogs pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba ni thog ma med pa can gyi 'khor ba na sngon 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa mngon par rtogs shing yongs su shes pa dang spangs pa dang /üîΩmngon sum du byas pa'i sgo nas mngon par rtogs kyi gang gis na de mngon par rtogs pa'i mtha' las 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa ni sngon 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis mngon par ma rtogs pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba ni thog ma med pa can gyi 'khor ba na sngon 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa mngon par rtogs shing yongs su shes pa dang spangs pa dang / mngon sum du byas pa'i sgo nas mngon par rtogs kyi gang gis na de mngon par rtogs pa'i mtha' las 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: In beginningless samsara, the truths of suffering, origin and cessation are directly realized, fully understood, abandoned and manifested by the mundane path,üîΩbut the truth of path is not directly realized by the mundane path because it is not directly realized by the mundane path in the past.

original: de mngon par rtogs pa'i mthar de dang 'dra ba ma 'ongs pa 'thob par 'gyur ba kun rdzob shes pas lam gyi bden pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag tu mngon par mi rtogs so //
analyzed: de mngon par rtogs pa'i mthar de dang 'dra ba ma 'ongs pa 'thob par 'gyur ba kun rdzob shes pas lam gyi bden pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag tu mngon par mi rtogs so //
translated: Conventional knowledge does not directly realize the aspects of the truth of path and so on because it does not directly realize them in the future, since it is not directly realized by the mundane path.

original: zad par mngon par ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni lam zhes bya bar snyegs so //
analyzed: zad par mngon par ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni lam zhes bya bar snyegs so //
translated: The truth of path is not directly realized by the mundane path because it is not directly realized by the mundane path in the past.

original: lam thams cad ni sus kyang bsgom par mi nus so //
analyzed: lam thams cad ni sus kyang bsgom par mi nus so //
translated: No one can cultivate all paths.

original: gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa bsgom par mi nus la rang gi rgyud la yod pa'i snyed zin pa ni brgya'i cha yang mngon par bya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa bsgom par mi nus la rang gi rgyud la yod pa'i snyed zin pa ni brgya'i cha yang mngon par bya bar mi nus so //
translated: One cannot meditate on the suffering that exists in the mindstreams of others, and one cannot manifest even a hundredth part of the suffering that exists in one‚Äôs own mindstream.

original: de'i tshe kun 'byung yang thams cad spongs pa ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i tshe'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe kun 'byung yang thams cad spongs pa ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i tshe'o //
translated: At that time, one does not abandon all origination, because origination is not abandoned when subsequent knowledge of the truth of origination occurs.

original: gang zhig ma spangs she na /
analyzed: gang zhig ma spangs she na /
translated: What is not abandoned?

original: 'gog pa dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams te /
analyzed: 'gog pa dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams te /
translated: The afflictions that are to be abandoned by seeing the truths of cessation and path.

original: de'i phyir lam la rjes su shes pa ltar kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i tshe yang mngon par rtogs pa'i mtha' las 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir lam la rjes su shes pa ltar kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i tshe yang mngon par rtogs pa'i mtha' las 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, just as one does not emerge from the end of clear knowledge when subsequent knowledge of the truth of the path occurs, one also does not emerge from the end of clear knowledge when subsequent knowledge of the truth of origination occurs.

original: de'i bden pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba zhes bya ba ni kun 'byung gi bden pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i bden pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba zhes bya ba ni kun 'byung gi bden pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat which is to be abandoned by seeing the truth of cessation‚Äù means that which is to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origination.

original: rigs mang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la rigs ni nus pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa'i rgyud yin la /
analyzed: rigs mang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la rigs ni nus pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa'i rgyud yin la /
translated: A lineage is a continuum that possesses a special ability.

original: lam 'di la nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs kyi dbye bas rigs mang po zhig yod pas na rigs mang po'o //
analyzed: lam 'di la nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs kyi dbye bas rigs mang po zhig yod pas na rigs mang po'o //
translated: This path has many lineages because it is differentiated by the lineages of sravakas and so on.

original: nyan thos kyi rigs la sogs pa'i dbye bas tha dad pa'i lam thams cad ni bsgom par mi nus te /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi rigs la sogs pa'i dbye bas tha dad pa'i lam thams cad ni bsgom par mi nus te /
translated: One cannot cultivate all the paths that are differentiated by the lineages of sravakas and so on.

original: mngon du bya bar mi nus zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: mngon du bya bar mi nus zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The meaning of this is that one cannot manifest them.

original: gang yang rung ba zhig mngon du 'gyur na gang yang rung ba zhig gis so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang yang rung ba zhig mngon du 'gyur na gang yang rung ba zhig gis so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if any one of them were to be manifested, then one would obtain the cessation not due to deliberation of any one of them.üîΩBecause it is a retinue of the path of seeing.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi 'khor yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer te zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob shes pa mthong ba'i lam gyi 'khor yin la /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi 'khor yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer te zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob shes pa mthong ba'i lam gyi 'khor yin la /
translated: Subsequent knowledge of the truth of the path is the path of meditation.üîΩTherefore, it is said that one does not obtain it there.üîΩBecause it is a retinue of the path of seeing.

original: lam la rjes su shes pa ni bsgom pa'i lam yin te /üîΩde'i phyir der mi 'thob @241a * //
analyzed: lam la rjes su shes pa ni bsgom pa'i lam yin te / de'i phyir der mi 'thob @241a * //
translated: Subsequent knowledge of the truth of the path is the path of meditation.

original: po zhes zer ba'o //
analyzed: po zhes zer ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said that one does not obtain it there.

original: 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: This is to be established.üîΩIt is not an object of knowledge,

original: shes par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam gyi 'khor kho na yin gyi /üîΩbsgom pa'i lam gyi 'khor ram /
analyzed: shes par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam gyi 'khor kho na yin gyi / bsgom pa'i lam gyi 'khor ram /
translated: because it is the retinue of the path of seeing alone,üîΩnot the retinue of the path of meditation,

original: lam gnyi ga'i 'khor ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: lam gnyi ga'i 'khor ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
translated: or the retinue of both paths.üîΩIt is an unarisen dharma.

original: de ni mi skye ba'i chos can yin zhes bya ba la ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ni mi skye ba'i chos can yin zhes bya ba la ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i rten mi skye ba'i chos can yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i rten mi skye ba'i chos can yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because its basis is an unarisen dharma.

original: de ni dad pa dang chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i rten kho nas mngon du byed pa sred na /
analyzed: de ni dad pa dang chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i rten kho nas mngon du byed pa sred na /
translated: If it is manifested by the basis of a follower of faith or a follower of reality alone,

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi gong na de dag skye ba'i go skabs med de /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi gong na de dag skye ba'i go skabs med de /
translated: then there is no opportunity for them to arise above the path of seeing.

original: dad pa dang chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i rten dag kyang de'i gong rol na mi skye ba'i chos can yin pa'i phyir de mi skye ba'i chos can nyid yin no //
analyzed: dad pa dang chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i rten dag kyang de'i gong rol na mi skye ba'i chos can yin pa'i phyir de mi skye ba'i chos can nyid yin no //
translated: Because the basis of a follower of faith or a follower of reality does not arise above that, it is an unarisen dharma.

original: ji ltar de thob yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ji ltar de thob yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: How is it obtained?

original: gal te mngon du mi byed na snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: gal te mngon du mi byed na snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: then it is not obtained.üîΩObtained from non-acquisition means that in beginningless cyclic existence, it was not previously obtained, but is obtained at the end of the clear realization of the three truths.

original: ma rnyed pa las rnyed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de ni thog ma med pa can gyi 'khor bar sngar ma rnyed pa las bden pa gsum mngon par rtogs pa'i mthar rnyed pas ma rnyed pa las rnyed pa zhes bya'o//
analyzed: ma rnyed pa las rnyed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de ni thog ma med pa can gyi 'khor bar sngar ma rnyed pa las bden pa gsum mngon par rtogs pa'i mthar rnyed pas ma rnyed pa las rnyed pa zhes bya'o//
translated: Obtained from non-acquisition is said because it was not obtained.

original: ji ltar rnyed pa yin zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: ji ltar rnyed pa yin zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: How is it obtained?

original: de skyed pa'i nus pa rnyed na ji ltar mngon du mi byed /
analyzed: de skyed pa'i nus pa rnyed na ji ltar mngon du mi byed /
translated: If the potential to generate it is obtained, why would it not be manifested?

original: 'on te mngon du mi byed na ji ltar rnyed de mi rnyed pa nyid do snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te mngon du mi byed na ji ltar rnyed de mi rnyed pa nyid do snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: If it is not manifested, how is it obtained? It is not obtained at all.

original: 'thob pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir gnas skabs der de'i thob pa skye ste /
analyzed: 'thob pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir gnas skabs der de'i thob pa skye ste /
translated: Obtained from obtainment means that at that time, its obtainment arises.

original: des na de'i tshe rnyed do zhes brjod kyi /
analyzed: des na de'i tshe rnyed do zhes brjod kyi /
translated: Therefore, at that time, it is said to be obtained.

original: skye bo zhes bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skye bo zhes bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not obtained from the person.üîΩObtained from practice means that it is obtained from the practice of the path.

original: gang gi phyir rnyed pa de'i phyir rnyed do zhes bya ba ni thob pa dang rnyed pa'i sgra la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnyed pa de'i phyir rnyed do zhes bya ba ni thob pa dang rnyed pa'i sgra la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is obtained, it is called obtained.

original: ston pa 'di ni sngon ma byung ba'i rnam pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /üîΩrigs pa dang bral ba'i phyir ram /
analyzed: ston pa 'di ni sngon ma byung ba'i rnam pa yin no zhes bya ba ni / rigs pa dang bral ba'i phyir ram /
translated: This teaching is of a type that has not previously occurred.

original: sngar ma thos pa'i phyir sngon ma byung ba ste /
analyzed: sngar ma thos pa'i phyir sngon ma byung ba ste /
translated: It is not previously occurred because it is not reasonable or because it was not previously heard.

original: sngar sus kyang de nyid nges par bya ba'i phyir de nyid ma bstan pas ston pa sngon ma byung ba'i rnam pa yin no //
analyzed: sngar sus kyang de nyid nges par bya ba'i phyir de nyid ma bstan pas ston pa sngon ma byung ba'i rnam pa yin no //
translated: It is not previously occurred because no one previously taught reality in order to ascertain that reality.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi mthus zhes bya ba ni mthu'i sgo nas kun rdzob shes pa 'thob kyi /üîΩmngon du gyur ba'i sgo nas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi mthus zhes bya ba ni mthu'i sgo nas kun rdzob shes pa 'thob kyi / mngon du gyur ba'i sgo nas ni ma yin te /
translated: Through the power of the supramundane path means that conventional knowledge is obtained through the power of the path of seeing,

original: langs pas mngon du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: langs pas mngon du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: but not through manifestation because it manifests when one arises from that path.

original: ches khyad par du 'phags pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan 'jig rten pa'i kun rdzob shes pa bas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: ches khyad par du 'phags pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan 'jig rten pa'i kun rdzob shes pa bas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: It is superior means it is superior to other conventional knowledge that is mundane.

original: gzhan ni bden pa mthong ba'i bden pas ma dmigs pa nyid kyis khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir rtog pa la dpyod pa yin pas ches khyad par du 'phags pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni bden pa mthong ba'i bden pas ma dmigs pa nyid kyis khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir rtog pa la dpyod pa yin pas ches khyad par du 'phags pa yin no //
translated: The other is superior to the former because it is analyzed by thought, since it is distinguished by not observing the truth of seeing the truth.

original: 'thob pa med na ji ltar ma 'ongs pa de rnyed ce na de'i phyir /
analyzed: 'thob pa med na ji ltar ma 'ongs pa de rnyed ce na de'i phyir /
translated: If there is no obtainment, how is the future obtained?

original: de nyid de rnyed pa yin te zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so//
analyzed: de nyid de rnyed pa yin te zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so//
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: @241b rigs rnyed na rigs las byung ba yang rnyed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni dper na 'thob pa dang ldan pa rnyed pa bzhin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: @241b rigs rnyed na rigs las byung ba yang rnyed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni dper na 'thob pa dang ldan pa rnyed pa bzhin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: Obtaining the lineage is also obtaining that which arises from the lineage, just as obtaining possession is obtained.

original: rigs ni de skyed par nus pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: rigs ni de skyed par nus pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The lineage is the cause that is able to generate it.

original: de las byung ba ni rigs las byung ba'o //
analyzed: de las byung ba ni rigs las byung ba'o //
translated: That which arises from the lineage is that which arises from the lineage.

original: de skad bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de skad bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: This is taught:üîΩIf the basis that is able to manifest it is obtained, that which is generated by that basis is also obtained.

original: de mngon sum du 'byung bar nus pa'i rten rnyed na rten des skyed pa de yang rnyed par 'gyur ro bye brag tu smra ba rnams ni de mi 'dod de /
analyzed: de mngon sum du 'byung bar nus pa'i rten rnyed na rten des skyed pa de yang rnyed par 'gyur ro bye brag tu smra ba rnams ni de mi 'dod de /
translated: Vaibhasikas do not assert that.

original: de ni mthong ba'i lam gyis thob par bya ba yin na /
analyzed: de ni mthong ba'i lam gyis thob par bya ba yin na /
translated: If it is to be obtained by the path of seeing,

original: de bsgom pa'i lam du ji ltar mngon sum du byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: de bsgom pa'i lam du ji ltar mngon sum du byed par 'gyur /
translated: how could it be manifested on the path of meditation?

original: de nyid kyi phyir de mi skye ba'i chos can du rnam par gzhag go zhe'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de mi skye ba'i chos can du rnam par gzhag go zhe'o //
translated: Therefore it is posited as an unarisen phenomenon.

original: sa bdun pa'i kun rdzob shes pa de 'thob ce na /
analyzed: sa bdun pa'i kun rdzob shes pa de 'thob ce na /
translated: If it is asked whether one obtains conventional knowledge of the seventh ground,

original: mthong ba'i lam bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa yin nas bdun pa'i kun rdzob shes pa thob pa'i bar du ste /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa yin nas bdun pa'i kun rdzob shes pa thob pa'i bar du ste /
translated: it is obtained from the path of seeing, which is the level of the fourth concentration, up to the attainment of conventional knowledge of the seventh ground.

original: sa bdun pa ni 'dod pa'i khams dang mi lcogs pa med pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / bsam gtan khyad par can no //
analyzed: sa bdun pa ni 'dod pa'i khams dang mi lcogs pa med pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / bsam gtan khyad par can no //
translated: The seventh ground is the desire realm, unrestricted access concentration, the four concentrations, and special absorption.

original: bar du zhes bya ba'i sgras ni bsam gtan dang po dang bsam gtan khyad par can dang / bsam gtan gnyis pa dang gsum pa'i mthong ba'i lam bsdu'o //
analyzed: bar du zhes bya ba'i sgras ni bsam gtan dang po dang bsam gtan khyad par can dang / bsam gtan gnyis pa dang gsum pa'i mthong ba'i lam bsdu'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúup to‚Äù includes the path of seeing of the first concentration, special absorption, and the second and third concentrations.

original: mthong ba'i lam bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa zhig yin na ni /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa zhig yin na ni /
