translated: If the path of seeing is the level of the first concentration,

original: sa gsum pa'i kun rdzob shes pa ma 'ongs pa 'thob ste /
analyzed: sa gsum pa'i kun rdzob shes pa ma 'ongs pa 'thob ste /
translated: one obtains future conventional knowledge of the third level.

original: bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa dang / mi lcogs pa med pa'i sa pa dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa dang / mi lcogs pa med pa'i sa pa dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa'o //
translated: The path of seeing is of four stages: the first absorption, the stage of unrestricted access concentration, the stage of the special absorption and the desire realm.

original: mthong ba'i lam bsam gtan khyad par can gyis pa zhig yin na ni de'i sa pa kho na klags te sa bzhi pa 'thob bo //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam bsam gtan khyad par can gyis pa zhig yin na ni de'i sa pa kho na klags te sa bzhi pa 'thob bo //
translated: If the path of seeing is of the stage of the special absorption, then it is obtained in four stages, since the conventional knowledge of the special absorption is added to the three stages.

original: mthong ba'i lam bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa pa zhig yin na ni bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa pa klags te sa lnga pa thob po //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa pa zhig yin na ni bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa pa klags te sa lnga pa thob po //
translated: If the path of seeing is of the stage of the second absorption, then it is obtained in five stages, since the conventional knowledge of the second absorption is added to the four stages.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa pa zhig yin na ni sa drug pa thob po bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa zhig yin na ni sa bdun pa'i kun rdzob shes pa ma 'ongs pa 'thob ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa pa zhig yin na ni sa drug pa thob po bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa zhig yin na ni sa bdun pa'i kun rdzob shes pa ma 'ongs pa 'thob ste /
translated: If it is of the stage of the third absorption, then it is obtained in six stages. If it is of the stage of the fourth absorption, then future conventional knowledge of the seventh stage is obtained,

original: bsam gtan bzhi'i sa pa nas 'dod pa na spyod pa'i bar ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi'i sa pa nas 'dod pa na spyod pa'i bar ro //
translated: since it is of the stage of the fourth absorption and of the desire realm.

original: 'gog pa'i mtha' zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa'i dran ba nye bar gzhag pa'am /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i mtha' zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa'i dran ba nye bar gzhag pa'am /
translated: The term limit of cessation refers to the close placement of mindfulness that focuses on cessation.

original: rang bzhin gyi dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin yang rung chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin te 'gog pa la dmigs pa'i phyir dang / shes rab kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin yang rung chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin te 'gog pa la dmigs pa'i phyir dang / shes rab kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro//
translated: It is also the close placement of mindfulness of the nature of phenomena, because it focuses on cessation and because it is by nature wisdom.üîΩThe remaining are the four foundations of mindfulness.

original: lhag ma ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi char yin no zhes bya ba la ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: lhag ma ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi char yin no zhes bya ba la ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is this?

original: sdug bsngal mngon par rtogs na kun rdzob shes pa gang 'thob pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal mngon par rtogs na kun rdzob shes pa gang 'thob pa'o //
translated: When suffering is realized, any conventional knowledge that is obtained.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi char zhes bya ba ni lus dang tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams te /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi char zhes bya ba ni lus dang tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams te /
translated: The four foundations of mindfulness are the foundations of mindfulness of body, feeling, mind, and phenomena.

original: phung po lnga la dmigs pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: phung po lnga la dmigs pa'i phyir ro//
translated: They focus on the five aggregates.

original: @242a * // kun 'byung ba la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: @242a * // kun 'byung ba la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said for the origin.

original: rang bden rnam can zhes bya ba ni gang zhig bden pa gang mngon par rtogs pas 'thob pa de'i ni de rang gi bden pa ste /
analyzed: rang bden rnam can zhes bya ba ni gang zhig bden pa gang mngon par rtogs pas 'thob pa de'i ni de rang gi bden pa ste /
translated: Those who obtain any knowledge of the truth that is realized have their own truth.

original: sdug bsngal mngon par rtogs pa ni kun rdzob shes pa gang thob pa de ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal mngon par rtogs pa ni kun rdzob shes pa gang thob pa de ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The realization of suffering is the conventional knowledge that is obtained, and its aspects are impermanence, etc.

original: de bzhin du kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said of the realization of origination and cessation.

original: de'i dmigs pa yang bden pa de nyid yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: de'i dmigs pa yang bden pa de nyid yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ste /
translated: Its object is that truth itself, etc.

original: de'i dmigs pa can ma yin pa ni de'i rnam pa can nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dmigs pa can ma yin pa ni de'i rnam pa can nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not the object of that, because it is not suitable to be its aspect.

original: rnam pa ni dmigs pa 'dzin pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa ni dmigs pa 'dzin pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: An aspect is the form of apprehending an object.

original: 'bad las byung zhes bya ba ni skye bas thob pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'bad las byung zhes bya ba ni skye bas thob pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Arisen from effort means it is not obtained from birth.

original: phung po bzhi dang lnga'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa la rjes su 'brang ba'i gzugs med pa'i phyir phung po bzhi'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: phung po bzhi dang lnga'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa la rjes su 'brang ba'i gzugs med pa'i phyir phung po bzhi'i rang bzhin no //
translated: It has the nature of four or five aggregates means it has the nature of four aggregates because it does not have the form aggregate that is associated with the desire realm.

original: gzugs na spyod pa ni bsam gtan gyi sdom pa'i gzugs yod pa'i phyir phung po lnga yin no //
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa ni bsam gtan gyi sdom pa'i gzugs yod pa'i phyir phung po lnga yin no //
translated: Those who practice in the form realm have five aggregates because they have the form of the absorption vows.üîΩThose with attachment obtain six.

original: chags bcas bcu drug pa las drug / ces bya ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa dang lan cig phyir 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: chags bcas bcu drug pa las drug / ces bya ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa dang lan cig phyir 'ong ba'o //
translated: Those who are stream enterers and once returners obtain six.üîΩTwo are present.

original: shes pa gnyis da ltar byung ba yin la zhes bya ba ni lam shes pa'o zhes lam la rjes su shes pa kho na gnyis su brtsi'o //
analyzed: shes pa gnyis da ltar byung ba yin la zhes bya ba ni lam shes pa'o zhes lam la rjes su shes pa kho na gnyis su brtsi'o //
translated: The present two are the cognition of the path and the cognition of nonarising.

original: ma 'ongs pa drug 'thob ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa drug 'thob ste zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Six are obtained in the future.üîΩThose who are stream enterers and once returners obtain six cognitions.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa dang lan cig phyir 'ong bas shes pa drug thob pas de'i phyir de dag nyid ma 'ongs pa 'thob ste /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa dang lan cig phyir 'ong bas shes pa drug thob pas de'i phyir de dag nyid ma 'ongs pa 'thob ste /
translated: Therefore they obtain those six in the future.

original: chos khyad par du 'phags pa rnams kyi thob pa dag skye zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos khyad par du 'phags pa rnams kyi thob pa dag skye zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that the obtainment of superior qualities arises.

original: 'dod chags dang ni bral bas bdun //üîΩzhes bya ba ni skad cig ma bcu drug kho na la ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang ni bral bas bdun //üîΩzhes bya ba ni skad cig ma bcu drug kho na la ste /
translated: Those free of attachment obtain seven.üîΩThose who are nonreturners obtain seven.

original: mthong ba'i lam la ni 'dod chags dang bral bas kyang gzhan gyi sems shes pa mi 'thob ste /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam la ni 'dod chags dang bral bas kyang gzhan gyi sems shes pa mi 'thob ste /
translated: One also does not obtain knowledge of others' minds through freedom from attachment on the path of seeing,

original: de ni mngon sum du bya bas rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: de ni mngon sum du bya bas rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: because it is distinguished by being directly perceived,

original: de na yang de'i skabs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de na yang de'i skabs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and because there is no opportunity for it there.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,

original: de ni bar chad med pa'i lam thams cad la yang mi 'thob po //
analyzed: de ni bar chad med pa'i lam thams cad la yang mi 'thob po //
translated: one also does not obtain it on all uninterrupted paths.üîΩOne obtains seven on the path of meditation,

original: bsgom pa'i lam la bdun 'thob po zhes bya ba ni rnam pa brgyad spangs pa'i bar der ro //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam la bdun 'thob po zhes bya ba ni rnam pa brgyad spangs pa'i bar der ro //
translated: up to the elimination of the eighth class of defilements.

original: rnam pa dgu pa ni ma gtogs te /
analyzed: rnam pa dgu pa ni ma gtogs te /
translated: The ninth class is excluded,

original: der thob pa de ni phyis bshad pa'i lhag ma la brgyad thob ces bya ba der 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: der thob pa de ni phyis bshad pa'i lhag ma la brgyad thob ces bya ba der 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: because it is explained that one obtains eight later on the remaining path of meditation.

original: de'i phyir rnam par grol ba'i lam dgu pa ma gtogs pa gzhan gang dag 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral bar byed pa sbyor ba'i lam la sogs pa de dag tu gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dag ma gtogs
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par grol ba'i lam dgu pa ma gtogs pa gzhan gang dag 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral bar byed pa sbyor ba'i lam la sogs pa de dag tu gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dag ma gtogs
translated: Therefore, except for the ninth liberated path, any other path that is a path of preparation and so on that is free from attachment to the desire realm does not possess knowledge of others' minds and knowledge of elimination and nonarising.üîΩ

original: @242b pa shes pa bdun thob po //
analyzed: @242b pa shes pa bdun thob po //
translated: Therefore, except for the ninth liberated path, in other paths such as the path of preparation that free from attachment to the desire realm, one obtains seven knowledges, excluding the knowledge of others' minds and the knowledge of elimination and nonarising.

original: 'jig rten pa zhig yin na ni //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa zhig yin na ni //
translated: If one is an ordinary being,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gal te 'phags pas 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis 'dod par gtogs pa'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba zad par byed na de'i phyir kun rdzob shes pa da ltar byung ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gal te 'phags pas 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis 'dod par gtogs pa'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba zad par byed na de'i phyir kun rdzob shes pa da ltar byung ba yin no //
translated: If an ƒÅrya makes desire realm beings objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation cease by the mundane path, then conventional knowledge arises in the present.

original: ci ste 'jig rten las 'das pas zad par byed na de'i phyir shes pa bzhi las zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ci ste 'jig rten las 'das pas zad par byed na de'i phyir shes pa bzhi las zhes bya ba ste /
translated: If they are made to cease by the transcendent path, then four knowledges arise in the present.

original: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang / lam la chos shes pa rnams las gang yang rung ba zhig da ltar byung ba yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang / lam la chos shes pa rnams las gang yang rung ba zhig da ltar byung ba yin te /
translated: From among the four knowledges of the truths of suffering, origin, cessation and path, any one arises in the present.

original: 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i bsgom pa'i lam ni 'dod pa'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i spyod yul can kho na yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i bsgom pa'i lam ni 'dod pa'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i spyod yul can kho na yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The path of meditation that possesses attachment is only the object field of the suffering of the desire realm and so on.

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni mi 'thob ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni mi 'thob ste /
translated: One does not obtain knowledge of others' minds because

original: de ni 'dod chags dang ma bral ba la med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni 'dod chags dang ma bral ba la med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that is not possessed by one who is not free from attachment.

original: sa bdun las rgyal zhes bya ba ni shes pa bdun thob bo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: sa bdun las rgyal zhes bya ba ni shes pa bdun thob bo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: One who has conquered seven stages is one who has obtained seven knowledges.

original: de dag nyid do zhes bya ba ni chos dang / rjes dang / sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang / lam dang / kun rdzob shes pa rnams so //
analyzed: de dag nyid do zhes bya ba ni chos dang / rjes dang / sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang / lam dang / kun rdzob shes pa rnams so //
translated: Those very seven is to say, the conventional knowledge, knowledge of the truth of Dharma, subsequent knowledge, knowledge of the truth of suffering, knowledge of the origin of suffering, knowledge of the cessation of suffering, and knowledge of the path.

original: 'dod pa'i khams las 'dod chags dang bral yang gzhan gyi sems shes pa mi thob ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams las 'dod chags dang bral yang gzhan gyi sems shes pa mi thob ste /
translated: One who is free from attachment to the desire realm does not obtain knowledge of others' minds.

original: de ni bar chad med pa'i lam la bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni bar chad med pa'i lam la bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is blocked on the uninterrupted path.üîΩIf the path of meditation is mundane, then one obtains the conventional knowledge of the summit of existence.

original: gal te bsgom pa'i lam 'jig rten pa zhig yin na ni zhes bya ba la bsgom pa'i lam ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gal te bsgom pa'i lam 'jig rten pa zhig yin na ni zhes bya ba la bsgom pa'i lam ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The path of meditation is twofold:

original: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
translated: mundane and supramundane.

original: de la sa bdun las 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs par ci rigs par gal te bsgom pa'i lam 'jig rten pa yin na ni kun rdzob shes pa da ltar byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de la sa bdun las 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs par ci rigs par gal te bsgom pa'i lam 'jig rten pa yin na ni kun rdzob shes pa da ltar byung ba yin no //
translated: If the path of cultivation is mundane, then conventional knowledge is present.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa zhig yin na ni rjes su shes pa bzhi zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang 'gog pa dang lam la rjes su shes pa rnams la gang yang rung ba zhig ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa zhig yin na ni rjes su shes pa bzhi zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang 'gog pa dang lam la rjes su shes pa rnams la gang yang rung ba zhig ste /
translated: If it is supramundane, then one of the four subsequent knowledges is present.

original: thams cad cig car mngon sum du 'gyur ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //üîΩchos shes pa gnyis las zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa dang lam la dmigs pa dag las te /üîΩ'gog pa dang / lam la chos shes gang yin te //
analyzed: thams cad cig car mngon sum du 'gyur ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro // chos shes pa gnyis las zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa dang lam la dmigs pa dag las te / 'gog pa dang / lam la chos shes gang yin te //
translated: It is impossible for all of them to be present simultaneously.üîΩFrom two of the Dharma knowledges means from the two that have cessation and path as their objects.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: The Dharma knowledge of cessation and the Dharma knowledge of path.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo'i gnyen po ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob shes pa srid pa'i rtse mo'i gnyen po med de /
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo'i gnyen po ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob shes pa srid pa'i rtse mo'i gnyen po med de /
translated: Because it is not the antidote of the summit of existence.üîΩConventional knowledge is not the antidote of the summit of existence, because there is no access concentration to a higher level.

original: sa gong ma'i nyer bsdogs med pa'i phyir la mi g-yo ba'i sems rnam par grol ba yang srid pa'i rtse mo'i gnyen pos rab tu phye ba yin no //
analyzed: sa gong ma'i nyer bsdogs med pa'i phyir la mi g-yo ba'i sems rnam par grol ba yang srid pa'i rtse mo'i gnyen pos rab tu phye ba yin no //
translated: The unshakable liberation is distinguished by the antidote of the summit of existence.

original: der ni zad pa shes pa bdun pa yin par rig par bya'o //üîΩyang ci'i phyir der mi skye ba shes pa yang mi 'thob ce na bar chad med pa'i lam la @243a * //
analyzed: der ni zad pa shes pa bdun pa yin par rig par bya'o // yang ci'i phyir der mi skye ba shes pa yang mi 'thob ce na bar chad med pa'i lam la @243a * //
translated: It should be understood that the knowledge of elimination is the seventh.üîΩWhy is the knowledge of nonarising not obtained there?

original: gnas pa ni mi g-yo ba'i chos can ma yin te /
analyzed: gnas pa ni mi g-yo ba'i chos can ma yin te /
translated: One who abides in the uninterrupted path is not unshakable.

original: de ni dus kyi rnam par grol ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni dus kyi rnam par grol ba yin no //
translated: That is the one liberated according to circumstances.

original: rnam par grol ba'i lam dgu pa la mi skye ba shes pa 'byung gi bar chad med pa'i lam la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i lam dgu pa la mi skye ba shes pa 'byung gi bar chad med pa'i lam la ni ma yin no //
translated: The knowledge of nonarising occurs on the ninth liberated path, but not on the uninterrupted path.

original: gal te kun rdzob shes pa mi 'thob na gzhan gyi sems shes pa ji ltar 'thob ce na /
analyzed: gal te kun rdzob shes pa mi 'thob na gzhan gyi sems shes pa ji ltar 'thob ce na /
translated: If conventional knowledge is not obtained, how is knowledge of others' minds obtained?

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni rnam par grol ba'i lam gyis bsdus pa dang / zag pa med pa yin pas 'thob pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni rnam par grol ba'i lam gyis bsdus pa dang / zag pa med pa yin pas 'thob pa'o //
translated: Knowledge of others' minds is obtained by those who are liberated by the transcendent wisdom of the ƒÅrya path, because it is included in the liberated path and is uncontaminated.

original: slob pa sbyang ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa thams cad 'byung ngo //
analyzed: slob pa sbyang ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa thams cad 'byung ngo //
translated: All that is explained in the Abhidharmako≈õa, such as ‚ÄúThose in training obtain the state of an arhat through nine.‚ÄùüîΩBoth those who possess attachment and those free from attachment obtain conventional knowledge.

original: gnyi gas kun rdzob shes pa yang 'thob bo zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba gnyi gas rnam par grol ba'i lam la 'thob bo //
analyzed: gnyi gas kun rdzob shes pa yang 'thob bo zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba gnyi gas rnam par grol ba'i lam la 'thob bo //
translated: On the path of preparation, they obtain both.

original: sbyor ba'i lam la ni de nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang 'dod chags dang bral ba de gnyi gas kyang dbang po sbyong ba'i sbyor ba'i lam la sngar bshad pa chos dang rjes su shes pa la sogs pa 'ba' zhig du ma
analyzed: sbyor ba'i lam la ni de nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang 'dod chags dang bral ba de gnyi gas kyang dbang po sbyong ba'i sbyor ba'i lam la sngar bshad pa chos dang rjes su shes pa la sogs pa 'ba' zhig du ma
translated: On the path of preparation that is the training in the faculties, both those who possess attachment and those free from attachment obtain not only the seven knowledges previously explained, such as Dharma knowledge and subsequent knowledge,

original: zad kyi kun rdzob shes pa yang 'thob po //
analyzed: zad kyi kun rdzob shes pa yang 'thob po //
translated: but also conventional knowledge.

original: de ltar na 'dod chags dang bral bas ni sbyor ba'i lam la shes pa bdun 'thob po //
analyzed: de ltar na 'dod chags dang bral bas ni sbyor ba'i lam la shes pa bdun 'thob po //
translated: Thus those free from attachment obtain seven knowledges on the path of preparation.

original: 'dod chags dang bral bas ni brgyad 'thob po //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral bas ni brgyad 'thob po //
translated: One free from attachment obtains eight.üîΩBecause one is free from the path of seeing.

original: mthong ba'i lam dang bral ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dbang po dag sbyong na rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu rnams las gang yang rung ba 'bras bu 'dus byas dbang po rnon pos bsdus pa 'thob bo zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam dang bral ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dbang po dag sbyong na rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu rnams las gang yang rung ba 'bras bu 'dus byas dbang po rnon pos bsdus pa 'thob bo zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam
translated: If one refines the faculties, one obtains any one of the conditioned results subsumed by the sharp faculties, such as the result of stream entry.

original: dang 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: dang 'dra ba yin no //
translated: This is similar to the path of seeing.

original: der bar chad med pa'i lam la kun rdzob shes pa thob pa yang ma yin pa de bzhin du 'dir yang bar chad med pa'i lam la kun rdzob shes pa 'thob pa med do //
analyzed: der bar chad med pa'i lam la kun rdzob shes pa thob pa yang ma yin pa de bzhin du 'dir yang bar chad med pa'i lam la kun rdzob shes pa 'thob pa med do //
translated: Just as one does not obtain conventional knowledge on the uninterrupted path there, so too here one does not obtain conventional knowledge on the uninterrupted path.

original: gnyen po ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni mngon par shes pa'i bdag nyid yin pa nyid kyis rnam par grol ba'i lam gyis bsdus pa'i phyir gnyen po ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: gnyen po ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni mngon par shes pa'i bdag nyid yin pa nyid kyis rnam par grol ba'i lam gyis bsdus pa'i phyir gnyen po ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: Because it is not an antidote. Knowledge of others' minds is not an antidote because it is subsumed by the liberated path, since it is itself an actual basis of higher perception.

original: 'dir ni spong ba'i gnyen por 'dod do //
analyzed: 'dir ni spong ba'i gnyen por 'dod do //
translated: Here it is asserted that it is an antidote of abandonment.

original: de bzhin srid rtse rnam rgyal la //üîΩzhes bya ba ni ji ltar dbang po sbyong ba na 'dod chags dang ma bral bas rnam par grol ba'i lam dang / 'dod chags dang bral yang rung ma bral yang rung bas bar chad med pa'i lam la shes pa drug 'thob pa de bzhin du srid pa'i rtse mo las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i bar chad med pa'i lam rnams la yang chos dang rjes su sdug bsngal dang kun
analyzed: de bzhin srid rtse rnam rgyal la // zhes bya ba ni ji ltar dbang po sbyong ba na 'dod chags dang ma bral bas rnam par grol ba'i lam dang / 'dod chags dang bral yang rung ma bral yang rung bas bar chad med pa'i lam la shes pa drug 'thob pa de bzhin du srid pa'i rtse mo las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i bar chad med pa'i lam rnams la yang chos dang rjes su sdug bsngal dang kun
translated: So too, on the summit of existence,üîΩJust as when one upgrades one's intellectual faculty, one obtains six knowledges on the liberated path, whether or not one is free from attachment, and one obtains six knowledges on the uninterrupted path, whether or not one is free from attachment, so too, one obtains six knowledges on the uninterrupted paths that are free from attachment to the summit of existence.üîΩOne obtains the knowledge of the dharma, subsequent knowledge, the knowledge of suffering, origin,

original: 'byung dang 'gog pa dang / lam shes pa drug kho na 'thob po //
analyzed: 'byung dang 'gog pa dang / lam shes pa drug kho na 'thob po //
translated: cessation and path.

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa mi 'thob ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa mi 'thob ste /
translated: One does not obtain knowledge of others' minds,

original: bar chad med @243b pa'i lam la bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bar chad med @243b pa'i lam la bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is blocked on the uninterrupted path.

original: kun rdzob shes pa yang mi 'thob ste /
analyzed: kun rdzob shes pa yang mi 'thob ste /
translated: One also does not obtain conventional knowledge,

original: srid pa'i rtse mo'i gnyen po ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo'i gnyen po ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not the antidote of the summit of existence.

original: bar chad med pa'i lam dag tu kun du sbyor ba zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dag kyang mi 'thob po //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam dag tu kun du sbyor ba zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dag kyang mi 'thob po //
translated: One does not obtain the cognition of exhaustion and the cognition of non-arising on the uninterrupted paths.

original: zad pa shes pa la dgu'o //
analyzed: zad pa shes pa la dgu'o //
translated: Nine on the cognition of exhaustion.

original: zhes bya ba ni dus kyi rnam par grol bas ni zad pa shes pa la shes pa dgu 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dus kyi rnam par grol bas ni zad pa shes pa la shes pa dgu 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: One who is liberated according to circumstances obtains nine cognitions on the cognition of exhaustion.

original: yongs su nyams pa srid pa'i phyir mi skye ba shes pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa srid pa'i phyir mi skye ba shes pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The cognition of non-arising is not included, because regression is possible.

original: zad pa shes pa'i las thams cad pa'i yon tan zag pa dang bcas pa rnams 'thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir kun rdzob shes pa yang 'thob po //
analyzed: zad pa shes pa'i las thams cad pa'i yon tan zag pa dang bcas pa rnams 'thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir kun rdzob shes pa yang 'thob po //
translated: One also obtains conventional cognition, because one obtains all the qualities of the sphere of the cognition of exhaustion, which are accompanied by impurity.

original: dus kyi rnam par grol ba gang zhig mi g-yo ba nyid du 'pho ba de'i rnam par grol ba'i lam tha ma la yang mi skye ba shes pas bsnan te bcu 'thob po //
analyzed: dus kyi rnam par grol ba gang zhig mi g-yo ba nyid du 'pho ba de'i rnam par grol ba'i lam tha ma la yang mi skye ba shes pas bsnan te bcu 'thob po //
translated: One who is liberated according to circumstances who upgrades to the class of the unshakable ones obtains ten cognitions on the last path of liberation, by adding the cognition of non-arising.üîΩEight are obtained on the remaining paths.

original: bshad pa'i lhag ma la brgyad 'thob ces bya ba la bshad pa'i lhag ma ni bshad pa las gzhan ma bshad pa'o //
analyzed: bshad pa'i lhag ma la brgyad 'thob ces bya ba la bshad pa'i lhag ma ni bshad pa las gzhan ma bshad pa'o //
translated: The remaining paths are the paths other than those that have been explained.

original: de la lhag ma yang gang zhig ce na /
analyzed: de la lhag ma yang gang zhig ce na /
translated: What is the remainder?

original: 'dod pa'i khams las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rnam par grol ba'i lam dgu pa zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rnam par grol ba'i lam dgu pa zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //
translated: The ninth liberated path of the stage of equipoise that is free from attachment to the desire realm.

original: ji ltar zhe na /üîΩde yi gong ma chags bcas kyi //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na / de yi gong ma chags bcas kyi //
translated: How is that?üîΩThe remaining one is the ninth liberated pathüîΩof the uncontaminated path of meditation.üîΩThe remaining one is the ninth liberated path of the uncontaminated path of meditation, because it is said,

original: bsgom pa'i lam la bdun 'thob po //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam la bdun 'thob po //
translated: One obtains seven on the remaining uncontaminated path of meditation of the higher realms that possesses attachment.üîΩHow is that?üîΩThe remaining one is the ninth liberated pathüîΩof the uncontaminated path of meditation.

original: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir rnam par grol ba'i lam dgu pa lhag ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir rnam par grol ba'i lam dgu pa lhag ma yin no //
translated: The remaining one is the ninth liberated path of the uncontaminated path of meditation, because it is said,üîΩOne obtains seven on the remaining uncontaminated path of meditation of the higher realms that possesses attachment.üîΩHow is that?üîΩThe remaining one is the ninth liberated pathüîΩof the uncontaminated path of meditation.üîΩThe remaining one is the ninth liberated path of the uncontaminated path of meditation, because it is said,

original: de bzhin du sa bdun po las 'dod chags dang bral ba dang mngon par shes pa dang spel mar bsgom pa dag gis rnam par grol ba'i lam rnams kyang lhag ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du sa bdun po las 'dod chags dang bral ba dang mngon par shes pa dang spel mar bsgom pa dag gis rnam par grol ba'i lam rnams kyang lhag ma yin no //
translated: One obtains seven on the remaining uncontaminated path of meditation of the higher realms that possesses attachment.

original: ji ltar zhe na /üîΩsa bdun las rgyal mngon shes dang // mi g-yo thob dang spel bsgom pa'i //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na / sa bdun las rgyal mngon shes dang // mi g-yo thob dang spel bsgom pa'i //
translated: How is that?üîΩThe remaining one is the ninth liberated pathüîΩof the uncontaminated path of meditation.üîΩThe remaining one is the ninth liberated path of the uncontaminated path of meditation, because it is said,

original: bar chad med pa'i lam dag dang // zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam dag dang // zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: One obtains seven on the remaining uncontaminated path of meditation of the higher realms that possesses attachment.üîΩHow is that?üîΩThe remaining one is the ninth liberated path

original: de bzhin du mi g-yo ba rtogs par byed pa'i rnam par grol ba'i lam brgyad lhag ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du mi g-yo ba rtogs par byed pa'i rnam par grol ba'i lam brgyad lhag ma yin no //
translated: of the uncontaminated path of meditation.

original: 'di ga las she na /
analyzed: 'di ga las she na /
translated: Why is this?üîΩBecause it is said, ‚ÄúOne obtains ten on the last liberated path of that.‚Äù

original: de'i rnam par grol ba'i lam tha ma la yang bcu 'thob po zhes 'byung ba'i phyir mi g-yo ba rtogs par byed pa'i rnam par grol ba'i lam brgyad lhag ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i rnam par grol ba'i lam tha ma la yang bcu 'thob po zhes 'byung ba'i phyir mi g-yo ba rtogs par byed pa'i rnam par grol ba'i lam brgyad lhag ma yin no //
translated: The remaining eight are the liberated paths that realize the immoveable.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sbyor ba dang khyad par can gyi lam thams cad lhag ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sbyor ba dang khyad par can gyi lam thams cad lhag ma yin te /
translated: All the remaining paths are the paths of preparation and the special path of the desire realm.

original: ma bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not explained here.üîΩOne obtains the eight future knowledges.

original: shes pa brgyad ma 'ongs pa 'thob pas 'thob ste zhes bya ba ni rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: shes pa brgyad ma 'ongs pa 'thob pas 'thob ste zhes bya ba ni rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: This is the extensive explanation.üîΩThe learner is like that.

original: slob pa'i ni de lta bu yin no zhes bya ba la ci zhig ce na /üîΩzad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa ma gtogs pa gzhan shes pa brgyad 'thob po zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: slob pa'i ni de lta bu yin no zhes bya ba la ci zhig ce na / zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa ma gtogs pa gzhan shes pa brgyad 'thob po zhes bya ba'o //
translated: What is that?üîΩOne obtains the eight knowledges other than the knowledge of elimination and the knowledge of nonarising.

original: mi slob pa ni mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i sbyor @244a * //
analyzed: mi slob pa ni mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i sbyor @244a * //
translated: The nonlearner obtains the eight knowledgesüîΩon the paths of the higher perceptions and so on,üîΩon the paths of preparation,

original: ba dang / rnam par grol ba dang / khyad par can gyi lam rnams la zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ba dang / rnam par grol ba dang / khyad par can gyi lam rnams la zhes bya ba la /
translated: liberation, and the special path.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni spel mar bsgom pa la sogs pa bsdu'o //üîΩmngon par shes pa mngon par bsgrub pa dang / spel mar bsgom pa'i sbyor ba dang / rnam par grol ba dang khyad par gyi lam gang dag yin pa de dag la shes pa dgu 'am bcu ma 'ongs pa 'thob pas 'thob ste /üîΩdus kyi rnam par grol bas ni mi skye ba shes pa ma gtogs pa dgu 'thob po //üîΩmi g-yo ba'i chos can gyis ni mi skye ba shes pa bsnan te bcu 'thob po //üîΩbrgyad dam dgu 'thob po zhes bya ba ni dus kyi rnam par grol bas ni gzhan gyi sems dang mi skye ba shes pa ma gtogs pa brgyad 'thob po //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni spel mar bsgom pa la sogs pa bsdu'o // mngon par shes pa mngon par bsgrub pa dang / spel mar bsgom pa'i sbyor ba dang / rnam par grol ba dang khyad par gyi lam gang dag yin pa de dag la shes pa dgu 'am bcu ma 'ongs pa 'thob pas 'thob ste / dus kyi rnam par grol bas ni mi skye ba shes pa ma gtogs pa dgu 'thob po // mi g-yo ba'i chos can gyis ni mi skye ba shes pa bsnan te bcu 'thob po // brgyad dam dgu 'thob po zhes bya ba ni dus kyi rnam par grol bas ni gzhan gyi sems dang mi skye ba shes pa ma gtogs pa brgyad 'thob po //
translated: The term ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the cultivation of the combination of calm abiding and insight.

original: mi g-yo ba'i chos can gyis ni gzhan gyi sems shes pa ma gtogs pa dgu 'thob ste /üîΩde ni bar chad med pa'i lam thams cad la bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i chos can gyis ni gzhan gyi sems shes pa ma gtogs pa dgu 'thob ste /üîΩde ni bar chad med pa'i lam thams cad la bkag pa yin no //

original: mngon par shes pa'i rnam par grol ba'i lam rnams la shes pa dgu'am bcu 'thob po zhes khyad par med par smos pa'i phyir mig dang rna ba'i mngon par shes pa'i rnam par grol ba'i lam gnyis la yang thal bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir mngon bar shes pa'i
analyzed: mngon par shes pa'i rnam par grol ba'i lam rnams la shes pa dgu'am bcu 'thob po zhes khyad par med par smos pa'i phyir mig dang rna ba'i mngon par shes pa'i rnam par grol ba'i lam gnyis la yang thal bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir mngon bar shes pa'i
translated: Since it is said that there is no distinction, it would follow that nine or ten knowledges would be obtained on the two liberated paths of the higher perceptions of eye and ear.

original: rnam par grol ba'i lam gnyis ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i lam gnyis ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: Therefore the Abhidharmakosa says, Two liberated paths of higher perception are knowledge of elimination and nonarising.

original: mig dang rna ba'i mngon par shes pa dag ni lung du ma bstan pa yin pas de'i phyir de dag gi rnam par grol ba'i lam lung du ma bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: mig dang rna ba'i mngon par shes pa dag ni lung du ma bstan pa yin pas de'i phyir de dag gi rnam par grol ba'i lam lung du ma bstan pa yin la /
translated: The higher perceptions of eye and ear are neutral avyakrta, therefore the liberated paths of those are neutral.

original: chos lung du ma bstan pa la ni ma 'ongs pa'i 'thob pa med de /üîΩlung bstan min thob lhan cig skye //
analyzed: chos lung du ma bstan pa la ni ma 'ongs pa'i 'thob pa med de / lung bstan min thob lhan cig skye //
translated: But future obtainment of a neutral phenomenon does not exist,üîΩbecause it says:

original: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Obtainment of neutral states arises simultaneously.

original: so so'i skye bo zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
translated: An ordinary being who is free from attachment to the desire realm

original: 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba dang bsam gtan gsum las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rnam par grol ba'i lam tham rnams la kun rdzob shes pa dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa ma 'ongs pa 'thob bo //
analyzed: 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba dang bsam gtan gsum las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rnam par grol ba'i lam tham rnams la kun rdzob shes pa dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa ma 'ongs pa 'thob bo //
translated: Conventional knowledge and knowledge of others' minds are obtained on the first liberated path free from attachment to the desire realm and on the first liberated path free from attachment to the third absorption.

original: yang bsam gtan bzhi pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i yang ci'i phyir ma brjod ce na /
analyzed: yang bsam gtan bzhi pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i yang ci'i phyir ma brjod ce na /
translated: Why is it not stated that they are obtained on the first liberated path free from attachment to the fourth absorption?

original: de ni nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyis bsdus pa yin na /
analyzed: de ni nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyis bsdus pa yin na /
translated: If it were subsumed by the base of infinite space,

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa gzugs med pa'i khams kyis bsdus pa yang med de /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa gzugs med pa'i khams kyis bsdus pa yang med de /
translated: knowledge of others' minds would not be subsumed by the formless realm.

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa gzugs la brten nas bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang bsam gtan gyis ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa gzugs la brten nas bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang bsam gtan gyis ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because knowledge of others' minds is established in dependence on form and it is a state of absorption.

original: bsam gtan gyis pa dag gi sbyor ba rnams dang mngon bar shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyis pa dag gi sbyor ba rnams dang mngon bar shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The preparation of those of the absorptions and higher perception and so on.

original: sbyor ba'i lam dang / mngon par shes pa gsum gyi rnam @244b par grol ba'i lam rnams dang / tshad med pa la sogs pa'i yon tan mngon par bsgrub pa rnams ni /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i lam dang / mngon par shes pa gsum gyi rnam @244b par grol ba'i lam rnams dang / tshad med pa la sogs pa'i yon tan mngon par bsgrub pa rnams ni /
translated: The path of preparation, the liberated paths of the three higher perceptions and the actual basis of the immeasurables and so on are the three knowledges.

original: sbyor ba rnams dang mngon par shes pa gsum gyi rnam par grol ba'i lam rnams dang / tshad med pa la sogs pa'i yon tan mngon par bsgrub pa rnams te /
analyzed: sbyor ba rnams dang mngon par shes pa gsum gyi rnam par grol ba'i lam rnams dang / tshad med pa la sogs pa'i yon tan mngon par bsgrub pa rnams te /
translated: The path of preparation, the liberated paths of the three higher perceptions and the actual basis of the immeasurables and so on are the three knowledges.

original: bsam gtan gyi sa pa de rnams la kun rdzob shes pa ma 'ongs pa dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa 'thob po //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi sa pa de rnams la kun rdzob shes pa ma 'ongs pa dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa 'thob po //
translated: On those levels of absorption, one obtains future conventional knowledge and knowledge of others' minds.

original: bsam gtan gyi sa pa dag ces bya ba ci'i phyir zhe na gzhan gyi sems shes pa nyer bsdogs kyi sa pa med pas so //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi sa pa dag ces bya ba ci'i phyir zhe na gzhan gyi sems shes pa nyer bsdogs kyi sa pa med pas so //
translated: Why are they called levels of absorption? Because knowledge of others' minds does not exist on the level of access concentration.

original: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: This is taught:

original: bsam gtan dang po las 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba la gal te dang po'i sbyor ba yin na ni kun rdzob shes pa dang gzhan gyi sems shes pa 'thob po //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po las 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba la gal te dang po'i sbyor ba yin na ni kun rdzob shes pa dang gzhan gyi sems shes pa 'thob po //
translated: If one is preparing for freedom from attachment to the first absorption, one obtains conventional knowledge and knowledge of others' minds.

original: gal te bsam gtan gnyis pa'i nyer bsdogs kyi sbyor ba yin na ni kun rdzob shes pa kho na 'thob bo //
analyzed: gal te bsam gtan gnyis pa'i nyer bsdogs kyi sbyor ba yin na ni kun rdzob shes pa kho na 'thob bo //
translated: If it is the preparatory stage of access to the second meditation, he obtains only conventional cognition.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa las 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba'i bar la yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa las 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba'i bar la yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The same holds for the detachment from the third meditation.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa las 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba la gal te de nyid sbyor ba yin na ni kun rdzob dang gzhan gyi sems shes pa dag 'thob po //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa las 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba la gal te de nyid sbyor ba yin na ni kun rdzob dang gzhan gyi sems shes pa dag 'thob po //
translated: If the detachment from the fourth meditation is by means of this meditation itself, he obtains conventional cognition and cognition of another's thoughts.

original: gong ma'i nyer bsdogs kyi yin na ni /
analyzed: gong ma'i nyer bsdogs kyi yin na ni /
translated: If it is by means of the access of a higher meditation,

original: kun rdzob shes pa kho na 'thob po //
analyzed: kun rdzob shes pa kho na 'thob po //
translated: he obtains only conventional cognition.

original: mngon par shes pa gsum gyi rnam par grol ba'i lam rnams la yang shes pa gnyis kho na 'thob po //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa gsum gyi rnam par grol ba'i lam rnams la yang shes pa gnyis kho na 'thob po //
translated: On the paths of liberation of the three superknowledges, he obtains two cognitions.

original: mngon par shes pa gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three superknowledges?

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi yul shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i shes pa dang / sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi yul shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i shes pa dang / sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa'o //
translated: The cognition of the object of supernormal accomplishments, the cognition of the memory of past abodes, and the cognition of another's thoughts.

original: sogs pa zhes smos pa /
analyzed: sogs pa zhes smos pa /
translated: The word etc.üîΩrefers to the cognition of exhaustion of fluxes.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: rnam par thar pa dang / zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched dang / zad par gyi skye mched la sogs pa'i yon tan mngon par bsgrub pa dag gi bsam gtan gyi sa pa'i rnam par grel ba'i lam gang dag yin pa de rnams la yang kun rdzob shes pa ma 'ongs pa dang gzhan gyi sems shes pa 'thob ste /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa dang / zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched dang / zad par gyi skye mched la sogs pa'i yon tan mngon par bsgrub pa dag gi bsam gtan gyi sa pa'i rnam par grel ba'i lam gang dag yin pa de rnams la yang kun rdzob shes pa ma 'ongs pa dang gzhan gyi sems shes pa 'thob ste /
translated: Because it is said that future conventional knowledge and knowledge of others' minds are obtained in the uncontaminated state and in the absorptions and formless states, and also in the path of liberation and in the special paths that are the means of accomplishing qualities such as the immeasurables, liberations, subjugations, totalities and so on.

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni bsam gtan gyi dngos gzhis bsdus pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni bsam gtan gyi dngos gzhis bsdus pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Knowledge of others' minds is subsumed by the actual basis of the absorptions.üîΩExcept for the factors conducive to penetrative insight,

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dag ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa bsam gtan gyi sa pa dag kyang yod mod kyi /
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dag ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa bsam gtan gyi sa pa dag kyang yod mod kyi /
translated: there are also factors conducive to penetrative insight that are levels of absorption.

original: de dag la ni gzhan gyi sems shes pa mi 'thob ste /
analyzed: de dag la ni gzhan gyi sems shes pa mi 'thob ste /
translated: But knowledge of others' minds is not obtained in those levels.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi 'khor yin pa'i phyir dang / mthong ba'i lam la gzhan gyi sems shes pa bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi 'khor yin pa'i phyir dang / mthong ba'i lam la gzhan gyi sems shes pa bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are retinue of the path of seeing and because knowledge of others' minds is blocked on the path of seeing.

original: sngon med pa'i lam @245a * //
analyzed: sngon med pa'i lam @245a * //
translated: Obtaining other unarisen pathsüîΩis by the power of preparation.üîΩObtaining other unarisen paths is by the power of preparation.üîΩObtaining other unarisen paths is by the power of preparation.üîΩObtaining other unarisen paths is by the power of preparation.üîΩObtaining other unarisen paths is by the power of preparation.

original: shes pa gsum gyi rnam par grol ba'i lam la sogs pa dag las gzhan pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa gsum gyi rnam par grol ba'i lam la sogs pa dag las gzhan pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Obtaining other unarisen paths is by the power of preparation.

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: Obtaining other un

original: 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i bar chad med pa'i lam dang / rnam par grol ba'i lam brgyad dang / de bzhin du bsam gtan gsum pa dang / bzhi pa'i bar las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i bar chad med pa la /
analyzed: 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i bar chad med pa'i lam dang / rnam par grol ba'i lam brgyad dang / de bzhin du bsam gtan gsum pa dang / bzhi pa'i bar las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i bar chad med pa la /
translated: The uninterrupted path and eight liberated paths free from attachment to the desire realm and similarly the uninterrupted and liberated paths free from attachment to the third and fourth absorptions and

original: rnam par grol ba'i lam dang / sa gong ma'i nyer bsdogs kyi sbyor ba'i lam dang / gzugs med pa gsum las 'dod chags dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i lam dang / sa gong ma'i nyer bsdogs kyi sbyor ba'i lam dang / gzugs med pa gsum las 'dod chags dang bral ba ste /
translated: the path of preparation of access concentration to higher levels and freedom from attachment to the three formless realm levels

original: de rnams la ni kun rdzob shes pa kho na thob kyi gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de rnams la ni kun rdzob shes pa kho na thob kyi gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni ma yin te /
translated: are obtained only by conventional knowledge and not knowledge of others' minds.

original: de ni nyer bsdogs dang bar chad med pa'i lam dang gzugs med pa rnams su bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni nyer bsdogs dang bar chad med pa'i lam dang gzugs med pa rnams su bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is because knowledge of others' minds is blocked in access concentrations, uninterrupted paths and the formless realm levels.

original: yang lam gang la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam mngon sum du gyur pa la'o //
analyzed: yang lam gang la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam mngon sum du gyur pa la'o //
translated: Again, on which path and so on is conventional knowledge obtained?

original: lam sa gang ba zhes bya ba ni mi lcogs pa med pa la sogs pa'i sa pa'o //
analyzed: lam sa gang ba zhes bya ba ni mi lcogs pa med pa la sogs pa'i sa pa'o //
translated: The path that is traversed is the level of unrestricted access concentration and so on.

original: dang po nyid du sa 'thob pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sgo nas bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa thob pa ste /
analyzed: dang po nyid du sa 'thob pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sgo nas bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa thob pa ste /
translated: Obtaining the level for the first time means obtaining the first absorption and so on through freedom from attachment.

original: sa de pa'i kun rdzob shes pa ma 'ongs pa 'thob po //
analyzed: sa de pa'i kun rdzob shes pa ma 'ongs pa 'thob po //
translated: One obtains future conventional knowledge of that level.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: gal te mi lcogs pa med pa la brten te 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral nas bsam gtan dang po 'thob ni mi lcogs pa med pa'i sa pa dang / bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i kun rdzob shes pa 'thob po /üîΩde bzhin du bsam gtan gnyis pa'i nyer bsdogs la brten te dang por sa gang 'thob na /
analyzed: gal te mi lcogs pa med pa la brten te 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral nas bsam gtan dang po 'thob ni mi lcogs pa med pa'i sa pa dang / bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i kun rdzob shes pa 'thob po / de bzhin du bsam gtan gnyis pa'i nyer bsdogs la brten te dang por sa gang 'thob na /
translated: If one obtains the first absorption through freedom from attachment to the desire realm by means of the mundane path in dependence on unrestricted access concentration, one obtains conventional knowledge of the level of unrestricted access concentration and the level of the first absorption.

original: kun rdzob shes pa bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa pa dang / de'i nyer bsdogs kyi sa pa 'thob po //
analyzed: kun rdzob shes pa bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa pa dang / de'i nyer bsdogs kyi sa pa 'thob po //
translated: Similarly, if one obtains the first level in dependence on the preparatory stage of the second absorption, one obtains conventional knowledge of the level of the second absorption and the level of its preparatory stage.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: This is similar up to the summit of existence.

original: der yang srid pa'i rtse mo'i sa pa dang / de'i nyer bsdogs kyi sa pa 'thob po //
analyzed: der yang srid pa'i rtse mo'i sa pa dang / de'i nyer bsdogs kyi sa pa 'thob po //
translated: Also, the state of summit is obtained in the same way.

original: gang las chags bral bya phyir zhes bya ba ni sa gang las 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang las chags bral bya phyir zhes bya ba ni sa gang las 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to be free from attachment to a realm means in order to be free from attachment to a level.

original: gang thob pa zhes bya ba ni lam gang thob pa'o //
analyzed: gang thob pa zhes bya ba ni lam gang thob pa'o //
translated: The path that is obtained is the path of preparation and so on.

original: rnam pa gnyis yin la zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten @245b las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis yin la zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten @245b las 'das pa'o //
translated: It is of two types means it is mundane and transcendent.

original: sbyor ba'i lam la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa bzhi char yang ngo //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i lam la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa bzhi char yang ngo //
translated: The path of preparation and so on means all four types.

original: de'i sa pa dang sa 'og ma'i zag pa med pa'i shes pa 'thob po //
analyzed: de'i sa pa dang sa 'og ma'i zag pa med pa'i shes pa 'thob po //
translated: One obtains the uncontaminated knowledge of its level and lower levels.

original: ji ltar zhe na /üîΩdper na / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched las 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na / dper na / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched las 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: How is that?

original: ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi nyer bsdogs kyis bsdus pa'i 'jig rten pa'i lam mngon du byed pa 'am /
analyzed: ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi nyer bsdogs kyis bsdus pa'i 'jig rten pa'i lam mngon du byed pa 'am /
translated: For example, in order to be free from attachment to the base of infinite consciousness, one manifests the mundane path subsumed by access concentration to the base of nothingness.üîΩOr in order to be free from attachment to the base of nothingness, one manifests the transcendent path subsumed by the uninterrupted stage of the base of nothingness.

original: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi zag pa med pa de nyid mngon sum du byed pa na rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi bdag nyid kyi sa gang las /üîΩ'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba'i don du lam de mngon sum du byed pa dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi sa rnyed pa gang yin pa de'i sa pa dang / 'og ma mi lcogs pa med pa'i bar thob pa bzhin nam /
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi zag pa med pa de nyid mngon sum du byed pa na rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi bdag nyid kyi sa gang las / 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba'i don du lam de mngon sum du byed pa dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi sa rnyed pa gang yin pa de'i sa pa dang / 'og ma mi lcogs pa med pa'i bar thob pa bzhin nam /
translated: When one manifests the uncontaminated state of the base of infinite consciousness, one manifests that path in order to be free from attachment to the level of the base of infinite consciousness.

original: dper na / gang zhig 'dod pa'i khams las 'dod chags dang bral nas bsam gtan dang po rnyed pa des bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa dang / mi lcogs pa med pas bsdus pa'i yon tan dag thob pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na / gang zhig 'dod pa'i khams las 'dod chags dang bral nas bsam gtan dang po rnyed pa des bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa dang / mi lcogs pa med pas bsdus pa'i yon tan dag thob pa bzhin no //
translated: One obtains the level of the base of nothingness and the level of unrestricted access concentration to lower level, just as one obtains the qualities subsumed by unrestricted access concentration to the first absorption when one obtains the first absorption and becomes free from attachment to the desire realm.

original: de bzhin du srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar las 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur bas sa thams cad pa'i yon tan zag pa med pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar las 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur bas sa thams cad pa'i yon tan zag pa med pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, one obtains uncontaminated qualities of all levels up to the summit of existence when one becomes free from attachment to the summit of existence.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra dang pos ni de'i sa pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra dang pos ni de'i sa pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: The first ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that not only those of its level are obtained.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is obtained?

original: gzhan gyis pa yang thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan la ;
analyzed: gzhan gyis pa yang thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan la ;
translated: Also those of other levels are obtained.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra gnyis pas kyang 'jig rten las 'das pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra gnyis pas kyang 'jig rten las 'das pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: The second ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that not only transcendent states are obtained.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is obtained?

original: 'jig rten pa yang ngo zhes bstan to //üîΩzad pa shes la zag bcas kyang //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa yang ngo zhes bstan to // zad pa shes la zag bcas kyang //
translated: Also mundane states are obtained.üîΩAlso contaminated states are obtained

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: with respect to the knowledge of elimination.

original: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni zag pa med pa yang zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni zag pa med pa yang zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that uncontaminated states are obtained.

original: dgra bcom pa nyid thob na thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa las byung ba dang / mi sdug pa dang dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa dran pa la sogs pa sa thams cad pa dag 'thob po //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid thob na thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa las byung ba dang / mi sdug pa dang dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa dran pa la sogs pa sa thams cad pa dag 'thob po //
translated: When the state of an arhat is obtained, all states derived from hearing, contemplation, and meditation, and the states of repulsiveness, mindfulness of inhalation and exhalation, and so on, are obtained.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched dang / zad par gyi skye mched la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched dang / zad par gyi skye mched la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes the bases of subjugation, the bases of totality, and so on.

original: sprog ma thag pa bcad de zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni dper na sprog ma thag pa gzhungs te bcings pa thag pa bcad de dbugs phyin pa lta bu ste /üîΩde bzhin du sprog ma dang chos mtshungs pa de lta bu bar chad med pa'i lam dgu pa rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis nyon mongs pa'i thob pa bcad pa las ji skad bshad pa'i yon tan mi sdug pa la sogs pa mi slob @246a *
analyzed: sprog ma thag pa bcad de zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni dper na sprog ma thag pa gzhungs te bcings pa thag pa bcad de dbugs phyin pa lta bu ste / de bzhin du sprog ma dang chos mtshungs pa de lta bu bar chad med pa'i lam dgu pa rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis nyon mongs pa'i thob pa bcad pa las ji skad bshad pa'i yon tan mi sdug pa la sogs pa mi slob @246a *
translated: Just as when a bundle is tied with string and when the string is cut, the bundle is loosened,üîΩso too, when the fetters are cut, the mind is at ease.üîΩJust as when a bundle is tied with a strong rope and the rope is cut, the bundle is loosened and one is relieved,

original: // pa'i rgyud la yod pa rnams thob pa'i sgo nas dbugs phyin pa lta bur 'gyur te /
analyzed: // pa'i rgyud la yod pa rnams thob pa'i sgo nas dbugs phyin pa lta bur 'gyur te /
translated: so too, when the ninth uninterrupted path, the vajra like concentration, cuts the obtainment of afflictions, one is relieved by obtaining the qualities explained, such as the state of nonlearner that possesses the unattractive state and so on.

original: cher sbyangs pa rnams kyi thob pa skye zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: cher sbyangs pa rnams kyi thob pa skye zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of the statement, ‚ÄúThe obtainment of those who are greatly trained arises.‚Äù

original: dbugs phyin pa lta bur zhes bya ba ni dbugs phyin pa srog chags kyi chos yin pa'i phyir nye bar btags pa'o //
analyzed: dbugs phyin pa lta bur zhes bya ba ni dbugs phyin pa srog chags kyi chos yin pa'i phyir nye bar btags pa'o //
translated: The statement ‚Äújust as when one is relieved‚Äù is a metaphor because relief is a phenomenon of living beings.

original: rang gi sems la rgyal srid chen po nyid thob na //
analyzed: rang gi sems la rgyal srid chen po nyid thob na //
translated: When one‚Äôs mind obtains the state of a great king,

original: zhes bya ba la lhag pa'i rgyal po ni rgyal srid chen po'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la lhag pa'i rgyal po ni rgyal srid chen po'o //
translated: The sovereignty of a great king is a great kingdom.

original: de'i dngos po ni rgyal srid chen po nyid do //üîΩrang gi sems la rgyal srid chen po nyid thob pa ni /
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni rgyal srid chen po nyid do // rang gi sems la rgyal srid chen po nyid thob pa ni /
translated: The state of that is the state of a great king.üîΩHaving attained the sovereignty of a great king in one's own mind,

original: rang gi sems la rgyal srid chen po nyid thob pa ste /
analyzed: rang gi sems la rgyal srid chen po nyid thob pa ste /
translated: one has attained the sovereignty of a great king in one's own mind.

original: rang gi sems la dbang thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi sems la dbang thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one has attained mastery over one's own mind.üîΩBecause all the virtues of wholesome qualities are offered to it.

original: dge ba'i chos thams cad thob pa rnams kyis bsu ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor pa de 'dra ba de la mi sdug pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dge ba'i chos thams cad kyis thob pa 'bul ba dang 'dra ba rnams kyis bsu ba'i phyir
analyzed: dge ba'i chos thams cad thob pa rnams kyis bsu ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor pa de 'dra ba de la mi sdug pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dge ba'i chos thams cad kyis thob pa 'bul ba dang 'dra ba rnams kyis bsu ba'i phyir
translated: The virtues of the wholesome qualities of repulsiveness, etc. are offered to that yogin, as if they were offered to one who has attained the sovereignty of a great king.

original: te / dper na rgyal srid chen po thob na yul rnams 'bul bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: te / dper na rgyal srid chen po thob na yul rnams 'bul bar byed pa ste /
translated: For example, when one attains the sovereignty of a great king, the provinces offer gifts.

original: gos dang rgyan la sogs pa 'bul gyis bsu ba bzhin no //
analyzed: gos dang rgyan la sogs pa 'bul gyis bsu ba bzhin no //
translated: They offer clothing, ornaments, etc. and welcome him.

original: yul las rnams zhes brjod par bya ba las yul rnams zhes bstan pa ni yul gyis yul la bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yul las rnams zhes brjod par bya ba las yul rnams zhes bstan pa ni yul gyis yul la bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: The term ‚Äúobject‚Äù is used in the sense of ‚Äúthat which is to be demonstrated,‚Äù and the term ‚Äúfield‚Äù is used in the sense of ‚Äúthat which demonstrates.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar smra ba po dang yul thams cad 'ongs so zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar smra ba po dang yul thams cad 'ongs so zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the speaker and the object are both referred to as ‚Äúfields.‚Äù

original: gang ji rnyed pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang ji rnyed pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The term ‚Äúwhatever is obtained‚Äù refers to

original: bsam gtan la sogs pa mngon du byed pa de thams cad ma 'ongs pa thob pa ma zhe na /
analyzed: bsam gtan la sogs pa mngon du byed pa de thams cad ma 'ongs pa thob pa ma zhe na /
translated: the fact that all meditative states, such as the meditative absorptions, are obtained in the future.

original: de ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not the case.

original: sngon rnyed zin pa mi 'thob bo //
analyzed: sngon rnyed zin pa mi 'thob bo //
translated: One does not obtain what has already been obtained.

original: gang zhig rnyed de rnam par nyams pa las yang rnyed pa de yang mi 'thob bo //
analyzed: gang zhig rnyed de rnam par nyams pa las yang rnyed pa de yang mi 'thob bo //
translated: One also does not obtain what has been lost and then regained.

original: gang sngon ma rnyed pa las rnyed pa de 'thob bo //
analyzed: gang sngon ma rnyed pa las rnyed pa de 'thob bo //
translated: One only obtains what has not been obtained previously.

original: 'khor bar ma 'dris par zag pa med pa dang / de dang mthun pa gang yin pa de ni mngon du gyur na /
analyzed: 'khor bar ma 'dris par zag pa med pa dang / de dang mthun pa gang yin pa de ni mngon du gyur na /
translated: When one who has not become familiar with the pure meditative states of the form and formless realms, or with the pure meditative states that are similar to them, manifests one of these states,

original: de dang 'dra ba ma 'ongs pa khyad par can 'thob ste /
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba ma 'ongs pa khyad par can 'thob ste /
translated: he or she obtains a superior form of that state in the future.

original: 'bad nas mngon du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bad nas mngon du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because one manifests these states through effort.

original: 'di ltar rnyed pa'i lam ni 'bad pas mngon du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnyed pa'i lam ni 'bad pas mngon du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the path that is thus acquired is actualized through effort.

original: 'di ltar rnyed pa'i lam ni 'bad pas mngon du byed pa des 'phangs pa stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa 'thob kyi ;
analyzed: 'di ltar rnyed pa'i lam ni 'bad pas mngon du byed pa des 'phangs pa stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa 'thob kyi ;
translated: The future is acquired through the power of the projection of the path that is thus acquired and actualized through effort.

original: sngon rnyed pa ni 'bad pa med par mngon du 'gyur te /
analyzed: sngon rnyed pa ni 'bad pa med par mngon du 'gyur te /
translated: The previously acquired is actualized without effort,

original: de bsgoms shing rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bsgoms shing rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is acquired through cultivation.

original: mtshar cig dga' ba med pa'i phyir dang / shin tu mngon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ma 'ongs pa mi 'thob bo //
analyzed: mtshar cig dga' ba med pa'i phyir dang / shin tu mngon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ma 'ongs pa mi 'thob bo //
translated: The future is not acquired, because it is not marvelous, and because it is not clearly evident.üîΩThere are four kinds of acquisition,

original: 'thob pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste zhes grangs bstan pa ni nges par gzung bar bya ba'i phyir ro //üîΩrnyed pa'i 'thob pa @246b zhes bya ba ni yon tan gang yang rung ba goms pas yon tan gang yang rung ba 'thob pa'o //
analyzed: 'thob pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste zhes grangs bstan pa ni nges par gzung bar bya ba'i phyir ro // rnyed pa'i 'thob pa @246b zhes bya ba ni yon tan gang yang rung ba goms pas yon tan gang yang rung ba 'thob pa'o //
translated: the number is stated in order to indicate the certainty.üîΩThe acquisition of what is acquired is the acquisition of any quality through the cultivation of any quality.

original: rnyed pa nyid thob pa yin pas na rnyed pa'i thob pa'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa nyid thob pa yin pas na rnyed pa'i thob pa'o //
translated: The acquisition of the acquisition is the acquisition of the acquisition of any quality through the cultivation of any quality.

original: bsten pa'i thob pa zhes bya ba la bsten pa ni chos thob zin pa mngon du byed pa'o //
analyzed: bsten pa'i thob pa zhes bya ba la bsten pa ni chos thob zin pa mngon du byed pa'o //
translated: The possession of reliance is the actualization of a previously obtained dharma.

original: bsten pa nyid thob pa yin pas na bsten pa'i thob pa'o //
analyzed: bsten pa nyid thob pa yin pas na bsten pa'i thob pa'o //
translated: Since reliance itself is possession, it is the possession of reliance.

original: gnyen po'i thob pa zhes bya ba la gnyen po ni lam ste /
analyzed: gnyen po'i thob pa zhes bya ba la gnyen po ni lam ste /
translated: The possession of antidote is the path.

original: gnyen po nyid 'thob pa yin pas na gnyen po'i thob pa'o //üîΩde ni lus la sogs pa rnams kyi lus la sogs pa'i gnyen po rtogs pa las lus bsgom pa zhes bya ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: gnyen po nyid 'thob pa yin pas na gnyen po'i thob pa'o // de ni lus la sogs pa rnams kyi lus la sogs pa'i gnyen po rtogs pa las lus bsgom pa zhes bya ba lta bu ste /
translated: Since the antidote itself is obtained, it is the possession of the antidote.üîΩIt is like the statement, ‚ÄúOne meditates on the body by realizing the antidote to the body and so on.‚ÄùüîΩIt is also like the statement, ‚ÄúOne meditates on the body and so on by realizing the antidote to the body and so on.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du zag pa dang bcas pa'i tshes gzhan dag kyang yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du zag pa dang bcas pa'i tshes gzhan dag kyang yin no //
translated: Thus the body and so on are the antidote to the body and so on.üîΩThe sutras state:

original: 'di ltar lus bsgom pa dang sems bsgom pa dang tshul khrims bsgom pa ni dge slong zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar lus bsgom pa dang sems bsgom pa dang tshul khrims bsgom pa ni dge slong zhes bya'o //
translated: One who meditates on the body, meditates on the mind and meditates on ethics is called a true monk.

original: ji ltar lus bsgom pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar lus bsgom pa yin zhe na /
translated: How does one meditate on the body?

original: lus 'dod chags dang bral ba sred pa dang bral ba dang / bsgom pa dang bral ba zhes rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: lus 'dod chags dang bral ba sred pa dang bral ba dang / bsgom pa dang bral ba zhes rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: One meditates on the body by being free from attachment, free from craving and free from meditation.

original: kha cig na re lus kyi gnyen po ni bsam gtan bzhi pa las 'dod chags dang bral bar byed pa'i gang yin pa'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re lus kyi gnyen po ni bsam gtan bzhi pa las 'dod chags dang bral bar byed pa'i gang yin pa'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say: The antidote to the body is that which causes freedom from attachment to the fourth absorption.

original: gzhan dag na re gzugs kyi 'dod chags zad par byed pa'i bar chad med pa'i lam yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re gzugs kyi 'dod chags zad par byed pa'i bar chad med pa'i lam yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: It is the uninterrupted path that exhausts attachment to the form realm.üîΩObtaining distance is obtaining distance,

original: thag bsring ba'i thob pa zhes bya ba la thag bsring ba nyid thob pa yin pas na thag bsring ba'i thob pa'o //
analyzed: thag bsring ba'i thob pa zhes bya ba la thag bsring ba nyid thob pa yin pas na thag bsring ba'i thob pa'o //
translated: that is, it is the obtainment of distance.

original: de ni nyon mongs pa'i thob pa gcod pa ste /üîΩthag bsring bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩma 'ongs pa rnams kyi ni gcig go zhes bya ba ni rnyed pa'i 'thob pa'o //
analyzed: de ni nyon mongs pa'i thob pa gcod pa ste / thag bsring bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go // ma 'ongs pa rnams kyi ni gcig go zhes bya ba ni rnyed pa'i 'thob pa'o //
translated: It is the severing of the obtainment of affliction.üîΩIt is the obtainment of distance.üîΩObtaining future states is the obtainment of future states.

original: da ltar byung ba rnams kyi ni gnyi ga'o zhes bya ba ni de dang bsten pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba rnams kyi ni gnyi ga'o zhes bya ba ni de dang bsten pa thob pa'o //
translated: Obtaining present states is both.

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Thus, it is said:

original: gang gi phyir rnyed pa dang bsten pa thob pa ni bye brag med par bshad pa'i phyir dge ba 'dus byas zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa rnams kyi yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnyed pa dang bsten pa thob pa ni bye brag med par bshad pa'i phyir dge ba 'dus byas zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa rnams kyi yin no //
translated: Because obtainment of acquisition and endowment is explained without differentiation, it is obtainment of all conditioned virtuous states and uncontaminated states.üîΩBecause obtainment of antidotes and separation is explained without differentiation, it is obtainment of all contaminated states, both afflicted and unafflicted.

original: gnyen po dang thag bsring ba 'thob pa dag ni bye brag med par bshad pa'i phyir zag pa dang bcas pa nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa rnams kyi yin pa de'i phyir de ltar na dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa rnams kyi 'thob pa bzhi yin te /
analyzed: gnyen po dang thag bsring ba 'thob pa dag ni bye brag med par bshad pa'i phyir zag pa dang bcas pa nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa rnams kyi yin pa de'i phyir de ltar na dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa rnams kyi 'thob pa bzhi yin te /
translated: Therefore obtainment of virtuous contaminated states is fourfold.

original: dge ba 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir dang po gnyis yin la /
analyzed: dge ba 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir dang po gnyis yin la /
translated: Because virtuous states are conditioned, they have the first two types of obtainment.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i phyir phyi ma gnyis yin no //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i phyir phyi ma gnyis yin no //
translated: Because they are contaminated, they have the latter two types of obtainment.

original: de'i phyir de ltar na de dag gi ni thob pa bzhi yin no //üîΩzag pa med pa rnams kyi ni gnyis yin te snga ma gnyis so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar na de dag gi ni thob pa bzhi yin no // zag pa med pa rnams kyi ni gnyis yin te snga ma gnyis so //
translated: Therefore obtainment of these states is fourfold.üîΩObtainment of uncontaminated states is twofold: the former two.

original: nyon mongs pa can @247a * //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can @247a * //
translated: Obtainment of afflicted states is twofold: the latter two.

original: dang lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyi ni gnyis te phyi ma gnyis so //
analyzed: dang lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyi ni gnyis te phyi ma gnyis so //
translated: The neutral ones have two, the latter two.üîΩObtaining a vow and obtaining the destruction of a vow.

original: sdom pa'i 'thob pa dang rnam par 'jig pa'i 'thob pa'o zhes bya ba la sdom pa nyid de thob pa yin pas na sdom pa'i thob pa ste /
analyzed: sdom pa'i 'thob pa dang rnam par 'jig pa'i 'thob pa'o zhes bya ba la sdom pa nyid de thob pa yin pas na sdom pa'i thob pa ste /
translated: Obtaining a vow is the obtainment of a vow itself.

original: de ni dbang po'i sdom pa dran pa dang shes bzhin gyi bdag nyid de /
analyzed: de ni dbang po'i sdom pa dran pa dang shes bzhin gyi bdag nyid de /
translated: That is the obtainment of the restraint of the faculties, which has the nature of mindfulness and introspection.

original: dbang po drug po 'di dag shin tu dul ba dang / shin tu sbas pa dang / shin tu bsrungs pa dang / shin tu bsdams pa dang / shin tu bsgoms pa ni phyi ma la rnams par smin pa bde bar 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dbang po drug po 'di dag shin tu dul ba dang / shin tu sbas pa dang / shin tu bsrungs pa dang / shin tu bsdams pa dang / shin tu bsgoms pa ni phyi ma la rnams par smin pa bde bar 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: These six faculties are very disciplined, very guarded, very protected, very restrained, and very cultivated, and they will become the ripening of happiness in the future.

original: rnam par 'jig pa nyid 'thob pa yin pas na rnam par 'jig pa'i 'thob pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'jig pa nyid 'thob pa yin pas na rnam par 'jig pa'i 'thob pa'o //
translated: Obtaining the destruction of a vow is the obtainment of the destruction of a vow.

original: de ni lus la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa thag bsring ba ste /
analyzed: de ni lus la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa thag bsring ba ste /
translated: That is the removal of affliction that focuses on the body.

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: It is said:

original: lus 'di la skra dang / spu dang / so dang / sen mo dang / rdul dang / dri ma dang / pags pa dang / sha dang rus pa dang / rgyus pa dang / rtsa dang / mkhal ma dang / mchin pa dang / glo ba dang /
analyzed: lus 'di la skra dang / spu dang / so dang / sen mo dang / rdul dang / dri ma dang / pags pa dang / sha dang rus pa dang / rgyus pa dang / rtsa dang / mkhal ma dang / mchin pa dang / glo ba dang /
translated: This body has hair, body hair, nails, teeth, skin, flesh, sinews, bones, bone marrow, kidney, heart, liver, lungs,üîΩintestines, mesentery, stomach, spleen, feces, tears, sweat, mucus, synovial fluid, urine,

original: rgyu ma dang / gnye ma dang / pho ba dang / long ka dang lgong pa dang / bshang ba dang / mchi ma dang ; rdul dang / mchil ma dang / sna bas dang / rkang dang / chu ser dang / gzhungs pa dang /üîΩtshil dang / bad kan dang / rnag dang / khrag dang / klad pa dang / klad rgyas dang / gcin yod do zhes 'byung ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: rgyu ma dang / gnye ma dang / pho ba dang / long ka dang lgong pa dang / bshang ba dang / mchi ma dang ; rdul dang / mchil ma dang / sna bas dang / rkang dang / chu ser dang / gzhungs pa dang / tshil dang / bad kan dang / rnag dang / khrag dang / klad pa dang / klad rgyas dang / gcin yod do zhes 'byung ba lta bu'o //
translated: fat, phlegm, pus, blood, brain, meninges, and bile.

original: de dag ni grangs bzhin du gnyen po dang thag bsring ba'i thob pa'i nang du 'dus so //
analyzed: de dag ni grangs bzhin du gnyen po dang thag bsring ba'i thob pa'i nang du 'dus so //
translated: They are respectively included in the obtainment of antidotes and the obtainment of distance.

original: de la dbang po sdom pa'i thob pa ni dran pa dang shes bzhin gyi rang bzhin yin pas gnyen po'i thob pa grub na /
analyzed: de la dbang po sdom pa'i thob pa ni dran pa dang shes bzhin gyi rang bzhin yin pas gnyen po'i thob pa grub na /
translated: The obtainment of restraining the faculties is by nature mindfulness and introspection. Therefore, if the obtainment of antidotes is established,

original: rnam par 'jig pa'i phyir thob pa ni ji ltar thag bsring ba'i thob par grub ce na /
analyzed: rnam par 'jig pa'i phyir thob pa ni ji ltar thag bsring ba'i thob par grub ce na /
translated: How can the obtainment of the knowledge of elimination be distant obtainment?
