original: 'di ltar de ni lus la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa thag bsring ba'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni lus la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa thag bsring ba'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: Because it is the characteristic of distancing the affliction that focuses on the body.

original: de ni gnyen po'i thob pa yin par yang mi 'gal te /
analyzed: de ni gnyen po'i thob pa yin par yang mi 'gal te /
translated: It is not contradictory that it is the obtainment of the antidote,

original: shes rab kyis lus rnam par 'jig par byed pas so //
analyzed: shes rab kyis lus rnam par 'jig par byed pas so //
translated: because wisdom eliminates the body.

original: gang zag thams cad kyis zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang yang dag bar rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis zad pa shes pa'i skad cig la yon tan thob pa bshad de /üîΩzad pa shes pa zag bcas kyang //
analyzed: gang zag thams cad kyis zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang yang dag bar rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis zad pa shes pa'i skad cig la yon tan thob pa bshad de / zad pa shes pa zag bcas kyang //
translated: All persons refers to sravakas, pratyekabuddhas, and completely enlightened buddhas, because it is said that the obtainment of qualities occurs in the moment of the knowledge of elimination.

original: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //üîΩstobs bcu zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro // stobs bcu zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The knowledge of elimination is contaminated.

original: stobs la sogs pa thugs rje chen po la thug ba de dag ni ma 'dres ba'i chos bco brgyad ces brjod do //
analyzed: stobs la sogs pa thugs rje chen po la thug ba de dag ni ma 'dres ba'i chos bco brgyad ces brjod do //
translated: The ten powers and so on up to great compassion are called the eighteen unmixed qualities.

original: ma 'dres pa zhes bya ba la 'dres pa ni 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'dres pa zhes bya ba la 'dres pa ni 'dus pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúUnmixed‚Äù means uncombined.

original: ma 'dres pa ni 'dres pa med pa ste /
analyzed: ma 'dres pa ni 'dres pa med pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúUnmixed‚Äù means not mixed.

original: zla ba med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zla ba med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is ‚Äúwithout a companion.‚Äù

original: 'di dag la ma 'dres @247b pa'i gang zag gis yin pas na ma 'dres pa ste /
analyzed: 'di dag la ma 'dres @247b pa'i gang zag gis yin pas na ma 'dres pa ste /
translated: Since they are the unmixed state of the person, they are called ‚Äúunmixed.‚Äù

original: de nyid kyi phyir thun mong ma yin pa ni ma 'dres pa'o zhes bshad par bya ste gang dag de kho na'i yin gyi gzhan gyi ma yin pa'o //üîΩgnas dang gnas min shes pa bcu //üîΩzhes bya ba la gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig ce na dge slong dag gnas ni gnas su yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir thun mong ma yin pa ni ma 'dres pa'o zhes bshad par bya ste gang dag de kho na'i yin gyi gzhan gyi ma yin pa'o // gnas dang gnas min shes pa bcu // zhes bya ba la gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig ce na dge slong dag gnas ni gnas su yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: For that very reason, they are called ‚Äúuncommon,‚Äù because they are not shared with others.üîΩThe power of knowledge of what is right and wrongüîΩWhat is the power of knowledge of what is right and wrong?

original: gnas ma yin pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes 'di ni bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis rgyas par bshad de //
analyzed: gnas ma yin pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes 'di ni bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis rgyas par bshad de //
translated: The Blessed One has explained this extensively: ‚ÄúMonks, I know what is right as right, and what is wrong as wrong.‚Äù

original: chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin dang nus pa dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu nges pa de la 'di ni gnon mi za bar rgyu 'di las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin dang nus pa dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu nges pa de la 'di ni gnon mi za bar rgyu 'di las 'byung ngo //
translated: The nature, power, cause and effect of all things are ascertained.

original: 'di ni mi 'byung ngo snyam pa'i mkhyen pa thogs pa med pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mi 'byung ngo snyam pa'i mkhyen pa thogs pa med pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the unobstructed knowledge that this or that result will certainly arise from this or that cause, and that this or that result will not arise from this or that cause.

original: gnas zhes bya ba ni srid pa'o //
analyzed: gnas zhes bya ba ni srid pa'o //
translated: The term place means possibility.

original: gnas ma yin pa ni mi srid pa'o //
analyzed: gnas ma yin pa ni mi srid pa'o //
translated: The term non-place means impossibility.

original: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa dag las gang yang rung ba zhig bstan pas cig shos kyang bstan par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa dag las gang yang rung ba zhig bstan pas cig shos kyang bstan par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: Isn't it so that by teaching one of them, the other is also taught?

original: ci'i phyir gnyi ga bstan zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gnyi ga bstan zhe na /
translated: Why are both taught?

original: 'di ni de ltar yin mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ni de ltar yin mod kyi /
translated: This is indeed so, but

original: gnas mkhyen pas ni rgyu med par smra ba bkag par ston la /
analyzed: gnas mkhyen pas ni rgyu med par smra ba bkag par ston la /
translated: the knowledge of place refutes the doctrine of causelessness,

original: gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pas ni mi mthun pa'i rgyur smra ba dgag par ston pas gnyi gnye bar bstan to //
analyzed: gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pas ni mi mthun pa'i rgyur smra ba dgag par ston pas gnyi gnye bar bstan to //
translated: and the knowledge of non-place refutes the doctrine of discordant causes. Thus both are taught.

original: gnas dang gnas min shes pa bcu //
analyzed: gnas dang gnas min shes pa bcu //
translated: The knowledge of place and non-place is ten knowledges.

original: zhes bya bya ba la ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bya bya ba la ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is this?

original: 'di ltar gnas dang gnas ma yin pas ni chos thams cad la khyab pa'i phyir 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar gnas dang gnas ma yin pas ni chos thams cad la khyab pa'i phyir 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas so //
translated: Thus, the knowledge of the possible and impossible pervades all dharmas, both conditioned and unconditioned.

original: de la 'dus byas ni rnam pa brgyad du dbye bar bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'dus byas ni rnam pa brgyad du dbye bar bya ste /
translated: Among them, the conditioned is divided into eight types:

original: khams gsum dang / zag pa med pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: khams gsum dang / zag pa med pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i dbye bas so //
translated: the three realms and the uncontaminated, divided into the concomitant and nonconcomitant.

original: 'dus ma byas ni rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: The unconditioned is twofold:

original: dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i dbye bas so //
translated: virtuous and neutral.

original: de la kun rdzob shes pa'i dmigs pa ni rnam pa bcu char yin no //
analyzed: de la kun rdzob shes pa'i dmigs pa ni rnam pa bcu char yin no //
translated: The object of conventional knowledge is all ten types.

original: chos shes pa'i ni lnga ste /
analyzed: chos shes pa'i ni lnga ste /
translated: The object of Dharma knowledge is five types:

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa dang zag pa med pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / ldan pa ma yin pa dang / 'dus ma byas dge ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa dang zag pa med pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / ldan pa ma yin pa dang / 'dus ma byas dge ba'o //
translated: those concomitant with the uncontaminated in the desire realm, the nonconcomitant, and the virtuous unconditioned.üîΩSimilarly, the objects of subsequent knowledge and so on are also five types each, as appropriate.

original: de bzhin du rjes su shes pa la sogs pa rnams kyi yul yang ci rigs par de ltar byas na gnas dang gnas ma yin pa shes pa ni shes pa bcu yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du rjes su shes pa la sogs pa rnams kyi yul yang ci rigs par de ltar byas na gnas dang gnas ma yin pa shes pa ni shes pa bcu yin no //
translated: The knowledge of the possible and impossible is ten knowledges.

original: las 'bras la brgyad ces bya ba la las dang rnam par smin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las rnams kyi rnam par smin @248a * //
analyzed: las 'bras la brgyad ces bya ba la las dang rnam par smin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las rnams kyi rnam par smin @248a * //
translated: The power of knowledge of actions and their ripeningüîΩThe power of knowledge of actions and their ripening is the knowledge of the ripening of virtuous and nonvirtuous actions.üîΩ

original: pa dang / nyung ba dang mang ba nyid dang nges pa dang ma nges pa la sogs pa'i don dag la thogs pa med pa'i mkhyen pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: pa dang / nyung ba dang mang ba nyid dang nges pa dang ma nges pa la sogs pa'i don dag la thogs pa med pa'i mkhyen pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The power of knowledge of actions and their evolutionary effects is the unobstructed knowledge of the effects of good and bad actions, and of the smallness, bigness, certainty, and uncertainty, etc.üîΩof their effects.

original: las dang rnam par smin pa ni khams gsum pa'i chos mtshungs par ldan pa dang / ldan pa ma yin pa yin la /
analyzed: las dang rnam par smin pa ni khams gsum pa'i chos mtshungs par ldan pa dang / ldan pa ma yin pa yin la /
translated: Actions and their effects are dharmas of the three realms, either conjoined or not conjoined to the mind.

original: de dag kyang sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gis bsdus pa yin pas de'i phyir 'gog pa dang lam shes pa dag ma gtogs so zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de dag kyang sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gis bsdus pa yin pas de'i phyir 'gog pa dang lam shes pa dag ma gtogs so zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: And since they are included in the truths of suffering and origination, the knowledge of cessation and path are excluded.

original: de la kun rdzob shes pa ni khams gsum pa'i las dang rnam par smin pa'i yul can no //
analyzed: de la kun rdzob shes pa ni khams gsum pa'i las dang rnam par smin pa'i yul can no //
translated: Among these, conventional knowledge has as its object actions and their effects in the three realms.

original: chos shes pa ni 'dod par gtogs pa'i yul can no //
analyzed: chos shes pa ni 'dod par gtogs pa'i yul can no //
translated: Knowledge of the truth of dharmas has as its object only those in the realm of desire.

original: rjes su shes pa ni gzugs dang gzugs med par gtogs pa'i yul can no //
analyzed: rjes su shes pa ni gzugs dang gzugs med par gtogs pa'i yul can no //
translated: Subsequent knowledge has as its object the realm of desire and the realms of form and formlessness.üîΩThe knowledges of suffering, origin, elimination, and the path have as their object the wholesome and unwholesome minds and mental factors of the realm of desire and the realms of form and formlessness, as is appropriate.üîΩThe bases of mastery are the meditative development of the concentrations, etc.üîΩThe bases of mastery are the meditative development of the concentrations, etc.üîΩThe bases of mastery are the meditative development of the concentrations, etc.

original: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang zad pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa dag kyang ci rigs par 'dod pa dang / gzugs su gtogs pa yang dge ba dang mi dge ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i yul can no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang zad pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa dag kyang ci rigs par 'dod pa dang / gzugs su gtogs pa yang dge ba dang mi dge ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i yul can no //
translated: The bases of mastery are the meditative development of the concentrations, etc.

original: bsam gtan sogs /
analyzed: bsam gtan sogs /
translated: The bases of mastery are the meditative development of the concentrations, etc.üîΩThe bases of mastery are the meditative development of the concentrations, etc.

original: dbang po mos dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gang dag bsam gtan dang por yod pa de dag ni bsam gtan sogs te /üîΩde dag ni rnam par thar ba dang / ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa dag go //üîΩbsam gtan la sogs pa dang / dbang po rnams dang / mos pa rnams ni bsam gtan sogs /
analyzed: dbang po mos dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gang dag bsam gtan dang por yod pa de dag ni bsam gtan sogs te / de dag ni rnam par thar ba dang / ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa dag go // bsam gtan la sogs pa dang / dbang po rnams dang / mos pa rnams ni bsam gtan sogs /
translated: The bases of mastery are the meditative development of the concentrations, etc.üîΩThe bases of mastery are the meditative development of the concentrations, etc.üîΩThe bases of mastery are the meditative development of the concentrations, etc.üîΩThe bases of mastery are the meditative development of the concentrations, etc.

original: dbang po mos pa dang ste de dag la'o //üîΩde la bsam gtan ni bzhi'o //
analyzed: dbang po mos pa dang ste de dag la'o // de la bsam gtan ni bzhi'o //
translated: The bases of mastery are the meditative development of the concentrations, etc.üîΩThe bases of mastery are the meditative development of the concentrations, etc.üîΩThe bases of mastery are the meditative development of the concentrations, etc.üîΩThe bases of mastery are the meditative development of the concentrations, etc.üîΩThe bases of mastery are the meditative development of the concentrations, etc.üîΩThe bases of mastery are the meditative development of the concentrations, etc.üîΩThe bases of mastery are the meditative development of the concentrations, etc.üîΩThe bases of mastery are the meditative development of the concentrations, etc.üîΩThe bases of mastery are the meditative development of the concentrations, etc.üîΩThe bases of mastery are the meditative development of the concentrations, etc.üîΩThe bases of mastery are the meditative development of the concentrations, etc.üîΩThe bases of mastery are the meditative development of the concentrations, etc.üîΩThe bases of mastery are the meditative development of the concentrations, etc.üîΩThe bases of mastery are the meditative development of the concentrations, etc.üîΩThe bases of mastery are the meditative development of the concentrations, etc.üîΩThe bases of mastery are the meditative development of the concentrations, etc.üîΩThe bases of mastery are the meditative development of the concentrations, etc.üîΩThe bases of mastery are the meditative development of the concentrations, etc.üîΩThe bases of mastery are the meditative development of the concentrations, etc.

original: rnam par thar pa ni brgyad do //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa ni brgyad do //
translated: The bases of mastery are the meditative development of the

original: ting nge 'dzin ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: Concentration is emptiness and so on.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa ni 'gog pa dang 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / gzugs med pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa ni 'gog pa dang 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / gzugs med pa bzhi ste /
translated: Absorption is the four formless states and the two meditative attainments of cessation and nonperception.

original: bsam gtan la sogs pa de dag gi rang bzhin dang / thob pa dang thabs dang phan 'dogs pa dang / ro myang ba dang dag pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / nyams pa dang gnas pa dang / khyad par dang nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa la sogs pa'i don dag la mkhyen pa thogs pa med pa gang yin pa de ni bsam gtan dang /
analyzed: bsam gtan la sogs pa de dag gi rang bzhin dang / thob pa dang thabs dang phan 'dogs pa dang / ro myang ba dang dag pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / nyams pa dang gnas pa dang / khyad par dang nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa la sogs pa'i don dag la mkhyen pa thogs pa med pa gang yin pa de ni bsam gtan dang /
translated: The unobstructed knowledge of the nature of those such as the absorptions, their attainment, their means, their benefit, their enjoyment, their purity, their uncontaminated nature, their degeneration, their maintenance, their distinction, their conformity with the factors of definite discrimination and so on is the power of knowledge of the absorptions,

original: ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa mkhyen pa'i stobs te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa mkhyen pa'i stobs te /
translated: concentrations and attainments.

original: 'di ni 'gog pa shes pa ma gtogs pa shes pa dgu yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni 'gog pa shes pa ma gtogs pa shes pa dgu yin no //
translated: This power is nine knowledges, excluding the knowledge of cessation.

original: ji ltar zhe na bsam gtan la sogs pa de dag ni mdor bsdu na 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin yin pa de dag kyang mtshungs par ldan pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i bye brag gis re re zhing rnam @248b
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na bsam gtan la sogs pa de dag ni mdor bsdu na 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin yin pa de dag kyang mtshungs par ldan pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i bye brag gis re re zhing rnam @248b
translated: How are they similar? In brief, they are similar because they are the nature of mundane and transcendent paths. They are also similar because each is classified as either concomitant or nonconcomitant.üîΩ

original: pa gnyis su dbye'o //
analyzed: pa gnyis su dbye'o //
translated: How so? In brief, these meditative states, etc., are of the nature of mundane and supramundane paths. Each is twofold, divided according to whether it is associated or not associated with the path.

original: de la kun rdzob shes pa ni lam thams cad kyi yul can no //
analyzed: de la kun rdzob shes pa ni lam thams cad kyi yul can no //
translated: Conventional knowledge is the subject of all paths.

original: chos shes pa ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi gnyen po la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: chos shes pa ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi gnyen po la dmigs pa'o //
translated: Knowledge of the Dharma has as its object the antidote to the realm of desire.

original: rjes su shes pa ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i gnyen po la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su shes pa ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i gnyen po la dmigs pa'o //
translated: Subsequent knowledge has as its object the antidote to the realms of form and the formless.

original: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung shes pa dag ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i lam la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung shes pa dag ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i lam la dmigs pa'o //
translated: Knowledge of suffering and origination have as their object the contaminated path.

original: lam shes pa ni zag pa med pa la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: lam shes pa ni zag pa med pa la dmigs pa'o //
translated: Knowledge of the path has as its object the uncontaminated path.

original: zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dag ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dag ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa la dmigs pa'o //
translated: Knowledge of elimination and nonproduction have as their object the contaminated and uncontaminated path.

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni mtshungs par ldan pa'i lam la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni mtshungs par ldan pa'i lam la dmigs pa'o //
translated: Knowledge of others' minds focuses on the path concomitant with it.

original: dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya ba la /
translated: The power of knowledge of superior and nonsuperior facultiesüîΩThe power of knowledge of superior and nonsuperior faculties is the unobstructed knowledge that knows the difference between superior and nonsuperior faculties.

original: dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams gang mchog ces bya ba ni gtso bo yin la /
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams gang mchog ces bya ba ni gtso bo yin la /
translated: Superior faculties are the dominant faculties of faith and so on.

original: mchog ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni gtso bo ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: mchog ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni gtso bo ma yin pa ste /
translated: Nonsuperior faculties are not dominant.

original: chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'i bye brag dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'i bye brag la thogs pa med pa'i ye shes gang yin pa de ni dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs so //
analyzed: chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'i bye brag dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'i bye brag la thogs pa med pa'i ye shes gang yin pa de ni dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs so //
translated: The power of knowledge of superior and nonsuperior faculties is the unobstructed knowledge that knows the difference between weak, medium and strong faculties and the difference between those that are contaminated and uncontaminated.

original: de yang dbang po rnams zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa yin pa'i phyir shes pa dgu yin no zhes rgyas par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de yang dbang po rnams zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa yin pa'i phyir shes pa dgu yin no zhes rgyas par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This power is nine knowledges, since it is the knowledge of contaminated and uncontaminated faculties.üîΩThe power of knowledge of various dhƒÅtus

original: 'dir 'dod par gtogs pa'i dbang po rnams kyang yod pas chos shes pa sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung la dmigs pa yang yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro //
analyzed: 'dir 'dod par gtogs pa'i dbang po rnams kyang yod pas chos shes pa sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung la dmigs pa yang yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro //
translated: The distinction is that since the faculties belonging to the desire realm also exist here, the knowledge of the factors also focuses on the truths of suffering and origin.

original: mdor bsdu na sems can rnams kyi legs pa 'thob pa'i nus pa rnam pa gsum la thogs pa med pas mkhyen pa ni dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs so //
analyzed: mdor bsdu na sems can rnams kyi legs pa 'thob pa'i nus pa rnam pa gsum la thogs pa med pas mkhyen pa ni dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs so //
translated: In brief, the power of knowledge of superior and nonsuperior faculties is the unobstructed knowledge of the three types of potential for obtaining the excellence of sentient beings.üîΩThe power of knowledge of various higher interests

original: mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya ba ni mos pa sna tshogs pa ni dman pa dang gya nom pa dag la 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya ba ni mos pa sna tshogs pa ni dman pa dang gya nom pa dag la 'dod pa ste /
translated: The power of knowledge of various higher interests is the unobstructed knowledge of the various higher interests of sentient beings.üîΩHigher interest is the wish for inferior, middling, or superior objects.

original: 'dod pa dang mos pa zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs so //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang mos pa zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs so //
translated: Interest and higher interest are synonyms.

original: sems can rnams kyi 'dod pa sna tshogs pa thogs pa med par mkhyen pa ni mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs so //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi 'dod pa sna tshogs pa thogs pa med par mkhyen pa ni mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs so //
translated: The power of knowledge of various higher interests is the unobstructed knowledge of the various higher interests of sentient beings.

original: mos pa de yang zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa yin pas snga ma bzhin du shes pa dgu yin no //
analyzed: mos pa de yang zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa yin pas snga ma bzhin du shes pa dgu yin no //
translated: Since that interest is either contaminated or uncontaminated, it is the nine knowledges as before.

original: khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya ba la /
translated: The power of knowledge of the various dhƒÅtus.

original: de la khams ni sems can rnams kyi sngon goms pa'i bag chags so //
analyzed: de la khams ni sems can rnams kyi sngon goms pa'i bag chags so //
translated: Here, dhƒÅtu refers to the latent tendencies of beings‚Äô previous practice.

original: de ni sems dang sems las byung ba khyad par can de dag yin no //
analyzed: de ni sems dang sems las byung ba khyad par can de dag yin no //
translated: It is the special mental factors and mental episodes.

original: rang bzhin yang khams yin te /üîΩrang bzhin yongs su shes na chos rnams kyi @249a * //
analyzed: rang bzhin yang khams yin te / rang bzhin yongs su shes na chos rnams kyi @249a * //
translated: It is also the nature of the dhƒÅtus.üîΩWhen the nature is fully known,

original: ngo bo'i khyad par yongs su shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo'i khyad par yongs su shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the specific natures of phenomena are fully known.

original: de dag la zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i dbye ba dang / khams kyi dbye ba byas te /
analyzed: de dag la zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i dbye ba dang / khams kyi dbye ba byas te /
translated: The dhƒÅtus are divided into those that are contaminated and those that are uncontaminated, and they are divided into the eighteen dhƒÅtus.

original: de dag la dmigs pa'i shes pa dgu sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dag la dmigs pa'i shes pa dgu sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The knowledge that focuses on them is applied to the nine.

original: mdor bsdu na sems can rnams kyi sngon goms pas yang dag par 'grub ba'i bsam pa dang / bag la nyal dang / chos rnams kyi rang bzhin sna tshogs pa mkhyen pa'i mkhyen pa ni khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs so //
analyzed: mdor bsdu na sems can rnams kyi sngon goms pas yang dag par 'grub ba'i bsam pa dang / bag la nyal dang / chos rnams kyi rang bzhin sna tshogs pa mkhyen pa'i mkhyen pa ni khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs so //
translated: In brief, the power of knowledge of the various dhƒÅtus is the knowledge that knows the various dhƒÅtus: the various aspirations of beings that are accomplished through their previous practice, their latent tendencies, and the various natures of phenomena.

original: lam dag la zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: lam dag la zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: The power of knowledge of the paths and their respective destinations.

original: de la lam ni mang ste /
analyzed: de la lam ni mang ste /
translated: There are many paths,

original: dmyal bar 'gro ba nas lhar 'gro ba dang / 'gog par 'gro ba'i bar ro //
analyzed: dmyal bar 'gro ba nas lhar 'gro ba dang / 'gog par 'gro ba'i bar ro //
translated: from the path that leads to hell to the path that leads to cessation.

original: 'dis dmyal ba la sogs pa sgrub bas na /
analyzed: 'dis dmyal ba la sogs pa sgrub bas na /
translated: Since this path establishes hell, etc.,

original: dmyal bar 'gro ba'i lam ste rgyu'o //
analyzed: dmyal bar 'gro ba'i lam ste rgyu'o //
translated: it is the path that leads to hell, i.e., the cause of hell.

original: 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam ste /
analyzed: 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam ste /
translated: It is the path that leads to cessation,

original: bral ba thob par bya ba'i phyir 'dis 'gog pa sgrub par byed pas so //
analyzed: bral ba thob par bya ba'i phyir 'dis 'gog pa sgrub par byed pas so //
translated: because it establishes cessation through the attainment of separation.

original: lam ni mdor bsdu na 'jig tshogs 'byung bar 'gro ba dang / 'jig tshogs 'gog par 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: lam ni mdor bsdu na 'jig tshogs 'byung bar 'gro ba dang / 'jig tshogs 'gog par 'gro ba'o //
translated: In brief, the path is twofold: that which leads to the origination of the perishing aggregates and that which leads to the cessation of the perishing aggregates.

original: de la 'jig tshogs ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'o //
analyzed: de la 'jig tshogs ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'o //
translated: Here, the perishing aggregates are the five aggregates that are appropriated.

original: 'byung ba ni 'dir de skye ba la mngon par 'dod do //
analyzed: 'byung ba ni 'dir de skye ba la mngon par 'dod do //
translated: Origination is the desire for the arising of those.

original: 'jig tshogs 'gog pa ni bral ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs 'gog pa ni bral ba'o //
translated: The cessation of the perishing aggregates is separation.

original: 'di la der 'gro ba'i ngang tshul yod pas na 'di ni 'jig tshogs 'gog par 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la der 'gro ba'i ngang tshul yod pas na 'di ni 'jig tshogs 'gog par 'gro ba'o //
translated: Since it has the nature of leading to that, it is the path that leads to the cessation of the perishing aggregates.üîΩIt is the path that leads everywhere,

original: thams cad du 'gro ba yang de yin la lam yang yin pas na thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam ste /
analyzed: thams cad du 'gro ba yang de yin la lam yang yin pas na thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam ste /
translated: because it is the path that leads to all.

original: de la mkhyen ba ni thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs so //
analyzed: de la mkhyen ba ni thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs so //
translated: The knowledge of this is the power of knowledge of all paths and their respective destinations.

original: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: This is taught as follows:

original: skye ba thams cad sgrub par byed pa dang / skye ba zad par byed pa'i chos rnams la thogs pa med pa'i mkhyen pa ni thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs yin no //
analyzed: skye ba thams cad sgrub par byed pa dang / skye ba zad par byed pa'i chos rnams la thogs pa med pa'i mkhyen pa ni thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs yin no //
translated: The unobstructed knowledge of all dharmas that accomplish all births and cause the exhaustion of birth is the power of knowledge of all paths and their respective destinations.

original: de la gcig gi tshig ni lam gyi rigs la ltos pa ste /
analyzed: de la gcig gi tshig ni lam gyi rigs la ltos pa ste /
translated: Here, the word ‚Äúone‚Äù refers to the type of path.

original: dmyal ba dang dud 'gro dang yi dags dang / mi dang lha dang thar par 'gro ba zhes bya ba lam dag ni mang ngo //
analyzed: dmyal ba dang dud 'gro dang yi dags dang / mi dang lha dang thar par 'gro ba zhes bya ba lam dag ni mang ngo //
translated: There are many paths, such as the paths called ‚Äúgoing to hell,‚Äù ‚Äúgoing to the animal realm,‚Äù ‚Äúgoing to the ghost realm,‚Äù ‚Äúgoing to the human realm,‚Äù ‚Äúgoing to the god realm,‚Äù and ‚Äúgoing to liberation.‚ÄùüîΩIf the path is taken as possessing a result,

original: gal te lam 'bras bu dang bcas par gzung na ni zhes bya ba la lam gyi 'bras bu ni 'gog pa ste /
analyzed: gal te lam 'bras bu dang bcas par gzung na ni zhes bya ba la lam gyi 'bras bu ni 'gog pa ste /
translated: the result of the path is cessation,

original: bral ba'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bral ba'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the result of separation.

original: gnyis ni kun rdzob shes pa yin //
analyzed: gnyis ni kun rdzob shes pa yin //
translated: Two are conventional knowledge.

original: zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin no //
translated: This is the nature.

original: de dag gi mtshan nyid ni bdag dang gzhan dag gi skye ba 'das pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa dran pa la thogs pa med pa'i mkhyen pa ni sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i stobs so //
analyzed: de dag gi mtshan nyid ni bdag dang gzhan dag gi skye ba 'das pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa dran pa la thogs pa med pa'i mkhyen pa ni sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i stobs so //
translated: The power of knowledge of recollecting former abodes or existences is the unobstructed knowledge of remembering the succession of one's own and others' lives.üîΩThe power of knowledge of death and rebirth is the unobstructed knowledge of sentient beings' future connection to existence.

original: sems can rnams kyi ma 'ongs pa'i srid par nying mtshams sbyor ba la thogs @249b pa med pa'i mkhyen pa ni shi 'pho ba dang skye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs so //üîΩzad pa drug gam bcu yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi ma 'ongs pa'i srid par nying mtshams sbyor ba la thogs @249b pa med pa'i mkhyen pa ni shi 'pho ba dang skye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs so // zad pa drug gam bcu yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: The power of knowledge of the extinction of contaminants is the knowledge of the extinction of contaminants.

original: gal te zag pa zad pa'i mkhyen pa'i stobs zag pa zad pa'i yul can nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te zag pa zad pa'i mkhyen pa'i stobs zag pa zad pa'i yul can nyid yin na /
translated: If the power of knowledge of the extinction of contaminants is the knowledge of the extinction of contaminants alone,

original: de ltar na shes pa drug gi bdag nyid de /
analyzed: de ltar na shes pa drug gi bdag nyid de /
translated: then it is the nature of six knowledges,

original: gzhan gyi sems dang sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang lam shes pa dag ma gtogs so //üîΩ'on te zag pa zad pa /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems dang sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang lam shes pa dag ma gtogs so // 'on te zag pa zad pa /
translated: excluding the knowledge of others' minds, the knowledge of suffering, the knowledge of origin and the knowledge of the path.üîΩBut if the power of knowledge of the extinction of contaminants is the knowledge of the extinction of contaminants in the mindstream of another,

original: zag pa zad pa'i rgyud la yod pa thabs dang bcas pa gzung na ni de lta na shes pa bcu ste /
analyzed: zag pa zad pa'i rgyud la yod pa thabs dang bcas pa gzung na ni de lta na shes pa bcu ste /
translated: then it is the nature of ten knowledges,

original: de skad du yang zag pa zad pa dang // de'i thabs la thogs pa med pa'i mkhyen pa ni zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs so zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de skad du yang zag pa zad pa dang // de'i thabs la thogs pa med pa'i mkhyen pa ni zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs so zhes bshad do //
translated: The power of knowledge of the exhaustion of contaminants is the unobstructed knowledge of the contaminants and the means of exhausting them.

original: sngon gnas 'chi 'pho skye ba'i stobs //
analyzed: sngon gnas 'chi 'pho skye ba'i stobs //
translated: The power of knowledge of former existences and of death and rebirth.

original: bsam gtan dag na zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dag kho na mngon par shes pa'i rten ting nge 'dzin yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan dag na zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dag kho na mngon par shes pa'i rten ting nge 'dzin yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The bases of the higher perceptions are the absorptions, because the concentrations of the absorptions exist in the absorptions.

original: lhag ma ni /
analyzed: lhag ma ni /
translated: The remaining powers

original: sa rnams kun na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sa rnams kun na zhes bya ba la /
translated: exist on all levels.

original: 'dod pa'i khams na stobs lhag ma ji ltar yod ce na /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams na stobs lhag ma ji ltar yod ce na /
translated: How do the remaining powers exist in the desire realm?

original: de'i phyogs gcig du gyur pa kun rdzob shes pa yod do //
analyzed: de'i phyogs gcig du gyur pa kun rdzob shes pa yod do //
translated: The power of knowledge of the absorptions, liberations, and so on exists in the desire realm because it is conventional knowledge that is a part of the desire realm.

original: blo gsal ba'i phyir 'dzam bu'i gling pa rnams la sangs rgyas 'byung ba dang stobs rnams sangs rgyas kyi rten can yin pa'i phyir thams cad 'dzam bu'i gling gi skyes pa'i rten can yin no //
analyzed: blo gsal ba'i phyir 'dzam bu'i gling pa rnams la sangs rgyas 'byung ba dang stobs rnams sangs rgyas kyi rten can yin pa'i phyir thams cad 'dzam bu'i gling gi skyes pa'i rten can yin no //
translated: Because beings of Jambudvƒ´pa have clear minds, buddhas appear there and the powers are the support of buddhas. Therefore all buddhas are born in Jambudvƒ´pa.

original: gzhan gyi stobs zhes mi bya'i zhes bya ba ni nyan thos sam rang sangs rgyas kyi'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi stobs zhes mi bya'i zhes bya ba ni nyan thos sam rang sangs rgyas kyi'o //
translated: that is, of the ≈õrƒÅvakas or pratyekabuddhas.

original: thogs mi mnga' zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: thogs mi mnga' zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is called unobstructed,

original: thams cad la 'jug ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: thams cad la 'jug ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: which means it penetrates everything.

original: rab tu 'byung bar 'dod pa'i mi phyir btang ba zhes bya ba ni rab tu 'byung ba ni rab tu 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: rab tu 'byung bar 'dod pa'i mi phyir btang ba zhes bya ba ni rab tu 'byung ba ni rab tu 'byung ba'o //
translated: The person who wanted to go forth was sent away means that going forth is leaving home.

original: de 'dod pa ni rab tu 'byung bar 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dod pa ni rab tu 'byung bar 'dod pa'o //
translated: He who wanted that was the person who wanted to go forth.

original: rab tu 'byung bar 'dod pa'i mi de slar btang ba ni rab tu 'byung bar 'dod pa'i mi phyir btang ba'o //
analyzed: rab tu 'byung bar 'dod pa'i mi de slar btang ba ni rab tu 'byung bar 'dod pa'i mi phyir btang ba'o //
translated: The person who wanted to go forth was sent away means that the person who wanted to go forth was sent away.

original: thar ba'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ma mthong bas phyir btang ba ste /
analyzed: thar ba'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ma mthong bas phyir btang ba ste /
translated: Because he had not seen the roots of virtue that are conducive to liberation,

original: rab tu ma byung zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rab tu ma byung zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: he was sent away, which means he did not go forth.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ni gzigs shing rab tu phyung ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ni gzigs shing rab tu phyung ngo //
translated: But the Blessed One saw him and allowed him to go forth.

original: 'di ni ji ltar gzhan gyi shes pa thogs pa'i dper brjod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni ji ltar gzhan gyi shes pa thogs pa'i dper brjod pa'o //
translated: This is an example of the obstruction of knowledge of others.

original: skye ba la sogs pa'i mtha' ma shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni 'chi 'pho ba'i mtha' ma shes pa bsdu'o //üîΩsred med kyi bu'i stobs zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa'i mtha' ma shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni 'chi 'pho ba'i mtha' ma shes pa bsdu'o // sred med kyi bu'i stobs zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúthe end of birth and so on‚Äù includes the end of death and transmigration.

original: stobs nyid kyi ming gi khyad par te /
analyzed: stobs nyid kyi ming gi khyad par te /
translated: The strength of Narayana is the name of a particular strength.

original: gang la stobs de yod pa de yang sred med kyi bu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang la stobs de yod pa de yang sred med kyi bu zhes bya'o //
translated: One who possesses that strength is called Narayana.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi phun sum tshogs pa ni gnyis te /üîΩrten phun sum @250a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi phun sum tshogs pa ni gnyis te / rten phun sum @250a * //
translated: The perfection of the Lord is twofold:

original: tshogs pa ni gzugs kyi sku'o //
analyzed: tshogs pa ni gzugs kyi sku'o //
translated: The perfection of the support is the form body.

original: brten pa phun sum tshogs pa ni stobs la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams so //
analyzed: brten pa phun sum tshogs pa ni stobs la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams so //
translated: The perfection of the supported is the excellences such as the strengths.

original: gzhan dag tshigs na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhan dag tshigs na zhes bya ba la /
translated: Others say that it is in the joints.

original: gzhan dag na re sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi sku thams cad la sred med kyi bu'i stobs gcig yod pa ma yin te ;üîΩ'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi sku thams cad la sred med kyi bu'i stobs gcig yod pa ma yin te ; 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Others say that the strength of Narayana is not in all the bodies of the Lord Buddha,üîΩbut rather

original: tshigs dang tshigs na'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: tshigs dang tshigs na'o zhes zer ro //
translated: in the joints.

original: de lta ma yin na mkhyen pa'i stobs mtha' yas pa bzod par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /üîΩde lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni thugs kyi bzhin du sku'i stobs mi 'dod na ste /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na mkhyen pa'i stobs mtha' yas pa bzod par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la / de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni thugs kyi bzhin du sku'i stobs mi 'dod na ste /
translated: If it were not so, then the infinite power of knowledge would not be accepted.

original: mkhyen pa'i stobs mtha' yas pa bzod par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mkhyen pa'i stobs mtha' yas pa bzod par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If it were not so, then if one did not accept the power of the body to be like the mind, then the infinite power of knowledge would not be accepted.üîΩOne would not be of the nature of forbearance.

original: bzod pa'i ngang tshul can du mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bzod pa'i ngang tshul can du mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: tshigs na zhes bshad pa de'i phyir rus pa'i tshigs kyi khyad par klu mdud ba zhes bya ba rgyas par bkod do //
analyzed: tshigs na zhes bshad pa de'i phyir rus pa'i tshigs kyi khyad par klu mdud ba zhes bya ba rgyas par bkod do //
translated: Since it was explained that the joints are the bones, the special joint of the bones called naga-bandha is set forth in detail.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi tshigs ni klu mdud pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi tshigs ni klu mdud pa lta bu ste /
translated: The joints of the Buddhas are like naga-bandha.

original: klu mdud pa ni klu sbrel ba'o //
analyzed: klu mdud pa ni klu sbrel ba'o //
translated: Naga-bandha is the joining of the nagas.

original: rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi tshigs ni lu gu rgyud lta bu yin no //üîΩ'khor los sgyur ba rnams kyi tshigs ni gzer bus btab ba lta bu yin no //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi tshigs ni lu gu rgyud lta bu yin no // 'khor los sgyur ba rnams kyi tshigs ni gzer bus btab ba lta bu yin no //
translated: The joints of the Pratyekabuddhas are like a chain.üîΩThe joints of the Cakravartins are like a bolt.

original: glang chen sogs /üîΩbdun cu glags pa'i stobs yin no //
analyzed: glang chen sogs /üîΩbdun cu glags pa'i stobs yin no //
translated: The joints of the elephants, etc.üîΩare like a hook.

original: zhes bya ba ni glang po che la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni glang po che la sogs pa ste /
translated: These are elephants and so on.

original: glang po che phal pa dang / spos kyi glang po che dang / tshan po che chen po dang / rab gnon dang / yan lag mchog dang / stobs mchog dang / sred med kyi bu dang bdun yin no //üîΩde'i stobs ni bcus glags pa'am /
analyzed: glang po che phal pa dang / spos kyi glang po che dang / tshan po che chen po dang / rab gnon dang / yan lag mchog dang / stobs mchog dang / sred med kyi bu dang bdun yin no // de'i stobs ni bcus glags pa'am /
translated: There are seven types of elephants: ordinary elephants, fragrant elephants, great elephants, very powerful elephants, supreme limb elephants, supreme strength elephants, and Narayana elephants.üîΩThe strength of the latter is equal to ten times the former.

original: bcu bas lhag pa'o //
analyzed: bcu bas lhag pa'o //
translated: Or it is greater than ten times the former.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is this?

original: glang po che phal pa ste /üîΩglang po che tha ma la pa bcu'i stobs gang yin pa de ni spos kyi glang po che gcig gi stobs yin no zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo ;
analyzed: glang po che phal pa ste / glang po che tha ma la pa bcu'i stobs gang yin pa de ni spos kyi glang po che gcig gi stobs yin no zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo ;
translated: Ordinary elephants are the least.üîΩThe strength of ten ordinary elephants is the strength of one fragrant elephant, and so on.

original: / ji ltar ches che ba de ltar rung ngo zhes bya ba ni slob dpon te /
analyzed: / ji ltar ches che ba de ltar rung ngo zhes bya ba ni slob dpon te /
translated: The master Vasubandhu says that the strength of Narayana elephants is equal to the strength of ten ordinary elephants, or it is greater than that.

original: de lta ma yin na mkhyen pa mtha' yas pa bzod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na mkhyen pa mtha' yas pa bzod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, it would not be possible to have infinite knowledge.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩsku la brten pa ni sku dang 'tsham pa yin te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / sku la brten pa ni sku dang 'tsham pa yin te /
translated: Why is this?üîΩThe body is supported by strength, and strength is appropriate for the body.

original: sku dang thugs ni phan tshun mthun par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sku dang thugs ni phan tshun mthun par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The body and mind are mutually supportive.

original: gzhan du na lha sbyin gyis bsad pa'i glang po che zhabs kyi mthe bos ra ba dang 'obs bdun zlo ba der mi 'gyur ba 'di ni rgyu yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du na lha sbyin gyis bsad pa'i glang po che zhabs kyi mthe bos ra ba dang 'obs bdun zlo ba der mi 'gyur ba 'di ni rgyu yin no //
translated: Otherwise, the elephant that Devadatta killed would not have been able to leap over the seven moats and walls with the toe of his foot.

original: de ni reg bya'i skye mched yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ni reg bya'i skye mched yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is the base of tactility.

original: stobs thams cad reg bya'i skye mched yin no //
analyzed: stobs thams cad reg bya'i skye mched yin no //
translated: All of these are the base of tactility.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: They are of two types:üîΩthe great elements and those derived from the great elements.

original: 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa yin pas de'i phyir 'byung ba chen po'i khyad par @250b zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa yin pas de'i phyir 'byung ba chen po'i khyad par @250b zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, the root text states, ‚Äúthe specific nature of the great elements.‚Äù

original: 'byung ba las gyur pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba las gyur pa ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not derived from the great elements.

original: bdun las don gzhan du gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bdun las don gzhan du gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because it is a different substance from the seven.

original: sngar bshad pa 'jam pa nyid la sogs pa dag las gzhan pa rgyur byas pa'i gzugs ni stobs yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa 'jam pa nyid la sogs pa dag las gzhan pa rgyur byas pa'i gzugs ni stobs yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The substance of strength is derived form that is different from the seven qualities of smoothness, etc., that were explained previously.

original: mod las ji skad du 'byung ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mod las ji skad du 'byung ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: As the sutra states.

original: kye ma nga mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa la 'di na chos 'di dag mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas so zhes nga la dge sbyong ngam bram ze 'am lha 'am bdud dam tshangs pa'ang rung 'ga' yang chos dang mthun pas rgol zhing gleng bar byedüîΩpa'i rgyu mtshan yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: kye ma nga mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa la 'di na chos 'di dag mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas so zhes nga la dge sbyong ngam bram ze 'am lha 'am bdud dam tshangs pa'ang rung 'ga' yang chos dang mthun pas rgol zhing gleng bar byed pa'i rgyu mtshan yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúI have not seen any reason to think that any ascetic, brahmin, god, MƒÅra, BrahmƒÅ, or anyone else in the world could legitimately dispute my full and complete awakening to these phenomena.

original: de ltar ngas rgyu mtshan yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas bde ba thob pa dang / 'jigs pa med par gyur cing mi 'jigs pa thob par gnas te /
analyzed: de ltar ngas rgyu mtshan yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas bde ba thob pa dang / 'jigs pa med par gyur cing mi 'jigs pa thob par gnas te /
translated: Since I do not see any reason to think that, I have attained happiness, fearlessness, and the state of fearlessness.

original: khyu mchog gi gnas rlabs po che zhal gyis 'che zhing tshangs pa'i 'khor lo bskor /
analyzed: khyu mchog gi gnas rlabs po che zhal gyis 'che zhing tshangs pa'i 'khor lo bskor /
translated: I declare the exalted and lofty state of a bull, and I turn the wheel of BrahmƒÅ.

original: 'khor gyi nang du seng ge'i sgra yang dag par sgrogs pa 'di ni mi 'jigs pa dang po'o//
analyzed: 'khor gyi nang du seng ge'i sgra yang dag par sgrogs pa 'di ni mi 'jigs pa dang po'o//
translated: I proclaim the lion‚Äôs roar in the midst of the assembly. This is the first fearlessness.

original: kye ma nga zag pa zad pa la 'di na zag pa 'di dag ma zad do zhes nga la dge sbyong ngam bram ze 'am zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: kye ma nga zag pa zad pa la 'di na zag pa 'di dag ma zad do zhes nga la dge sbyong ngam bram ze 'am zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
translated: ‚ÄúO, if anyone, whether a monk or a brahman, should say to me, ‚ÄòIn you who have exhausted the contaminants, these contaminants have not been exhausted,‚Äô then I would reply to him, ‚ÄòI do not see that this is so.‚Äô

original: 'di na nyan thos rnams la bar du gcod pa'i chos su gsungs pa gang dag yin pa de dag bstan na par du gcod par mi 'gyur ro zhes nga la dge sbyong ngam zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no//üîΩ'di na ngas nyan thos rnams la nges par 'byin pa'i lam du gsungs pa nges par 'byin pa sdug bsngal yang dag par zad par byed pa'i ched du nges par 'byung ba la sdug bsngal gyi mthar byed pa'i ched du nges par 'byung ba ma yin no zhes
analyzed: 'di na nyan thos rnams la bar du gcod pa'i chos su gsungs pa gang dag yin pa de dag bstan na par du gcod par mi 'gyur ro zhes nga la dge sbyong ngam zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no// 'di na ngas nyan thos rnams la nges par 'byin pa'i lam du gsungs pa nges par 'byin pa sdug bsngal yang dag par zad par byed pa'i ched du nges par 'byung ba la sdug bsngal gyi mthar byed pa'i ched du nges par 'byung ba ma yin no zhes
translated: ‚ÄúO, if anyone should say to me, ‚ÄòThose things that have been taught by the Lord as obstacles are not obstacles if practiced by a disciple of the Well-Gone One,‚Äô then I would reply to him, ‚ÄòI do not see that this is so.‚ÄôüîΩ‚ÄúO, if anyone should say to me, ‚ÄòThe path taught by the Lord as leading to the deliverance of disciples is not a path leading to the deliverance of disciples,‚Äô then I would reply to him, ‚ÄòI do not see that this is so.‚Äô

original: nga la dge sbyong ngam bram ze'am zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: nga la dge sbyong ngam bram ze'am zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin te /
translated: ‚ÄúO, if anyone should say to me, ‚ÄòThe deliverance taught by the Lord as leading to the complete exhaustion of suffering for disciples is not a deliverance leading to the complete exhaustion of suffering for disciples,‚Äô then I would reply to him, ‚ÄòI do not see that this is so.‚Äô

original: 'di ni mi 'jigs pa bzhi pa yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ni mi 'jigs pa bzhi pa yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: This is the fourth fearlessness.‚Äù

original: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs ji lta bar zhes bya ba ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs shes pa bcu dang sa thams cad kyis bsdus pa ji lta bar kye ma nga mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par gyur pa laüîΩzhes bya ba 'di mi 'jigs pa 'di yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs ji lta bar zhes bya ba ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs shes pa bcu dang sa thams cad kyis bsdus pa ji lta bar kye ma nga mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par gyur pa la zhes bya ba 'di mi 'jigs pa 'di yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: Just as the power of knowledge of the exhaustion of contaminants is the six or ten knowledges and is subsumed by eleven levels, so too is this fearlessness.

original: de kho na bzhin du chos rnam pa bcur phye nas sbyar bar bya'o //üîΩzag pa zad pa'i mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du chos rnam pa bcur phye nas sbyar bar bya'o // zag pa zad pa'i mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Here too, just as the power of knowledge of the exhaustion of contaminants is the six or ten knowledges and is subsumed by eleven levels, so too is this fearlessness.

original: de shes pa drug gam bcu dang / sa bcu gcig gis bsdus pa ji lta bar kye ma nga zag pa zad par gyur pa la zhes bya ba'i mi 'jigs pa 'di yang de dang 'dra ste /üîΩ'dir yang de @251a * //
analyzed: de shes pa drug gam bcu dang / sa bcu gcig gis bsdus pa ji lta bar kye ma nga zag pa zad par gyur pa la zhes bya ba'i mi 'jigs pa 'di yang de dang 'dra ste / 'dir yang de @251a * //
translated: Here too, just as the power of knowledge of the exhaustion of contaminants is the six or ten knowledges and is subsumed by eleven levels, so too is this fearlessness.

original: kho na bzhin du chos rnams phye nas shes pa drug gam bcu dang sa bcu gcig par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: kho na bzhin du chos rnams phye nas shes pa drug gam bcu dang sa bcu gcig par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Here too, just as the power of knowledge of the exhaustion of contaminants is the six or ten knowledges and is subsumed by eleven levels, so too is this fearlessness.üîΩHere too, just as the power of knowledge of the exhaustion of contaminants is the six or ten knowledges and is subsumed by eleven levels, so too is this fearlessness.

original: las bdag gir bya ba mkhyen pa'i stobs 'gog pa dang lam shes pa ma gtogs pa shes pa brgyad dang sa thams cad kyis bsdus pa ji lta bar ngas gang dag nyan thos rnams la bar du gcod pa'i chos su gsungs pa yang de dang 'dra ste /üîΩ'dir yang de kho na bzhin du chos rnams phye nas sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: las bdag gir bya ba mkhyen pa'i stobs 'gog pa dang lam shes pa ma gtogs pa shes pa brgyad dang sa thams cad kyis bsdus pa ji lta bar ngas gang dag nyan thos rnams la bar du gcod pa'i chos su gsungs pa yang de dang 'dra ste / 'dir yang de kho na bzhin du chos rnams phye nas sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The power of knowledge of the paths that lead to all migrations is the same as the power of knowledge of the paths that lead to all migrations, since it is the ten or nine knowledges and it is included in all levels.üîΩThe power of knowledge of superior and inferior faculties is the same as the power of knowledge of various elements, since it is the ten knowledges and it is included in all levels.üîΩThe power of knowledge of various dispositions is the same as the power of knowledge of various interests, since it is the ten knowledges and it is included in all levels.üîΩThe power of knowledge of the paths that lead to all migrations is the same as the power of knowledge of the paths that lead to all migrations, since it is the ten or nine knowledges and it is included in all levels.üîΩThe power of knowledge of superior and inferior faculties is the same as the power of knowledge of various elements, since it is the ten knowledges and it is included in all levels.üîΩThe power of knowledge of various dispositions is the same as the power of knowledge of various interests, since it is the ten knowledges and it is included in all levels.

original: kun du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs shes pa bcu 'am dgu dang / sa thams cad na yod pa ji ltar bar ngas nyan thos rnams kyi nges par 'byung ba'i lam du gsungs pa la zhes bya ba'i mi 'jigs pa 'di yang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //üîΩde dag ni rnam pa bzhi yin te /
analyzed: kun du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs shes pa bcu 'am dgu dang / sa thams cad na yod pa ji ltar bar ngas nyan thos rnams kyi nges par 'byung ba'i lam du gsungs pa la zhes bya ba'i mi 'jigs pa 'di yang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o // de dag ni rnam pa bzhi yin te /
translated: The power of knowledge of the paths that lead to all migrations is the same as the power of knowledge of the paths that lead to all migrations, since it is the ten or nine knowledges and it is included in all levels.

original: snga ma gnyis kyis ni de'i bdag nyid kyi ye shes dang spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa brjod do //
analyzed: snga ma gnyis kyis ni de'i bdag nyid kyi ye shes dang spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa brjod do //
translated: The power of knowledge of superior and inferior faculties is the same as the power of knowledge of various elements, since it is the ten knowledges and it is included in all levels.üîΩThe power of knowledge of various dispositions is the same as the power of knowledge of various interests, since it is the ten knowledges and it is included in all levels.üîΩThe power of knowledge of the paths that lead to all migrations is the same as the power of knowledge of the paths that lead to all migrations

original: phyi ma gnyis kyis ni gzhan la phan pa phun sum tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: phyi ma gnyis kyis ni gzhan la phan pa phun sum tshogs pa ste /
translated: The latter two are the excellent benefit for others,

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i lam bzlog pa'i phyir dang / yang dag pa'i lam bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i lam bzlog pa'i phyir dang / yang dag pa'i lam bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they respectively turn away from the wrong path and reveal the right path.

original: ji ltar na mkhyen pa nyid mi 'jigs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na mkhyen pa nyid mi 'jigs pa yin zhe na /
translated: How are the knowledges the fearlessnesses?

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams ni mi 'jigs pa ni mi skrag pa yin la 'di dag gis kyang mi skrag par 'gyur bas shes pa rnams mi 'jigs pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams ni mi 'jigs pa ni mi skrag pa yin la 'di dag gis kyang mi skrag par 'gyur bas shes pa rnams mi 'jigs pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Vaibhasikas say: Fearlessness is non-terror and since they are not terrified by these, the knowledges are fearlessnesses.

original: slob dpon gyi shes pas byas pa ni mi 'jigs pa yin par rung gi shes pa nyid ni ma yin no zhes smos te /
analyzed: slob dpon gyi shes pas byas pa ni mi 'jigs pa yin par rung gi shes pa nyid ni ma yin no zhes smos te /
translated: The master says: It is suitable that fearlessness is made by knowledge, but it is not knowledge itself.

original: mi 'jigs pa ni mi skrag pa yin la mi skrag pa nyid kyang skrag pa dang bral ba yin zhing de yang shes pa las yin pas shes pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa ni mi skrag pa yin la mi skrag pa nyid kyang skrag pa dang bral ba yin zhing de yang shes pa las yin pas shes pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: Fearlessness is non-terror and non-terror is freedom from terror and that is made by knowledge, but it is not knowledge itself.

original: mi brdzi ba'i rgyu thogs pa med pa'i lam mkhyen pa ni stobs yin la /
analyzed: mi brdzi ba'i rgyu thogs pa med pa'i lam mkhyen pa ni stobs yin la /
translated: The power is the unobstructed path that is the cause of non-contention.

original: mi zhum ba'i rgyu ni mi 'jigs pa yin te /
analyzed: mi zhum ba'i rgyu ni mi 'jigs pa yin te /
translated: The cause of non-discouragement is fearlessness.

original: ji ltar gzhan gyis zil gyis mi gnon pa de ltar na stobs yin la /
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan gyis zil gyis mi gnon pa de ltar na stobs yin la /
translated: It is power in the sense that one is not overwhelmed by others.

original: ji ltar gzhan dag zil gyis gnon pa de ltar na mi 'jigs pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan dag zil gyis gnon pa de ltar na mi 'jigs pa yin no //
translated: It is fearlessness in the sense that one overwhelms others.

original: gzhan dag na re stobs ni dpa' ba nyid yin la /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re stobs ni dpa' ba nyid yin la /
translated: Others say: Power is heroism.

original: mi 'jigs pa ni brtan pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa ni brtan pa nyid yin no //
translated: Fearlessness is steadfastness.

original: 'di gnyis kyi bya ba tha dad de /
analyzed: 'di gnyis kyi bya ba tha dad de /
translated: The function of these two is different.

original: stobs kyi don ni mngon par 'dod pa'i sgrub pa'i don to //
analyzed: stobs kyi don ni mngon par 'dod pa'i sgrub pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of power is the meaning of accomplishing what is desired.

original: mi 'jigs pa'i don ni mi zhum pa'i don to zhes zer ro //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa'i don ni mi zhum pa'i don to zhes zer ro //
translated: The meaning of fearlessness is the meaning of non-discouragement.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyis bsdus pa rnams las gzhag pa dag go //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyis bsdus pa rnams las gzhag pa dag go //
translated: The foundations of mindfulness are the foundations among the factors of enlightenment.

original: 'khor gyi bye brag las zhes bya ba ni 'khor gyi khyad @251b par las so //
analyzed: 'khor gyi bye brag las zhes bya ba ni 'khor gyi khyad @251b par las so //
translated: From the distinction of retinue means from the distinction of retinue.

original: mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dge slong dag ston pa thugs brtse ba thugs rje can don bzhed pa thugs rje ste /
analyzed: mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dge slong dag ston pa thugs brtse ba thugs rje can don bzhed pa thugs rje ste /
translated: Bhikshus, the Teacher, who is compassionate, who has loving kindness, who is benevolent,üîΩteaches the Dharma to the sravakas, saying,

original: nyan thos rnams la 'di ni khyed la phan par byed pa /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams la 'di ni khyed la phan par byed pa /
translated: This is for your benefit,

original: 'di ni khyed la bde bar byed pa /
analyzed: 'di ni khyed la bde bar byed pa /
translated: this is for your happiness,üîΩthis is for your benefit and happiness.

original: 'di ni khyed la phan pa dang bde bar byed pa'o zhes chos ston par mdzad cing nyan thos de dag de la nyan par byed /
analyzed: 'di ni khyed la phan pa dang bde bar byed pa'o zhes chos ston par mdzad cing nyan thos de dag de la nyan par byed /
translated: The sravakas listen to that,

original: rna ba gtod par byed /
analyzed: rna ba gtod par byed /
translated: pay attention,

original: kun shes pa'i sems nye bar 'jog par byed /
analyzed: kun shes pa'i sems nye bar 'jog par byed /
translated: apply their minds to understand it,

original: chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub par byed /
analyzed: chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub par byed /
translated: practice the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma,

original: ston pa'i bstan pa la mi 'gal bar byed na /
analyzed: ston pa'i bstan pa la mi 'gal bar byed na /
translated: and do not contradict the teachings of the Teacher.

original: des de bzhin gshegs pa thugs dgyes par yang mi 'gyur /üîΩyid bde ba yang ma yin ;
analyzed: des de bzhin gshegs pa thugs dgyes par yang mi 'gyur / yid bde ba yang ma yin ;
translated: But that does not please the Tathagata,üîΩdoes not make him happy,

original: thugs ya ya por yang mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: thugs ya ya por yang mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: does not make him feel satisfied.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa dran pa dang shes bzhin du btang snyoms su bzhugs te /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa dran pa dang shes bzhin du btang snyoms su bzhugs te /
translated: The Tathagata remains equanimous with regard to that, mindful and aware.

original: 'di ni gang dag 'phags pa sten par byed pa ste /üîΩ'phags pas de dag bsten na /
analyzed: 'di ni gang dag 'phags pa sten par byed pa ste / 'phags pas de dag bsten na /
translated: This is the first application of mindfulness that is suitable for teaching the assembly,

original: tshogs la rjes su ston par 'os pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang po yin no //
analyzed: tshogs la rjes su ston par 'os pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang po yin no //
translated: when the noble ones rely on it.

original: gzhan yang dge slong dag thugs brtse ba zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang dge slong dag thugs brtse ba zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Moreover, monks, the compassionate teacher, as before,

original: bzlog ste nyan thos de dag de la nyan par mi byed ces bya ba yang snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: bzlog ste nyan thos de dag de la nyan par mi byed ces bya ba yang snga ma bzhin no //
translated: the disciples do not listen to him, as before,

original: des de bzhin gshegs pa kun nas mnar sems su yang mi 'gyur /
analyzed: des de bzhin gshegs pa kun nas mnar sems su yang mi 'gyur /
translated: the TathƒÅgata does not become angry,

original: mi bzod pa yang ma yin /üîΩ'tshig pa yang mi mnga'/
analyzed: mi bzod pa yang ma yin / 'tshig pa yang mi mnga'/
translated: does not become impatient,üîΩdoes not become irritated,

original: thugs ma rangs ba yang mi mnga'o //
analyzed: thugs ma rangs ba yang mi mnga'o //
translated: and does not become displeased.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa dran pa dang shes bzhin du btang snyoms su bzhugs te /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa dran pa dang shes bzhin du btang snyoms su bzhugs te /
translated: There the TathƒÅgata, with mindfulness and awareness, remains equanimous,

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gnyis pa yin no //
translated: this is the second application of mindfulness.

original: gzhan yang dge slong dag 'di na ston pa thugs brtse ba zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang dge slong dag 'di na ston pa thugs brtse ba zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Moreover, monks, the compassionate teacher, as before,

original: nyan thos kha cig ni de la nyan par byed rna ba gtod par byed kun shes pa'i sems nye bar 'jog par byed chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub par byed /
analyzed: nyan thos kha cig ni de la nyan par byed rna ba gtod par byed kun shes pa'i sems nye bar 'jog par byed chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub par byed /
translated: Some of the listeners listen, lend an ear, set their minds on total understanding, and practice the teachings in accordance with the teachings.

original: ston pa'i bstan pa las mi 'gal bar byed la /
analyzed: ston pa'i bstan pa las mi 'gal bar byed la /
translated: They do not contradict the Teacher‚Äôs teachings.

original: kha cig nyan par mi byed rna ba gtod par mi byed pa nas ston pa'i bstan pa las 'gal ba'i bar du byed na /
analyzed: kha cig nyan par mi byed rna ba gtod par mi byed pa nas ston pa'i bstan pa las 'gal ba'i bar du byed na /
translated: But some do not listen, do not lend an ear, and so on up to: they contradict the Teacher‚Äôs teachings.

original: des de bzhin gshegs pa dgyes par mi 'gyur /üîΩyid bde ba yang ma yin thugs ya ya por yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: des de bzhin gshegs pa dgyes par mi 'gyur / yid bde ba yang ma yin thugs ya ya por yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: This does not please the TathƒÅgata.üîΩIt does not make him happy, nor does he become displeased.

original: kun nas mnar sems su yang mi 'gyur /
analyzed: kun nas mnar sems su yang mi 'gyur /
translated: He does not become angry,

original: mi bzod pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: mi bzod pa yang ma yin /
translated: nor does he become impatient.

original: 'tshig pa yang mi mnga'i /
analyzed: 'tshig pa yang mi mnga'i /
translated: He is not irritated,

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa dran pa dang shes bzhin du btang snyoms su bzhugs te /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa dran pa dang shes bzhin du btang snyoms su bzhugs te /
translated: but the TathƒÅgata remains equanimous, mindful and alert.

original: @252a * // 'di ni gang dag sten par byed pa ste /
analyzed: @252a * // 'di ni gang dag sten par byed pa ste /
translated: Those who follow

original: 'phags pa de dag bsten na tshogs la rjes su ston par 'os pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum pa yin no zhes 'byung ngo //üîΩde yang / dran dang shes bzhin bdag nyid gsum //
analyzed: 'phags pa de dag bsten na tshogs la rjes su ston par 'os pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum pa yin no zhes 'byung ngo // de yang / dran dang shes bzhin bdag nyid gsum //
translated: This is the third application of mindfulness that is suitable for teaching the assembly when relying on those noble ones.üîΩAnd that is said to beüîΩof the nature of mindfulness and vigilance.

original: zhes bya ba ni dran pa'i bdag nyid dang shes bzhin gyi bdag nyid de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dran pa'i bdag nyid dang shes bzhin gyi bdag nyid de /
translated: It is of the nature of mindfulness and of the nature of vigilance,

original: dran pa dang shes bzhin du btang snyoms su bzhugs te zhes gang bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: dran pa dang shes bzhin du btang snyoms su bzhugs te zhes gang bshad pa yin no //
translated: because it is said that he dwells in equanimity endowed with mindfulness and vigilance.

original: gang gi tshe nyan thos kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: gang gi tshe nyan thos kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
translated: When even the sravakas...

original: nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: because they abandon afflictions.

original: bag chags dang bcas par spangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba dag gi bag chags kyang spangs kyi /
analyzed: bag chags dang bcas par spangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba dag gi bag chags kyang spangs kyi /
translated: Because they abandon them along with their traces. The Bhagavan abandons the traces of attachment and aversion,

original: gzhan nyan thos rnams kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan nyan thos rnams kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: but other sravakas do not.

original: bag chags zhes bya ba 'di ci zhe na /
analyzed: bag chags zhes bya ba 'di ci zhe na /
translated: What is this so-called trace?

original: gang sngar nyon mongs pa spyad pa de'i des byas pa'i lus dang ngag gi g-yo ba 'gyur ba'i rgyu nus pa'i khyad par ni bag chags yin no //
analyzed: gang sngar nyon mongs pa spyad pa de'i des byas pa'i lus dang ngag gi g-yo ba 'gyur ba'i rgyu nus pa'i khyad par ni bag chags yin no //
translated: The special potency that is the cause of the movement of body and speech that is done by that affliction is the latent tendency.

original: yang na nyan thos rnams gang gi yin pa de la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang na nyan thos rnams gang gi yin pa de la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Or, it is that of the ≈õrƒÅvakas, etc.

original: nyan thos rnams sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi yin gyi /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi yin gyi /
translated: The ≈õrƒÅvakas are of the BhagavƒÅn Buddha,

original: gzhan dag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni ma yin no //
translated: but not of others.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: nyan thos thams cad sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi dbang du byas nas rab tu 'byung bas so //
analyzed: nyan thos thams cad sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi dbang du byas nas rab tu 'byung bas so //
translated: Because all ≈õrƒÅvakas go forth under the BhagavƒÅn Buddha.üîΩIt does not occur in him alone, etc.

original: de kho na la de mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni nyan thos de dag gang gi yin pa ston pa de kho na la'o //
analyzed: de kho na la de mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni nyan thos de dag gang gi yin pa ston pa de kho na la'o //
translated: It does not occur in the ≈õrƒÅvakas alone, but in the teacher himself who is of the ≈õrƒÅvakas.

original: de zhes bya ba ni yid bde ba la sogs pa de dag mi skye ba ngo mtshar ba'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni yid bde ba la sogs pa de dag mi skye ba ngo mtshar ba'o //
translated: That is amazing, etc.üîΩIf it were not so, etc.

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te snying rje bzhin du zhe sdang med pa'i ngo bo yin pa'am /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te snying rje bzhin du zhe sdang med pa'i ngo bo yin pa'am /
translated: If, like compassion, it were by nature non-hatred,

original: zag pa med pa'i bdag nyid yin na'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i bdag nyid yin na'o //
translated: It is when it has the nature of being uncontaminated.

original: sems can thams cad la dmigs par mi 'grub la /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la dmigs par mi 'grub la /
translated: It is not established as having all sentient beings as its object.üîΩAnd it is not established as having the aspect of the three kinds of suffering, like compassion.

original: snying rje bzhin du sdug bsngal gsum gyi rnam pa can du yang mi 'grub bo zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems can rnams la dmigs pa de bzhin du 'di yang 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: snying rje bzhin du sdug bsngal gsum gyi rnam pa can du yang mi 'grub bo zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems can rnams la dmigs pa de bzhin du 'di yang 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: The idea is that just as it is said to have as its object sentient beings who live in the desire realm, so it is in this case.

original: sdug bsngal gsum gyi rnam pa can du yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gsum gyi rnam pa can du yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: It does not have the aspect of the three kinds of suffering.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: sdug bsngal sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa can kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa can kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: It has the aspect of the suffering of suffering alone.

original: dper na snying rje bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na snying rje bzhin no //
translated: For example, like compassion.

original: shes pa zag pa med pa yang de ltar mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: shes pa zag pa med pa yang de ltar mi 'jug ste /
translated: Uncontaminated knowledge does not operate in that way.

original: de'i phyir thugs rje ni kun rdzob shes pa'i bdag nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir thugs rje ni kun rdzob shes pa'i bdag nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, compassion has the nature of conventional knowledge.

original: chen po'i sgra sbyar ba @252b bstan pa'i phyir 'di ci'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: chen po'i sgra sbyar ba @252b bstan pa'i phyir 'di ci'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: To show the application of the word ‚Äúgreat,‚Äù he says, ‚ÄúWhy is that?‚Äù and so on.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen po yang dag par 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu chen po nyid ni rgyu chen po sngon du 'gro ba yin pas so //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen po yang dag par 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu chen po nyid ni rgyu chen po sngon du 'gro ba yin pas so //
translated: The greatness of the result is due to the greatness of the cause that precedes it.

original: de la bsod nams kyi tshogs chen po ni sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de la bsod nams kyi tshogs chen po ni sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: Among them, the great accumulation of merit is the perfections of giving, morality, and patience.

original: ye shes ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: Knowledge is the perfection of wisdom.

original: brtson 'grus dang bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa gnyis ni /
analyzed: brtson 'grus dang bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa gnyis ni /
translated: The two perfections of effort and meditation

original: rnam pa gnyis ka yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis ka yin te /
translated: are both.

original: bsam gtan med na shes rab med do zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan med na shes rab med do zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said, ‚ÄúWithout meditation, there is no wisdom.‚Äù

original: brtson 'grus med par sbyin pa mi gtong la /
analyzed: brtson 'grus med par sbyin pa mi gtong la /
translated: Without effort, one does not practice giving,

original: tshul khrims yang dag par mi len cing bzod pa mi sgom mo //
analyzed: tshul khrims yang dag par mi len cing bzod pa mi sgom mo //
translated: does not take up morality, and does not cultivate patience.

original: de ltar na brtson 'grus ni bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi cha dang mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na brtson 'grus ni bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi cha dang mthun pa yin no //
translated: Thus, effort is a factor conducive to the accumulation of merit.

original: de bzhin du brtson 'grus med na shes rab kyang med pas ye shes kyi tshogs chen po'i cha dang mthun par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du brtson 'grus med na shes rab kyang med pas ye shes kyi tshogs chen po'i cha dang mthun par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Likewise, if there is no striving, there is no wisdom, so it is also a condition for the great accumulation of intuition.

original: sdug bsngal gsum la rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'dis ni rnam pa che ba nyid kyis che ba nyid bstan la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gsum la rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'dis ni rnam pa che ba nyid kyis che ba nyid bstan la /
translated: Because of the realization of the three sufferings shows the greatness by the greatness of the aspects.

original: khams gsum pa'i sems can la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'dis ni dmigs pa che ba nyid bstan to //
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i sems can la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'dis ni dmigs pa che ba nyid bstan to //
translated: Because of the objective reference to the sentient beings of the three realms shows the greatness of the objective reference.

original: 'dra bar 'jug pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni phul du byung ba'i khyad par la ltos te chen po nyid yin par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dra bar 'jug pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni phul du byung ba'i khyad par la ltos te chen po nyid yin par bstan to //
translated: Because of the engagement in similarity shows the greatness in relation to the special excellence.

original: ches che ba nyid ni de bas ches che ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de la shin tu dang rim ches kyis rim pa ldog pa'o //
analyzed: ches che ba nyid ni de bas ches che ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de la shin tu dang rim ches kyis rim pa ldog pa'o //
translated: The superlatively great is because there is no greater than that shows that the sequence of the very and the superlatively great is reversed.

original: ji ltar snying rjes snying rje bar byed pa de ltar des kyang yin pa de gnyis la /
analyzed: ji ltar snying rjes snying rje bar byed pa de ltar des kyang yin pa de gnyis la /
