translated: Just as one has compassion through compassion, so also the other two.

original: khyad par ma mthong nas tha dad du bya ba ci yod ces bya ba dris so //
analyzed: khyad par ma mthong nas tha dad du bya ba ci yod ces bya ba dris so //
translated: What is the difference between them?

original: tha dad du bya ba ni dbye bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: tha dad du bya ba ni dbye bar bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú Difference‚Äù means distinction.

original: zhe sdang med pa dang gti mug med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhe sdang med pa dang gti mug med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because they are, respectively, by nature the absence of hatred and the absence of delusion.

original: snying rje ni zhe sdang med pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: snying rje ni zhe sdang med pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: Compassion is by nature the absence of hatred.

original: thugs rje chen po ni gti mug med pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: thugs rje chen po ni gti mug med pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: Great compassion is by nature the absence of delusion.üîΩBecause they have, respectively, the aspect of one suffering and the aspect of three sufferings.

original: sdug bsngal gcig dang gsum gyi rnam pa can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni snying rje ni sdug bsngal gcig gi rnam pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gcig dang gsum gyi rnam pa can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni snying rje ni sdug bsngal gcig gi rnam pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Compassion has the aspect of one suffering,

original: thugs rje chen po ni sdug bsngal gsum gyi rnam pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thugs rje chen po ni sdug bsngal gsum gyi rnam pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: great compassion has the aspect of three sufferings.

original: khams gcig dang gsum gyi sems can la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khams gcig dang gsum gyi sems can la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because they have, respectively, the sentient beings of one realm and the sentient beings of three realms for their object.

original: snying rje ni khams gcig gi sems can la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snying rje ni khams gcig gi sems can la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Compassion has the sentient beings of one realm for its object.üîΩGreat compassion has the sentient beings of three realms for its object.

original: thugs rje chen po ni khams gsum gyi sems can la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thugs rje chen po ni khams gsum gyi sems can la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Great compassion is focused on sentient beings of the three realms.

original: sa las ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /üîΩsnying rje ni bsam gtan @253a * //
analyzed: sa las ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / snying rje ni bsam gtan @253a * //
translated: As for the levels, etc.,

original: bzhi'i sa pa yin no //
analyzed: bzhi'i sa pa yin no //
translated: compassion is on the level of the four meditations.

original: 'dir mi lcogs pa med pa dang bsam gtan khyad par can ni bsam gtan dang po'i khongs su gtogs pas logs shig tu ma bshad do //
analyzed: 'dir mi lcogs pa med pa dang bsam gtan khyad par can ni bsam gtan dang po'i khongs su gtogs pas logs shig tu ma bshad do //
translated: Here, the level of unrestricted access concentration to the first meditation and the special level of the first meditation are not mentioned separately because they are included in the first meditation.

original: thugs rje chen po ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa'o //
analyzed: thugs rje chen po ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa'o //
translated: Great compassion is on the level of the fourth meditation.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: As for the disciples, etc.,

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni 'jig rten pa dang rang sangs rgyas bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni 'jig rten pa dang rang sangs rgyas bsdu'o //
translated: the word etc. includes mundane beings and solitary realizers.

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang srid pa'i rtse mo las 'dod chags dang bral bas 'thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang srid pa'i rtse mo las 'dod chags dang bral bas 'thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because it is obtained through freedom from attachment to the desire realm and the peak of existence.

original: snying rje ni 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral bas 'thob la //
analyzed: snying rje ni 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral bas 'thob la //
translated: Compassion is obtained through freedom from attachment to the desire realm.

original: thugs rje chen po ni srid pa'i rtse mo la 'dod chags dang bral ba 'thob pa ste /
analyzed: thugs rje chen po ni srid pa'i rtse mo la 'dod chags dang bral ba 'thob pa ste /
translated: Great compassion is obtained through freedom from attachment to the peak of existence.

original: zad pa shes pa dang stobs la sogs pa bzhi yin no //
analyzed: zad pa shes pa dang stobs la sogs pa bzhi yin no //
translated: The four are the knowledge of elimination, the powers, and so on.

original: yongs su mi skyob pa dang yongs su skyob pa dang zhes bya ba ni snying rjes nyan thos la sogs pa dag sems can sdug bsngal ba rnams la nyam nga ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi de dag gis sdug bsngal de las bskyab par mi nus so
analyzed: yongs su mi skyob pa dang yongs su skyob pa dang zhes bya ba ni snying rjes nyan thos la sogs pa dag sems can sdug bsngal ba rnams la nyam nga ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi de dag gis sdug bsngal de las bskyab par mi nus so
translated: The phrase ‚Äúnot protecting and protecting‚Äù means that, out of compassion, the Buddha does not merely feel pity for suffering sentient beings, but he also protects them from that suffering.

original: // mi 'dra ba dang 'dra bar thugs rje mdzad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: // mi 'dra ba dang 'dra bar thugs rje mdzad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause he has compassion for those who are different and those who are not different‚Äù means that

original: snying rje ni sdug bsngal ba rnams kho na la thugs rje mdzad la /
analyzed: snying rje ni sdug bsngal ba rnams kho na la thugs rje mdzad la /
translated: compassion is only for those who are suffering.

original: thugs rje chen pos ni sems can thams cad la ste /
analyzed: thugs rje chen pos ni sems can thams cad la ste /
translated: Great compassion is for all sentient beings.

original: mnar med par skyes pa rnams la ji lta ba de bzhin du srid pa'i rtse mor skyes pa rnams la yang ngo //
analyzed: mnar med par skyes pa rnams la ji lta ba de bzhin du srid pa'i rtse mor skyes pa rnams la yang ngo //
translated: Just as it is for those born in the Avici hell, so it is for those born at the peak of worldly existence.

original: sngon gyi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyis yang dag par 'grub pa ni sangs rgyas pa nyid kyi sngon rol gyi bsod nams kyi tshogs dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyis yang dag par 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyis yang dag par 'grub pa ni sangs rgyas pa nyid kyi sngon rol gyi bsod nams kyi tshogs dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyis yang dag par 'grub pa'o //
translated: The perfection of the accumulations of merit and knowledge in the past is the perfection of the accumulations of merit and knowledge prior to Buddhahood.

original: tshogs ni tshogs so //
analyzed: tshogs ni tshogs so //
translated: The accumulation is the collection.

original: yang na 'dis sangs rgyas nyid kyi rgyu dge ba'i spyod pa thams cad tshogs pas na tshogs so //
analyzed: yang na 'dis sangs rgyas nyid kyi rgyu dge ba'i spyod pa thams cad tshogs pas na tshogs so //
translated: Or, it is the accumulation because all virtuous practices are accumulated in it as the cause of Buddhahood.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba 'di yang dag par sdud ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba 'di yang dag par sdud ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù means that it is the collection of all the causes of Buddhahood.

original: chos kyi sku yongs su grub pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos kyi sku yongs su grub pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The perfection of the Dharma Body is the Dharma Body itself.

original: chos kyi sku ni zag pa med pa'i chos kyi rgyun nam /
analyzed: chos kyi sku ni zag pa med pa'i chos kyi rgyun nam /
translated: The Dharma Body is the stream of undefiled dharmas,

original: gnas yongs su gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: gnas yongs su gyur pa yin no //
translated: or the transmutation of the basis.

original: 'jig rten gyi don spyod pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi don spyod pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The performance of benefit for the world is the performance of benefit for the world.

original: 'jig rten gyi don ni mtho ris dang byang grol gyi rgyu'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi don ni mtho ris dang byang grol gyi rgyu'o //
translated: The benefit of the world is the cause of heaven and liberation.

original: de sgrub pa ni don spyod pa ste /
analyzed: de sgrub pa ni don spyod pa ste /
translated: The performance of benefit is the performance of benefit for the world.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyis gzhan gyi don mdzad pa'i rgyu thugs rje chen po mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis gzhan gyi don mdzad pa'i rgyu thugs rje chen po mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the great compassion of the buddhas is the same in causing them to act for the benefit of others.

original: dus ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni thams cad dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: dus ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni thams cad dang sbyar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIn accordance with the time‚Äù is to be supplied in each case.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is it so?

original: yun shin tu ring ba dang / thung ngur 'tsho ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar skye dgu'i tshe lo brgyad khri pa yin pa na sku tshe lo brgyad khri pa yin la skye dgu'i tshe lo brgya pa yin pa na sku tshe lo brgya par @253b 'gyur ba'o //üîΩdus ji lta ba bzhin du rgyal rigs dang bram ze'i rigs tha dad pa ni gang gi tshe 'jig rten gyis rgyal rigs bkur pa de'i tshe rgyal rigs 'byung la /
analyzed: yun shin tu ring ba dang / thung ngur 'tsho ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar skye dgu'i tshe lo brgyad khri pa yin pa na sku tshe lo brgyad khri pa yin la skye dgu'i tshe lo brgya pa yin pa na sku tshe lo brgya par @253b 'gyur ba'o // dus ji lta ba bzhin du rgyal rigs dang bram ze'i rigs tha dad pa ni gang gi tshe 'jig rten gyis rgyal rigs bkur pa de'i tshe rgyal rigs 'byung la /
translated: Because they live for a very long or short time, that is, when the life expectancy of living beings is eighty thousand years, their life expectancy is eighty thousand years; when the life expectancy of living beings is one hundred years, their life expectancy is one hundred years.üîΩIn accordance with the time, the different castes of k·π£atriyas and brahmins appear. When the world honors the k·π£atriyas, the k·π£atriyas appear.

original: gang gi tshe bram ze bkur pa de'i tshe ni bram zer ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe bram ze bkur pa de'i tshe ni bram zer ro //
translated: When the world honors the brahmins, the brahmins appear.

original: dus ji lta ba bzhin du 'od srungs dang sh'akya la sogs pa gdung tha dad pa ni gang gi tshe 'jig rten na /
analyzed: dus ji lta ba bzhin du 'od srungs dang sh'akya la sogs pa gdung tha dad pa ni gang gi tshe 'jig rten na /
translated: The Buddha‚Äôs family line is different from that of KƒÅ≈õyapa, ≈öƒÅkyamuni, and so on, in accordance with the time.

original: rus gang ches mchod par 'os par 'gyur ba de'i tshe de'i gdung du 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: rus gang ches mchod par 'os par 'gyur ba de'i tshe de'i gdung du 'byung ba'o //
translated: When a family line is most worthy of worship in the world, he is born into that family line.üîΩThe Buddha‚Äôs body size is different, sometimes small and sometimes not small, in accordance with the time.

original: dus ji lta ba bzhin du sku bong tshod chung ba dang chung ba ma yin pa tha dad pa ni gang gi tshe 'jig rten na bong tshod chung ngu yin pa de'i tshe sku bong tshod chung la /
analyzed: dus ji lta ba bzhin du sku bong tshod chung ba dang chung ba ma yin pa tha dad pa ni gang gi tshe 'jig rten na bong tshod chung ngu yin pa de'i tshe sku bong tshod chung la /
translated: When the size of the body is small in the world, his body is small.

original: gang gi tshe bong tshod chung ba ma yin pa de'i tshe sku bong tshod chung ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe bong tshod chung ba ma yin pa de'i tshe sku bong tshod chung ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: When the size of the body is not small, his body is not small.

original: rnam pa gsum po 'di kho na zhes bya ba ni gang zhig thal ma thag tu sangs rgyas rnams mnyam pa nyid kyi rgyur bshad ba rgyu phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa dang / phan 'dogs pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum po 'di kho na zhes bya ba ni gang zhig thal ma thag tu sangs rgyas rnams mnyam pa nyid kyi rgyur bshad ba rgyu phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa dang / phan 'dogs pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: This is the only threefold perfection that is mentioned, namely, the perfection of cause, the perfection of effect, and the perfection of benefit, which were just mentioned as the causes of the equality of the buddhas.

original: sngon gyi bsod nams dang ye shes kyis yang dag par 'grub pas ni rgyu phun sum tshogs pa bstan la //
analyzed: sngon gyi bsod nams dang ye shes kyis yang dag par 'grub pas ni rgyu phun sum tshogs pa bstan la //
translated: The perfection of cause is shown by the perfection of merit and knowledge, because it is accomplished by the perfection of merit and knowledge.

original: chos kyi sku yongs su 'grub pas ni 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa dang / don spyod pas ni phan 'dogs pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sku yongs su 'grub pas ni 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa dang / don spyod pas ni phan 'dogs pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: The perfection of result is shown by the perfection of the Dharma Body, and the perfection of benefit is shown by the perfection of the performance of benefit.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs thams cad la goms pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs thams cad la goms pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The perfection of all the accumulations of merit and knowledge is called ‚Äúlong practice.‚Äù

original: bsod nams ye shes smos pa ni ci rigs par sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa lnga bsdus so //
analyzed: bsod nams ye shes smos pa ni ci rigs par sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa lnga bsdus so //
translated: The mention of merit and knowledge includes the five perfections of giving, etc., as appropriate.

original: ye shes smos pas ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: ye shes smos pas ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa kho na'o //
translated: The mention of knowledge includes only the perfection of wisdom.

original: yun ring po nas goms pa zhes bya ba ni bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du goms pa'o //
analyzed: yun ring po nas goms pa zhes bya ba ni bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du goms pa'o //
translated: Long practice means practice for three incalculable eons.

original: yun ring por goms kyang bar dang bcas pa yod pas /
analyzed: yun ring por goms kyang bar dang bcas pa yod pas /
translated: Even though one practices for a long time, there may be interruptions.

original: de'i phyir bar chad med pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bar chad med pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that it is uninterrupted,

original: bar chad med par bya dka' bas so //
analyzed: bar chad med par bya dka' bas so //
translated: because it is difficult to practice without interruption.

original: res 'ga' gus par ma byas par yang yin pas de'i phyir gus par byas te /
analyzed: res 'ga' gus par ma byas par yang yin pas de'i phyir gus par byas te /
translated: Sometimes, he is not worshipped. Therefore, he is worshipped.

original: gom pa zhes bya ba smos so //üîΩngan song gsum dang 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal las gtan du thar bar mdzad pa phun sum tshogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni ngan song gsum las thar bar mdzad pa phan 'dogs pa phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa gsum dang / 'khor ba las thar bar mdzad pa ste te de ltar na rnam pa bzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gom pa zhes bya ba smos so // ngan song gsum dang 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal las gtan du thar bar mdzad pa phun sum tshogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni ngan song gsum las thar bar mdzad pa phan 'dogs pa phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa gsum dang / 'khor ba las thar bar mdzad pa ste te de ltar na rnam pa bzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: He is said to be the one who is worshipped.üîΩHe is the one who is endowed with the perfect liberation from the suffering of the three lower realms and from cyclic existence.

original: yang na theg pa gsum dang bde 'gro la 'god par mdzad pa phun sum tshogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni theg pa gsum po re re la dgod pa phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa gsum dang bde 'gro la 'god pa ste rnam pa bzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na theg pa gsum dang bde 'gro la 'god par mdzad pa phun sum tshogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni theg pa gsum po re re la dgod pa phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa gsum dang bde 'gro la 'god pa ste rnam pa bzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: He is the one who is endowed with the perfect establishment in the three vehicles and in the happy realms.

original: ye shes phun sum @254a * //
analyzed: ye shes phun sum @254a * //
translated: He is the one who is endowed with the perfect knowledge of all things.

original: tshogs pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa bzhi po gang yin pa bde 'gro re re la yang de ltar rnam pa bzhir 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: tshogs pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa bzhi po gang yin pa bde 'gro re re la yang de ltar rnam pa bzhir 'byed pa'o //
translated: The assembly is also of four kinds. The four kinds of excellence of result are distinguished in this way for each happy destiny.

original: ma bstan par mkhyen pa zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis mngon par rdzogs pa'i byang chub pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: ma bstan par mkhyen pa zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis mngon par rdzogs pa'i byang chub pa'i don gyis so //
translated: Knowledge without teaching means by oneself, by the meaning of perfect enlightenment.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid ma lus par thugs su chud pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid ma lus par thugs su chud pa'i don gyis so //
translated: Omniscience means by the meaning of comprehending all specific and general characteristics without exception.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rnam pa thams cad du thugs su chud pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rnam pa thams cad du thugs su chud pa'i don gyis so //
translated: Knowledge of all aspects means by the meaning of comprehending all specific and general characteristics in all aspects.

original: ma 'bad par mkhyen pa ni bzhed pa tsam gyis thugs su chud pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: ma 'bad par mkhyen pa ni bzhed pa tsam gyis thugs su chud pa'i don gyis so //
translated: Knowledge without effort means by the meaning of comprehending by mere wish.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa zhes bya ba ni mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa khams gsum pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa zhes bya ba ni mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa khams gsum pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Abandonment of all afflictions means by abandoning the afflictions of the three realms to be abandoned by seeing and meditation.

original: gtan du spangs pa ni yongs su mi nyams pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: gtan du spangs pa ni yongs su mi nyams pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: Abandonment forever is by way of not falling away.

original: bag chags dang bcas te spangs pa ni rjes su 'brel ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bag chags dang bcas te spangs pa ni rjes su 'brel ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Abandonment together with the instinct is by way of not having a subsequent connection.

original: ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa'o zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa'o zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Abandonment of the obscurations of concentration and meditative attainment is because of being liberated from both aspects.

original: yul sprul pa dang yongs su sgyur ba dang byin gyis rlob pa'i mnga' phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba de la sprul pa ni spyi'i yul sngon med pa 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: yul sprul pa dang yongs su sgyur ba dang byin gyis rlob pa'i mnga' phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba de la sprul pa ni spyi'i yul sngon med pa 'byin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of the power of emanation, transformation, and blessing of the objective realm is as follows: Emanation is the creation of a general objective realm that did not exist before.

original: yongs su sgyur ba ni rdo la sogs pa gser la sogs pa'i dngos por mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su sgyur ba ni rdo la sogs pa gser la sogs pa'i dngos por mdzad pa'o //
translated: Transformation is the making of things such as stone into things such as gold.

original: byin gyis brlab pa ni yun ring du gnas par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: byin gyis brlab pa ni yun ring du gnas par mdzad pa'o //
translated: Blessing is the making of things such as food inexhaustible.

original: de dag la mnga' ba nyid ni bzhed pa'i sgo nas 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de dag la mnga' ba nyid ni bzhed pa'i sgo nas 'jug pa'o //
translated: The power over those is the engagement by way of will.

original: mnga' nyid phun sum tshogs pa ni mnga' phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: mnga' nyid phun sum tshogs pa ni mnga' phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: The perfection of the power is the perfection of the power.

original: sku tshe gtong ba dang byin gyis rlob pa'i mnga' de nyid phun sum tshogs pa ni sku tshe gtong ba dang byin gyis rlob pa'i mnga' phun sum tshogs pa'o //üîΩbsgribs pa la gshegs pa dang / nam mkha' la gshegs pa dang / shin tu ring ba la myur du gshegs pa dang / rdul phra rab chung ngur mang po ste /
analyzed: sku tshe gtong ba dang byin gyis rlob pa'i mnga' de nyid phun sum tshogs pa ni sku tshe gtong ba dang byin gyis rlob pa'i mnga' phun sum tshogs pa'o // bsgribs pa la gshegs pa dang / nam mkha' la gshegs pa dang / shin tu ring ba la myur du gshegs pa dang / rdul phra rab chung ngur mang po ste /
translated: The perfection of the power to enter into the subtle and the gross is the power to enter into the subtle and the gross.üîΩThe perfection of the power to enter into the obstructed, the sky, and the very distant, and to enter into the many in the small is the power to enter into the obstructed, the sky, the very distant, and the many in the small.üîΩThe perfection of the power to do what is to be done in the world is the power to do what is to be done in the world.üîΩThe perfection of the power to manifest various kinds of miracles is the power to manifest various kinds of miracles.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams 'jug par mdzad pa ni bsgribs pa dang / nam mkha' dang shin tu ring ba la myur du gshegs pa dang / chung ngur mang po 'jug par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams 'jug par mdzad pa ni bsgribs pa dang / nam mkha' dang shin tu ring ba la myur du gshegs pa dang / chung ngur mang po 'jug par mdzad pa'o //
translated: The perfection of the power to manifest various kinds of superknowledge is the power to manifest various kinds of superknowledge.üîΩThe perfection of the power to manifest various kinds of psychic power is the power to manifest various kinds of psychic power.üîΩThe perfection of the power to manifest various kinds of elocution is the power to manifest various kinds of elocution.üîΩThe perfection of the power to manifest various kinds of instruction is the power to manifest various kinds of instruction.

original: de dag la mnga' ba ni bzhed pa dgur mdzad pa ste de nyid phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag la mnga' ba ni bzhed pa dgur mdzad pa ste de nyid phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
translated: The perfection of the power to manifest various kinds of transformations is the power to manifest various kinds of transformations.üîΩThe perfection of the power to manifest various kinds of miracles, various kinds of superknowledge, various kinds of psychic power, various kinds of elocution, various kinds of instruction, and various kinds of transformations is the power to manifest various kinds of miracles, various kinds of superknowledge, various kinds of psychic power, various kinds of elocution, various kinds of instruction, and various kinds of transformations.

original: ya mtshan gyi chos nar ma rnam pa sna tshogs phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni nar ma rang bzhin gyis 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: ya mtshan gyi chos nar ma rnam pa sna tshogs phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni nar ma rang bzhin gyis 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: The perfection of the power to manifest various kinds of miracles, various kinds of superknowledge, various kinds of psychic power, various kinds of elocution, various kinds of instruction, and various kinds of transformations is the power to manifest various kinds of miracles, various kinds of superknowledge, various kinds of psychic power, various kinds of elocution, various kinds of instruction, and various kinds of transformations.üîΩThe perfection of the power to manifest various kinds of miracles, various kinds of superknowledge, various kinds of psychic power, various kinds of elocution, various kinds of instruction, and various kinds of transformations is the power to manifest various kinds of miracles, various kinds of superknowledge, various kinds of psychic power, various kinds of elocution, various kinds of instruction, and various kinds of transformations

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni gshegs pa na mthon dman mnyam par 'gyur @254b te ;
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni gshegs pa na mthon dman mnyam par 'gyur @254b te ;
translated: When the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, walk, the high places become low and the low places become high.

original: mtho ba gang yin pa de ni dma' bar 'gyur la dma' ba gang yin pa de ni mthon por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtho ba gang yin pa de ni dma' bar 'gyur la dma' ba gang yin pa de ni mthon por 'gyur ro //
translated: Whatever is high becomes low and whatever is low becomes high.

original: long ba rnams kyis ni mig 'thob bo //
analyzed: long ba rnams kyis ni mig 'thob bo //
translated: The blind obtain sight.

original: 'on pa rnams kyis ni rna ba 'thob bo //
analyzed: 'on pa rnams kyis ni rna ba 'thob bo //
translated: The deaf obtain hearing.üîΩThe insane obtain memory.

original: smyon pa rnams kyis ni dran pa 'thob bo zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'di ni chos nyid yin te /
analyzed: smyon pa rnams kyis ni dran pa 'thob bo zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'di ni chos nyid yin te /
translated: This is the nature of things.

original: thams cad rgyas par mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad rgyas par mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: All of this should be understood in detail as it is explained in the sutras.

original: mtshan phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni gsal ba rdzogs pa dang / yul na gnas pa'i phyir skyes bu chen po'i ngo bo nye bar mtshon pas mtshan dag ste /
analyzed: mtshan phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni gsal ba rdzogs pa dang / yul na gnas pa'i phyir skyes bu chen po'i ngo bo nye bar mtshon pas mtshan dag ste /
translated: The perfection of the major marks indicates the essence of a great being through the completion of the clear signs and the signs that exist in a particular place.

original: de dag ni gtsug tor la sogs pa sum cu rtsa gnyis so //
analyzed: de dag ni gtsug tor la sogs pa sum cu rtsa gnyis so //
translated: These are the thirty-two, such as the crown protrusion.

original: dpe byad bzang po phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dpe byad bzang po phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The perfection of the excellent minor marks

original: skyes bu chen po'i ngo bo gsal bar byed pa'i phyir dpe byad bzang po dag ste /
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i ngo bo gsal bar byed pa'i phyir dpe byad bzang po dag ste /
translated: The excellent minor marks clarify the nature of the great person.

original: de dag ni sen mo zangs kyi mdog lta bu la sogs pa brgyad cu'o //
analyzed: de dag ni sen mo zangs kyi mdog lta bu la sogs pa brgyad cu'o //
translated: They are the eighty minor marks, such as having copper-colored nails.

original: stobs phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni sred med kyi bu'i stobs dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: stobs phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni sred med kyi bu'i stobs dang ldan pas so //
translated: The perfection of power means that he has the power of Narayana.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi sku gdung rdo rje ltar sra ba ni mi phyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi sku gdung rdo rje ltar sra ba ni mi phyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Bhagavat's body is hard as a diamond because it is indestructible.

original: de ltar na de dag ni mdor bsdus pa yin no zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi che ba'i bdag nyid mdor bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na de dag ni mdor bsdus pa yin no zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi che ba'i bdag nyid mdor bsdus pa'o //
translated: Thus, they are summarized as follows. This is the summary of the greatness of the Buddhas.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: skyes bu dam pa rab tu dang ba skye ba gang yang rung sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la bstod pa dang bstod par 'gyur ba de dag thams cad phun sum tshogs pa gsum po 'di kho nas yin te /
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa rab tu dang ba skye ba gang yang rung sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la bstod pa dang bstod par 'gyur ba de dag thams cad phun sum tshogs pa gsum po 'di kho nas yin te /
translated: All those who have generated faith in the holy being and praise or will praise the Bhagavat Buddha do so by means of these three perfections alone.

original: ji skad du ;
analyzed: ji skad du ;
translated: As it is said:

original: tshogs ni bsags par dka' ba'i phyir //
analyzed: tshogs ni bsags par dka' ba'i phyir //
translated: Because the accumulation is difficult to gather,

original: sangs rgyas chos rnams bla med dang // 'gro ba'i don nyid mdzad pa nyid //üîΩsangs rgyas rnams la bsam par bya //
analyzed: sangs rgyas chos rnams bla med dang // 'gro ba'i don nyid mdzad pa nyid // sangs rgyas rnams la bsam par bya //
translated: The Buddha‚Äôs qualities are unsurpassed, and he acts for the benefit of the world.

original: zhes bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bshad do //
translated: One should reflect on the Buddhas.

original: gal te sku tshe bskal pa grangs med pa du mar zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /üîΩ'di skad du /
analyzed: gal te sku tshe bskal pa grangs med pa du mar zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste / 'di skad du /
translated: If the Blessed One, the Buddha, extends his life for many incalculable eons,üîΩthen the greatness of the Buddha is proclaimed and known.

original: gal te sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis bskal pa grangs med pa gnyis lan gsum du sku tshe byin gyis rlob par mdzad na /
analyzed: gal te sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis bskal pa grangs med pa gnyis lan gsum du sku tshe byin gyis rlob par mdzad na /
translated: If the Blessed One, the Buddha, extends his life for three times two incalculable eons,

original: de ltar na sangs rgyas kyi che ba'i bdag nyid gsungs pa dang mkhyen par spyod do zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //üîΩre zhig de ltar na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ltar na sangs rgyas kyi che ba'i bdag nyid gsungs pa dang mkhyen par spyod do zhes bstan par 'gyur ro // re zhig de ltar na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: then the greatness of the Buddha is proclaimed and known.

original: yon tan rnams dang ye shes rnams dang mthu dang phan 'dogs pa ni yon tan dang ye shes dang mthu dang phan 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan rnams dang ye shes rnams dang mthu dang phan 'dogs pa ni yon tan dang ye shes dang mthu dang phan 'dogs pa'o //
translated: Thus, the qualities, wisdoms, powers, and benefits are the qualities, wisdoms, powers, and benefits.

original: mtha' yas pa ni grangs dang mthu mthas gtugs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtha' yas pa ni grangs dang mthu mthas gtugs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Infinite means that the number and power are limitless.

original: rmad du byung ba ni sangs rgyas rnams las gzhan la med pa'i phyir dang / mdzad par dka' ba'i phyir dang / brnyes par dka' ba'i phyir ro //üîΩde nyid rin po che @255a * //
analyzed: rmad du byung ba ni sangs rgyas rnams las gzhan la med pa'i phyir dang / mdzad par dka' ba'i phyir dang / brnyes par dka' ba'i phyir ro // de nyid rin po che @255a * //
translated: It is marvelous because it does not exist in others, i.e., in the Buddhas, because it is difficult to perform, and because it is difficult to obtain.üîΩIt is a great jewel because

original: chen po yin te /
analyzed: chen po yin te /
translated: it is the source of those great jewels,

original: sems can thams cad la sman 'dogs pa'i phyir te /üîΩrin po che chen po de dag gi 'byung gnas yin no //üîΩsangs rgyas dang de'i chos la gus par mi byed ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la sman 'dogs pa'i phyir te / rin po che chen po de dag gi 'byung gnas yin no // sangs rgyas dang de'i chos la gus par mi byed ces bya ba ni /
translated: because it is the benefactor of all beings.üîΩIt is not respectful of the Buddha and his Dharma.

original: gus par byed pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gus par byed pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúnot respectful‚Äù is the meaning of ‚Äúnot respectful of the Buddha and his Dharma.‚Äù

original: lha zhes bya ba ni lha dag na yod pa ni lha'o //
analyzed: lha zhes bya ba ni lha dag na yod pa ni lha'o //
translated: The gods are those who exist among the gods.

original: 'bras bu med pa ma yin pa dang / yid du 'ong ba dang / mchog tu gyur pa dang / myur ba dang / mtha' bzang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'bras bu med pa ma yin pa dang / yid du 'ong ba dang / mchog tu gyur pa dang / myur ba dang / mtha' bzang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because it is not fruitless, because it is pleasant, because it is supreme, because it is swift, and because it has a good end.

original: de la bsod nams bya ba'i sa bon chung ngu yin yang 'bras bu med pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: de la bsod nams bya ba'i sa bon chung ngu yin yang 'bras bu med pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: Even though the seed of the meritorious work is small, it is not fruitless,

original: 'bras bu 'byin par nges par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'byin par nges par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is established as certain to yield a fruit.

original: 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu mngon par 'dod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu mngon par 'dod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The desirable result is the desired result, the result of evolution.

original: 'bras bu mchog tu gyur pa ni lha la sogs pa'i 'byor pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir dang / 'bras bu mang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu mchog tu gyur pa ni lha la sogs pa'i 'byor pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir dang / 'bras bu mang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The supreme result is the cause of the prosperity of gods and so on, and it is the abundant result.

original: 'bras bu myur ba ni mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu myur ba ni mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The quick result is the result experienced in this life.

original: 'bras bu mtha' bzang ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu mtha' bzang ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The good final result is the cause of nirvana.

original: ji skad bshad pa 'di /
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa 'di /
translated: This is what has been explained.

original: shes par byed pa ni gang dag rgyal ba zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: shes par byed pa ni gang dag rgyal ba zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
translated: The cause of knowledge is that which is called the Victorious One, etc.

original: 'dis nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa las rgyal bar byed pas na rgyal ba ste /
analyzed: 'dis nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa las rgyal bar byed pas na rgyal ba ste /
translated: It is the Victorious One because it causes victory over the addictions together with their instincts.

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: sdig chos las nga rgyal des na //
analyzed: sdig chos las nga rgyal des na //
translated: By that pride in sinful things

original: nyer song nga ni rgyal ba yin ;üîΩ/ zhes ji skad du gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: nyer song nga ni rgyal ba yin ;üîΩ/ zhes ji skad du gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: I have come to be called the Victor.üîΩThe cause of the abandonment of addictions is the cause of the abandonment of the addictions.

original: gdul ba 'dul bas rnam 'dren no //üîΩbya bas na bya ba ste /
analyzed: gdul ba 'dul bas rnam 'dren no // bya bas na bya ba ste /
translated: He is the Leader because he leads those to be trained.

original: mchod pa la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: mchod pa la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The activities are the worship, etc.

original: sna tshogs dag ces bya ba ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs dag ces bya ba ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'o //
translated: The various are those that occur in the desire, form, and formless realms.

original: bdud rtsi'i go 'phang ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //üîΩslob dang thun mong yin zhes rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bdud rtsi'i go 'phang ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o // slob dang thun mong yin zhes rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: The state of immortality is nirvana.üîΩThe disciples are the disciples of the Buddhas.üîΩThe Buddhas are the teachers of the disciples.üîΩThe disciples are the followers of the Buddhas.üîΩThe disciples are the vessels of the Buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chos thams cad ni dbang rnam par dag pa'i khyad par gyis rnam par dag pa'i phyir bla na med pa yin mod kyi slob ma dang thun mong yin no //üîΩso so'i skye bo dang thun mong yin no zhes yon tan thun mong ma yin pa'i rigs la dgongs nas brjod do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chos thams cad ni dbang rnam par dag pa'i khyad par gyis rnam par dag pa'i phyir bla na med pa yin mod kyi slob ma dang thun mong yin no // so so'i skye bo dang thun mong yin no zhes yon tan thun mong ma yin pa'i rigs la dgongs nas brjod do //
translated: The disciples are the retinue of the Buddhas.

original: ci rigs par zhes bya ba ni ji ltar srid par ro //
analyzed: ci rigs par zhes bya ba ni ji ltar srid par ro //
translated: The disciples are the sons of the Buddhas.üîΩThe disciples are the heirs of the Buddhas.üîΩThe disciples are the offspring of the Buddhas.üîΩThe disciples are the offspring of the Buddhas.üîΩThe disciples are the offspring of the Buddhas.üîΩThe disciples are the offspring of the Buddhas.üîΩThe disciples are the offspring of the Buddhas.üîΩThe disciples are the offspring of the Buddhas.üîΩThe disciples are the offspring of the Buddhas.üîΩThe disciples are the offspring of the Buddhas.üîΩThe disciples are the offspring of the Buddhas.üîΩThe disciples are the offspring of the Buddhas.üîΩThe disciples are the offspring of the Buddhas.üîΩThe disciples are the offspring of the Buddhas.üîΩThe disciples are the offspring of the Buddhas.üîΩThe disciples are the offspring of the Buddhas.üîΩThe disciples are the offspring of the Buddhas.üîΩThe disciples are the offspring of the Buddhas.üîΩThe disciples are the offspring of the Buddhas.üîΩThe disciples are the offspring of the Buddhas.üîΩThe disciples are the offspring of the Buddhas.üîΩThe disciples are the offspring of the Buddhas.üîΩThe disciples are the offspring of the Buddhas.üîΩThe disciples are the offspring of the Buddhas.üîΩThe disciples are the offspring of the Buddhas.üîΩThe disciples are the offspring of the Buddhas.üîΩThe disciples are the offspring of the Buddhas.üîΩThe disciples are the offspring of the Buddhas.üîΩThe disciples are the offspring of the Buddhas.üîΩThe disciples are the offspring of the Buddhas.

original: de la slob ma dang thun mong ba ni nyon mongs pa med pa dang / smon nas shes pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
analyzed: de la slob ma dang thun mong ba ni nyon mongs pa med pa dang / smon nas shes pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
translated: The first is common to disciples and so on, because it is the absence of affliction, knowledge through prayer, and the correct and discerning awarenesses.

original: so so'i skye bo dang thun mong ma yin pa ni mngon par shes pa lnga la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo dang thun mong ma yin pa ni mngon par shes pa lnga la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The second is not common to ordinary beings, because it is the five higher perceptions and so on.

original: zad par gyi skye mched la @255b sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams dang ting nge 'dzin gzhan dag bsdu'o //
analyzed: zad par gyi skye mched la @255b sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams dang ting nge 'dzin gzhan dag bsdu'o //
translated: The phrase and so on in the phrase the bases of subjugation and so on includes the concentrations of emptiness, wishlessness and signlessness and other concentrations.

original: dgra bcom pa la la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa la la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
translated: Some arhats

original: 'di na dgra bcom pa la la smad 'tshong ma dang zlos gar mkhan dang / g-yon can dang chang 'tshong la sogs pa'i skye ba dag la bdag dang gzhan gyi nyon mongs pa skye ba'i 'bras bu yid du mi 'ong ba rjes su 'brel pa dran nas /
analyzed: 'di na dgra bcom pa la la smad 'tshong ma dang zlos gar mkhan dang / g-yon can dang chang 'tshong la sogs pa'i skye ba dag la bdag dang gzhan gyi nyon mongs pa skye ba'i 'bras bu yid du mi 'ong ba rjes su 'brel pa dran nas /
translated: Some arhats remember the unpleasant results of the afflictions of self and others in their past lives as prostitutes, actors, swindlers, tavern owners and so on.

original: re zhig 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i rgyud la skyes pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyang 'bras bu yid du mi 'ong ba yin no /
analyzed: re zhig 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i rgyud la skyes pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyang 'bras bu yid du mi 'ong ba yin no /
translated: Even the afflictions that arise in a mind that is still attached to the object of attachment have an unpleasant result.üîΩWhen the afflictions arise in a mind that is free from attachment, what will be their condition?

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rgyud la skyes pa rnams kyi gnas skabs gang zhig du 'gyur snyam du de ltar rjes su sems shing bsams nas ji ltar gzhan dag la de la dmigs pa'i 'dod chags dang zhe sdang ngam nga rgyal lam /üîΩser sna 'am /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rgyud la skyes pa rnams kyi gnas skabs gang zhig du 'gyur snyam du de ltar rjes su sems shing bsams nas ji ltar gzhan dag la de la dmigs pa'i 'dod chags dang zhe sdang ngam nga rgyal lam / ser sna 'am /
translated: In this way, he contemplates and thinks about this.

original: phrag dog la sogs pa rnams las gang yang rung ba skye bar mi 'gyur ba de lta bu'i ngo bo'i shes pa skyed do //
analyzed: phrag dog la sogs pa rnams las gang yang rung ba skye bar mi 'gyur ba de lta bu'i ngo bo'i shes pa skyed do //
translated: He generates a cognition that is such that any of the following will not arise in relation to others: attachment, aversion, pride,üîΩgreed,üîΩor jealousy that has that as its object.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyud la sor mo'i phreng ba can la sogs pa rnams kyi nyon mongs pa skye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyud la sor mo'i phreng ba can la sogs pa rnams kyi nyon mongs pa skye ba'i phyir /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn said to A·πÖgulimƒÅla and others, ‚ÄúBecause the afflictions arise,

original: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das nyon mongs pa med pa la gnas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das nyon mongs pa med pa la gnas pa yin zhe na /
translated: how can the BhagavƒÅn abide in the absence of afflictions?‚Äù

original: skyon 'di ni med de /
analyzed: skyon 'di ni med de /
translated: This fault does not exist.

original: thugs rje mnga' ba gzhan dag gi nyon mongs pa gtan dbyung bar 'dod pa rnams ni res 'ga' dgos pa ches brling ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa skye ba btang snyoms su mdzad de /
analyzed: thugs rje mnga' ba gzhan dag gi nyon mongs pa gtan dbyung bar 'dod pa rnams ni res 'ga' dgos pa ches brling ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa skye ba btang snyoms su mdzad de /
translated: Others who possess compassion and desire to eliminate the passions of others sometimes generate the passions in order to benefit others,

original: mngon par rtogs pa'i skal ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'i skal ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they possess the fortune of realization.

original: nyan thos rnams ni bsam pa dang bag la nyal shes pa dang bral ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa rnam pa thams cad du dbyung bar mi nus te /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams ni bsam pa dang bag la nyal shes pa dang bral ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa rnam pa thams cad du dbyung bar mi nus te /
translated: ≈örƒÅvakas are unable to eliminate the passions in every way because they lack the knowledge of the thoughts and propensities of others.

original: de'i phyir dus re zhig spong bar byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir dus re zhig spong bar byed do //
translated: Therefore, they abandon the passions for a time.

original: 'dir mthong bas spang bar bya ba bsrung bar bya ba mi nus pas 'dod chags la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'dir mthong bas spang bar bya ba bsrung bar bya ba mi nus pas 'dod chags la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Here, attachment and so on are mentioned because the passions that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing cannot be guarded against.

original: nyon mongs par mi byed pa ni nyon mongs par byed pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nyon mongs par mi byed pa ni nyon mongs par byed pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthey do not become passionate‚Äù means they do not become passionate.

original: kun rdzob shes zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi rgyud kyi bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ma 'ongs pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: kun rdzob shes zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi rgyud kyi bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ma 'ongs pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúconventional knowledge‚Äù refers to future knowledge of the path of meditation that has the propensities of others as its object.

original: de ltar zhugs pa'i zag pa med pa'i shes pa ni yod pa ma yin no//
analyzed: de ltar zhugs pa'i zag pa med pa'i shes pa ni yod pa ma yin no//
translated: But the uncontaminated knowledge that engages in this way does not exist.

original: nyon mongs pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin las ma langs pa des /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin las ma langs pa des /
translated: Without rising from the concentration of nonconflict,

original: bdag mthong nas 'di'i 'dod chags skye bar 'gyur du 'ong ngo //
analyzed: bdag mthong nas 'di'i 'dod chags skye bar 'gyur du 'ong ngo //
translated: he sees himself and thinks, ‚ÄúIt is possible that attachment will arise for him,üîΩthat aversion, pride, or negligence will arise for him.‚Äù

original: 'di'i zhe sdang dang 'di'i nga rgyal dang / 'di'i bag med pa skye bar 'ong ngo snyam du ji lta ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa de lta de ltar ting nge 'dzin de las langs nas kyang mthun par spyod par byed do//
analyzed: 'di'i zhe sdang dang 'di'i nga rgyal dang / 'di'i bag med pa skye bar 'ong ngo snyam du ji lta ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa de lta de ltar ting nge 'dzin de las langs nas kyang mthun par spyod par byed do//
translated: In whatever way he wishes, he rises from that concentration and acts in accordance with his wish.

original: @256a * // bsam gtan mtha' na zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu dang 'gal ba'i phyir dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa lam sla ba rnams kyi mchog yin pa'i phyir bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: @256a * // bsam gtan mtha' na zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu dang 'gal ba'i phyir dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa lam sla ba rnams kyi mchog yin pa'i phyir bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa kho na yin no //
translated: The last absorption refers to the fourth absorption alone, because it is the antidote to the cause of suffering and because it is the best of the easy paths.

original: mi g-yo ba'i chos can gyi yin te //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i chos can gyi yin te //
translated: It belongs to the immovable being.

original: gzhan gyi rgyud la nyon mongs pa sel bar zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rgyud la nyon mongs pa sel bar zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he engages in eliminating the afflictions of others‚Äô mindstreams.

original: dgra bcom pa gzhan gyi ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni dus kyi rnam par grol ba'i ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa gzhan gyi ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni dus kyi rnam par grol ba'i ma yin pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúnot the other arhats‚Äù refers to those liberated according to circumstances.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúin their own continuum‚Äù means that they do not have mastery over concentration when they are subject to retrogressing.

original: rang gi rgyud las kyang zhes bya ba ni yongs su nyams pa'i tshe na ting nge 'dzin la dbang ba nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes gzhir bcas zhes bya ba ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba 'dod chags la sogs pa dag go //
analyzed: rang gi rgyud las kyang zhes bya ba ni yongs su nyams pa'i tshe na ting nge 'dzin la dbang ba nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes gzhir bcas zhes bya ba ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba 'dod chags la sogs pa dag go //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwith a basis‚Äù refers to the afflictions that are to be abandoned by cultivation, such as attachment.

original: ji ltar ma 'ongs pa'i nyon mongs pa la dmigs she na /
analyzed: ji ltar ma 'ongs pa'i nyon mongs pa la dmigs she na /
translated: How can they focus on future afflictions?

original: de'i phyir pha rol po dag nyon mongs pa skye bar ma gyur cig ces bya ba de ltar zhugs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir pha rol po dag nyon mongs pa skye bar ma gyur cig ces bya ba de ltar zhugs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚Äúbecause they are engaged in the thought ‚ÄòMay the afflictions of others not arise in this way.‚Äô‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir gzhi dang bcas pa rnams kho na la dmigs she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gzhi dang bcas pa rnams kho na la dmigs she na /
translated: Why do they focus on those afflictions that have a basis?

original: de'i phyir nyon mongs pa gzhi med pa rnams ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir nyon mongs pa gzhi med pa rnams ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚Äúbecause the afflictions that are without a basis are not objects to be abandoned by the path of cultivation.‚Äù

original: nyon mongs pa gzhi med pa ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa gzhi med pa ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams te /
translated: The afflictions that are without a basis are those that are to be abandoned by the path of vision.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa rnams ni khams dang sa thams cad la dmigs pa'i phyir bzlog par mi nus so //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa rnams ni khams dang sa thams cad la dmigs pa'i phyir bzlog par mi nus so //
translated: The afflicted views and so on cannot be averted because they focus on all realms and levels.

original: smon nas shes pa'ang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: smon nas shes pa'ang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: So too, knowledge through prayer.

original: nyon mongs pa med pa rang gi ngo bo dang sa dang rgyud dang rten las ji skad du bshad pa de bzhin du kun rdzob shes pa yang yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa rang gi ngo bo dang sa dang rgyud dang rten las ji skad du bshad pa de bzhin du kun rdzob shes pa yang yin te /
translated: Just as the nature, level, mindstream, and basis of the absence of conflict were explained, so too is conventional knowledge.

original: de'i dmigs pa thams cad do zhes bya ba 'di ni khyad par yin te /
analyzed: de'i dmigs pa thams cad do zhes bya ba 'di ni khyad par yin te /
translated: The difference is that all are its object.

original: thams cad la smon nas shes pa 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad la smon nas shes pa 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Knowledge through prayer engages all objects.

original: smon nas shes pa gzugs med pa rnams mngon sum du mi shes so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: smon nas shes pa gzugs med pa rnams mngon sum du mi shes so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Knowledge through prayer does not directly know formless states.

original: smon nas shes pa bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: smon nas shes pa bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: This is because knowledge through prayer is on the level of the fourth absorption.

original: mngon par shes pa rang dang 'og ma'i sa'i yul can yin la /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa rang dang 'og ma'i sa'i yul can yin la /
translated: Higher perception is an object of its own level and lower levels.

original: smon nas shes pa yang mngon par shes pa dang 'dra'o zhes bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: smon nas shes pa yang mngon par shes pa dang 'dra'o zhes bshad par bya'o //
translated: Knowledge through prayer should be explained in the same way as higher perception.

original: rgyu mthun pa dang spyod pa'i bye brag las zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa dang spyod pa'i bye brag las zhes bya ba la /
translated: From the specificities of natural outcome and practice.

original: rgyu mthun pa ni dman zhing dman pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa ni dman zhing dman pa'o //
translated: Natural outcome is inferior to inferior.

original: spyod pa ni zhi gnas lhag pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: spyod pa ni zhi gnas lhag pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'o //
translated: Practice is the practice of meditative concentration that is superior to calm.

original: gzugs med pa nas shi 'phos nas 'dod pa dang gzugs su skyes pa ni rgyu mthun pa'i bye brag las so //
analyzed: gzugs med pa nas shi 'phos nas 'dod pa dang gzugs su skyes pa ni rgyu mthun pa'i bye brag las so //
translated: One who dies in the formless realm and is reborn in the desire realm or form realm is from the specificity of natural outcome.

original: 'di nas shi 'phos nas gzugs med pa gang du skye ba gang yin pa de ni spyod pa'i bye brag las so //üîΩde ltar na 'bras bus rgyu rjes su dpag la /
analyzed: 'di nas shi 'phos nas gzugs med pa gang du skye ba gang yin pa de ni spyod pa'i bye brag las so // de ltar na 'bras bus rgyu rjes su dpag la /
translated: One who dies here and is reborn in the formless realm is from the specificity of practice.

original: rgyus kyang 'bras bu rjes su dpag go zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyus kyang 'bras bu rjes su dpag go zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the cause is inferred from the effect, and the effect is inferred from the cause.üîΩThis is the teaching.

original: 'dir dpe @256b ni zhing sa lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni dper na zhing sas 'bras bu dang 'bras bus sa bon dang / sa bon gyis 'bras bu rtogs pa de bzhin du 'dir yang yin no //
analyzed: 'dir dpe @256b ni zhing sa lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni dper na zhing sas 'bras bu dang 'bras bus sa bon dang / sa bon gyis 'bras bu rtogs pa de bzhin du 'dir yang yin no //
translated: The example here is like a field, for example, because a field is understood from a crop, a seed is understood from a crop, and a crop is understood from a seed.

original: smon pa sngar btang ba zhes bya ba ni gtod pa sngar btang ste /
analyzed: smon pa sngar btang ba zhes bya ba ni gtod pa sngar btang ste /
translated: It is said that the aspiration was made previously.

original: smon nas zhes bya ba 'di ni gtad nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: smon nas zhes bya ba 'di ni gtad nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The term aspiring has the sense of aiming at.

original: ha cang thal ba spang ba'i phyir ting nge 'dzin de'i yul du ji tsam gyur pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: ha cang thal ba spang ba'i phyir ting nge 'dzin de'i yul du ji tsam gyur pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In order to avoid an absurd consequence, he says, to the extent that they are the domain of that concentration.

original: 'di dag gi dmigs pa dang / sa dang / rang gi ngo bo'i bye brag bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di dag gi dmigs pa dang / sa dang / rang gi ngo bo'i bye brag bya ba la /
translated: The distinctions of their objects, levels, and individual natures are to be stated.

original: bye brag ces bya ba'i sgras ni dmigs pa'i bye brag dang / sa'i bye brag dang ngo bo'i bye brag ces re re la sbyar ro //üîΩthogs med ces bya ba ni thogs par mi nus pas na thogs med de /
analyzed: bye brag ces bya ba'i sgras ni dmigs pa'i bye brag dang / sa'i bye brag dang ngo bo'i bye brag ces re re la sbyar ro // thogs med ces bya ba ni thogs par mi nus pas na thogs med de /
translated: The term distinction refers to the distinction of object, the distinction of level, and the distinction of nature.

original: thogs pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: thogs pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The term unimpeded means that they are not impeded, that is, they are not obstructed.

original: chos so so yang dag par rig pa ni ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs dag la thogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: chos so so yang dag par rig pa ni ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs dag la thogs pa med pa'o //
translated: The unimpeded knowledge of phenomena is the unimpeded knowledge of the collections of names, expressions, and letters.

original: gsum po 'di dag ni shes bya khong du chud pa 'dzin par byed pa'i phyir chos zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gsum po 'di dag ni shes bya khong du chud pa 'dzin par byed pa'i phyir chos zhes bya'o //
translated: These three are called dharmas because they hold the understanding of the knowable.

original: don so so yang dag par rig pa ni chos rnams kyi don dam pa la thogs pa med pa'i shes pa ste /
analyzed: don so so yang dag par rig pa ni chos rnams kyi don dam pa la thogs pa med pa'i shes pa ste /
translated: The correct knowledge of the meaning is the unobstructed knowledge of the ultimate meaning of the teachings.

original: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis shes pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis shes pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is the knowledge of the general and particular characteristics of the teachings.

original: nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa ni ngag gi sbyor ba la thogs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa ni ngag gi sbyor ba la thogs pa med pa ste /
translated: The correct knowledge of etymology is the unobstructed knowledge of the application of language.

original: rtags dang dus dang byed pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba shes pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rtags dang dus dang byed pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba shes pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the knowledge of the application of the linguistic signs of gender, time, action, etc.

original: rigs pa thags thogs med /üîΩmngon brjod ces bya ba la /
analyzed: rigs pa thags thogs med / mngon brjod ces bya ba la /
translated: The correct knowledge of eloquence is the unobstructed knowledge of the expression of the Dharma.

original: rigs pa ni don dang 'brel pa'o //üîΩthags thogs med pa ni thogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rigs pa ni don dang 'brel pa'o // thags thogs med pa ni thogs pa med pa'o //
translated: The expression of the Dharma is the teaching of the Dharma.

original: de mngon par brjod pa ni de brjod pa ste /üîΩde'i dngos po ni rigs pa thags thogs med /üîΩmngon brjod nyid do //
analyzed: de mngon par brjod pa ni de brjod pa ste / de'i dngos po ni rigs pa thags thogs med / mngon brjod nyid do //
translated: The knowledge of that is the correct knowledge of eloquence.

original: mdor bsdus na chos dang don so so yang dag par rig pa gnyis ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa shes pa nyid do //
analyzed: mdor bsdus na chos dang don so so yang dag par rig pa gnyis ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa shes pa nyid do //
translated: In brief, the two correct knowledges of the teaching and the meaning are the knowledge of the conventional and ultimate truths.

original: 'di ni re zhig rnal 'byor pa'i bdag la phan pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni re zhig rnal 'byor pa'i bdag la phan pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: This is the complete benefit for the yogi's self.

original: gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa ni nges pa'i tshig so sor yang dag par rig pa ston pa la mkhas pa dang spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa dri ba dang brtsad pa gtan la dbab pa dang spang ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa ni nges pa'i tshig so sor yang dag par rig pa ston pa la mkhas pa dang spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa dri ba dang brtsad pa gtan la dbab pa dang spang ba shes pa'o //
translated: The complete benefit for others is skill in teaching the analytical knowledge of the teaching, and the analytical knowledge of eloquence, which is the knowledge of questions, debates, decisions, and abandonment.

original: ting nge 'dzin la dbang ba gsal bar bya ba la thogs pa med pa zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin la dbang ba gsal bar bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin la dbang ba gsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la dbang ba gsal bar bya ba la thogs pa med pa zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin la dbang ba gsal bar bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin la dbang ba gsal bar bya'o //
translated: The statement mastery over concentration is unobstructed in clarity means that mastery over concentration is clarity.

original: gsal ba yang ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: gsal ba yang ci zhig ce na /
translated: What is clarity?

original: mi brjed pa'o zhes pa dgu'o zhes bya ba ni re zhig ngag la dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba la dmigs @257a * //
analyzed: mi brjed pa'o zhes pa dgu'o zhes bya ba ni re zhig ngag la dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba la dmigs @257a * //
translated: It is non-forgetfulness. These are the nine. The object of speech is the truths of suffering and origin.

original: pa'i phyir sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang zad pa dang mi skye ba dang chos dang rjes dang kun rdzob shes pa rnams yin no //
analyzed: pa'i phyir sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang zad pa dang mi skye ba dang chos dang rjes dang kun rdzob shes pa rnams yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are the knowledges of suffering, origin, cessation, path, extinction, nonproduction, the conventional, and the principle.

original: lam la dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni zad pa dang mi skye ba dang chos dang rjes dang lam dang gzhan gyi sems dang kun rdzob shes pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: lam la dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni zad pa dang mi skye ba dang chos dang rjes dang lam dang gzhan gyi sems dang kun rdzob shes pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
translated: The knowledge that has the path as its object has the nature of the knowledge of extinction, nonproduction, the principle, subsequent, the path, the minds of others, and the conventional.

original: ngag dang lam gnyis las gang yang rung ba zhig la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la ngag la dmigs pa ni 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang po na'o //
analyzed: ngag dang lam gnyis las gang yang rung ba zhig la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la ngag la dmigs pa ni 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang po na'o //
translated: Because it has either speech or the path as its object. Speech is the object of the knowledge of the conventional in the desire realm and the first absorption.

original: lam la dmigs pa ni srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar na'o //
analyzed: lam la dmigs pa ni srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar na'o //
translated: The path is the object of the knowledge of the conventional up to the summit of existence.

original: lam smos pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'i lam bzung ngo //
analyzed: lam smos pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'i lam bzung ngo //
translated: The mention of the path includes both the contaminated and uncontaminated paths.

original: gal te chos thams cad lan na ni shes pa bcu'o zhes bya ba ni gang zhig ci rigs par shes pa bcu'i yul du mi 'gyur ba de ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad lan na ni shes pa bcu'o zhes bya ba ni gang zhig ci rigs par shes pa bcu'i yul du mi 'gyur ba de ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: If it has all phenomena as its object, then it is the ten knowledges. There is no phenomenon that is not the object of one of the ten knowledges, as is appropriate.

original: gzhan kun rdzob ces bya ba ni chos dang nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa dag ni ming gi tshogs la sogs pa dang / ngag la dmigs pa nyid kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can yin pa'i phyir kun rdzob shes pa rang bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan kun rdzob ces bya ba ni chos dang nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa dag ni ming gi tshogs la sogs pa dang / ngag la dmigs pa nyid kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can yin pa'i phyir kun rdzob shes pa rang bzhin no //
translated: The others are conventional knowledge. The analytical knowledges of dharma and of language have as their nature conventional knowledge, because they have as their object the aggregate of names, etc., and speech.

original: zag pa med pa'i shes pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam par ram sdug bsngal gyi phyogs gcig la mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i shes pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam par ram sdug bsngal gyi phyogs gcig la mi 'jug ste /
translated: Uncontaminated knowledge does not engage in the aspect of its own characteristic or in one part of suffering.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then what?

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la spyi'i rnam par 'jug pas de'i phyir de dag zag pa med pa'i shes pa'i bdag nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la spyi'i rnam par 'jug pas de'i phyir de dag zag pa med pa'i shes pa'i bdag nyid ma yin no //
translated: It engages in the aspect of the general characteristics of the five appropriated aggregates. Therefore it is not by nature uncontaminated knowledge.

original: yan chad na ming gi tshogs med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'dis ni gzugs med pa dag na chos so so yang dag par rig pa med do zhes ston to //
analyzed: yan chad na ming gi tshogs med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'dis ni gzugs med pa dag na chos so so yang dag par rig pa med do zhes ston to //
translated: Because there is no aggregate of names above, this shows that the analytical knowledge of dharma does not exist in the formless realm.

original: ming gi tshogs bkag pa kho nas tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs bkag pa ste /
analyzed: ming gi tshogs bkag pa kho nas tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs bkag pa ste /
translated: The aggregate of words and the aggregate of letters are negated by the negation of the aggregate of names alone.

original: phan tshun mi 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //üîΩyan chad na rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa dang / bsam gtan khyad par can na nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa med de /
analyzed: phan tshun mi 'khrul pa'i phyir ro // yan chad na rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa dang / bsam gtan khyad par can na nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa med de /
translated: because they are not confused with each other.

original: dag kun nas slong ba rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dag kun nas slong ba rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Above that, up to the fourth meditation, there is no analytical knowledge of etymology because there is no discursive thought that instigates speech.

original: btags pa las zhes bya ba ni btags pa'i bstan bcos las so //
analyzed: btags pa las zhes bya ba ni btags pa'i bstan bcos las so //
translated: The treatise that is designated is the treatise that is designated by the name of the subject matter.

original: 'di skad du zhes bya ba ni ji skad 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'di skad du zhes bya ba ni ji skad 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: This is what is said means what will be explained.

original: tshig dang yi ge zhes bya ba ni 'dis tshig gsal bar byed pas na yi ge ste ming ngo //
analyzed: tshig dang yi ge zhes bya ba ni 'dis tshig gsal bar byed pas na yi ge ste ming ngo //
translated: Words and letters means that which clarifies words is letters, i.e., names.

original: de nyid kyi don zhes bya ba ni tshig dang yi ge'i 'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi don zhes bya ba ni tshig dang yi ge'i 'o //
translated: That itself is the meaning means the meaning of words and letters.

original: de nyid kyi gcig dang zhes bya ba ni don gyi'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi gcig dang zhes bya ba ni don gyi'o //
translated: That itself is one means the meaning of the object.

original: de la thags thogs med par bya ba la zhes bya ba ni tshig dang yi ge la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: de la thags thogs med par bya ba la zhes bya ba ni tshig dang yi ge la sogs pa la'o //
translated: With regard to that, unimpeded activity means with regard to words, letters and so on.

original: thogs pa med par shes pa'i zhes bya ba ni @257b rdugs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: thogs pa med par shes pa'i zhes bya ba ni @257b rdugs pa med pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWithout obstruction‚Äù means without difficulty.

original: pho dang mo la sogs pa'i tshig bla dags zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni ma ning dang byed pa pa la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: pho dang mo la sogs pa'i tshig bla dags zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni ma ning dang byed pa pa la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: The words ‚Äúmale, female, and so on‚Äù include the words ‚Äúneuter‚Äù and ‚Äúeunuch‚Äù and so on.

original: tshig gcig nyid la sogs pa'i dbang du byas pa'i tshig ni tshig bla dags so //
analyzed: tshig gcig nyid la sogs pa'i dbang du byas pa'i tshig ni tshig bla dags so //
translated: The word ‚Äúname‚Äù is used in the sense of a single word and so on.

original: de nyid kyi 'di dag gi go rims grub pa yin no zhes bya ba gang gi phyir tshig dang yi ge zhes rgyas par ji skad du bshad pa 'di rim pa yin pas so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi 'di dag gi go rims grub pa yin no zhes bya ba gang gi phyir tshig dang yi ge zhes rgyas par ji skad du bshad pa 'di rim pa yin pas so //
translated: The order of these is established because the order of words and letters is as has been explained in detail.üîΩ‚ÄúName‚Äù is a synonym for definition.

original: tshig nges pa ni nges pa'i tshig ste zhes bya ba nas dper na ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: tshig nges pa ni nges pa'i tshig ste zhes bya ba nas dper na ji ltar zhe na /
translated: For example, what is it like?

original: dper na gzugs su rung ba zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dper na gzugs su rung ba zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is like the expression ‚Äúcapable of materiality.‚Äù

original: rnam par shes pa na rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa na rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: Consciousness is that which is conscious.

original: sems pas na sems so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sems pas na sems so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Mind is that which thinks.

original: go rims bzhin du zhes bya ba ni ji ltar zhe na chos so so yang dag par rig pa'i sbyor ba ni rtsis yin no //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du zhes bya ba ni ji ltar zhe na chos so so yang dag par rig pa'i sbyor ba ni rtsis yin no //
translated: The application of the analytical knowledge of the teachings is calculation.

original: don so so yang dag par rig pa ni sangs rgyas kyi bka'o //
analyzed: don so so yang dag par rig pa ni sangs rgyas kyi bka'o //
translated: The analytical knowledge of the meaning is the Buddha's word.

original: nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa ni sgra rig pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa ni sgra rig pa'o //
translated: The analytical knowledge of language is grammar.

original: spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa ni gtan tshigs rig pa'o //üîΩbye brag tu smra ba rnams na re sangs rgyas kyi bka' kho na yin te /
analyzed: spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa ni gtan tshigs rig pa'o // bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re sangs rgyas kyi bka' kho na yin te /
translated: The analytical knowledge of prowess is logic.

original: chos 'di pa rnams kho na de skyed pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: chos 'di pa rnams kho na de skyed pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas say that the Buddha's word is the analytical knowledge of the teachings, because it is the cause of the analytical knowledge of the teachings.üîΩThe analytical knowledge of the meaning is the Buddha's word, because it is the result of the analytical knowledge of the teachings.üîΩThe analytical knowledge of language is grammar, because it is the cause of the analytical knowledge of language.üîΩThe analytical knowledge of prowess is logic, because it is the result of the analytical knowledge of language.

original: gang la gcig yod pa de la gdon mi za bar so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi char yod de zhes bya ba ni lam gcig gi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang la gcig yod pa de la gdon mi za bar so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi char yod de zhes bya ba ni lam gcig gi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If one has any one of the analytical knowledges, one necessarily has all four, because they are the result of a single path.

original: ma tshang bar ni de thob med //
analyzed: ma tshang bar ni de thob med //
translated: One does not obtain them without deficiency.

original: ces bya ba ni 'gas kyang so so yang dag par rig pa dag ma tshang bar 'thob par mi 'gyur ro de dag ni rab kyi mtha' ba'i bsam gtan gyi stobs kyis 'thob bo zhes bya ba ni de dag rab kyi mtha' ba'i bsam gtan gyis ma bsdusüîΩpa nyid de /üîΩngag ni 'dod dad dang po na //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni 'gas kyang so so yang dag par rig pa dag ma tshang bar 'thob par mi 'gyur ro de dag ni rab kyi mtha' ba'i bsam gtan gyi stobs kyis 'thob bo zhes bya ba ni de dag rab kyi mtha' ba'i bsam gtan gyis ma bsdus pa nyid de / ngag ni 'dod dad dang po na //
translated: because they are not subsumed by the final summit of existence.

original: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Speech is in the desire realm and the first absorption.

original: nyon mongs pa med pa la sogs pa yon tan rnams ni rab kyi mtha' ba'i bsam gtan bzhi pa bskyed nas 'thob kyi /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa la sogs pa yon tan rnams ni rab kyi mtha' ba'i bsam gtan bzhi pa bskyed nas 'thob kyi /
translated: The qualities of the uncontaminated and so on are obtained after generating the final summit of existence,

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: but not otherwise.

original: rab kyi mtha' ba de nyid ces bya ba la /
analyzed: rab kyi mtha' ba de nyid ces bya ba la /
translated: The final summit of existence itself

original: de nyid nyon mongs pa med pa la sogs pa las tha dad pa sbyor ba las byung ba bsam gtan bzhi pa chen po'i chen po'o //
analyzed: de nyid nyon mongs pa med pa la sogs pa las tha dad pa sbyor ba las byung ba bsam gtan bzhi pa chen po'i chen po'o //
translated: is the great great fourth absorption that arises from preparation, which is distinct from the uncontaminated and so on.üîΩThey are obtained by the power of that,

original: de'i stobs kyis 'thob pa yin gyi zhes bya ba ni rab kyi mtha' ba'i stobs kyis so //
analyzed: de'i stobs kyis 'thob pa yin gyi zhes bya ba ni rab kyi mtha' ba'i stobs kyis so //
translated: that is, by the power of the final summit of existence.

original: de bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not on the level of the fourth meditation,

original: de na rtog pa med pa'i phyir dang rtog pa dang bcas pa'i sems kyis de kun nas slong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de na rtog pa med pa'i phyir dang rtog pa dang bcas pa'i sems kyis de kun nas slong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no conception there, and because it is projected by a mind that is associated with conception.

original: nyon mongs pa med pa la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams rab kyi mtha' ba'i bsam gtan @258a * //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams rab kyi mtha' ba'i bsam gtan @258a * //
translated: The qualities of the absence of conflict and so on are included in the fourth meditation, which is the highest limit of the summit of existence.

original: gyis bsdus pas de'i bdag nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: gyis bsdus pas de'i bdag nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are said to have that as their nature.

original: 'phel ba'i rab tu phyin pa yin //
analyzed: 'phel ba'i rab tu phyin pa yin //
translated: They are the culmination of the increase of the wholesome.

original: zhes bya ba ni thams cad ma yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni thams cad ma yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: This means that they are not all.

original: de ni sa kun gyis mthun byas //
analyzed: de ni sa kun gyis mthun byas //
translated: They are taken up by all the stages.

original: zhes bya ba ni sa kun gyis nye bar gzung zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sa kun gyis nye bar gzung zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that they are taken up by all the stages.

original: mi mthun pa ni zhes bya ba ni 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched nas ci yang med pa'i skye mched la'o //üîΩde nas rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched ma yin pa nas /
analyzed: mi mthun pa ni zhes bya ba ni 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched nas ci yang med pa'i skye mched la'o // de nas rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched ma yin pa nas /
translated: The absence of conflict is incompatible with the sphere of neither conception nor non-conception, up to the sphere of nothingness.

original: de bzhin du 'dod pa na spyod pa'i bar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dod pa na spyod pa'i bar ro //
translated: Then, it is incompatible with the sphere of the infinity of consciousness, up to the realm of desire.

original: 'di la mthar rab tu phyin pa yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'di la 'phel ba rab tu gyur pa yod ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di la mthar rab tu phyin pa yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'di la 'phel ba rab tu gyur pa yod ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because it has a final culmination. This means that it has a culmination that is an increase.
