original: mu bzhi pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni ji ltar mu bzhi rnam pa bzhi yin pa de bzhin du rab kyi mtha' yang rnam pa'i mthar rab tu phyin pa yin no //
analyzed: mu bzhi pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni ji ltar mu bzhi rnam pa bzhi yin pa de bzhin du rab kyi mtha' yang rnam pa'i mthar rab tu phyin pa yin no //
translated: Like the four possibilities. Just as the four possibilities have four aspects, so the culmination of the culmination is the culmination of the culmination.

original: sangs rgyas las gzhan zhes bya ba ni nyan thos sam rang sangs rgyas ni sbyor ba las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas las gzhan zhes bya ba ni nyan thos sam rang sangs rgyas ni sbyor ba las byung ba yin no //
translated: Other than a Buddha. A Sravaka or a Pratyekabuddha is born from application.

original: chos thams cad kyi dbang phyug yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni chos rnams de'i mangs 'jug pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi dbang phyug yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni chos rnams de'i mangs 'jug pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because he is the lord of all dharmas. This means that all dharmas are his servants.

original: mngon par shes pa la sogs pa ni so so'i skye ba dag dang / yang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa la sogs pa ni so so'i skye ba dag dang / yang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The higher faculties, etc. are of ordinary beings, Sravakas, etc.

original: yang gi sgras ni nyan thos rnams dang yang ngo //
analyzed: yang gi sgras ni nyan thos rnams dang yang ngo //
translated: And also means and also Sravakas.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi yul shes pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa zhes bya ba ni /üîΩ'dis sprul pa dang nam mkha' la 'gro ba 'byor par byed pas na /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi yul shes pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa zhes bya ba ni / 'dis sprul pa dang nam mkha' la 'gro ba 'byor par byed pas na /
translated: is the concentration by means of which one actualizes the knowledge of the object of magical power.

original: rdzu 'phrul te ;üîΩting nge 'dzin to //üîΩrdzu 'phrul gyi yul ni /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul te ; ting nge 'dzin to // rdzu 'phrul gyi yul ni /
translated: Magical power is the object of magical power.üîΩIt is the concentration by means of which one actualizes the knowledge of the object of magical power.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi yul te /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi yul te /
translated: The object of magical power is the object of magical power.

original: sprul pa dang nam mkha' la 'gro ba'o //üîΩrdzu 'phrul gyi yul gyi shes pa ni /üîΩrdzu 'phrul gyi yul gyi shes pa ste /
analyzed: sprul pa dang nam mkha' la 'gro ba'o // rdzu 'phrul gyi yul gyi shes pa ni / rdzu 'phrul gyi yul gyi shes pa ste /
translated: It is the magical creation of objects and the movement through space.üîΩThe knowledge of the object of magical power is the knowledge of the object of magical power.

original: de mngon du bya ba ni mngon sum du byed pa'o //
analyzed: de mngon du bya ba ni mngon sum du byed pa'o //
translated: It is the concentration by means of which one actualizes the knowledge of the object of magical power.üîΩThe superknowledge called ‚Äúthe realization of the knowledge of the divine ear‚ÄùüîΩis the concentration by means of which one actualizes the knowledge of the divine ear.üîΩThe divine ear is the ear of the gods.üîΩThe knowledge based on the divine ear is the knowledge of the divine ear.

original: lha'i rna ba zhes bya ba ni lha'i rna ba la brten pa'i shes pa ni lha'i rna ba'i shes pa ste /üîΩde mngon du byed pa ni mngon sum du byed pa'o //
analyzed: lha'i rna ba zhes bya ba ni lha'i rna ba la brten pa'i shes pa ni lha'i rna ba'i shes pa ste / de mngon du byed pa ni mngon sum du byed pa'o //
translated: It is the concentration by means of which one actualizes the knowledge of the divine ear.üîΩThe superknowledge called ‚Äúthe realization of the knowledge of the categories of mind‚ÄùüîΩis the concentration by means of which one actualizes the knowledge of the categories of mind.

original: sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa ni sems kyi bye brag shes pa ste /
analyzed: sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa ni sems kyi bye brag shes pa ste /
translated: The knowledge of the categories of mind is the knowledge of the distinctions of mind.

original: gzhan gyi sems chags pa dang sdang ba dang rmongs pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems chags pa dang sdang ba dang rmongs pa shes pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge of the attachment, hatred, and confusion of others.

original: yang na rnam grangs ni rim pa ste /
analyzed: yang na rnam grangs ni rim pa ste /
translated: Or, category means order.

original: res 'ga' chags so snyam du shes la /
analyzed: res 'ga' chags so snyam du shes la /
translated: Sometimes one knows, ‚ÄúI am attached,‚Äù

original: res 'ga' sdang ngo snyam du shes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: res 'ga' sdang ngo snyam du shes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: sometimes one knows, ‚ÄúI am averse,‚Äù and so on.

original: sngon gyi gnas ni sngon gyi gnas so //
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas ni sngon gyi gnas so //
translated: The former abode is the former birth.

original: sngon gyi gnas kyi dran pa ni sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa ste /
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas kyi dran pa ni sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa ste /
translated: The memory of the former abode is the recollection of the former birth.

original: de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes pa ni sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes pa ni sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge that is concomitant with that is the knowledge recollecting the former abode.

original: 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba ni 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba dag go //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba ni 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba dag go //
translated: Death and birth are death and birth.

original: de dag shes pa ni 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba @258b shes pa ste /
analyzed: de dag shes pa ni 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba @258b shes pa ste /
translated: The knowledge of those is the knowledge of death and birth.

original: 'di ni lha'i mig gi mngon par shes par bshad do //
analyzed: 'di ni lha'i mig gi mngon par shes par bshad do //
translated: This is explained as the superknowledge of the divine eye.

original: zag pa rnams zad pa ni zag pa zad pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa rnams zad pa ni zag pa zad pa'o //
translated: The exhaustion of the contaminants is the exhaustion of the contaminants.

original: de'i shes pa ni zag pa zad pa shes pa ste /
analyzed: de'i shes pa ni zag pa zad pa shes pa ste /
translated: The knowledge of that is the knowledge of the exhaustion of the contaminants.

original: de mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa zhes re re la sbyar ro //
analyzed: de mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa zhes re re la sbyar ro //
translated: Each is connected with the superknowledge that manifests that.

original: lnga ni so so'i skye bo rnams dang thun mong ba yin no zhes bya ba ni tha ma ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: lnga ni so so'i skye bo rnams dang thun mong ba yin no zhes bya ba ni tha ma ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: Five are common to ordinary beings, meaning except for the last one.

original: dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu bzhin du zhes bya ba ni ji ltar dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu 'dus byas rnam par grol ba'i lam gyis bsdus pa de bzhin du mngon par shes pa yang yin gyi /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu bzhin du zhes bya ba ni ji ltar dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu 'dus byas rnam par grol ba'i lam gyis bsdus pa de bzhin du mngon par shes pa yang yin gyi /
translated: just as the four fruits of the sramana are subsumed by the liberated path that is conditioned, so too are the higher perceptions.

original: bar chad med pa'i lam ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam ni ma yin te /
translated: They are not subsumed by the uninterrupted path,

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa bar chad med pa'i lam la bkag pa'i phyir dang / zag pa zad par byed pa'i bar chad med pa'i lam btang nas dgra bcom pa yang mngon par shes pa med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa bar chad med pa'i lam la bkag pa'i phyir dang / zag pa zad par byed pa'i bar chad med pa'i lam btang nas dgra bcom pa yang mngon par shes pa med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the knowledge of others minds is blocked on the uninterrupted path and because it would follow that arhats would not possess higher perception if they relinquished the uninterrupted path that brings about the elimination of contaminants.

original: de'i phyir mngon par shes pa ni rnam par grol ba'i lam gyis bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mngon par shes pa ni rnam par grol ba'i lam gyis bsdus pa yin no //
translated: Therefore higher perception is subsumed by the liberated path.

original: bzhi ni kun rdzob shes pa ste //
analyzed: bzhi ni kun rdzob shes pa ste //
translated: Four are conventional knowledge.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar gsum gyi dmigs pa ni gzugs kho na yin la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar gsum gyi dmigs pa ni gzugs kho na yin la /
translated: The focal object of the first three is form alone.

original: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i mngon par shes pa sngon gyi mtha' la dmigs pa yin na //
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i mngon par shes pa sngon gyi mtha' la dmigs pa yin na //
translated: The higher perception recalling past lives focuses on the past.

original: zag pa med pa'i shes pa ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i shes pa ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: But this is not so for uncontaminated knowledge.

original: sems la shes pa lnga yin no //
analyzed: sems la shes pa lnga yin no //
translated: Knowledge of the mind of another is five knowledges.

original: zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa yin pa'i phyir shes pa lngas bsdus pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa yin pa'i phyir shes pa lngas bsdus pa yin te /
translated: Knowledge of the mind of another is included in five knowledges, because it is either contaminated or uncontaminated.

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni shes pa gcig yin la /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni shes pa gcig yin la /
translated: Knowledge of the mind of another is one knowledge,

original: bzhi'i cha yang yin no zhes sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: bzhi'i cha yang yin no zhes sngar bshad zin to //
translated: but it is also a part of four knowledges, as was previously explained.

original: zad pa dang mi skye ba dang sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa shes pa rnams ma gtogs te /
analyzed: zad pa dang mi skye ba dang sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa shes pa rnams ma gtogs te /
translated: The knowledge of elimination, nonarising, suffering, origin, and cessation are excluded.

original: rim pa bzhin du gzhan gyi sems shes pa lta bu'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / rang gi mtshan nyid kyi phyogs gcig gi yul can yin pa'i phyir dang / sems dang sems las byung ba'i yul can yin pa'i phyir zad pa shes pa la sogs pa yin pa gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: rim pa bzhin du gzhan gyi sems shes pa lta bu'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / rang gi mtshan nyid kyi phyogs gcig gi yul can yin pa'i phyir dang / sems dang sems las byung ba'i yul can yin pa'i phyir zad pa shes pa la sogs pa yin pa gsal ba yin no //
translated: The knowledge of elimination, etc., are clearly not knowledge of the mind of another, because they are respectively of the nature of knowledge of the mind of another, because they are objects of a part of their own characteristics, and because they are objects of minds and mental factors.

original: 'di zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs ji skad du bshad pa zhes bya ba ni gal te zag pa zad pa shes pa 'gog pa la dmigs pa yin na ni shes pa drug yin te /
analyzed: 'di zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs ji skad du bshad pa zhes bya ba ni gal te zag pa zad pa shes pa 'gog pa la dmigs pa yin na ni shes pa drug yin te /
translated: If the knowledge of the extinction of the contaminants has the cessation of contaminants as its object, then it is six knowledges:

original: chos dang rjes dang 'gog pa dang zad pa dang mi skye ba dang kun rdzob shes pa dag go //
analyzed: chos dang rjes dang 'gog pa dang zad pa dang mi skye ba dang kun rdzob shes pa dag go //
translated: the knowledge of cessation, the knowledge of extinction, the knowledge of non-arising, and conventional knowledge.

original: 'on te zag pa zad pa'i rgyud la yod pa yin na ni de lta na shes pa bcu yin no //
analyzed: 'on te zag pa zad pa'i rgyud la yod pa yin na ni de lta na shes pa bcu yin no //
translated: But if it exists in the stream of one whose contaminants have been extinguished, then it is ten knowledges.üîΩSimilarly, it is to be understood that

original: de bzhin du 'di ni sa thams cad pa yin par @259a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di ni sa thams cad pa yin par @259a * //
translated: this is on all stages.

original: yang shes par bya ba zhes bya ba ni ji ltar zag pa zad par mkhyen pa'i stobs sa thams cad pa yin pa de bzhin du zag pa zad pa shes pa'i mngon par shes pa yang sa thams cad pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yang shes par bya ba zhes bya ba ni ji ltar zag pa zad par mkhyen pa'i stobs sa thams cad pa yin pa de bzhin du zag pa zad pa shes pa'i mngon par shes pa yang sa thams cad pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Just as the power of knowledge of the extinction of the contaminants is on all stages, so the superknowledge of the knowledge of the extinction of the contaminants should be understood as being on all stages.

original: mngon par shes pa lnga ni bsam gtan bzhi'i sa pa yin no zhes bya ba ni zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa lnga ni bsam gtan bzhi'i sa pa yin no zhes bya ba ni zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: The five superknowledges are on the level of the four meditations, except for the superknowledge of the extinction of the contaminants.

original: re zhig gsum ni med de /
analyzed: re zhig gsum ni med de /
translated: The first three are not,üîΩbecause they focus on form.

original: gzugs la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul dang mig dang rna ba'i mngon par shes pa dag ste /
analyzed: gzugs la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul dang mig dang rna ba'i mngon par shes pa dag ste /
translated: These three superknowledges are called the superknowledges of magical power, divine eye, and divine ear.

original: gsum po de dag ni gzugs la dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: gsum po de dag ni gzugs la dmigs pa yin no //
translated: These three focus on form.

original: gzugs med pa dag ni gzugs la dmigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs med pa dag ni gzugs la dmigs pa ma yin te /
translated: The formless realm does not focus on form,

original: gzugs kyi 'du shes dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'du shes dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is free from the discernment of form.üîΩThey are established by means of form,üîΩbecause they are established by means of form.üîΩThey are established by the path that focuses on form.üîΩThe superknowledge of former abodes is established by means of the formless realm,üîΩbecause it is established by the path that focuses on the formless realm.üîΩThe superknowledge of former abodes is established by means of the formless realm,üîΩbecause it is established by the path that focuses on the formless realm.üîΩThe superknowledge of former abodes is established by means of the formless realm,üîΩbecause it is established by the path that focuses on the formless realm.üîΩThe superknowledge of former abodes is established by means of the formless realm,üîΩbecause it is established by the path that focuses on the formless realm.üîΩThe superknowledge of former abodes is established by means of the formless realm,üîΩbecause it is established by the path that focuses on the formless realm.üîΩThe superknowledge of former abodes is established by means of the formless realm,üîΩbecause it is established by the path that focuses on the formless realm.üîΩThe superknowledge of former abodes is established by means of the formless realm,üîΩbecause it is established by the path that focuses on the formless realm.üîΩThe superknowledge of former abodes is established by means of the formless realm,

original: gzugs la stegs bcas nas mngon par bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi sgo nas bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzugs la stegs bcas nas mngon par bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi sgo nas bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it is established by the path that focuses on the formless realm.üîΩThe superknowledge of former abodes is established by means of the formless realm,

original: gzugs la dmigs pa'i lam gyis bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzugs la dmigs pa'i lam gyis bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: because it is established by the path that focuses on the formless realm.üîΩThe superknowledge of former abodes is established by means of the formless realm,üîΩbecause it is established by the path that focuses on the formless realm.üîΩThe superknowledge of former abodes is established by means of the formless realm,üîΩbecause it is established by the path that focuses on the formless realm.

original: mthar gyis sngon gyi gnas gzhan rjes su dran pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir mthar gyis bdag nyid kyis gnas skabs gzhan dag 'dod pa'i khams su dran pa na sgrub par byed pa na /
analyzed: mthar gyis sngon gyi gnas gzhan rjes su dran pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir mthar gyis bdag nyid kyis gnas skabs gzhan dag 'dod pa'i khams su dran pa na sgrub par byed pa na /
translated: The superknowledge of former abodes is established by means of the formless realm,üîΩbecause it is established by the path that focuses on the formless realm.üîΩThe superknowledge of former

original: gzugs med pa rnams ni 'dod pa'i khams la dmigs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs med pa rnams ni 'dod pa'i khams la dmigs pa yang ma yin no //
translated: But formless states do not focus on the desire realm.üîΩBecause they focus on place, time, and so on.

original: gnas dang dus la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gnas dang dus la sogs pa dag ni ci rigs par 'dod pa'i khams sam /üîΩgzugs kyi khams na yod kyi /
analyzed: gnas dang dus la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gnas dang dus la sogs pa dag ni ci rigs par 'dod pa'i khams sam / gzugs kyi khams na yod kyi /
translated: Place and time and so on exist in the desire realm and the form realm,

original: gzugs med pa'i khams na ni ma yin no //üîΩgzugs med pa'i dngos gzhi dag ni khams 'og ma la dmigs pa 'am /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams na ni ma yin no // gzugs med pa'i dngos gzhi dag ni khams 'og ma la dmigs pa 'am /
translated: but not in the formless realm.

original: gzugs la dmigs pa yod pa ma yin no //üîΩde lta na 'o na bsam gtan gyi nyer bsdogs dag dang / gzugs med pa dang po'i nyer bsdogs dag tu yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzugs la dmigs pa yod pa ma yin no // de lta na 'o na bsam gtan gyi nyer bsdogs dag dang / gzugs med pa dang po'i nyer bsdogs dag tu yang 'gyur te /
translated: The actual bases of the formless realm do not focus on lower realms or the form realm.

original: gzugs kyi yul can yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /üîΩde ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs kyi yul can yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na / de ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: If that is so, then the access concentrations to the absorptions and the access concentrations to the first formless realm would also be formless realm states because they focus on form.

original: ting nge 'dzin yan lag gis yongs su bzung ba kho na mngon par shes pa'i rten yin na /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin yan lag gis yongs su bzung ba kho na mngon par shes pa'i rten yin na /
translated: That is not so, because the bases of higher perception are only fully qualified when they are subsumed by the branch of absorption.

original: 'di ni gzugs med pa'i nyer bsdogs dag na yod pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: 'di ni gzugs med pa'i nyer bsdogs dag na yod pa ma yin pas /
translated: But they do not exist in the access concentrations to the formless realm.

original: de na mngon par shes pa med do //
analyzed: de na mngon par shes pa med do //
translated: But they do not have superknowledge.

original: de ltar na de dag na zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa yod par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na de dag na zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa yod par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Thus, in these heavens, the superknowledge of the destruction of the cankers would not exist.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: This is not so,

original: sa thams cad kyi shes pas zag pa zad pa'i shes pa la dmigs par nus pa'i @259b phyir ro //
analyzed: sa thams cad kyi shes pas zag pa zad pa'i shes pa la dmigs par nus pa'i @259b phyir ro //
translated: because the knowledge of the destruction of the cankers is capable of being the object of the knowledge of all the stages.

original: mngon par shes pa rnams kyi sbyor ba bshad pa 'am /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa rnams kyi sbyor ba bshad pa 'am /
translated: We have explained the preparatory practice of the superknowledges.

original: yang na ji ltar gzhan gyi sems shes pa gzugs la stegs bcas nas mngon par bsgrub par bya ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang na ji ltar gzhan gyi sems shes pa gzugs la stegs bcas nas mngon par bsgrub par bya ba yin zhe na /
translated: Or else, how can the cognition of another's thoughts be actualized by taking form as its object?

original: de'i phyir pha rol gyi sems shes par 'dod pa ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir pha rol gyi sems shes par 'dod pa ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: Thus, he who desires to cognize the thought of another...

original: de bzhin du pha rol po dag la yang gtod de zhes bya ba ni gtod par byed pa ste /üîΩbdag gi lus 'di 'dra ba zhig la sems ni 'di 'dra ba zhig yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du pha rol po dag la yang gtod de zhes bya ba ni gtod par byed pa ste / bdag gi lus 'di 'dra ba zhig la sems ni 'di 'dra ba zhig yin la /
translated: In the same way, he directs his thought to another, that is, he directs his thought to another person.

original: gzhan la yang lus 'dra ba 'di yod de /
analyzed: gzhan la yang lus 'dra ba 'di yod de /
translated: In this other person, there is a body similar to mine, and there is a thought similar to my thought.üîΩ And in the other person, there is a body similar to his, and there is a thought similar to his thought.

original: de'i phyir 'di'i sems kyang 'di 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba'i gnas skabs 'di mngon par shes pa mngon par grub nas gzugs la mi ltos par gzhan gyi sems shes so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di'i sems kyang 'di 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba'i gnas skabs 'di mngon par shes pa mngon par grub nas gzugs la mi ltos par gzhan gyi sems shes so //
translated: After the superknowledge has been accomplished, he knows the mind of another without relying on form.

original: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran par 'dod pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran par 'dod pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
translated: When he wishes to recollect past existences, etc.

original: mtshan ma bzung nas zhes bya ba ni sems kyi rnam pa yongs su bcad nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mtshan ma bzung nas zhes bya ba ni sems kyi rnam pa yongs su bcad nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Having taken up the sign means having ascertained the aspect of the mind.

original: de ma thag pa'i zhes bya ba ni sems gang la mtshan ma nye bar gzung ba de'i de ma thag tu 'gag pa gnas skabs gzhan gang dag yin pa de rnams dang po yid la byed do //
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i zhes bya ba ni sems gang la mtshan ma nye bar gzung ba de'i de ma thag tu 'gag pa gnas skabs gzhan gang dag yin pa de rnams dang po yid la byed do //
translated: Immediately after means immediately after the mind that takes up the sign, he attends to the other states that have ceased.

original: skad cig ma bar med pa yid la byed pa mi srid pas gnas skabs gzhan zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: skad cig ma bar med pa yid la byed pa mi srid pas gnas skabs gzhan zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: He attends to the other states because it is impossible to attend to the uninterrupted moments.üîΩHow does he recollect the pure abodes?

original: gnas gtsang ma rnams ji ltar dran zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te nyams su myong ba dran na'o //
analyzed: gnas gtsang ma rnams ji ltar dran zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te nyams su myong ba dran na'o //
translated: If he recollects what he has experienced.

original: gnas gtsang ma pa rnams 'dir 'ong ba ni med de /
analyzed: gnas gtsang ma pa rnams 'dir 'ong ba ni med de /
translated: The gods of the immaculate heavens do not come here,

original: phyir mi 'ong ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are nonreturners.üîΩBecause they experience it through hearing.

original: thos pas nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'dis ni gnas gtsang ma'i lha rnams 'di 'dra ba zhig go zhes thos pa yin no //
analyzed: thos pas nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'dis ni gnas gtsang ma'i lha rnams 'di 'dra ba zhig go zhes thos pa yin no //
translated: They experience it through hearing, ‚ÄúThe gods of the immaculate heavens are like this.‚Äù

original: nyam su myong ba ni rnam pa gnyis te //
analyzed: nyam su myong ba ni rnam pa gnyis te //
translated: Experience is of two types:

original: thos pas nyams su myong ba dang // mthong bas nyams su myong ba'o //
analyzed: thos pas nyams su myong ba dang // mthong bas nyams su myong ba'o //
translated: experience through hearing and experience through seeing.üîΩOne generates it in dependence on the mindstream of another.üîΩOne who is born here after death in the formless realm generates it in dependence on the mindstream of another.

original: pha rol po'i rgyud la brten nas 'dir skyed do zhes bya ba la gzugs med pa dag nas shi 'phos nas 'dir skyes pa gang zhig bsam gtan bskyed nas sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran par 'dod pa de ni pha rol po'i rgyud la brten nas skyed do
analyzed: pha rol po'i rgyud la brten nas 'dir skyed do zhes bya ba la gzugs med pa dag nas shi 'phos nas 'dir skyes pa gang zhig bsam gtan bskyed nas sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran par 'dod pa de ni pha rol po'i rgyud la brten nas skyed do
translated: One who wishes to recollect a former abode generates it in dependence on the mindstream of another.

original: // sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa shes pa ni bsam gtan gyis bsdus pa yin pas des gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sems mi 'dzin te /
analyzed: // sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa shes pa ni bsam gtan gyis bsdus pa yin pas des gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sems mi 'dzin te /
translated: The knowledge that recollects former abodes is subsumed by the absorptions. Therefore it does not apprehend the mind that operates in the formless realm.

original: sa gong ma pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa gong ma pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is of a higher stage.

original: de pha rol po'i rgyud kyis yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'gags ma thag pa mtshan ma bzung nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa sbyar bar bya'o //üîΩgzhan dag na zhes bya ba ni gang dag gzugs med pa dag nas shi 'phos pa ma yin @260a * //
analyzed: de pha rol po'i rgyud kyis yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'gags ma thag pa mtshan ma bzung nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa sbyar bar bya'o // gzhan dag na zhes bya ba ni gang dag gzugs med pa dag nas shi 'phos pa ma yin @260a * //
translated: The mental consciousness of the other person, which has just ceased, grasps the sign.

original: pa de dag ni rang gi rgyud la brten nas skyed do //
analyzed: pa de dag ni rang gi rgyud la brten nas skyed do //
translated: Others say: Those who do not die in the formless realm generate the formless realm through their own continuum.üîΩIf one does not remember the formless realm, then how is it that the sutra says:

original: gal te gzugs med pa rnams mi dran na 'o na mdo las bcom ldan 'das kyis gal te gzugs dag gam gzugs med pa dag tu sngon gnas pa thams cad rnam pa dang bcas par rjes su dran no zhes mdo las gsungs pa ji ltar zhe na kha
analyzed: gal te gzugs med pa rnams mi dran na 'o na mdo las bcom ldan 'das kyis gal te gzugs dag gam gzugs med pa dag tu sngon gnas pa thams cad rnam pa dang bcas par rjes su dran no zhes mdo las gsungs pa ji ltar zhe na kha
translated: The Bhagavat said: If one remembers all previous abodes with their aspects and their signs in the form realm or the formless realm, then one is a liar.

original: cig na re de'i rjes su dpag pa 'khrul pa med pas shes so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: cig na re de'i rjes su dpag pa 'khrul pa med pas shes so zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say: One knows it through inference that is not mistaken.

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

original: bzhed pa tsam gyis thams cad mkhyen te /
analyzed: bzhed pa tsam gyis thams cad mkhyen te /
translated: One knows it through omniscience that is merely wished for.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi mkhyen pa'i yul ni bsam gyis mi khyab bo zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi mkhyen pa'i yul ni bsam gyis mi khyab bo zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: The domain of the knowledge of the buddhas is inconceivable.

original: rdzu 'phrul la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul dang / lha'i rna ba dang / mig gi mngon par shes pa dag gi sbyor ba ni go rims bzhin du spang ba dang sgra dang snang ba yid la byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul dang / lha'i rna ba dang / mig gi mngon par shes pa dag gi sbyor ba ni go rims bzhin du spang ba dang sgra dang snang ba yid la byed pa yin no //
translated: The application of the superknowledges of supernatural power, the divine ear, and the divine eye is, respectively, the mental orientation of the elimination, sound, and light.

original: lha'i rna ba'i sbyor ba ni sgra yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: lha'i rna ba'i sbyor ba ni sgra yid la byed pa'o //
translated: The application of the divine ear is the mental orientation of sound.

original: lha'i mig gi sbyor ba ni snang ba yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: lha'i mig gi sbyor ba ni snang ba yid la byed pa'o //
translated: The application of the divine eye is the mental orientation of light.

original: tshul gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdzod kyi gnas drug par nyon mongs pa spong ba'i thabs rgyas par bstan pa'i phyir zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa skyed pa'i sbyor ba yang mi brjod do //
analyzed: tshul gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdzod kyi gnas drug par nyon mongs pa spong ba'i thabs rgyas par bstan pa'i phyir zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa skyed pa'i sbyor ba yang mi brjod do //
translated: The method of eliminating the defilements is extensively taught in the sixth chapter of the Abhidharmako≈õa, so the application of generating the superknowledge of the elimination of the contaminants is not mentioned here.

original: 'di dag ji ltar 'thob ces bya ba ni 'thob pa rnyed pa'i dbang du byas nas dris pa ste /
analyzed: 'di dag ji ltar 'thob ces bya ba ni 'thob pa rnyed pa'i dbang du byas nas dris pa ste /
translated: How are they obtained? This question is asked from the point of view of acquisition.

original: mngon sum du 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: mngon sum du 'gyur ba ni /
translated: The direct realization of the four noble truths is as follows.

original: 'dris pa'am ma 'dris pa'ang rung ste sbyor ba kho nas yin no //
analyzed: 'dris pa'am ma 'dris pa'ang rung ste sbyor ba kho nas yin no //
translated: The direct realization of the superknowledges is by means of practice, whether one is familiar with them or not.üîΩThose that are not familiar are by means of practice.

original: ma 'dris pa rnams ni sbyor bas zhes bya ba ni bye brag can sngon ma bskyed pa gang yin pa'o //üîΩthams cad kyang sbyor bas bskyed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'dris pa dang / ma 'dris pa bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: ma 'dris pa rnams ni sbyor bas zhes bya ba ni bye brag can sngon ma bskyed pa gang yin pa'o // thams cad kyang sbyor bas bskyed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'dris pa dang / ma 'dris pa bskyed pa ste /
translated: Those that are not familiar are those that have not previously been generated in a specific way.üîΩAll are generated by means of practice.

original: mngon sum du byed pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum du byed pa'o //
translated: Those that are familiar and those that are not familiar are generated and actualized.

original: mngon par shes pa gang zhig dran pa nye bar gzhag pa du ma zhig yin /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa gang zhig dran pa nye bar gzhag pa du ma zhig yin /
translated: How many applications of mindfulness are the superknowledges?

original: thams cad shes rab kyi rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: thams cad shes rab kyi rang bzhin yin te /
translated: All are of the nature of wisdom.

original: mngon par shes pas na mngon par shes pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: mngon par shes pas na mngon par shes pa'o zhe na /
translated: They are called superknowledges because they are directly known.

original: gsum pa dran pa nyer gzhag gsum //
analyzed: gsum pa dran pa nyer gzhag gsum //
translated: Three are the three applications of mindfulness.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
translated: This is stated in the Abhidharma.üîΩBecause they focus on mind and mental factors.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la ci zhe na /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of this?

original: sems kyi rnam grangs mngon par shes pa lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i rang bzhin ma yin no //
analyzed: sems kyi rnam grangs mngon par shes pa lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i rang bzhin ma yin no //
translated: The superknowledge of the cognition of the categories of thought is not by nature the application of mindfulness to the body.

original: dbang po rna ba rdzu 'phrul gyi mig ces bya ba ni 'di dag gzugs la dmigs pa'i phyir lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: dbang po rna ba rdzu 'phrul gyi mig ces bya ba ni 'di dag gzugs la dmigs pa'i phyir lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
translated: The ear faculty is the superknowledge of the divine eye. Since these have form as their object, they are by nature the application of mindfulness to the body.

original: gzugs la dmigs pa @260b yin pa'i phyir zhes bshad pas de'i phyir rdzu 'phrul gyi dmigs pa ni phyi'i skye mched bzhi yin te zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: gzugs la dmigs pa @260b yin pa'i phyir zhes bshad pas de'i phyir rdzu 'phrul gyi dmigs pa ni phyi'i skye mched bzhi yin te zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: Since it is said that they have form as their object, the object of the divine eye is the four external bases, that is, form, sound, smell, and taste.

original: sgra ma gtogs so zhes bya ni sgra ni rgyun 'chad pa'i phyir sprul par mi byed do //
analyzed: sgra ma gtogs so zhes bya ni sgra ni rgyun 'chad pa'i phyir sprul par mi byed do //
translated: The exception is sound, because sound is not emanated, since it is interrupted.

original: 'o na ji ltar 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba shes pas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gal te mig gi mngon par shes pa gzugs la dmigs pa yin na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba shes pas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gal te mig gi mngon par shes pa gzugs la dmigs pa yin na /
translated: If the superknowledge of the eye has form as its object, then how does the knowledge of death and rebirth occur?

original: lha'i mig gis ngag dang yid kyi nyes par spyad pa dang / legs par spyad pa 'am /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis ngag dang yid kyi nyes par spyad pa dang / legs par spyad pa 'am /
translated: The divine eye does not know speech and mental karma, nor does it know the past and future.

original: de dang ldan par gzugs kyi skye mched kyi rang bzhin ma yin pa ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: de dang ldan par gzugs kyi skye mched kyi rang bzhin ma yin pa ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How do you know that it is not the nature of the form base?

original: 'di'i lan gyi phyir de ni des mi shes kyi zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'di'i lan gyi phyir de ni des mi shes kyi zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: To answer that, he says, ‚ÄúIt is not known by that.‚Äù

original: gang gis she na /
analyzed: gang gis she na /
translated: By what?

original: lha'i mig gis so //
analyzed: lha'i mig gis so //
translated: By the divine eye.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Well then, what?

original: mngon par shes pa'i 'khor du gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa'i 'khor du gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is a companion of the superknowledge.

original: de zhes bya ba ni ngag dang yid kyi nyes par spyad pa la sogs pa dang / 'du byed kyi phung po'i phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni ngag dang yid kyi nyes par spyad pa la sogs pa dang / 'du byed kyi phung po'i phyogs gcig go //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to verbal and mental misdeeds and so on and one part of the aggregate of formation.

original: lhag ma ni zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi gnas dang zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa'o //üîΩre zhig sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba la dmigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lhag ma ni zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi gnas dang zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa'o // re zhig sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba la dmigs pa'i phyir /
translated: ‚ÄúThe remainder‚Äù refers to the superknowledge of the former lives and the exhaustion of the contaminants.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi'i bdag nyid yin la rag mod /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi'i bdag nyid yin la rag mod /
translated: The recollection of former lives is certainly the nature of the four establishments of mindfulness because it focuses on form, mind, and mental factors.

original: zag pa zad pa mngon par shes pa ni ji ltar dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin te /
analyzed: zag pa zad pa mngon par shes pa ni ji ltar dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin te /
translated: But how is the superknowledge of the exhaustion of the contaminants an establishment of mindfulness?

original: 'gog pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhe na 'gog pa la dmigs pa'i phyogs yin na ni chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa kho na yin la /
analyzed: 'gog pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhe na 'gog pa la dmigs pa'i phyogs yin na ni chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa kho na yin la /
translated: If it is the factor that focuses on cessation, then it is the close placement of mindfulness of dharmas alone.üîΩIf it is the factor in the mindstream that exhausts contaminants, then it is the four foundations of mindfulness.

analyzed: zag pa zad pa'i rgyud kyi phyogs yin na ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi yin pas 'gal ba med do //

analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' la kun tu rmongs pa dang zlog par byed do //
translated: The superknowledge of the cognition of exhaustion of fluxes eliminates confusion with regard to the future, for it says: ‚ÄúI know that from this existence there is no other existence.

original: 'chi 'pho dang skye ba shes pas ni bar la kun du rmongs pa zlog par byed do //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho dang skye ba shes pas ni bar la kun du rmongs pa zlog par byed do //
translated: The superknowledge of the cognition of death and rebirth eliminates confusion with regard to the present.

original: zag pa zad pa shes pas ni 'di las srid pa gzhan gyi mi shes so zhes phyi ma'i mtha' la kun tu rmongs pa sel bar byed do //
analyzed: zag pa zad pa shes pas ni 'di las srid pa gzhan gyi mi shes so zhes phyi ma'i mtha' la kun tu rmongs pa sel bar byed do //
translated: The superknowledge of the cognition of exhaustion of fluxes eliminates confusion with regard to the future, for it says: ‚ÄúI know that from this existence there is no other existence.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re ni 'chi 'pho dang skye ba'i mngon par shes pas ni phyi ma'i mtha' la kun du rmongs pa zlog par byed do //
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re ni 'chi 'pho dang skye ba'i mngon par shes pas ni phyi ma'i mtha' la kun du rmongs pa zlog par byed do //
translated: According to the master Sa·πÉghabhadra, the superknowledge of the cognition of death and rebirth eliminates confusion with regard to the future;

original: zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pas ni bar la kun du rmongs pa zlog par byed do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pas ni bar la kun du rmongs pa zlog par byed do zhes zer ro //
translated: the superknowledge of the cognition of exhaustion of fluxes eliminates confusion with regard to the present.

original: yang mngon par shes pa gsum kho na rig pa gsum yin no zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: yang mngon par shes pa gsum kho na rig pa gsum yin no zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How do you know that the three superknowledges are the three knowledges?

original: 'di ltar mi slob pa'i sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa shes pa mngon du byed pa'i rig pa dang / mi slob pa'i 'chi 'pho dang skye ba shes pa mngon du byed pa'i rig pa dang / mi slob pa'i zag pa zad pa shes pa mngon du byed pa'i rig pa zhes gsungs la /
analyzed: 'di ltar mi slob pa'i sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa shes pa mngon du byed pa'i rig pa dang / mi slob pa'i 'chi 'pho dang skye ba shes pa mngon du byed pa'i rig pa dang / mi slob pa'i zag pa zad pa shes pa mngon du byed pa'i rig pa zhes gsungs la /
translated: Thus, the knowledge of the arhat that manifests the knowledge of the recollection of former abodes is called the knowledge of the arhat. The knowledge of the arhat that manifests the knowledge of death and rebirth is called the knowledge of the arhat. The knowledge of the arhat that manifests the knowledge of the elimination of the contaminants is called the knowledge of the arhat.

original: rig pa gsum du rnam par gzhag pa yang 'di skad du mdo 'di nyid las sde snod gsum pa yin @261b rig pa gsum pa yin zhes 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: rig pa gsum du rnam par gzhag pa yang 'di skad du mdo 'di nyid las sde snod gsum pa yin @261b rig pa gsum pa yin zhes 'byung ba'o //
translated: The three knowledges are also posited in this way.

original: zag pa zad pa mngon du bya ba kho na mi slob pa'i rig pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis so //
analyzed: zag pa zad pa mngon du bya ba kho na mi slob pa'i rig pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis so //
translated: The knowledge of the elimination of the contaminants is the knowledge of the arhat alone.

original: de zhes bya ba ni rgyud kyi sgo nas yin gyi /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni rgyud kyi sgo nas yin gyi /
translated: The term ‚Äúthat‚Äù refers to the continuum.

original: rang bzhin gyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not by nature the knowledge of the arhat.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de gnyis ni slob pa yang ma yin la mi slob pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de gnyis ni slob pa yang ma yin la mi slob pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said that those two are neither learner nor nonlearner.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they possess contaminants.

original: mngon par shes pa 'di dag zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi gnas dang / 'chi 'pho dang skye ba shes pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa 'di dag zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi gnas dang / 'chi 'pho dang skye ba shes pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa'o //

analyzed: slob pa'i zhes bya ba ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'o //

analyzed: mi 'dod dam zhes bya ba ni khas mi len nam zhes bya ba'o //
