original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rjes su ston pa ni rnam pa gzhan gyis bya bar mi nus pas mi 'phrul ba nyid yin te nyon mongs pa zad pa med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rjes su ston pa ni rnam pa gzhan gyis bya bar mi nus pas mi 'phrul ba nyid yin te nyon mongs pa zad pa med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The miracle of instruction is the best because it cannot be performed by others, and it does not occur if the afflictions are not exhausted.

original: de'i phyir rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul mchog yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul mchog yin no //
translated: The miracle of instruction is the best.

original: rdzu 'phrul ni ting nge 'dzin te /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul ni ting nge 'dzin te /
translated: Miraculous power is concentration.

original: 'dis 'byor par byed pas so //
analyzed: 'dis 'byor par byed pas so //
translated: It is called ‚Äúmiraculous power‚Äù because it is the means of achieving the miraculous.

original: 'byor par byed pa ni sgrub par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'byor par byed pa ni sgrub par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The means of achieving the miraculous is synonymous with the means of accomplishing the miraculous.

original: yid bzhin du mgyogs pa na zhes bya ba la yid kyis 'gro ba ni dmigs pa 'dzin pa ste /üîΩdus de tsam gyis bcom ldan 'das @262a * //
analyzed: yid bzhin du mgyogs pa na zhes bya ba la yid kyis 'gro ba ni dmigs pa 'dzin pa ste / dus de tsam gyis bcom ldan 'das @262a * //
translated: The Buddha‚Äôs mind is swift, as if traveling by thought, because he seizes the object of thought in that time.

original: kyis 'di nas bzhed pa'i yul 'og min du byon te /
analyzed: kyis 'di nas bzhed pa'i yul 'og min du byon te /
translated: The Bhagavat goes to Akani·π£·π≠ha, the realm he wishes to go to, from here in that time.

original: mthu 'di nyan thos la ni yod pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: mthu 'di nyan thos la ni yod pa ma yin pas /
translated: This power does not exist for the ≈õrƒÅvakas.

original: yid mgyogs ni sangs rgyas rnams kho na yin no //
analyzed: yid mgyogs ni sangs rgyas rnams kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, the swiftness of thought belongs only to the Buddhas.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: For that reason, etc.

original: yul thag shin tu ring ba yang thugs bskyed pa tsam gyis gshegs pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mthu bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin no //
analyzed: yul thag shin tu ring ba yang thugs bskyed pa tsam gyis gshegs pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mthu bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin no //
translated: The Bhagavat Buddha has inconceivable power, for he goes to very distant places merely by wishing to do so.

original: mos pa las byung ba ni mos pa'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: mos pa las byung ba ni mos pa'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: Arisen from resolution is the result of resolution.

original: myur du 'gro ba ni lus phyin par byed pas so //
analyzed: myur du 'gro ba ni lus phyin par byed pas so //
translated: It goes quickly, for it moves the body.

original: mos pa las byung ba ni thag ring ba la nye bar mos pa gang yin pa las te /
analyzed: mos pa las byung ba ni thag ring ba la nye bar mos pa gang yin pa las te /
translated: Arisen from resolution is that which is produced by the resolution of what is distant as being near.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bsam gtan pa rnams kyi bsam gtan gyi yul ni bsam gtan gyis mi khyab po zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bsam gtan pa rnams kyi bsam gtan gyi yul ni bsam gtan gyis mi khyab po zhes gsungs so //
translated: The Bhagavat has said, ‚ÄúThe object of the meditation of the meditator is not the object of the meditation of the Buddha.

original: sprul pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: sprul pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Emanation is of two kinds:

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs med pa na spyod pa med pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs med pa na spyod pa med pa ste /
translated: of the realm of desire and of the realm of fine-materiality.

original: de na gzugs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de na gzugs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is none of the realm of immateriality, because there is no material form there.

original: 'dod par gtogs pa'i sprul pa ni /
analyzed: 'dod par gtogs pa'i sprul pa ni /
translated: Emanation of the realm of desire is twofold:

original: phyi'i zhes bya ba ni nang gi skye mched ni sprul par mi byed de /
analyzed: phyi'i zhes bya ba ni nang gi skye mched ni sprul par mi byed de /
translated: External means that one does not emanate internal sense-spheres.

original: sngon med pa'i sems can 'byung bar 'gyur du 'ong bas so //
analyzed: sngon med pa'i sems can 'byung bar 'gyur du 'ong bas so //
translated: because it would follow that sentient beings would arise without a cause.

original: sgra'i sprul pa ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sgra'i sprul pa ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The emanation of sound does not exist,

original: rgyun 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyun 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is interrupted.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi lus dang 'brel pa zhes bya ba ni bdag gi lus dang 'brel pa dang / gzhan gyi lus dang 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi lus dang 'brel pa zhes bya ba ni bdag gi lus dang 'brel pa dang / gzhan gyi lus dang 'brel pa'o //
translated: It is related to one‚Äôs own body and to the body of another.

original: de kho na bzhin du zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'dod pa'i khams na rang dang gzhan gyi lus dang 'brel pa de bzhin du gzugs su gtogs pa yang bdag gi lus dang gzhan gyi lus dang 'brel pa zhes bya ba rnam pa gnyis yin no //
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'dod pa'i khams na rang dang gzhan gyi lus dang 'brel pa de bzhin du gzugs su gtogs pa yang bdag gi lus dang gzhan gyi lus dang 'brel pa zhes bya ba rnam pa gnyis yin no //
translated: Just as in the realm of desire, the emanation is related to one‚Äôs own body and to the body of another, so also in the realm of form, the emanation is related to one‚Äôs own body and to the body of another.üîΩThis is the fourfold classification of emanations.

original: 'di ni sprul pa rnam pa bzhi yin no zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa'i'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sprul pa rnam pa bzhi yin no zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa'i'o //
translated: The emanation of one born in the realm of desire is of four types.

original: gzugs kyi khams na yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa'i yang /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa'i yang /
translated: The emanation of one born in the realm of form is also like this.

original: 'dod par gtogs pa dang / gzugs su gtogs pa rang gi lus dang 'brel pa dang / gzhan gyi lus dang 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod par gtogs pa dang / gzugs su gtogs pa rang gi lus dang 'brel pa dang / gzhan gyi lus dang 'brel pa yin no //
translated: Those belonging to the desire realm and those belonging to the form realm are related to one‚Äôs own body and to the bodies of others.

original: rnam pa brgyad yin no zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa'i rnam pa bzhi dang / gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa'i rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: rnam pa brgyad yin no zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa'i rnam pa bzhi dang / gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa'i rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: They are of eight types, because there are four types that arise in the desire realm and four types that arise in the form realm.

original: rnam pa brgyad yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa brgyad yin no //
translated: They are of eight types.

original: mdor bsdus na zhes bya ba ni rgyas par ni mtha' yas pa'o //
analyzed: mdor bsdus na zhes bya ba ni rgyas par ni mtha' yas pa'o //
translated: In brief, they are infinite.

original: ji ltar dri dang ro dang mi ldan zhes bya ba ni gal te /
analyzed: ji ltar dri dang ro dang mi ldan zhes bya ba ni gal te /
translated: How can they be without smell and taste?

original: gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa 'dod pa na spyod pa skye mched bzhi kho na sprul par byed na /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa 'dod pa na spyod pa skye mched bzhi kho na sprul par byed na /
translated: If one born in the form realm emanates only the four sense spheres of the desire realm,

original: ji ltar rang gi lus dang 'brel pa sprul pa na dri dang ro dag @262b dang mi ldan zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rang gi lus dang 'brel pa sprul pa na dri dang ro dag @262b dang mi ldan zhes bya ba'o //
translated: how can the emanation be related to one‚Äôs own body and be without smell and taste?

original: gos dang rgyan bzhin du mi ldan no zhes bya ba ni dper na sems can du mi bgrang ba'i phyir gos dang rgyan rang gi lus dang 'brel pa dag dang mi ldan pa de bzhin du sprul pa dang yang mi ldan no //
analyzed: gos dang rgyan bzhin du mi ldan no zhes bya ba ni dper na sems can du mi bgrang ba'i phyir gos dang rgyan rang gi lus dang 'brel pa dag dang mi ldan pa de bzhin du sprul pa dang yang mi ldan no //
translated: They are not possessed like clothing and ornaments, for example, because they are not counted as sentient beings.

original: gzhan dag na re skye mched gnyis sprul par byed do zhes bya ba ni rang gi lus dang 'brel pa gzugs dang reg bya'i skye mched kho na sprul par byed pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re skye mched gnyis sprul par byed do zhes bya ba ni rang gi lus dang 'brel pa gzugs dang reg bya'i skye mched kho na sprul par byed pa ste /
translated: Others say: Two bases are emanated. Only the form and tactility bases that are related to one's body are emanated.

original: de'i phyir dri dang ro dag dang ldan pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dri dang ro dag dang ldan pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore they are not possessed by smell and taste.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan gsum pa dang bzhi pa'i sa pa dag kyang bzhi dang lngar sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan gsum pa dang bzhi pa'i sa pa dag kyang bzhi dang lngar sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Similarly, those of the third and fourth absorptions are applied to four and five.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: bsam gtan gsum pa'i 'bras bu bzhi ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa'i 'bras bu bzhi ste /
translated: The result of the third absorption is four:

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa dang / gsum pa'i sa pa dag go //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa dang / gsum pa'i sa pa dag go //
translated: those of the desire realm, first absorption, second absorption and third absorption.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i 'bras bu lnga ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i 'bras bu lnga ste /
translated: The result of the fourth absorption is fivefold.

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang / bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa dang gsum pa dang bzhi pa'i sa pa dag go //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang / bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa dang gsum pa dang bzhi pa'i sa pa dag go //
translated: It is of the level of the desire realm, and of the first, second, third, and fourth absorptions.üîΩIt is also superior in terms of its range.

original: 'gros kyi sgo nas kyang khyad par du 'phags so zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sprul pa bsam gtan gyi sa pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu ni go rims bzhin du /
analyzed: 'gros kyi sgo nas kyang khyad par du 'phags so zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sprul pa bsam gtan gyi sa pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu ni go rims bzhin du /
translated: The emanation of the desire realm, which is the result of the first absorption, goes to the second absorption.üîΩThe emanation of the second absorption goes to the third absorption.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa dang gsum pa dang / bzhi par 'gro la /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa dang gsum pa dang / bzhi par 'gro la /
translated: The emanation of the third absorption goes to the fourth absorption.

original: bsam gtan dang po'i 'bras bu ni bsam gtan dang po nyid du 'gro'o //üîΩbsam gtan dang po'i 'bras bu sprul pas ni bsam gtan gnyis pa'i 'bras bu sprul pas bsam gtan gsum pa'i sar 'gro bar mi nus te /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i 'bras bu ni bsam gtan dang po nyid du 'gro'o // bsam gtan dang po'i 'bras bu sprul pas ni bsam gtan gnyis pa'i 'bras bu sprul pas bsam gtan gsum pa'i sar 'gro bar mi nus te /
translated: The emanation of the first absorption goes to the first absorption.üîΩThe emanation of the first absorption cannot go to the level of the third absorption through the emanation of the second absorption.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa'i 'bras bu sprul pas bsam gtan gsum pa'i sar 'gro bar mi nus pa la sogs pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa'i 'bras bu sprul pas bsam gtan gsum pa'i sar 'gro bar mi nus pa la sogs pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The emanation of the second absorption cannot go to the level of the third absorption.

original: de rnyed bsam gtan bzhin zhes bya ba ji ltar bsam gtan rnyed ce na /
analyzed: de rnyed bsam gtan bzhin zhes bya ba ji ltar bsam gtan rnyed ce na /
translated: How is it obtained?

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba dang skye bas so zhes 'chad do //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba dang skye bas so zhes 'chad do //
translated: It is said that it is obtained through freedom from attachment and through birth.üîΩOne who is established in the result of concentration.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi 'bras bu la gnas pa ni zhes bya ba la ting nge 'dzin gyi 'bras bu ni sprul pa'i sems te rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ram /üîΩmngon par shes pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi 'bras bu la gnas pa ni zhes bya ba la ting nge 'dzin gyi 'bras bu ni sprul pa'i sems te rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ram / mngon par shes pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The result of concentration is the mind of emanation, because it is the nature of the liberated path or because it is the result of higher perception.

original: sa gong ma bas ni bsam gtan dang po'i sa pas smrar 'jug ste /
analyzed: sa gong ma bas ni bsam gtan dang po'i sa pas smrar 'jug ste /
translated: One who is established in the result of concentration can speak through the mind of emanation of the level of the first absorption.

original: yan chad bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa dag na rnam par rig byed kun nas slong bar byed pa rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i sems med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yan chad bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa dag na rnam par rig byed kun nas slong bar byed pa rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i sems med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But one who is established in the result of concentration of the second absorption and so on can speak through the mind of emanation of the level of the first absorption, because the motivating mind that is the cause of emanation that possesses investigation and analysis does not exist in the second absorption and so on.

original: ji ltar 'di smrar 'jug ces bya ba ni bsam pa ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di smrar 'jug ces bya ba ni bsam pa ci zhig ce na /
translated: How does one speak through the mind of emanation?

original: sprul pa'i sems 'gags shing @263a * //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sems 'gags shing @263a * //
translated: The mind of emanation is stopped.

original: smrar 'jug pa'i sems skyes nas sprul pa'i sems 'gags pas sprul pa 'gags te /
analyzed: smrar 'jug pa'i sems skyes nas sprul pa'i sems 'gags pas sprul pa 'gags te /
translated: The emanation ceases when the mind that causes speech arises and the mind of emanation ceases,

original: sems de gnyis cig car med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sems de gnyis cig car med pa'i phyir te /
translated: because these two minds do not exist simultaneously.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar smrar 'jug ce na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar smrar 'jug ce na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, how can the emanation speak?

original: byin gyis brlabs nas gzhan 'jug phyir //
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs nas gzhan 'jug phyir //
translated: Because it is empowered and then made to speak by another.

original: zhes bya ba ni sprul pa'i sems kyis sprul pa sprul par byed do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sprul pa'i sems kyis sprul pa sprul par byed do //
translated: The mind of emanation projects the emanation.

original: de nas dus phyis byin gyis brlab pa'i sems mngon du byed la /
analyzed: de nas dus phyis byin gyis brlab pa'i sems mngon du byed la /
translated: Later, the mind of empowerment manifests.

original: des sprul pa byin gyis brlabs nas /
analyzed: des sprul pa byin gyis brlabs nas /
translated: That empowers the emanation.

original: phyis rnam par rig byed kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems mngon du byas te smrar 'jug go //
analyzed: phyis rnam par rig byed kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems mngon du byas te smrar 'jug go //
translated: Then, the mind that motivates manifest speech manifests and the emanation speaks.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone asks,

original: byin gyis rlob pa'i sems mngon du gyur na sprul pa'i sems mi snang bar gyur pas sprul pa mi snang bar ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: byin gyis rlob pa'i sems mngon du gyur na sprul pa'i sems mi snang bar gyur pas sprul pa mi snang bar ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúIf the mind of empowerment manifests, the mind of emanation disappears. Why doesn‚Äôt the emanation disappear?‚Äù

original: 'di la brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di la brjod par bya ste /
translated: This should be answered as follows.

original: sngon gyi bsam pa'i rgyud rjes su 'brang ste sprul pa sprul par bya'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi bsam pa'i rgyud rjes su 'brang ste sprul pa sprul par bya'o //
translated: He should emanate emanations following the stream of thought of the prior intention.

original: de byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: de byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: He should bless it.üîΩHe should cause it to speak.

original: de smrar gzhug go snyam du de ltar sngar sems la gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de smrar gzhug go snyam du de ltar sngar sems la gzhag pa yin no //
translated: He should establish his mind in this way beforehand.

original: gnas skabs gnyis su byin gyis brlabs srid pa'i phyir ci gson po kho na la zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dri'o //
analyzed: gnas skabs gnyis su byin gyis brlabs srid pa'i phyir ci gson po kho na la zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dri'o //
translated: The question, ‚ÄúIs it only with regard to a living being?‚Äù is asked because it is possible to bless two states.

original: 'phags pa 'od srungs chen po'i byin gyi rlabs kyis zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa 'od srungs chen po'i mos pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'phags pa 'od srungs chen po'i byin gyi rlabs kyis zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa 'od srungs chen po'i mos pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúBy the blessing of the noble MahƒÅkƒÅ≈õyapa‚Äù means by the noble MahƒÅkƒÅ≈õyapa‚Äôs aspiration.

original: dang por du mas gcig yin te //
analyzed: dang por du mas gcig yin te //
translated: First, many create one.

original: zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni dang po sgrub na ni sprul pa'i sems mang pos sprul pa nye bar len pa dang bcas pa gcig sprul par byed la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni dang po sgrub na ni sprul pa'i sems mang pos sprul pa nye bar len pa dang bcas pa gcig sprul par byed la /
translated: The first is when many emanation minds create one single appropriated emanation.

original: mngon par shes pa byang nas ni sems gcig gi dus ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa byang nas ni sems gcig gi dus ma yin no //
translated: But after the higher perception has been mastered, it is not the time for a single mind.

original: sprul pa'i sems ni bsgom pa'i 'bras bu dang / skye bas thob pa dang rnam pa gnyis yin pas yang ci sprul pa'i sems thams cad ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sems ni bsgom pa'i 'bras bu dang / skye bas thob pa dang rnam pa gnyis yin pas yang ci sprul pa'i sems thams cad ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore it is asked: Is all emanating mind?

original: bsgom las skyes pa lung ma bstan //
analyzed: bsgom las skyes pa lung ma bstan //
translated: The emanating mind that arises from meditation is neutral.

original: zhes bya ba la sa gong mar skyes pas sa 'og ma pa'i sprul pa'i sems mngon du byed pa'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa yin no zhes bya bar rtogs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sa gong mar skyes pas sa 'og ma pa'i sprul pa'i sems mngon du byed pa'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa yin no zhes bya bar rtogs so //
translated: Because one born in a higher level manifests the emanating mind of a lower level, it is neutral.

original: skye ba las skyes rnam gsum mo //üîΩzhes bya ba ni yi dags la sogs pa dag ni res 'ga' gzhan la tho btsams pa'i phyir gzugs sprul par byed la /
analyzed: skye ba las skyes rnam gsum mo // zhes bya ba ni yi dags la sogs pa dag ni res 'ga' gzhan la tho btsams pa'i phyir gzugs sprul par byed la /
translated: That obtained from birth is of three types.üîΩPretas and so on sometimes emanate form to harm others and sometimes to benefit others.

original: res 'ga' phan gdags pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa blta bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: res 'ga' phan gdags pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa blta bar bya ba'o //
translated: This should be understood and so on.

original: de dag gis byas pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni lta la sogs pas byas pa dang / skye bas byas pa'i sprul pa bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud dang 'brel pa skye mched dgu pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gis byas pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni lta la sogs pas byas pa dang / skye bas byas pa'i sprul pa bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud dang 'brel pa skye mched dgu pa yin no //
translated: The emanation created by seeing and so on, and the emanation created by birth, are the nine sense bases that are related to the mindstreams of oneself and others.

original: ga las she na /
analyzed: ga las she na /
translated: Why is this?

original: sgra med pa'i gzugs @263b can gyi skye mched yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra med pa'i gzugs @263b can gyi skye mched yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are sense bases that are not sound.

original: gang gi phyir de na sgra med pa'i gzugs can gyi skye mched mig la sogs pa yod pa de'i phyir ming gi sgo nas skye mched dgu pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de na sgra med pa'i gzugs can gyi skye mched mig la sogs pa yod pa de'i phyir ming gi sgo nas skye mched dgu pa yin gyi /
translated: Because there are sense bases that are not sound, such as the eyes, in the emanation, therefore it is the ninth sense base from the perspective of name.

original: rdzas kyi sgo nas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rdzas kyi sgo nas ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not from the perspective of substance.

original: sgra ni rgyun med pa'i phyir sprul par mi byed la /
analyzed: sgra ni rgyun med pa'i phyir sprul par mi byed la /
translated: Sound is not created in the emanation because it does not have a continuum.

original: sbrul pa sems med pa yin pa'i phyir yid dang chos kyi skye mched dag kyang med do //
analyzed: sbrul pa sems med pa yin pa'i phyir yid dang chos kyi skye mched dag kyang med do //
translated: The mental faculty and the entity sense base also do not exist in the emanation because the emanation is mindless.

original: sprul pa sems med pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las she na /
analyzed: sprul pa sems med pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las she na /
translated: How do you know that the emanation is mindless?üîΩThe treatise attainment of knowledge declares:

original: bstan bcos las sprul pa sems dang bcas pa zhes brjod par bya ba 'am /
analyzed: bstan bcos las sprul pa sems dang bcas pa zhes brjod par bya ba 'am /
translated: ‚ÄúThe emanation should be called ‚Äòhaving mind.‚Äô

original: sems med pa zhes brjod par bya /
analyzed: sems med pa zhes brjod par bya /
translated: It should be said that it is without mind.

original: smras pa sems med pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: smras pa sems med pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said to be without mind.

original: gal te dbang po dag kyang sprul par byed na ni dbang po rnams sems can du bgrang ba yin pa'i phyir ji ltar sngon med pa'i sems can 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dbang po dag kyang sprul par byed na ni dbang po rnams sems can du bgrang ba yin pa'i phyir ji ltar sngon med pa'i sems can 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If the sense faculties are also emanated, then since the sense faculties are counted as sentient beings, how could a sentient being arise that did not exist previously?

original: de'i phyir dbang po rnams dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dbang po rnams dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said, because it is not different from the sense faculties.

original: sprul pa skye mched bzhi pa de ni mig la sogs pa'i dbang po dang tha mi dad par skyes pa ste /
analyzed: sprul pa skye mched bzhi pa de ni mig la sogs pa'i dbang po dang tha mi dad par skyes pa ste /
translated: That emanation that has four sense bases is not different from the sense faculties such as the eyes,

original: rang gi lus dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi lus dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is related to its own body.

original: de'i phyir skye mched dgu par bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir skye mched dgu par bshad do //
translated: Therefore it is explained as having nine sense bases.

original: dbang po ni sprul par mi byed do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dbang po ni sprul par mi byed do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The sense faculties are not emanated.

original: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang rgyas pa las byung ba yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang rgyas pa las byung ba yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they arise from karmic maturation and enhancement.

original: sprul pa ni rnam par smin pa dang rgyas pa las byung bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: sprul pa ni rnam par smin pa dang rgyas pa las byung bar mi rigs so //
translated: It is not logical that emanations arise from karmic maturation and enhancement.

original: dbang po'i rten tsam sprul pa yin te /
analyzed: dbang po'i rten tsam sprul pa yin te /
translated: The emanation is merely the support of the sense faculty.

original: ras khra bzhin no //
analyzed: ras khra bzhin no //
translated: It is like a variegated cloth.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dbang po ni sprul par mi byed do zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dbang po ni sprul par mi byed do zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, the sense faculty is not emanated.

original: dper na nga las nu dang srid pa bar ma pa rnams kyi lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni las las skyes pa'i rdzu 'phrul ston pa'o //
analyzed: dper na nga las nu dang srid pa bar ma pa rnams kyi lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni las las skyes pa'i rdzu 'phrul ston pa'o //
translated: For example, like Manu and the intermediate beings. This shows the supernormal knowledge that arises from karma.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dang 'khor los sgyur ba dang / khyim bdag rin po che rnams kyi lta bur zhes bya ba la sogs pa de dag gi ni lha'i dang 'dra bas lha'i yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dang 'khor los sgyur ba dang / khyim bdag rin po che rnams kyi lta bur zhes bya ba la sogs pa de dag gi ni lha'i dang 'dra bas lha'i yin no //
translated: Like the Bodhisattvas, the wheel-turning kings, and the precious householders. The divine eye of these is like the divine eye.

original: 'di ltar de gnyis ni bsam gtan sa pa'i gzugs dang pa yin pa de'i phyir de dag ni lha'i kho na yin gyi lha'i dbang 'dra ba'i lha'i ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar de gnyis ni bsam gtan sa pa'i gzugs dang pa yin pa de'i phyir de dag ni lha'i kho na yin gyi lha'i dbang 'dra ba'i lha'i ni ma yin no //
translated: Because these two are the form and eye of the absorption levels, they are only divine, but not divine like the lord of the gods.

original: de nyid kyi phyir lha'i mig ni sha dang pags pa dang rus pa dang khrag dang ma 'brel zhing gzugs dang ba'o zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir lha'i mig ni sha dang pags pa dang rus pa dang khrag dang ma 'brel zhing gzugs dang ba'o zhes brjod do //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the divine eye is not connected with flesh, skin, bones, or blood, and is clear form.

original: lha'i mig gam rna ba ni de dang mtshungs pa med do zhes bya ba ni de dag lta ba dang nyan pa'i sgo nas mngon par bsgrubs pa ste /
analyzed: lha'i mig gam rna ba ni de dang mtshungs pa med do zhes bya ba ni de dag lta ba dang nyan pa'i sgo nas mngon par bsgrubs pa ste /
translated: The divine eye and ear are not similar to those because they are established by seeing and hearing.

original: de'i phyir rtag tu rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rtag tu rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are always associated with consciousness.

original: zhar ba dang long ba la sogs pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /üîΩzhar ba ni gang rung @264a * //üîΩcig ma tshang ba'o //
analyzed: zhar ba dang long ba la sogs pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la / zhar ba ni gang rung @264a * // cig ma tshang ba'o //
translated: Because there is no one who is blind or deaf, etc.

original: long ba ni yo ba'o //
analyzed: long ba ni yo ba'o //
translated: One who is blind is incomplete in one eye.üîΩOne who is deaf is incomplete in both ears.üîΩThe four, such as the divine ear, are also obtained from birth.

original: lha'i rna ba la sogs pa bzhi yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni lha'i mig dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa bsdu ste /
analyzed: lha'i rna ba la sogs pa bzhi yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni lha'i mig dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa bsdu ste /
translated: The term ‚Äúalso‚Äù includes the divine eye, recollection of past lives, and knowledge of others‚Äô minds.

original: 'di dag thams cad skyes nas thob pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad skyes nas thob pa yin no //
translated: All of these are obtained from birth.

original: 'don pa na spyod pa'i lha dang klu rnams dang / gzugs na spyod pa rnams kyi yin gyi /
analyzed: 'don pa na spyod pa'i lha dang klu rnams dang / gzugs na spyod pa rnams kyi yin gyi /
translated: They are possessed by gods and nagas who move in the desire realm, and by those who move in the form realm.

original: gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams kyi ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams kyi ni ma yin te /
translated: They are not possessed by those who move in the formless realm,

original: de na gzugs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de na gzugs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no form there.

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa skye bas thob pa ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'o //üîΩgang rtog dang rig sngags kyi byas ba 'ang zhes bya ba de yang rnam pa gsum yin no //üîΩde la 'dod pa'i khams kho na mi dge ba yod kyi gzhan na ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa skye bas thob pa ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'o // gang rtog dang rig sngags kyi byas ba 'ang zhes bya ba de yang rnam pa gsum yin no // de la 'dod pa'i khams kho na mi dge ba yod kyi gzhan na ni ma yin no //
translated: The superknowledge of the destruction of the cankers is wholesome.

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu ni dge ba kho na ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu ni dge ba kho na ma yin no //
translated: The superknowledge of the destruction of the cankers is wholesome.üîΩThe superknowledge of the destruction of the cankers is wholesome.üîΩThe superknowledge of the destruction of the cankers is wholesome.üîΩThe superknowledge of the destruction of the cankers is wholesome.üîΩThe superknowledge of the destruction of the cankers is wholesome.üîΩThe superknowledge of the destruction of the cankers is wholesome.üîΩThe superknowledge of the destruction of the cankers is wholesome.üîΩThe superknowledge of the destruction of the cankers is wholesome.üîΩThe superknowledge of the destruction of the cankers is wholesome.üîΩThe superknowledge of the destruction of the cankers is wholesome.üîΩThe superknowledge of the destruction of the cankers is wholesome.üîΩThe superknowledge of the destruction of the cankers is wholesome.üîΩThe superknowledge of the destruction of the cankers is wholesome.üîΩThe superknowledge of the destruction of the cankers is wholesome.üîΩThe superknowledge of the destruction of the cankers is wholesome.

original: dmyal ba pas ni dang por shes //üîΩzhes bya ba ni dmyal ba rnams kyis ni skyes tsam nyid nas sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i shes pas de ma thag pa'i skye ba dran gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dmyal ba pas ni dang por shes // zhes bya ba ni dmyal ba rnams kyis ni skyes tsam nyid nas sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i shes pas de ma thag pa'i skye ba dran gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: The superknowledge of the destruction of the cankers is wholesome.üîΩThe superknowledge of the destruction of the cankers is wholesome.üîΩThe superknowledge of the destruction of the cankers is wholesome.üîΩThe superknowledge of the destruction of the cankers is wholesome.üîΩThe superknowledge of the destruction of the cankers is wholesome.üîΩThe superknowledge of the destruction of the cankers is wholesome.üîΩThe superknowledge of the destruction of the cankers is wholesome.üîΩThe superknowledge of the destruction of the cankers is wholesome.üîΩThe superknowledge of the destruction of the cankers is wholesome.üîΩThe superknowledge of the destruction of the cankers is wholesome.üîΩThe superknowledge of the destruction of the cankers is wholesome.üîΩThe superknowledge of the destruction of the cankers is wholesome.üîΩThe superknowledge of the destruction of the cankers is wholesome.üîΩThe superknowledge of the destruction of the cankers is wholesome.

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pas kyang dang po'i kho na shes so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pas kyang dang po'i kho na shes so //
translated: The superknowledge of the destruction of the cankers is wholesome.üîΩThe superknowledge of the destruction

original: ji srid du sdug bsngal gyi tshor bas ma nyen pas zhes bya ba la de dag ni gang gi tshe tshor ba drag po gnad thams cad 'byed par byed pa dag gis gnod pa de'i tshe bdag nyid kyang mi dran na /
analyzed: ji srid du sdug bsngal gyi tshor bas ma nyen pas zhes bya ba la de dag ni gang gi tshe tshor ba drag po gnad thams cad 'byed par byed pa dag gis gnod pa de'i tshe bdag nyid kyang mi dran na /
translated: When they are tormented by intense feelings that tear the body apart, they do not even remember themselves,

original: sngon gyi gnas sam gzhan gyi sems shes par go ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas sam gzhan gyi sems shes par go ga la 'gyur /
translated: so how could they know the former existences of others or the minds of others?üîΩThey always know the minds of others who are in the other destinies.

original: 'gro ba gzhan na gnas pa ni rtag tu shes so zhes bya ba ni yi dags dang dud 'gro dang mi dang lha'i 'gro ba la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba gzhan na gnas pa ni rtag tu shes so zhes bya ba ni yi dags dang dud 'gro dang mi dang lha'i 'gro ba la gnas pa ste /
translated: They always know the minds of others who are in the destinies of ghosts, animals, humans, and gods.

original: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa de dag gis rtag tu shes so //
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa de dag gis rtag tu shes so //
translated: They always know the former existences of others and the minds of others.

original: re zhig dud 'gros ni shes so //
analyzed: re zhig dud 'gros ni shes so //
translated: Animals know the minds of others.

original: klu la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: klu la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: Like the nƒÅgas and so on.

original: yi dags kyis kyang shes te /
analyzed: yi dags kyis kyang shes te /
translated: Ghosts also know the minds of others.

original: ji skad du /üîΩbdag gis mthun dang mi mthun pas //
analyzed: ji skad du / bdag gis mthun dang mi mthun pas //
translated: As it is said:üîΩ‚ÄúWhatever enjoyments I have accumulated

original: longs spyod dag ni gang bsags pa //
analyzed: longs spyod dag ni gang bsags pa //
translated: through what is agreeable and disagreeable,

original: de dag gzhan gyi longs spyod de //
analyzed: de dag gzhan gyi longs spyod de //
translated: they are the enjoyments of others;

original: kho bo cag ni sdug bsngal bsten //
analyzed: kho bo cag ni sdug bsngal bsten //
translated: I am tormented by suffering.‚Äù

original: zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //üîΩmi skye ba dran pa dag ni mthong ba nyid do //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa lta bu'o // mi skye ba dran pa dag ni mthong ba nyid do //
translated: This is what is meant.

original: lhas kyang dran te /
analyzed: lhas kyang dran te /
translated: The gods also remember the past lives of those who are mindful of the future.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:üîΩThe forest of Jetavana,üîΩwhere the assembly of sages taught

original: drang srong tshogs kyis bstan pa dang // chos kyi rgyal po bzhugs gyur cing //üîΩbdag la dga' ba skyed pa yi //
analyzed: drang srong tshogs kyis bstan pa dang // chos kyi rgyal po bzhugs gyur cing // bdag la dga' ba skyed pa yi //
translated: and the Dharma King resided,

original: rgyal byed tshal de 'di yin no //
analyzed: rgyal byed tshal de 'di yin no //
translated: is the very place that gives rise to joy in me.üîΩAnd similarly, it is explained:

original: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du gang nas shi 'phos nas gang du skyes zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa @264b lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du gang nas shi 'phos nas gang du skyes zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa @264b lta bu'o //
translated: From where did you die and transmigrate and where were you reborn?

original: mi la skye bas thob pa med //
analyzed: mi la skye bas thob pa med //
translated: Humans do not have birth-obtained superknowledge.

original: ces bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul la sogs pa thams cad do //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul la sogs pa thams cad do //
translated: This means that they do not have all the superknowledges such as the superknowledge of supernatural power.

original: skye bas thob pa bkag pas 'dod chags dang bral bas thob pa dang / rtog pa dang / rig sngags dang / sman dang las kyis byas pa yod do zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye bas thob pa bkag pas 'dod chags dang bral bas thob pa dang / rtog pa dang / rig sngags dang / sman dang las kyis byas pa yod do zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since birth-obtained superknowledge is refuted, it is explained that they have superknowledge obtained from freedom from attachment, from contemplation, from spells, from medicine, and from karma.

original: de dag gi de ni las kyi khyad par las skyes pa yin te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de dag gi de ni las kyi khyad par las skyes pa yin te zhes bya ba la /
translated: Their superknowledge arises from the special power of karma.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: Three types of knowledge of former abodes,

original: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa ni bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu kho na ma yin te 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa ni bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu kho na ma yin te 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Knowledge of former abodes is not only the result of meditation.

original: rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: What are the three types?

original: ji skad bshad pa'i bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu dang skye bas thob pa ste /
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu dang skye bas thob pa ste /
translated: The result of meditation as previously explained, knowledge obtained from birth, and knowledge arisen from karma.

original: lha la sogs pa rnams kyi dang / las las skyes pa ste byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lta bu'o //
analyzed: lha la sogs pa rnams kyi dang / las las skyes pa ste byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lta bu'o //
translated: Knowledge obtained from birth is, for example, the knowledge of gods and so on and knowledge arisen from karma is, for example, the knowledge of bodhisattvas.

original: slob dpon gang ba spel bas mdzad pa chos mngon pa mdzod kyi 'grel bshad mtshan nyid kyi rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya ba las ye shes bstan pa zhes bya ba gnas bdun pa'i 'grel bshad do //
analyzed: slob dpon gang ba spel bas mdzad pa chos mngon pa mdzod kyi 'grel bshad mtshan nyid kyi rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya ba las ye shes bstan pa zhes bya ba gnas bdun pa'i 'grel bshad do //
translated: This completes the commentary on the seventh chapter, called ‚ÄúThe Knowledge Chapter,‚Äù from the treatise that explains the Abhidharma Treasury called Following the Meaning of the Text.

original: shes pa rnams bshad zin to /
analyzed: shes pa rnams bshad zin to /
translated: The knowledges have been explained.

original: // / de rnams kyang bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa la brten nas skye bas 'brel pa bstan pa'i phyir shes pa'i skabs kyi shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi yon tan rnams bshad zin to zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: // / de rnams kyang bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa la brten nas skye bas 'brel pa bstan pa'i phyir shes pa'i skabs kyi shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi yon tan rnams bshad zin to zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Since they arise in dependence on the absorptions and formless states, the qualities of knowledge are explained in the section on knowledge.

original: zad pa shes pa'i tshe sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi thun mong ma yin pa'i chos stobs la sogs pa rnams dang / nyan thos rnams dang thun mong ba smon nas shes pa dang so so yang dag par rig pa la sogs pa rnams dang /
analyzed: zad pa shes pa'i tshe sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi thun mong ma yin pa'i chos stobs la sogs pa rnams dang / nyan thos rnams dang thun mong ba smon nas shes pa dang so so yang dag par rig pa la sogs pa rnams dang /
translated: At the time of the knowledge of elimination, one obtains the qualities of knowledge that are not common to the Buddha Bhagavans, such as the powers, and those that are common to the sravakas, such as the knowledge through prayer and the correct and discerning awarenesses.

original: so so'i skye bo dang thun mong ba mngon par shes pa dang / bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa la sogs pa rnams 'thob bo zhes spyir bshad la /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo dang thun mong ba mngon par shes pa dang / bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa la sogs pa rnams 'thob bo zhes spyir bshad la /
translated: And one obtains the qualities of knowledge that are common to ordinary beings, such as the superknowledges, the absorptions, the formless states, and so on.üîΩThese are explained in general.

original: de dag kyang shes pa'i rang bzhin dang rang bzhin gzhan yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang shes pa'i rang bzhin dang rang bzhin gzhan yin no //
translated: They are also of the nature of knowledge and other natures.

original: de la shes pa'i rang bzhin stobs la sogs pa nas mngon par shes pa la thug pa gang yin pa de dag ni shes pa'i skabs kho nas bshad zin to //
analyzed: de la shes pa'i rang bzhin stobs la sogs pa nas mngon par shes pa la thug pa gang yin pa de dag ni shes pa'i skabs kho nas bshad zin to //
translated: The nature of consciousness, beginning with power and ending with superknowledge, has already been explained in the chapter on consciousness.

original: de la / shes pa zag bcas zag pa med //
analyzed: de la / shes pa zag bcas zag pa med //
translated: The nature of consciousness is both contaminated and uncontaminated.

original: ces bya ba de lta bu la sogs pas ni rgyas par shes pa bstan pa'i dbang du byas so //
analyzed: ces bya ba de lta bu la sogs pas ni rgyas par shes pa bstan pa'i dbang du byas so //
translated: This and other such statements explain consciousness in detail from the perspective of its own characteristics.

original: de nas shes pa dang 'brel pas de'i rang bzhin gyi yon tan rnams kho na bshad kyi /
analyzed: de nas shes pa dang 'brel pas de'i rang bzhin gyi yon tan rnams kho na bshad kyi /
translated: After that, the qualities that are its nature are explained in terms of their connection with consciousness.

original: rang bzhin gzhan rnams ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gzhan rnams ni ma yin te /
translated: The other natures are not explained.

original: bsam gtan la sogs pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩyang na zhes bya ba'i skabs @265a * //
analyzed: bsam gtan la sogs pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // yang na zhes bya ba'i skabs @265a * //
translated: This means the natures of the absorptions and so on.

original: kyis gti mug med pa'i rang bzhin rgyas par bshad la /
analyzed: kyis gti mug med pa'i rang bzhin rgyas par bshad la /
translated: Or, the explanation of the nature of nondelusion is given in detail in the section on the term ‚Äúor.‚Äù

original: da ni ma chags pa dang zhe sdang med pa'i rang bzhin bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa rnams bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: da ni ma chags pa dang zhe sdang med pa'i rang bzhin bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa rnams bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Now the absorptions and formless states that are the nature of nonattachment and nonaversion should be explained.

original: de la dang po bsam gtan rnams las brtsams te /
analyzed: de la dang po bsam gtan rnams las brtsams te /
translated: The first of these is the absorptions.

original: gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the most important.

original: ji ltar gtso bo yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar gtso bo yin zhe na /
translated: How is it the most important?

original: de'i phyir yon tan thams cad kyi rten yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir yon tan thams cad kyi rten yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúbecause it is the basis of all the qualities.‚Äù

original: gzugs med pa rnams kyang yon tan gyi rten yin mod kyi /
analyzed: gzugs med pa rnams kyang yon tan gyi rten yin mod kyi /
translated: Although the formless states are also the basis of the qualities,

original: lnga ni bsam gtan bzhi dag na //
analyzed: lnga ni bsam gtan bzhi dag na //
translated: the five are the basis of all the qualities.

original: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir yon tan thams cad kyi rten ni ma yin pas de dag sngar ma brjod do //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir yon tan thams cad kyi rten ni ma yin pas de dag sngar ma brjod do //
translated: The formless states are not mentioned first because they are not the basis of all the qualities, as stated in the line, ‚ÄúThe five are in the four meditations.‚Äù

original: bde ba'i mjug thogs su skye ba'i phyir yang gzugs med pa rnams bstan pa skye ba dang mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: bde ba'i mjug thogs su skye ba'i phyir yang gzugs med pa rnams bstan pa skye ba dang mthun pa yin no //
translated: The formless states are taught last because they are the culmination of birth, since one is born after the pleasure of the fourth meditation.

original: bsam gtan dag ni rnam gnyis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsam gtan dag ni rnam gnyis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The meditations are twofold.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bsam gtan gyi dbye bas so //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bsam gtan gyi dbye bas so //
translated: They are divided into causal and resultant meditations.

original: de nyid kyi phyir skye ba dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i bsam gtan gyi bye brag gis zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir skye ba dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i bsam gtan gyi bye brag gis zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúdue to the distinction of the meditations of birth and meditative attainment.‚Äù

original: de la skye ba'i bsam gtan ni 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: de la skye ba'i bsam gtan ni 'bras bu'o //
translated: The meditation of birth is the result.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i bsam gtan ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i bsam gtan ni rgyu'o //
translated: The meditation of meditative attainment is the cause.

original: dge ba rtse gcig pa zhes bya ba 'di ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i bsam gtan gyi thun mong gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: dge ba rtse gcig pa zhes bya ba 'di ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i bsam gtan gyi thun mong gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: This is the common characteristic of the meditative concentration of meditative attainment.

original: sems rtse gcig pa nyon mongs pa can dang lung du ma bstan pa yang yod pas dge ba zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa nyon mongs pa can dang lung du ma bstan pa yang yod pas dge ba zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Since there is also a single-pointedness of mind that is defiled and indeterminate, he says virtuous.

original: dge ba g-yeng ba yang yod pas rtse gcig pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: dge ba g-yeng ba yang yod pas rtse gcig pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Since there is also a virtuous state of distraction, he says single-pointed.

original: sems rtse gcig pa ni bsam gtan yin te zhes bya ba der sems las byung ba ma smos pa ni sems gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa ni bsam gtan yin te zhes bya ba der sems las byung ba ma smos pa ni sems gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Meditative concentration is a single-pointed mind.üîΩSince it is the nature of meditative concentration,

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan rnams dmigs pa gcig pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan rnams dmigs pa gcig pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the absorptions are the nature of a single focal object.

original: rjes 'brang bcas nas phung po lnga //
analyzed: rjes 'brang bcas nas phung po lnga //
translated: Together with its following, it is five aggregates.

original: zhes bya ba ni gal te snyoms par 'jug pa'i bsam gtan rnams kyi rang bzhin tshol na ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gal te snyoms par 'jug pa'i bsam gtan rnams kyi rang bzhin tshol na ni /
translated: If one seeks the nature of the absorptions of meditative attainment,

original: de'i rang bzhin yin pa de nyid kyi dge ba rtse gcig pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin yin pa de nyid kyi dge ba rtse gcig pa yin te /
translated: It is virtuous concentration, since it is by nature virtue.

original: bsam gtan rnams ni ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan rnams ni ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For the meditative absorptions are by nature concentration.

original: 'on te 'khor dang bcas pa brjod par 'dod na ni /
analyzed: 'on te 'khor dang bcas pa brjod par 'dod na ni /
translated: But if you assert that it is accompanied by its retinue,

original: de'i phyir phung po lnga'i rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir phung po lnga'i rang bzhin yin te /
translated: then it is by nature the five aggregates,

original: rjes su 'jug pa'i gzugs yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su 'jug pa'i gzugs yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: since form that is a subsequent state exists.

original: dge ba'i sems rtse gcig pa ni bsam gtan yin te zhes bshad na /
analyzed: dge ba'i sems rtse gcig pa ni bsam gtan yin te zhes bshad na /
translated: If you say that virtuous singlepointedness is meditative absorption,

original: de ni nges par ma zin pas de'i phyir rtse gcig pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhe na zhes bya ba 'dri'o //üîΩ@265b dmigs pa gcig pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ni nges par ma zin pas de'i phyir rtse gcig pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhe na zhes bya ba 'dri'o // @265b dmigs pa gcig pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: then that is not ascertained, so you ask, ‚ÄúWhat is this singlepointedness?‚ÄùüîΩSingle focus on the object is the answer.

original: yul gcig pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yul gcig pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Single focus on the object means single focus on the object field.

original: de lta na ni 'o na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
translated: If that is so, then what is the point of the question, ‚ÄúWhat is singlepointedness?‚Äù

original: gal te rtse gcig pa dmigs pa gcig pa nyid yin na ni //
analyzed: gal te rtse gcig pa dmigs pa gcig pa nyid yin na ni //
translated: If singlepointedness is single focus on the object,

original: des na sems dmigs pa gcig pa ste /
analyzed: des na sems dmigs pa gcig pa ste /
translated: then the mind is singlepointedness.

original: ma g-yengs shing mnyam par gzhag pa dag kho na ting nge 'dzin yin gyi /üîΩchos gzhan sems las byung ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ma g-yengs shing mnyam par gzhag pa dag kho na ting nge 'dzin yin gyi / chos gzhan sems las byung ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Only non-distraction and meditative equipoise are concentration.üîΩIt is not a separate mental factor.

original: dmigs pa gcig pa nyid de ni sems dag las gzhan med de /
analyzed: dmigs pa gcig pa nyid de ni sems dag las gzhan med de /
translated: The sameness of object is not separate from the mind,üîΩbecause the mind would be distracted.

original: sems ni g-yengs pa nyid yin par 'gyur du 'ong bas so //
analyzed: sems ni g-yengs pa nyid yin par 'gyur du 'ong bas so //
translated: The mind itself is concentration, because it is the mind that is concentrated.üîΩThe mind itself is not concentration, because the mind is distracted.

original: sems kho na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: sems kho na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The mind itself is concentration, because the mind is concentrated.üîΩThe mind itself is not concentration, because the mind is distracted.üîΩThe mind itself is concentration, because the mind is concentrated.

original: sems rnams ni dmigs pa gcig la 'jug pa las rang la nus pa yod pa ma yin te /üîΩrnam par g-yeng ba med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems rnams ni dmigs pa gcig la 'jug pa las rang la nus pa yod pa ma yin te / rnam par g-yeng ba med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The mind itself is not concentration, because the mind is distracted.üîΩThe mind itself is concentration, because the mind is concentrated.üîΩThe mind itself is not concentration, original: de'i phyir rnam par g-yeng ba bzhin du sems rnams kyi dmigs pa gcig pa nyid kyang rang bzhin las byung ba ma yin pas de'i phyir sems rnams kho na ting nge 'dzin ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par g-yeng ba bzhin du sems rnams kyi dmigs pa gcig pa nyid kyang rang bzhin las byung ba ma yin pas de'i phyir sems rnams kho na ting nge 'dzin ma yin gyi /
translated: The mind itself is not concentration, because the mind is distracted.

original: gang gis de dag rtse gcig par byed pa'i chos de ting nge 'dzin yin no //
analyzed: gang gis de dag rtse gcig par byed pa'i chos de ting nge 'dzin yin no //
translated: The mind itself is concentration,

original: de nyid rtse gcig pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pas de dag sems rtse gcig par 'gyur bas ting nge 'dzin kho nas sems rtse gcig pa yin gyi sems dag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid rtse gcig pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pas de dag sems rtse gcig par 'gyur bas ting nge 'dzin kho nas sems rtse gcig pa yin gyi sems dag ni ma yin no //
translated: That is the one-pointedness of that, because it is endowed with concentration, they become one-pointed in mind. Therefore, one-pointedness of mind is only concentration, not the mind.

original: skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir sems thams cad rtse gcig pa yin nam ma yin /
analyzed: skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir sems thams cad rtse gcig pa yin nam ma yin /
translated: Is every mind one-pointed or not?

original: zhes bya ba ni sems thams cad rtse gcig pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sems thams cad rtse gcig pa kho na yin te /
translated: Every mind is one-pointed,

original: skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir dmigs pa yin la 'pho ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir dmigs pa yin la 'pho ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is momentary, it has an object, and it does not move.

original: de'i phyir sems la ting nge 'dzin yongs su rtogs pa don med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems la ting nge 'dzin yongs su rtogs pa don med do //
translated: Therefore, it is pointless to understand concentration as the mind.

original: dge ba'i sems thams cad mnyam par gzhag pa nyid yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i sems thams cad mnyam par gzhag pa nyid yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that all virtuous minds are equipoise.

original: gal te gnyis pa de las rnam par mi g-yeng ba yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te gnyis pa de las rnam par mi g-yeng ba yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If you say that the second is non-distraction from that,

original: sems gnyis pa ni sems snga ma dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyi sems dang po'i dmigs pa las mi g-yeng bas nyes pa 'di med do zhes bya pa'o //
analyzed: sems gnyis pa ni sems snga ma dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyi sems dang po'i dmigs pa las mi g-yeng bas nyes pa 'di med do zhes bya pa'o //
translated: The second mind is not faulty, because it is not distracted from the object of the first mind by the power of concentration that is concomitant with the first mind.üîΩConcentration is purposeless in regard to the first mind.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa la ting nge 'dzin don med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni sems dang po ting nge 'dzin dang mtshungs par ldan pa gang yin pa de la ting nge 'dzin don med pa yin te /
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa la ting nge 'dzin don med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni sems dang po ting nge 'dzin dang mtshungs par ldan pa gang yin pa de la ting nge 'dzin don med pa yin te /
translated: Concentration is purposeless in regard to the first mind that is concomitant with concentration,

original: de la bya ba mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la bya ba mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not perform any function in regard to it.

original: gang kho na la ting nge 'dzin yin pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: gang kho na la ting nge 'dzin yin pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: In regard to the second mind, concentration is purposeless.üîΩIn regard to the second mind, concentration is purposeless, because it is not concomitant with it.üîΩIn regard to the third mind, concentration is purposeless.üîΩIn regard to the third mind, concentration is purposeless, because it is not concomitant with it.üîΩIn regard to the fourth mind, concentration is purposeless.üîΩIn regard to the fourth mind, concentration is purposeless, because it is not concomitant with it.üîΩIn regard to the fifth mind, concentration is purposeless.üîΩIn regard to the fifth mind, concentration is purposeless, because it is not concomitant with it.

original: gang zhig sems ltar ting @266a * //üîΩnge 'dzin gyi dbang gis snga ma dang phyi ma dmigs pa gcig pa nyid du yongs su rtog par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: gang zhig sems ltar ting @266a * // nge 'dzin gyi dbang gis snga ma dang phyi ma dmigs pa gcig pa nyid du yongs su rtog par 'gyur ba /
translated: In regard to the sixth mind, concentration is purposeless.üîΩIn regard to the sixth mind, concentration is purposeless, because it is not concomitant with it.üîΩIn regard to the seventh mind, concentration is purposeless.

original: ting nge 'dzin la ni ting nge 'dzin gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la ni ting nge 'dzin gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
translated: In regard to the seventh mind, concentration is purposeless, because it is not concomitant with it.üîΩIn regard to the eighth mind, concentration is purposeless.üîΩIn regard to the eighth mind, concentration is purposeless, because it is not concomitant with it.üîΩIn regard to the ninth mind, concentration is purposeless.üîΩIn regard to the ninth mind, concentration is purposeless, because it is not concomitant with it.üîΩIn regard to the tenth mind, concentration is purposeless.üîΩIn regard to the tenth mind, concentration is purposeless, because it is not concomitant with it.üîΩIn regard to the eleventh mind, concentration is purposeless.üîΩIn regard to the eleventh mind, concentration is purposeless, because it is not concomitant with it.üîΩIn regard to the twelfth mind, concentration is purposeless.üîΩIn regard to the twelfth mind, concentration is purposeless, because it is not concomitant with it.üîΩIn regard to the thirteenth mind, concentration is purposeless.üîΩIn regard to the thirteenth mind, concentration is purposeless, because it is not concomitant with it.üîΩIn regard to the fourteenth mind, concentration is purposeless.üîΩIn regard to the fourteenth mind, concentration is purposeless, because it is not

original: de'i phyir ting 'dzin rnams la ting nge 'dzin las tha dad pa goms pa'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir ting 'dzin rnams la ting nge 'dzin las tha dad pa goms pa'am /
translated: Therefore, the concentrations are cultivated as distinct from the absorptions.

original: gzhan zhig las rtse gcig pa nyid du khas blang bar bya'o //üîΩgoms pa la sogs pa gang kho na la ting nge 'dzin rtse gcig pa nyid du 'gyur ba de kho na las sems dag kyang dmigs pa gcig tu 'gyur bas don gzhan du gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin don med do //üîΩting nge 'dzin sa mang po pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gal te sems snga ma dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mthus phyi ma sems snga ma'i dmigs pa las mi g-yeng ba yin no //üîΩde lta na ting nge 'dzin sa mang po pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan zhig las rtse gcig pa nyid du khas blang bar bya'o // goms pa la sogs pa gang kho na la ting nge 'dzin rtse gcig pa nyid du 'gyur ba de kho na las sems dag kyang dmigs pa gcig tu 'gyur bas don gzhan du gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin don med do // ting nge 'dzin sa mang po pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gal te sems snga ma dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mthus phyi ma sems snga ma'i dmigs pa las mi g-yeng ba yin no // de lta na ting nge 'dzin sa mang po pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, concentration should be accepted as the one-pointedness of mind that is either the cultivation of a mind that is different from concentration or the cultivation of a mind that is the same as concentration.üîΩSince the mind is focused on the same object in whatever mind is one-pointed due to concentration, concentration is meaningless as a different object.

original: sems thams cad rtse gcig pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems thams cad rtse gcig pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the later mind is not distracted from the object of the former mind due to the power of concentration that is concomitant with the former mind, then all minds would be one-pointed because concentration is a universal mental object.

original: ma yin te ting nge 'dzin stobs chung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sems thams cad rtse gcig pa nyid du thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma yin te ting nge 'dzin stobs chung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sems thams cad rtse gcig pa nyid du thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: No, because concentration is weak. It is not the case that all minds are one-pointed,

original: ci'i phyir zhe na ting nge 'dzin stobs chung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na ting nge 'dzin stobs chung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because concentration is weak.

original: ting nge 'dzin stobs dang ldan pa ni sems gnyis pa sems dang po'i dmigs pa las mi g-yeng bar byed kyi /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin stobs dang ldan pa ni sems gnyis pa sems dang po'i dmigs pa las mi g-yeng bar byed kyi /
translated: A strong concentration prevents a second mind from distracting the first mind from its object.

original: stobs chung bas ni ma yin la /
analyzed: stobs chung bas ni ma yin la /
translated: But a weak concentration does not do that.

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyang stobs mtshungs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyang stobs mtshungs pa ma yin te /
translated: And not all concentrations are of equal strength.

original: de'i phyir ting nge 'dzin sa mang po yin yang sems thams cad rtse gcig pa nyid du thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir ting nge 'dzin sa mang po yin yang sems thams cad rtse gcig pa nyid du thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, although concentration is a universal mental factor, it does not follow that all minds are one-pointed.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba dge ba'i rgyun 'jug par nus pa ting nge 'dzin kho na la bsam gtan du brjod pa'i phyir thams cad ni ma yin no//
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba dge ba'i rgyun 'jug par nus pa ting nge 'dzin kho na la bsam gtan du brjod pa'i phyir thams cad ni ma yin no//
translated: It is called meditative concentration dhyƒÅna only when it is able to generate a continuum of virtuous minds and mental factors.

original: sems rtse gcig pa kho na ting nge 'dzin yin te zhes bya ba ni don gzhan ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa kho na ting nge 'dzin yin te zhes bya ba ni don gzhan ma yin pa'o //
translated: The statement ‚Äúonly one pointedness of mind is concentration‚Äù means that there is no other meaning.

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThus‚Äù means ‚Äúbecause of that.‚ÄùüîΩThe sutras state:

original: lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni mdo las lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa dang sems yongs su dag pa'i gtso bo ni bsam gtan bzhi yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni mdo las lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa dang sems yongs su dag pa'i gtso bo ni bsam gtan bzhi yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: The training in superior mind and the purity of mind are the four absorptions.

original: de'i phyir rtse gcig pa'i sems kho na ting nge 'dzin yin te /üîΩdper na lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa tshul khrims kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir rtse gcig pa'i sems kho na ting nge 'dzin yin te / dper na lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa tshul khrims kho na yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, only one pointed mind is concentration.

original: de las gzhan ma yin la /üîΩlhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa shes rab kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: de las gzhan ma yin la / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa shes rab kho na yin gyi /
translated: For example, the training in superior ethics is ethics itself and nothing else.

original: de las gzhan ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: The training in superior wisdom is wisdom itself and nothing else.

original: @266b yang ji ltar mdo nyid las tshul khrims yongs su dag pa'i gtso bo dang / lta ba yongs su dag pa'i gtso bo dang / rnam par grol ba yongs su dag pa'i gtso bo zhes bshad pa ni tshul khrims dang lta ba dang / rnam par grol ba dag las gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin du sems yongs su dag pa'i gtso bo yang sems las don gzhan ma yin no zhes mdo las khong du chud do //üîΩde lta na 'o na ni zhes bya ba la gal te bsam gtan dag ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin yin na /
analyzed: @266b yang ji ltar mdo nyid las tshul khrims yongs su dag pa'i gtso bo dang / lta ba yongs su dag pa'i gtso bo dang / rnam par grol ba yongs su dag pa'i gtso bo zhes bshad pa ni tshul khrims dang lta ba dang / rnam par grol ba dag las gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin du sems yongs su dag pa'i gtso bo yang sems las don gzhan ma yin no zhes mdo las khong du chud do // de lta na 'o na ni zhes bya ba la gal te bsam gtan dag ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin yin na /
translated: Again, just as the sutras explain that the principal purity of ethics, the principal purity of view, and the principal purity of liberation are not different from ethics, view, and liberation, you should understand from the sutras that the principal purity of mind is not a different object from the mind.üîΩIf concentration is by nature meditative attainment,

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad bsam gtan du thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad bsam gtan du thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: then it follows that all concentrations are meditative attainment.üîΩBut it is not logical that all virtue, affliction, and neutral states of meditative attainment are concentrations,

original: ting nge 'dzin sa mang po pa yin pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin dge pa dang nyon mongs pa can dang lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyang bsam gtan nyid du thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin sa mang po pa yin pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin dge pa dang nyon mongs pa can dang lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyang bsam gtan nyid du thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: because meditative attainment is a universal mental state.

original: ma yin te phul du phyin pa dang ldan pa la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni phul du phyin pa dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa de la bsam gtan zhes ming du btags kyi /
analyzed: ma yin te phul du phyin pa dang ldan pa la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni phul du phyin pa dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa de la bsam gtan zhes ming du btags kyi /
translated: It is concentration that possesses the perfection that is called meditation,

original: ting nge 'dzin tsam la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin tsam la ni ma yin te /
translated: but not just any concentration.

original: de'i phyir ting nge 'dzin thams cad bsam gtan du thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir ting nge 'dzin thams cad bsam gtan du thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it does not follow that all concentrations are meditations.üîΩIt is like the sun,

original: nyi ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni gang zhig phul du phyin par snang ba dang ldan pa de nyid la nyi ma zhes bya'i srin bu me khyer la sogs pa dag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyi ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni gang zhig phul du phyin par snang ba dang ldan pa de nyid la nyi ma zhes bya'i srin bu me khyer la sogs pa dag ni ma yin no //
translated: for that which possesses the perfection of illumination is called the sun, not fireflies and so on.

original: zung du 'brel par ngang gis 'byung pa'i phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba ni zung du 'brel pa ni zung du 'brel pa ste 'brel zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zung du 'brel par ngang gis 'byung pa'i phyir // zhes bya ba ni zung du 'brel pa ni zung du 'brel pa ste 'brel zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because it is naturally associated with the pair.üîΩThe pair is associated with the pair, that is, it is associated.

original: gnya' sbrel ba dang 'dra ba ni zung du 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: gnya' sbrel ba dang 'dra ba ni zung du 'brel pa'o //
translated: It is like a yoke, that is, it is associated.

original: zung du 'brel par ngang gis 'byung bas na zung du 'jug par ngang gis 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: zung du 'brel par ngang gis 'byung bas na zung du 'jug par ngang gis 'byung ba ste /
translated: Since they are naturally unified, they are naturally unified.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dag gis mnyam par ngang gis 'byung zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dag gis mnyam par ngang gis 'byung zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that calm abiding and insight are naturally unified.

original: zung du 'brel par ngang gis 'byung ba'i dngos po ni zung du 'brel bar ngang gis 'jug pa nyid de de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zung du 'brel par ngang gis 'byung ba'i dngos po ni zung du 'brel bar ngang gis 'jug pa nyid de de'i phyir ro //
translated: The state of being naturally unified is naturally unified engagement.

original: gal te dge ba'i sems rtse gcig pa nyid bsam gtan yin na /
analyzed: gal te dge ba'i sems rtse gcig pa nyid bsam gtan yin na /
translated: If concentration is the one-pointedness of a virtuous mind,

original: nyon mongs pa can ro myang ba dang ldan pa ji ltar bsam gtan yin zhe na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ro myang ba dang ldan pa ji ltar bsam gtan yin zhe na /
translated: how can a defiled mind possessing enjoyment be concentration?

original: log par nges par sems pa'i phyir //
analyzed: log par nges par sems pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it is wrongly ascertained.

original: zhes bya ba 'byung ste /üîΩ'di ltar log par nges par sems par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'byung ste / 'di ltar log par nges par sems par byed pa yin te /
translated: This is stated.üîΩBecause it is wrongly ascertained.

original: log par nges par rtog ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: log par nges par rtog ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that it is wrongly conceptualized.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa thams cad log par nges par sems pa'i phyir bsam gtan nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro @267a * //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa thams cad log par nges par sems pa'i phyir bsam gtan nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro @267a * //
translated: There would be the fallacy of overextension, because concentration would be concentration with affliction, since it is certain that all afflictions are abandoned.

original: zhe na ; ma yin te /
analyzed: zhe na ; ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: de dang mthun pa kho na la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de dang mthun pa kho na la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: because it is only similar to that.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba med de /
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba med de /
translated: There is no fallacy of overextension,

original: de dang mthun pa mtshan nyid mang po mi mthun pa med pa bsam gtan nyon mongs pa can la de'i ming du btags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang mthun pa mtshan nyid mang po mi mthun pa med pa bsam gtan nyon mongs pa can la de'i ming du btags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because concentration with affliction is designated by the name of that which is similar to it, that is, concentration, which is not similar to many other characteristics.

original: sa bon rul ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dper na rdo la sogs pa sa bon ma yin pa de'i rigs dang mtshan nyid shin tu mi 'dra ba gang yang rung ba la sa bon rul ba zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: sa bon rul ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dper na rdo la sogs pa sa bon ma yin pa de'i rigs dang mtshan nyid shin tu mi 'dra ba gang yang rung ba la sa bon rul ba zhes mi bya'o //
translated: It is like a spoiled seed. For example, a seed is not called spoiled in relation to any other thing, such as a stone, that is not a seed and is not similar to it.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: sa bon gyi rigs nyid nyams pa sa bon dang 'dra ba gang yin pa de nyid la sa bon rul ba'o zhes ming du 'dogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sa bon gyi rigs nyid nyams pa sa bon dang 'dra ba gang yin pa de nyid la sa bon rul ba'o zhes ming du 'dogs pa bzhin no //
translated: A seed is called spoiled when the seed itself is damaged and is similar to a seed.

original: bsam gtan mi dge ba dag kyang gsungs so zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa'i dbang du byas nas sems par byas nas sems par byed rab tu sems par byed do zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba yin te /üîΩde'i phyir ha cang thal bar 'gyur pa'i skyon med do //üîΩbsam gtan dge ba zhes bya ba ni phal che ba bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan mi dge ba dag kyang gsungs so zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa'i dbang du byas nas sems par byas nas sems par byed rab tu sems par byed do zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba yin te / de'i phyir ha cang thal bar 'gyur pa'i skyon med do // bsam gtan dge ba zhes bya ba ni phal che ba bstan pa yin no //
translated: Also, nonvirtuous meditative stabilizations are mentioned.

original: lhan cig dpyod pa'i phyir du ba dang me bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dper na 'di na du ba yod pas zhes smos pas me yang smras pa yin te /üîΩme med na du ba mi 'byung bas lhan cig dpyod pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde dang 'dra bar dpyod pa smos pas rtog pa yang smos pa yin te /üîΩlhan cig dpyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhan cig dpyod pa'i phyir du ba dang me bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dper na 'di na du ba yod pas zhes smos pas me yang smras pa yin te /üîΩme med na du ba mi 'byung bas lhan cig dpyod pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde dang 'dra bar dpyod pa smos pas rtog pa yang smos pa yin te /üîΩlhan cig dpyod pa'i phyir ro //
